text: This cable from AZsales is NOT RG58/U coax as stated.  It is RG58A/U which is slightly smaller and has slightly more attenuation.  It is also of different construction.  It is close, but if you have a specific need this may not meet it.

These are very well made from high quality materials.  They do seem to run a little small compared to other brands I have used, but not to a large degree.There is one area which could use improvement, the waistband.  The waistband rolls up into an elastic rope very quickly and easily.  This might not happen so much if you have almost no body fat and a totally flat rock hard mid section (I do not), but for most people the waistband is likely to roll up instead of staying flat like some other brands.Otherwise this is the best quality supporter I have ever seen.

It is broken at the base right out of the box.  The antenna shaft wasn't seated  into the base and flopped over showing the wires inside.  Ordered another hoping this is a fluke.Update: I ordered a replacement and it too was broken at the base right out of the box exactly like the first.  Not ordering another from this seller.They either likely got a bad batch or a batch was damaged in shipment.

The UV5R belt clips both original and Tenq (which are identical) have one major flaw.  The hinge pin is not held in place by anything.  It has no retainers on either end, so it slowly moves out of the clip and causes everything to fall apart resulting in a radio drop test.  Don't trust the UV5R belt clips  Get a belt case instead.  As to these, they ARE the original Baofeng UV5R (and variants) belt clips in every way.This would have one star if it weren't for the fact that these are OEM and no different from what comes on your radio.

I have a number of HT antennas and for performance, this has proven to be the best.  In addition it seems to be the most physically durable as well.  You can fold it in half and it jumps right back to a straight line.  When I need the radio/antenna to be compact I just bend this antenna around in a 3/4 circle and clip it under the belt clip.  You wouldn't want to TX like that.  The SWR must be terrible and you could harm your radio.It outperforms the Nagoya NA771 by a little bit and is similar to the Diamond SRJF40A.  The problem with the Diamond is that although it is a bendable antenna, it is too flimsy to stay in the shape/position you put it.  Move the radio gently and the antenna flops about eventually drooping toward the ground.  But when straight, it performs well too.  Obviously the Sainsonic outperforms all the shorter antennas.

I wouldn't really call it flexible as much as bendable.  To me flexible means springy.  This antenna is like a microphone gooseneck.  You bend it to a different shape and it stays there, sort of.  It doesn't hold it's position well enough though.  If you move the radio gently the antenna loses it's position and droops.  Not all that practical.  However I got it to use with a HT on the belt so that this could slide under my coat and move with me, yet still give me extra gain over the stock antenna.  For that it works pretty well.  The only disadvantage is the base coil which is rigid and 3 inches long, so don't bend too much or you can break it off the radio.As to gain, it certainly receives and transmits better than the stock rubber duck that comes on HTs.  So performance is a definite improvement.You will have to decide if these features fit your need.  For some it will and for others not.  If it were a bit stiffer (held position better) it would have been a 4 star rating to me.

I purchased 4 of these almost 6 months ago.  Fit and function is good, except for the fact that even when only worn once to twice a week each, they have all fallen apart at the same seam.  Where the cup is sewn to the elastic straps, the stitching on all four has come loose at between 4 - 6 months.  Obviously a defective bit of sewing as it is also a chain stitch, which means if a thread comes loose the whole thing unravels.  Typical of cheap sewing.If you don't mind a little sewing on each unit then these should last about normally.  If you do not sew then don't buy these.

First, it works as expected in that it replaces your battery (it is a battery eliminator not a charger) and powers your radio from a 12 volt accessory socket.A couple poor design features to be aware of though:The cord is a coiled cord, but the coils are very stiff.  At rest it is about 2 feet long, but if you try to stretch it out, by the time you get to three feet it is pulling out of the car socket.  I would say that for most people, they would have a lot of trouble talking on the radio with that limitation combined with the fact that at that length you are playing tug of war if it stays plugged in.Also the cord comes out of the bottom of the battery adapter, which means you cannot stand your radio up.  Not a concern for car use but in emergency use where you might have to be on 12 volt power indoors, you cannot stand up your radio.  This means your antenna is operating at well below maximum efficiency.It seems that just a little forethought and beta testing of this product would have made it a MUCH better product with little or no change to cost.

This unit had 2 defects: 1) It would not latch onto radio.  Never snapped into place and even with good firm press would just slide back off, 2) when you plugged it in the power light went on and then faded to black.  Tried several sockets.  You had to remove it and wait 30 seconds to plug it on and same thing all over.  Power to radio did same thing.  Started up then turned off in a few seconds.  I also bought a BL-5 (for UV5R) and it worked fine on the appropriate radioSince it has good reviews, I returned this one for a refund and order another.  Will see how that does.A couple other poor design features, the cord is a coiled cord, but the coils are very stiff.  At rest it is about 2 feet long, but if you try to stretch it out, by the time you get to three feet it is pulling out of the car socket.  I would say that for most people, they would have a lot of trouble talking on the radio with that limitation combined with the fact that at that length you are playing tug of war if it stays plugged in.Also the cord comes out of the bottom of the battery adapter, which means you cannot stand your radio up.  Not a concern for car use but in emergency use where you might have to be on 12 volt power indoors, you cannot stand up your radio.  This means your antenna is operating at well below maximum efficiency.It seems that just a little forethought and beta testing of this product would have made it a MUCH better product with little or no change to cost.Update: I ordered and immediately received (Amazon Prime) a replacement as stated above from the same seller and it works fine.  The first was a single failure as far as the defects.  However the cord out the bottom is still a poorly thought out design.

The receive audio (earpiece) is horrible.  It sounds like you are listening to a tin can on a string in a tunnel.  Transmit (microphone) audio is good and the buttons align with the display as in upper is upper.  Otherwise it is good.  If you are only receiving good strong signals it could be ok.  Also receive audio is rather low even with the radio at full volume.  Tested on a UV82.

The one thing that I knew that I had to overcome in order to start really losing weight was late night cravings. For some reason no matter how great of a diet day I would be having, I would mess everything up with a late night binge. I tried to work everything out on my own, but was not successful. Eventually I decided to try some kind of supplement. I am not a stranger to supplements and have used them in the past with success. I was going to use one that I had had success with in the past, but my friend was going on and on about this particular supplement. We are both late night snackers and she swore that this was the only supplement that really curbed those cravings. I decided to trust her and ordered this product. I must admit that she was right about being able to control cravings. I have not had a late night binge in a while. A night of no late night binges is one thing, but for me to go weeks without having a late night binge is beyond impressive. This supplement has really helped me to achieve my diet goals and I highly recommend it if you are finding yourself in a similar situation.

I purchased a Shany makeup kit a handful of months ago and fell in love with the white eyeshadow that came in it. I ended up using it almost every day and was disappointed when I realized I was running out. I came on here and found that I could order an individual container of the white eyeshadow and instantly ordered it. I already knew how much I liked it so I was a very happy camper when it came in the mail. It looks great, doesn’t clump, and is easy to take off at night. Another awesome Shany purchase.

I am always impressed with the quality of Shany brand cosmetics, but this lip gloss is definitely my favorite out of everything that I had tried so far. I spent some time carefully picking out my favorite color, but it only took a few seconds after applying to fall in love with it. I am planning on buying more of the colors to add to my makeup collection. I love how smooth it is once applied and how long the color lasts throughout the day. This is definitely one of those makeup products that I recommend giving a try – you won’t be disappointed.

I have been slowly switching over to using Shany products for all of my makeup needs. As soon as I run out of something, I quickly replace it with a Shany brand version. Not only has this saved me money, but I am actually happier with the overall quality of the product. This liquid shimmer is no different and I could instantly see a difference after applying it. I love the natural glow that my face gives off after I apply this and I have definitely converted a bunch of my friends to this brand over some of the other lower quality, but more expensive brands. Highly recommended!

This was the first book of this series that my little one read to me instead of me reading to her. I have been reading Oliver & Jumpy to her for quite some time now and was so excited (and proud) when she was finished reading to me! We both had a sweet tooth after reading the first story and I definitely used Joey’s incident as a way to talk about how too much of a good thing can be bad. The second story in this series was also a hit with us, as I had lost my voice last summer when we went to an amusement park (too much screaming on rides, I guess). My little one said that we needed a fairy queen for the next time we go to an amusement park, which definitely made me chuckle. I am always amused by this series and my youngest is always very excited when I download the next book. Highly recommended.

If you have been following this series then you know that it is high quality. If you haven’t been following this series, but you enjoy westerns then I highly recommend taking a look at this set. As someone who has really enjoyed the previous books in this series, I was very interested to see how everything was going to close. I think that Luis Antwoord has outdone himself. I found myself questing what I would do in the same situation as our main character. I think my favorite part about this book was sitting back and thinking about the inner struggle that must have taken place when it came to defending the land. It is easy to see truth in the saying “it's a gift and a curse”. I think this wrap up fit this series perfectly and I am not at all disappointed.

The main reason that I liked this story so much was simply how relatable of a character Ray was. Ray wants to escape his current situation. He wants more out of life than what his surroundings can provide and he starts to come up with a plan to take a new path. Unfortunately, his plan does not end up playing out exactly as it should (due to outside forces) and he is forced to go in a different direction. You can definitely get the sense of “things have a funny way of working out” when you are reading this book and it helps to instill a pretty positive outlook on your own life. If you are looking for an adventure that leaves you feeling better about the future then I highly recommend checking this one out.

This is a powerful read about a young girl’s journey to find answers about the world and in turn, herself. It turns out that much more happens on this journey than our main character could have ever imagined. Actually, I was really not expecting this to be as climatic as it was and it left me thinking a lot about my own life and journey. There are some books that just leave you speechless and this is definitely one of them. It was a treat to watch this young lost girl find herself as the story unfolds. I can’t say enough good things about this Christian Romance and I highly recommend it.

The idea of being shunned (even if only for a little while) from the only life that you have ever known because of your beliefs is something that I find fascinating. As someone who uses technology on a daily basis, it is not hard to understand where Nicklaus is coming from and I found that I was instantly connected to him. This instant connection that I made with the main character made it so that I just wanted to root for him. That is why when he meets Emma my mind immediately starts to hope that they will be able to help each other figure out what they want from the world. I definitely wasn’t disappointed in the end. If you are interested in Amish Romances then this is one that I can recommend checking out.

I read this set of stories to a small group of tiny tots. My youngest and I have been reading this series for a little while now and have become used to the adventures that Oliver and Jumpy take. As always, we enjoyed this next book in the series. You never know exactly what kind of mess this gang is going to get into; the adventures really are cute and never dull. The group that I was reading to ended up talking about what they think their pets do when we leave them alone (from the first story). It was definitely funny to listen to their ideas; a fun story time for all of us. As I’ve said on every other review that I have done for this series, I highly recommend reading Oliver and Jumpy to your little ones.

I read the reviews before purchasing this book and I was a little weary because of some of the negative reviews. With that being said I was hooked after taking advantage of the “Look Inside” option that is offered on Amazon. I was getting so interested in the story that when I reached the end of the section I kept trying to scroll down to read more, purchasing the story right after. I honestly enjoyed this story of Veronica and Alan; all of the mystery and drama that sums up their lives. This is one of those stories that just did it for me; I’m not sure if it was how nicely everything flowed or if I felt connected to the characters. Regardless, this is definitely a story that I recommend reading if you are interested in mysteries.

I really can’t imagine being sheltered away from all of the technological advancements that we have made in this day in age. Even more so, I cannot imagine the struggle that one would have to go through if they had to decide to stay in this technological age or to go back to “the good life”. There was so much mental battling going on that it actually made me think a lot about what I would do in the same situation. This was definitely an interesting and thought provoking read. Any story that is able to get my thoughts flowing while also keeping me involved in the plot/characters is something that I can highly recommend.

The one thing that made me laugh about this story was the fact that Doc decided to go in and tell his friends his tale before his wife. I was reading this story on my fiancé’s Kindle on our way to see some of our family members from out of town and we laughed about how much trouble he would be in if he did that. With that being said this book was awesome and plays into your curiosity. I was so curious about Doc’s tale and it ends up being quite an adventure to watch him detail what had happened. If you are looking for a western short story that will keep your attention then I definitely recommend giving this one a read.

This is one of those stories that you are going to read start to finish because you find that you just can’t put it down. I was completely swept into the life of Twine and all of her ambitions that seem to pay off. The story line gets crazy and I honestly did not see any of the twists that were coming, but then you get completely involved in the excitement. This was definitely one of the more interesting and captivating short stories that I have read in a while. I highly recommend checking this out if you’re searching for a good mystery.

The thing that I love about Michelle Eastwood’s stories is the fact that regardless of your background (or religion) you can really take something away from the stories. I am not very religious; however, I love an inspiring read. This series definitely takes you on a journey. There is tragedy and a sense of being broken, but then you get to see the strength and the actions that can be taken to make everything whole again. I think that everyone can become inspired by these stories. This, mixed with the wonderful writing style of this author makes this set a great read.

I have not purchased this bundle, but I have read these books individually and I wanted to post a review on this set because this is an awesome series. You get drawn into the story and the connection (or lack of connection) that the characters have. If you are interested in romance and drama, especially paranormal romance then this is one of those series that you have to read. I am a sucker for love and this story definitely kept me wanting more and more. This author knows how to draw you in and keep you on the edge of your seat; I highly recommend this series.

I have been on a historical romance kick of late and books like this one is exactly why. There was so much tension and excitement, not to mention love, throughout this story. It was very interesting to see how the roles of power played into a love story. This was a different take on love then what I am used to reading about, but I ate it up and could not stop reading. I could relate to the unconditional love that Aaron has to give and it is intense to read his story. I ended this book and just wanted more; my attention was completely captured.

Yay! Yet another book in this series that I must give a positive review to. My little one is always excited when I purchase a new set of stories in this series, we have both become very fond of the adventures of Oliver and Jumpy. If you are looking for a cute series that offers adventure, moral values, and (my little one’s favorite) adorable illustrations then this is one of those series that I’d recommend picking up. My little one got a huge kick out of the first story in this series, we too had a little incident with a hide & go seek game gone wrong. Overall this is a series that I think most kids will love; it’s a crowd pleaser at our house.

My fiancé and I started our relationship on the internet, which made this a very enjoyable and adorable read for me. I loved being able to feel the giddiness that our main character feels with every new message from him and it’s interesting to watch it grow and grow. This is one of those books that have you hooked and tug at your heartstrings. I honestly think this is a great representation of new age romance. Social networking (technology, really) now plays a huge part in how relationships work and it was great to see a book encompass that. If you are a sucker for romance then I recommend this story.

This is such an adorable story that my youngest and I really enjoyed. We ended up having a pillow fight afterwards; one thing that she really liked. I enjoyed being able to discuss the concept of dreams, especially with regards to being able to make dreams a reality (such as when she is older). My youngest liked the few pictures that there was. I think that there could have been a few more pictures; however, she still sat and listened without moving so I don’t believe that the lack of pictures takes away from the quality. Overall I look forward to seeing more by Banks and I highly recommend checking out this book for you and your little ones.

I am very anxiety ridden when it comes to my health. I constantly think that there is something wrong with me and am constantly spending nights wide awake being unable to fall asleep because I think that X thing is wrong with me. That is when it was suggested to me that I start to spend time fixing my diet. I knew that improving my diet would help and got on board to create a healthier lifestyle for myself and my family. The DASH diet was also recommend and since I know this author’s writing style and enjoy it I went ahead and purchased this book. This book provided me with awesome information on the DASH diet and delicious recipes to help me stay on track. Basically I started to feel more confident that I was taking the right steps to being healthy and my anxiety started to ease away. I am definitely happier (and healthier) thanks to this book; highly recommended.

Despite the winter time there has been an awful lot of rain where I live. I walk my dog multiple times throughout the day and an umbrella is a must. Unfortunately my old umbrella broke and I knew that I needed to replace it. I have had great experiences in the past with this company and therefore felt confident to order an umbrella from them. The package came quickly and I was so excited to see the design. I am a sucker for the sky blue color and this brought a huge smile to my face. It is a little stiff to get open, but is nice and sturdy. I am very impressed with this umbrella and know that I will be using it to walk my dog in the rain for quite a while. If you are in the market for an umbrella I highly recommend grabbing this one; it’s cute and durable.

My fiancé is a big tea guy. He loves tea and is always telling me how great tea is for your body and mind. I am not a huge fan of tea, unless it is cold and sweetened (haha). With that being said I have a huge issue with anxiety. I am an anxious wreck and it seems to be worse at night when I am trying to sleep. I do not want to be heavily medicated, but I was reaching my breaking point. My fiancé convinced me to try tea. We came onto Amazon and picked out this book, which not only gave me some ways to make great tasting tea (which is not something I ever thought I’d say) but also provided me with the benefits of the herbs that I was drinking. This is definitely an awesome book and has really helped ease my nerves at night; I highly recommend this book!

I purchased this book because my fiancé has been eliminating gluten from his diet. His birthday was coming up and I knew that he was bummed about not being able to eat delicious desserts. I decided that I was going to make him a sweets table (if you will) for his birthday to show him that he can still eat all of the desserts that he loves. I decided to do a few test runs at my parent’s house and was so blown away by how delicious each dessert I made was. I was a bit skeptical, but grew more and more confident with every amazing bite I took. My fiancé was in heaven on his birthday! I am one happy baker and I highly recommend this healthy cookbook if you are looking for delicious gluten free desserts.

This was such an awesome book! I purchased this specifically so that I could learn how to increase my standing on Fiverr.com. I have been doing fairly well on the site selling my gigs; however, I knew that I had to learn a bit more in order to truly boost my sales. Dan Howe not only shares 33 tips that are beneficial to those selling on Fiverr, but provides tips and advice to those simply trying to earn an income online. I learned a lot that I can use to increase my sales on Fiverr and more importantly this book helped me think of new ways that I can earn an income online. Overall this book is easy to follow, well written, and jam packed with great information; I highly recommend this book!

To be completely honest, I never thought that I would be reviewing a chicken and waffle recipe book. If I am being even more honest I never actually thought that I would be making any kind of chicken and waffle recipes. That changed when I moved in with my boyfriend (now fiancé) and his brother. We started taking turns making dinner a few nights a week and one of the first nights my boyfriend’s brother made us chicken and waffles. I was so taken back by the mix of these two foods that I almost thought they were pranking me. I found out later that they are both very into chicken and waffles and now know how popular these recipes are. It has been a while since that has happened and my fiancé and I now have our own home; however, I still think back to that chicken and waffle dinner. I purchased this chicken and waffle recipe book because my boyfriend’s brother is coming over for dinner and I wanted to have a little throw-back to that night. I am not a great cook; however, this recipe book was very fun and easy to follow. My chicken and waffle dinner turned out awesome (I made more than one of these recipes for that night) and the four of us (his brother brought his new girlfriend) had a wonderful night. I highly recommend this book to anyone looking for some delicious chicken and waffle recipes; you won’t be disappointed!

I cannot help but rant and rave over this book. I am one of those people who has tried and failed when it comes to losing weight. I know that a huge portion of the problem was that I wanted results instantly. Unfortunately it had taken me a lot longer than I care to admit to actually understand that you cannot expect instant results when it comes to weight loss. If you do something that result in an instant weight loss then there is a chance that you are either causing yourself harm or you are going to be gaining the weight right back. My point is that I had finally understood this and was ready to try something that was slower, but that was going to lead me to success in the end. I had heard of the Ketogenic diet before and was very excited when my boyfriend told me that his friend recommended this book. I was mainly so excited because his friend had lost over 100 pounds and that is the direction I knew that I was headed. I purchased this book and to my surprise I received more than just a recipe book for losing weight. I learned the ins and outs (the history, if you will) of this diet and how it really works to help me look and feel my best. I have lost 20 pounds in less time than I would have imagined and I feel so much healthier. I plan on continuing using what I have learned in this book, as well as enjoy the delicious recipes, as I continue my quest to a healthier life. If you are looking for something that really works then I highly recommend this book!

This was such an awesome diet cookbook. Recently I have been trying to get back on track with my weight loss. I had been very successful and lost up towards 90 pounds, but then I stopped working so hard and gained all but 20 pounds back. I knew that I had to try something that was going to be long lasting and that I could sustain on for the rest of my life. That is why I purchased a few different diet tip books, recipe books, and diet cookbooks. I am most impressed with this particular cookbook because you are receiving a lot of solid information about why the 20/20 diet works. You are not just receiving recipes that can help you lose weight, but actual information on how this diet can help you become a healthier (and thinner) person. I highly recommend this book if you or someone you know is looking to lose weight.

It was way too easy to get completely lost in this story. I had a really hard time putting this book down once I started. I knew Ava Ashley would have me on the edge of my seat again and I was definitely not disappointed. You get so caught up in Savannah and Cooper as individuals and then even more caught up with the fact that they are in love with each other. I was hooked and needed to keep reading to find out how their relationship was going to turn out. I highly, highly recommend this book; great read!

I am a complete book worm and I am constantly adding new titles to my library. Once I find an author or a topic that interests me I tend to read everything that they have to offer me. I was very excited when I saw that Sam Siv (who is one of my favorites when it comes to instructional guides) had written a manual for newlyweds. I am in the very beginning stages of planning my wedding (I am so happy and giddy that everything feels perfect) and I know that there is a slight high that comes from being engaged and trying to throw together a wedding. With that being said I know that marriage is not always easy and therefore anything that I can learn to keep me and my better half together (and happy) is appreciated. Sam Siv once again did not disappoint me. I learned a whole bunch of tips on how to ensure everything stays good as we go through the good and bad in life. I highly recommend this book if you or someone you know are newlyweds (or getting married and will be newlyweds); you won’t be disappointed.

Review for Play Me  Kimberly KinkaidA young waitress grad student attends a girls night at a male strip club. She is very uncomfortable, and is looking for excuses to leave, until a very hot guy dares her to stay, and then totally breaks down her barriers with a very sexy dance.....for her. They're very attracted, but both have secrets. Can they share and their emotions survive?Pat Fordyce  Note: as of this moment I have received the incorrect download of this book. I received a copy of Pay Me from the publisher and author for an honest review.  When I receive the correct file, will review more.

Five+Stars! My favorite genre to read is romantic suspense.  I have read each and every I-Team novel and listened to them on audio. They never disappoint.This story is a rollercoaster ride that starts quickly at what is supposed to be a boring Christmas party at a glorious Denver hotel, and turns into a nightmare. Ms. Clare takes us through every harrowing turn and dip. There is violence, cruelty and even death, but the biggest message in all her novels is loyalty, honor, family and love.  Through this terrible night, there is strong bonds holding this little group of people together. The love of husband and wife, precious friends and the promise of being there for each other. I cried, gasped and thought my heart stopped for a minute.  The only disappointing thing about this hot, action packed novel? It's the end of the I-Team stories. I can't wait to see what Pamela Clare brings us next.....but someday I hope the I-Team is back.Pat Fordyce

This is the second book in the Hearts of Montana Series, and as much a pleasure to read as the first.Cherry Hill has lived all her life in Broken Falls, Montana. She was raised by her grandparents, her parents left her long ago. She was an only child, but her cousin Stacey was her best friend and the sister she never had. She nursed her grandmother through the last year of her life, her heart breaking to lose her. She inherited the diner owned by her grandparents and was determined to make them proud. It was taking all her savings, not to mention every minute of her time, and a grease fire in the kitchen was the beginning of a difficult life change. The same day, she receives a phone call that her best friend/sister Stacey and her husband were killed in a car accident, and her nephew, eight year old Sam, was hospitalized. She is the designated guardian in the will, and is overwhelmed with grief at the loss of her family, but so relived that Sam survived. She is met at the hospital by the rest of the family who feels she is worthless and are determined to take Sam away.Taylor Johnson is the town sheriff, recently returned to Broken Falls after many years. He and Cherry were young lovers, sworn to be together forever. Until he packed up his truck and left the sleepy town for the military and a new life. He regrets that day with all his heart, and hoped returning would convince Cherry to forgive him. In a spontaneous decision, when Cherry's  family confronts her, he explains that he is her fiancé  and would be taking Cherry and Sam to his home the Lazy J Ranch.  He convinces Cherry to go along with it, but soon old love becomes new love they can't deny. Cherry has a secret, one that could destroy their relationship and any hope of a future. She wants to open up, but when is there a right time?The characters in this novel pull you into their world. I laughed, cried and enjoyed every page. If you enjoy like reading romance with a sizzle, small towns and cowboys, grab this novel.I received this novel from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

If your looking for a very sexy read with great characters and some laughs, I suggest this book.Chloe Franklin has lived in Beaufort, South Carolina her whole life.  She grew up in the house that was transformed into a bar and restaurant by her Mom. It is called Honey's and she's trying very hard to make it a successful tribute to her Mom. Two years ago she met a handsome Search and Rescuer named Gage McGraw, while he was in town for the weekend. The weekend was hot, sexy and memorable. So much so they have repeated it multiple times over the last two years. Chloe has a commitment phobia, so sporadic weekends is perfect for her.Gage is former military, and loves his job with search and rescue. The travel, the great emotional high of finding the missing, and the adrenaline rush make him feel alive. That is, until a recent rescue almost ended his life. He realized that if he had died, no one would miss him, and that was a wake up call. He is in Beaufort for three weeks training new recruits, and decided to try and make Chloe more than a weekend fling. Starting with dating.....seems simple enough but horrifies Chloe. So Gage resorts to bribery. If she agrees to go on a date he will happily give her whatever she wants.......which is hot sex.Gage wants to continue his travel and S&R, but Chloe doesn't want to sit waiting for his return from his dangerous missions. His pursuit of a date and her frustration with his rules  for sex made me laugh out loud.  As far as Chloe is concerned, "love is a cliche." She saw it in her own life, her Dad leaving and occasionally returning, and the depression and misery it caused her Mom. She would rather be alone than suffer from her heart breaking a little at a time.  Is there even a possible compromise?This sizzling story in a quaint little town is a quick fun read. I enjoyed the secondary characters, and hope they have a story also. I received his ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

I have never had any experience with LARP ( Live Action Role Playing) and was very interested to see how this novel approached it. It was fascinating!Carlos Castiilo known as 'Los to his fellow operatives in Maltese Security, has been trying to prove he is more than a computer geek for over a year. A long time Gamer in the world of Battledrome, where he was known as Zephyr,  tragedy made him drop gaming and live in the "real world" of his security job. A lost bet and a hook up in a grungy bar leaves him with a strange feeling of sadness. She was gone when he woke up, and for the first time in a long time he was hoping for more.Mika Ito is a textile designer which she loves , but, she also is the Silver Queen in Battledrome. She designs elaborate costumes for her soldiers to wear while LARPing.  Lately some of her fellow players have been mugged, no one badly hurt so far, thank goodness, but they are stealing her costumes. What could anyone want with those? She decides to consult with Maltese Security to hopefully figure it out. But, in walks her gorgeous one night stand from the bar last night!  He is an operative and assigned to her case. Now, that's uncomfortable, especially when he is expected to go undercover as her new boyfriend. When she finds out who his alter ego was she decides maybe he is the one for the job. Especially when she herself is mugged. 'Los goes into protection mode, but he really wants more.This is the fourth Book in the Killer Style series. It can be read as a stand alone, but I recommend the first three in the series, all a unique and enjoyable read. Designed For Murder is a look into the world of role playing and on line adventures that cross over into everyday life. A very interesting story, with sizzle.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This is the first novel in a new series by Ms. Robson. It follows the O'Brien family, seven wild and crazy siblings (6 boys and one girl) who work and party around Philadelphia.  This first story centers around Curran, a police officer with a tough as nails reputation. Curran's self-esteem and emotions were recently rocked by the near death of his rookie partner and he feels responsible. His superiors feel he needs some time to get his head together, so he has been assigned to bodyguard duty for his brother Declan's intern. Declan is an Asst. D.A. and working on a dangerous high profile case that involves a mafia leader. Fear of retaliation is high.Contessa Newhart is Declan's intern. She is in her last year of law school, seems shy, very understated, almost frumpy, but a very hard worker. When Contessa (Tess) walks into Declan's office to meet her protector, she is rocked to her core. This tall gorgeous man with piercing blue eyes and Tess had a brief encounter in college. On her one and only escape from her boring routine, her friends convince her to go to frat party, and she remembers every moment, unfortunately so does he! He immediately calls her argyles, the socks she wears frequently, and actually tied him up with. His teasing and banter with Tess is hysterical until he realizes behind the shy mousey exterior is a very intelligent woman who has been traumatized by someone who should have been protecting her.This is a very sexy romance between two people who have serious issues and find themselves needing each other more than they could possibly have imagined. Danger is lurking, but Connor has promised to protect her with all that he has. But, how do you protect someone from their own father?I really enjoyed this novel, and can't wait to read the next in this very entertaining series.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for my honest review.Pat Fordyce

Tangled  Kate DouglasTangled is a short story included in the anthology Hot Alphas with Lora Leigh, Laurelin McGee, Shiloh Walker and Ms. Douglas. This is a romantic suspense, first in a series set in the wine country of California. Ms. Douglas is an award winning author of paranormal erotic novels, but I personally love her contemporary romance.Cassie Phillips is the winemaker for Tangled Vines Dry Creek Winery. This winery is supposed to be her legacy, but her father's failing health and unfortunate investments caused the property to almost go into bankruptcy. It was bought by an up and coming investor who is keeping Cassie on as winemaker, but the house and grounds, including her home are owned by the buyer. For now she is living in a cottage on the property and visiting her Dad in an assisted living facility, while continuing her first love, wine making.Nate Dunagan is the new Vineyard Manager hired by Marcus Reid, the buyer. He arrives at the vineyard in the dark, with a dead cell phone and a locked gate. Rescued by Cassie they share a pizza, wine and long conversation and they are deeply attracted. Cassie has "morning after" concerns, her life is too complicated. Nate wants to prove her wrong.A very satisfying  story, with suspense, danger and very old secrets. Not to mention hot romance! A perfect introduction to the new series.I received this novel from the publisher and author for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This novella is a laugh a minute! A strictly go by the rules PI with an office next to a beautiful woman who reads tarot cards, crystal balls and contacts ghosts. They team up to figure out who or what trashed there offices and find a much more interesting connection. Great Halloween quick read!

What can I say that hasn't been said before?  Another emotional roller coaster ride from Ms. Ashley!  I spent the first half of the book crying and wanting to shake Millie for putting up with the heartbreak; at the same time so angry at Chaos and the brothers for being so cruel. But I didn't give up and Walk Through Fire, Millie and High (Logan) proved that Chaos Motorcycle Club are bad boys with a lot of heart. Alternating from the past to the present was especially heart rending.  Can't wait to listen to the audio version of this amazing story. An amazing addition to the Chaos family..I received this novel from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce
These pajama's are soft, wash well and are very cute. This is the third time I've bought Leveret and have been pleased by all three.

I have read every one of Ms. Griffin's Tracer novels. They are amazing stories of romantic suspense. Shadow Fall is no exception. Investigations, tiny details, heart pounding action and a risky but sizzling love story. Don't miss this one! Pat Fodyce

Valentine's Day is a difficult holiday to get through at the best of times. But Stella Flynn  can't wait till it's over this year. Stella is the general manager of Flynn Winery, located in Napa and owned and run by her father and brother Liam. Her divorce papers were final three months ago and they are worried about her. Liam encourages her to get a way for a weekend, away from all the Valentine festivities at the winery. She agrees to a weekend away, but is not telling them her destination.Jason Roberts is the owner of Rough Ranch in Point Reyes. His ranch is known for it's amazing cheeses and organic farming. He left Napa many years ago to escape from his family and their winery and loves his new life. He is surprised to see Stella in his cheese tasting room on a rainy chilly day in February. He and Stella have known each other for years, Jason is Liam's best friend.  He immediately greets her and finding out she is there for the weekend, convinces her to spend the weekend with him in his home. Jason has given up his wild partying days and is even known as a "Rebel with a heart of gold!" Their immediate attraction moves him away from his "big brother " feelings.This novel is filled with the scenes and scents of Napa and Point Reyes. What could be more entertaining than wonderful cheese and wine in such a romantic setting?A friends to lovers story with the complications of family, stubbornness and fear of commitment. The passion and feelings they have for each other is too strong to walk away from.  A very enjoyable read. The first two books in the series are equally as entertaining.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

If you are a fan of Pamela Claire's novels, or even if you have never read one, grab this latest in her romantic suspense series, it will rock your world.Holly Bradshaw is an "entertainment writer; a smart but shallow blonde; a woman who loves sex, expensive clothes, and good times with friends."  She is close friends with the I-Team members, and their spouses, and they all feel very protective of her. In fact, joking with Kara, (wife of Reese) she was daydreaming about which of the men would be her fantasy. She immediately thought of Julian Darcangelo,  who she has had a secret crush on for years. I have to heartily agree with her on that choice. But, Holly does not play with married men.  She is dating Sasha Dudaev, a billionaire known for his interest in gas, oil and the arts. He is very generous with gifts, but Holly is finding him boring. Holly dates a lot of rich, intriguing, often dangerous men.Nick Andris is Holly's next door neighbor and has been investigating her for months. He listens, tracks her with a gps system, delved into her background and family and has yet to figure out what his bosses in the CIA/SAD ( Special Activities Division) could possibly want with her.  Other than the scumbag she is dating, who is involved with a lot more illegal dangerous things than he lets others know. Nick has a history with Sasha, and nothing would make him happier than taking him down dead or alive. Ms. Bradshaw seems to be a lover of expensive beautiful things, and men, not dangerous. It's time for Nick Andris ( alias Andrews) and Holly to meet. After all, their first encounter she wasn't aware he was there.I couldn't put this book down after the first chapter. It's shocking, funny and so heartwarming. So much fun to have all the characters together, the men bantering, all the kids, and the courageous women of the I-Team.  The epilogue alone is worth five stars as far as I'm concerned. I don't want the I-Team Series to end, but if this is the last story it ends with a blaze of glory.I received this ARC from the author for an honest review. I have all the books by Ms. Clare on audio, I can't wait to add The Seduction Game.Pat Fordyce

It is hard to categorize this story into a particular genre. There is suspense, police procedure, domestic abuse and an amazing love story.  A young woman survives her abuse and uses it to educate others about this often unreported crime. It is compelling in it's message and heartwarming to witness her road to recovery and love.  Ms. Eaton, as always, gives us a novel that keeps us talking about it, long after we reach the end.Pat Fordyce

I will be honest and say I don't usually enjoy reading novels about lawyers, legal problems or courtrooms. Sustained proved to me that legal novels are not all the same and this one has a lot of heart.Jake Becker is a well known defense attorney for a prestigious law firm in D.C. He is powerful, controlled and dedicated to routine, which includes his love life of one night stands. That is until two important things happen to him. One, a former hook up appears in his office with the news she has an STD. That rocks his control, a lot. He tests negative but decides he needs to change his routine and actually get to know a woman before he beds her, like actual dating. Two, while walking on the street he literally runs into a young boy who topples over in front of him. He helps him to his feet, the boy apologizes and is gone. Jake suddenly realizes his wallet is missing and goes after the boy. His life will change when he catches this child and learns his story.Chelsea McQuaid was in grad school enjoying her life with friends. But a phone call changes all that. Her life is uprooted and she has moved to D.C. to take care of her six nieces and nephews who were orphaned when their parents ( Chelsea's brother and only living relative) were killed in a car accident. The children range in age from 13 years-6 months. They are reeling from their grief and the upheaval in their lives, and though they love Aunt Chelsea, they are missing their parents. When Jake shows up with eight year old Rory, explains what happened, he can see the turmoil in the house on the shoulders of a young beautiful woman on her own. He agrees not to press charges, leaves his card for her if he can help. But, he can't seem to get Chelsea and those children out of his head.Sustained is a wonderful love story, not only between Chelsea and Jake but the children as well. I laughed a lot and shed some tears. Jake at times was frustrating but so lovable. These characters grabbed me from the first page, and when it ended I wanted more.  This can be read as a stand alone, but I'm anxious to read the next in the series Appealed.Pat Fordyce

Neve James is a gymnastics teacher for children, waiting for her dream to come true. "My real passion is Adagio, a combination of intimate dance moves that includes acrobatics and acro balance." Her dream is dancing with her partner Luca for a Cirque De Soleil troupe and she has been training tirelessly for the audition coming up.She has been exchanging letters with a soldier in Afghanistan, which has proven very interesting.  Sometimes outrageous, sexy and sad. But a real relationship is being forged.SPF Rory McRoy (Mic) is that soldier. His family is in Boston, runs a pub called McRoys along with his three brothers and his Mom and Dad. He is home on a short leave and Neve surprises him in the pub, a very sexy surprise, which is interrupted by a scream of a young  lady, who says she is his fiancé!  Neve decks him and is gone. No further communication. When he is finally home for good, he heads for Neve's and finds her seriously ill, in need of hospitalization. It's a rough few days, but she recovers and he insists she listen to his explanation...he is not going home till she believes him. She needs help with her meds at home, so he is staying.This is an emotional read dealing with families, misunderstandings and quick judgements. Neve's brother Nate is very protective of her, which helped her through trauma as a teenager. He is always there for her, but it's time she starts being realistic about her life. Does it include Rory?I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

It is always a pleasure to review a Jill Shalvis novel. There are so many wonderful things about her stories, the hysterical banter between characters, the story line usually has a little twist to give it some adventure, the romance and of course a dog! In this story we have the rescued  Burnese mountain dog, Oreo, who is afraid of his own farts.Zoe Stone lives in a 150 year old Victorian home, left her by her grandparents. Until recently she shared with her brother Wyatt and sister Darcy, but they have found their soul mates, so she is on her own. She is a professional pilot who can fix anything on her plane, but leaking sinks, clogged drains and bricks falling when she slams doors is a mystery to her. She is determined to go on a blind date, even though Darcy is trying to tell her the dress she's wearing makes her look like a granny going to bingo. Darcy has convinced Zoe to start this date off right, get the goodnight kiss over with when she opens the door, the rest of the night will be so more relaxing.Parker James is an Agent in Charge for the U.S. Fish and Wildlife service. He spends a lot of time undercover, and recently lost a friend and was injured on a case. He is supposed to be relaxing, healing but he can't get his mind off the case. Taking advantage of his good friend Wyatt's invitation he will be staying in the big old house with Zoe. He is quite amused when he knocks and the door and is opened by a long legged beauty who kisses him with out a word. Yes, he's going to enjoy his stay in Sunshine, Idaho. I laughed out loud at some of Zoe's predicaments. Walking in on Parker's shower, her crazy house problems and of course her lack of baking skills. But underneath is a beautiful love story, with a little danger and all our friends from Sunshine. Parker is trying to bring down a dangerous animal poacher, but Zoe gets under his skin. Ms. Shalvis never disappoints me with her wonderful novels.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

Faith Garrett had lived for three years believing she was part of a couple, wasn't exactly all sunshine and roses, but it worked. Until the day it didn't. Now she is working on being the independent woman she wants to be, she needs no man, especially someone from Evergreen Cove. Faith works for her best friend who owns an event planning business called Make it an Event. With the fall and holidays not too far off, their business is picking up. Plus, they are planning Sophie and Donavan's wedding and there happily ever after. Faith has her own apartment, and enjoys her solitude, until.....after a girls night of watching horror movies she is awakened by the sound of something scratching on her balcony door.Connor McClain has returned from four years in Afghanistan, and is starting up his landscaping business. He survived with out any physical wounds, but the horror of things he witnessed is still getting him up at night. He has been attracted to Faith forever, but after her breakup with the moron, he is giving her some space. That is till he hears about her possible break in. He goes into warrior mode. It seems there actually was an intruder, and he's not leaving Faith alone till she's safe, even if he has to sleep on her couch. He would much prefer her bed, but knows he can't rush.I love the characters of Evergreen Cove, and the couple's from previous Second Chance stories. The story is lighthearted, has some crazy characters, including Faith's previous boyfriend. The romance is hot, despite being stuck in a rustic cabin during a blizzard on Christmas.  This novel can be read as a stand alone, but I highly recommend the first two books in the series!I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This is the third book in the Extreme Risk Series. The series is centered around a group of best friends, professional snowboarders who always have to keep pushing for better and faster.Cam Bradley is extremely frustrated with her relationship with Luc Jennings. They had been best friends for years, but after a drunken encounter in a bed, it all changed. The only time they see each other is when the group is together, and then she is ignored. It was a fantastic night, but not worth ending their friendship. She just doesn't know how to get through to Luc.Luc Jennings is tired of being second best. He is a great athlete/snowboarder in his own right, but just can't seem to best his friends, Ash, Z, and Cam. His one night with Cam was amazing, but he knew she was still infatuated with Z, even though Z had fallen in love with Ophelia. Again, the underdog, Luc decided to cut his losses and try to move on. Very hard when your always thrown together. Suddenly one evening Cam shows up at his house, heart broken and near collapse from a disastrous evening with her family. Luc opens his arms to her, thrilled she has come to him.It was very hard to read the mistakes theses two made. They love each other, no doubt, but they can't communicate. Misunderstandings, jealousy and speaking without thinking plague this relationship. Ms. Wolff wrote this story with alternating chapters between Cam and Luc. If only the things that went on in there heads could have made it into words spoken to each other. After a life-changing event, for both of them, their love is put to the  test.This novel can be read as a stand alone, but reading the first two in the series will give you a better understanding of the characters. I enjoy this series very much.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

Welcome to Celebration Township, Pennsylvania. A small town with some wonderful characters.Cassandra Lowe, known as Casey has moved to Celebration to escape her recent past. She bought a "fixer upper" house and starts a new job soon. She will be the Nurse Supervisor of the ER, for the local hospital. She is escaping an ex and her family both of whom let her down, hard. As she is moving in, she realizes this is way more than a simple fixer upper!  Meeting her next door neighbor for the first time at the local bar is quite an experience. He's gorgeous, a local police officer and seems just as dazzled by her. So much so he walks into a door when leaving!Thad Wagner lives with his family, right next door to Casey.  He can't seem to get his new neighbor off his mind. He stops by to check on her and gets quite an eyeful of all the work she is planning to do and offers to help. As much as she wants to be independent in her new life, she realizes  some of the work is just too much for her and gladly accepts Thad's offer of help.  Each day they become more attracted to each other. A few stolen kisses and they both want more. But misunderstandings and silly arguments keep pulling them apart. Just when they think they have worked it out, danger from Casey's past threatens her and Thad must put his emotions aside and do his job as a police officer to save her.This novel is exciting, sexy and a fun read. Add some Christmas to the mix and this novella is a five star for me. I'm looking forward to more adventures in Celebration.I received an ARC of this novella for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This is a fascinating, very suspenseful time travel romance that will have you holding your breath at times!Anne Howard is an American young woman visiting her grandmother in London for the summer.  While going through the attic exploring she comes across a trunk with old letters addressed to her grandmother from a man she never heard of, not her grandfather. Catherine Hasting Howard decided it was time to tell her story....... She had fallen madly in love with an RAF surgeon and he with her. They were to be married on New Year's Eve. On Christmas Eve he disappeared with out a trace. Was it murder, kidnapping or something else? After hearing Catherine's story, and seeing his picture, Anne couldn't let it go. Catherine had moved on and met Arthur Howard and they lived happily together for 63 years. But she never forgot Jonnie.  Anne has decided she wants to know more. She investigates some of their favorite places even the pub, The Bishop's Crook, where Jonathan disappeared. She started hearing strange voices, people dressed in Elizabethan clothing and even someone calling her name. When Anne confessed this to Catherine, she became very agitated, explaining that Jonnie spoke of similar occurrences. Anne was frightened, wanted to go home to America, but couldn't get a flight. Catherine insisted she be prepared for the worst, clothing, a knife, penicillin and other needs always on her person. It came in handy. On a beautiful day in London, with her Grandmother by her side, Anne disappears.Her life in 16th century London is frightening, suspenseful and an amazing love story. Before she is unable to find Dr. Brandon she is manhandled by rogues and ends up in a few harrowing adventures that will have your pulse pounding!  Even after finding Jonathan, their lives became a life and death struggle with names the reader will find very familiar. I can't say enough wonderful things about this story. The prequel,  Begun By Time is equally as captivating as The Thornless Rose.  I'm hoping that the authors have another book in this series, I want to know a lot more about Sir Jonathan and Lady Anne.  This will be a novel added to my Best of 2015 list.I purchased this book, and this is my honest review.Pat Fordyce

Mesmerizing story about the last months of WWII in London. A young woman falls madly in love with an RAF physician and he with her. A love of a lifetime.  But, it's not to be......read it in one day and it totally grabbed my heart. Immediately began reading The Thornless Rose.

The Billionaire's Return  Dare Valley Meets Paris Book 4  Ava MilesMargie and Evan's parting in Paris was heartbreaking. After refusing his marriage proposal, he refused contact with her....his driver took her to the airport, he never answered phone calls, or texts. She just wanted to talk...explain.The bakery was off to an amazing start. She had more customers every day, and she was thrilled, but a big part of her was missing the joy. She missed Evan terribly. She even went so far as to contact Chase for help. Evan buried himself in his inventions and heartache. After Chase dragged him out of his lab, made him eat, and talked sense to him, Evan was going to Denver. He would try one more time.When Evan and Margie saw each other, they both new their love was solid. But, Margie still feared the notoriety, the lavish spending and it frightened her all over again. Evan had a solution, and a very good one, that would benefit so many people in Dare Valley.  Life was good, until Margie's parents interfered and caused more heartache and pain. Once again she realized she couldn't live like that. But, with the help of friends and looking deep into her heart, she couldn't live without Evan.This was an enjoyable series, and Ms. Miles told a beautiful story. I'm not a huge fan of serials, but Dare Valley Meets Paris flowed easily, the characters both in Dave Valley and Paris were a delight. All four books are released now, so the reader can read them all in order.  A very beautiful love story, with mouth watering baked goods.I received this ARC from the publisher for an honest reviewPat Fordyce
Exactly as pictured!  Very shiny small pendant which looks great with casual clothes. Very happy with my purchase.

In Book Three, Margie is devastated by the news of Evan's untruths and evasions. She backs away not answering his texts and calls to try and figure what she should do. When the texts show how worried he is she answers with a noncommittal "I'm fine just tired" Evan finally confronts her on her way to the bakery and tells all. "There are pieces of my past I'm not proud of, and I'm afraid you'll turn away from me when you find out about them." Margie feels like a weight has been lifted off her heart, she believes Evan and wants to spend as much time as she can with the days left in Paris. She is still enjoying every minute with Andre at the bakery, and feels she is learning valuable tools.Evan proceeds to give her a romantic tour of Paris. Dinners, scenery, unbelievable food and wine, and love. On one of the most magical nights, Evan proposes but is shocked at Margies answer. Soon her time in Paris will be over. What will her life be like in Dare Valley? The answers are in the final book, The Billionaire's Return.Pat Fordyce

Grace Andrews arrived in Las Vegas five years ago, and has been working on her life plan. She wants financial security, a home and even a family if she found the right guy. Her job as a fight promoter for the MFL has provided her with financial security, she is moving in with "the fight matchmaker" Erik Johnson, who is vice-president for the league of MMA fighters and hopefully has an engagement ring in her future. She is a little frustrated that Erik never seems to have time for her, but working together they at least see each other. Doing a favor for her best friend Kylie didn't seem that big a deal. Kylie's brother, Walker Adams, needs a place to crash for a few weeks, even if it's her couch. She had a huge crush on Walker when she was fifteen; now she is older, wiser and in a relationship. Grace sees hard, muscled, chiseled men all day, why does the sight of Walker shirtless leave her with a dry mouth and heart palpitations?Walker Adams has been sleeping in his jeep for a few weeks. He was cut off from his family after dropping out of law school to pursue his MMA fighting career. Staying with Grace was a huge help. She also set him up with a job, a very strict trainer, who  has led him to the chance for the first fight as a professional being a blockbuster.....if he survived. Grace is very much against this fight, she knows the fighter, Walker is no match. But, he is determined to fight, so she is all in, in more ways than one.I enjoyed this book, a lot. I'm not a huge fan of books based in Las Vegas,  they always seem too glitzy and have questionable characters. Grace and Walker are the exception. I enjoyed their easy banter, and slow realization of their feelings. But Grace  was still in a "relationship" with Erik while this was going on. Don't enjoy that a lot.If your into MMA fighting, Walker Adams is the underdog to root for.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This novel opens with a prologue, and we meet a little girl named Sunny. It is her birthday and she has a party, cake and friends. She is sure it is her best birthday ever, but what happens later that night will change and haunt her for the rest of her life.Sara Richards grew up with three brothers that lived next door. Being an only child, the boys and parents treated her like one of their own.  Rusty the oldest is a firefighter, Sam the middle son is a police officer, and Chris the youngest just finished his tour as a Navy Medic. He is now in medical school and working as a para-medic for the experience and helping to pay for school. He is almost done with his probation, and ironically his supervisor is none other than Sara. They have a easy relationship, and when Chris is looking for a place in Denver instead of his parents home, Sara offers him her extra bedroom to help her with rent. They both work the night shift called "deep night" and sleep and study during the day. Sara had a huge crush on Cris as a teenager, but a lot of things have changed, and she wants no part of a relationship. They live and work very well together, but Chris would like more.This entertaining novel takes us behind the scene for a look at First Responders. The calls they are sent on vary from heart attacks, drug overdoses and everything in-between. Sara suffers from nightmares ( her nickname is Sunny) and Chris has flashbacks to his harrowing experiences as a field medic and his own injuries. It shows the human side of PTSD, service dogs and the wonderful things they do, with a sweet friends to lover's romance adding spice.This is the third book of Denver Heroes, it can be read as a stand alone, but the stories do connect. Very enjoyable story, and one I recommend.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for a honest review.Pat Fordyce

This novel opens with a Marine on his tour of duty getting letters from someone from home. They grew up together, but have always had a rocky relationship. The letters between Tristan Lawson and Lemon McCoy are funny, sarcastic and sometimes even sweet giving us an idea of their "friendship."After an injury that sends him home he heads straight to Lemon's house, where he is turned away by Apple, Lemon's sister, telling him lies to "protect her sister." Lemon never learns about this encounter. A few years go by, Tristan is now the head librarian in their struggling library, Lemon owns her own business and is still living at home. She delivers some papers from her father to Tristan, and the old sparks combust. For one amazing night, all their bickering is pushed aside. But in the morning, it's back. But, something happened that night that can't be swept aside. Lemon is pregnant, she wants the baby and she wants to marry Tristan.This novel can be read as a stand alone, but characters from previous books are a large part of the story. I found myself wanting to shake Apple for her cruelty to both Tristan and Lemon. Their growing love is sweet and touching, and they find out they can handle just about anything together even with interference and bumps in the road. An enjoyable story with a very satisfying ending.I received this ARC from the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This is the fourth book in the Worth the Fight series and I found it somewhat different than the first three. An emotional roller coaster is the best way I can describe it.It is enjoyable to read how the previous characters are spending their lives.Violet Channing grew up with a very strict, emotionless military father.  Her best friends, Jeremy Edwards and Cain Sorensen, from military families also, were three years older than her but accepted her tagging along. When she was sixteen, Cain and Jeremy went on their first deployment. Cain gave her a mind bending kiss, her first, and she was in love. Cain is the strong very silent type, so he hardly ever contacted her, Jeremy on the other hand wrote as often as he could, saw her every time he came home and finally with a lot of fanfare, proposed. She said yes. But, on a mission not long after, Jeremy was killed.Cain Sorensen, former Army Ranger, MMA fighter and a contractor for IMF (International Military Coalition), has loved Violet since their first kiss, so many years ago. But as Jeremy's best friend, he stood back and tried to be happy for them. When Jeremy was killed, he went straight to Violet as soon as he could. But instead of pursuing her, he couldn't get past survivor's guilt, his own poor self image and his need to frequently disappear. He knew he could never be good enough for her, so instead, would pull her close when he needed her, then turn around and be gone. Violet has had enough of the way he treats her, if she could only be strong enough to not forgive him and send him on his way.I wanted to bash Cain and Violet's head together a few times. Little or no communication, loving each other with all their hearts, but could not put it into words.The ending is perfect and worth the frustration.  Cain and Violet are a couple destined to love, if they could just get over their fear and guilt.I received this ARC from the publisher and Netgalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

Another delightful read in the Late Bloomers series, and get ready for Ivy Cross! Ivy is "a breaker of rules and hearts and has crossed the threshold of middle age and lost her spark."  She is tired of her job as an economist for the American Embassy even though she is being offered an unexpected promotion. She needs a big change. One of her options is Ruben Allegre. A very handsome business man from Madrid who is best friend's with Mateo, Rose's lover now fiancé from Wild Rose. Ruben is a charming, flirtatious ladies man who has set his sights on Ivy. He wants her to stay in London or come to Madrid where they can spend time together. Ivy is attracted to Ruben, but is not interested in a relationship and dodges his every move.Along comes Christoph Brandt, a serious business rival of Ruben's and he sets his sights on Ivy, offering her a very lucrative job in Germany, with a BMW to sweeten the deal. Ivy is very tempted, but Ruben's determined to not let her go. The scenario is very well written and keeps you guessing; will it be Ruben, or Christoph and Germany, or something not yet in her sight?The Late Bloomers are an amazing group of five best friends, more like sisters, all have different personalities, dreams and hopes, but I think Ivy and Rose could not be any more opposite!  If you haven't read Wild Rose, you should!  The characters are delightful, the locations beautiful, and the stories will warm your heart. I can't wait for the next.I received this ARC from the publisher for an honest review.Pat Fordyce 5 Stars

Avery Crosslin, wedding planner, is hurrying to the venue for the wedding she and her half sister Sofia, have planned down to the last detail. The one thing she hadn't planned for was running into a scorpion in her path. She throws a glue gun, missed, now is aiming a can of hair spray when a deep voice informs her that scorpions can hold there breath for a week.  He than crushes the scorpion with a well worn boot.  Joe Travis, of the rich and famous Travis's introduces himself. Joe is a photographer, commercial and free lance. He is attending the wedding she has planned as a guest, and is fascinated by the wedding planner. Avery is a full figured woman, wears boxy, loose comfortable clothes, and is not interested in men. Ironically she was left at the altar for her own wedding, and she's much happier planning.Sofia and Avery met a few years ago at their fathers bedside. He had a massive stroke and was not expected to live. He was a serial husband, married five times with children scattered everywhere. Sofia grew up in San Antonio, Avery in Dallas, and from their first meeting they were best friends, and the business they started was becoming successful.This can be read as a stand alone, but I think you would love to meet the other Travis brothers. Joe is persistent in trying to convince Avery they would be good together, but, as in all good romances there are obstacles, some personal, some career choices. I totally enjoyed the characters, the romance and a second little romance working as a side plot. We also reconnect with some characters from the previous books.  All in all, a very satisfying read and I highly recommend it.I received this ARC from the publisher and Netgalley for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This series needs to be read in order, so if you haven't read The Billionaire's Gamble, start there first.Margie has arrived in Paris for her apprenticeship and much to her delight is met at the airport by Evan Murray( Michaels)  Evan is not ready to confess his true identity yet, he's afraid Margie will turn away. He sweeps her off her feet with a tour of the city, dinner plans, along with their first kiss. He has everything in control. The romance is sweet, sensual and add the beauty of Paris, almost like a fairytale.Margie starts work at Boulangerie Ma Belle, meets the chef, Andre and his lovely wife Belle. They take her into their hearts immediately, and Andre will be teaching her his old family recipe's and the art of perfect bread. She loves every minute, but can't wait to finish to be with Evan as much as possible.  Evan is having some difficulty with his partner Chase, who fears his infatuation with Margie is interrupting his need to work. Evan somewhat angrily informs Chase that it is not the case.Margie's dream continues.Walking Margie to work one morning, Evan meets Andre and Belle, in a casual conversation later in the day, Belle shows her a magazine with pictures of Evan Michaels, Margie's Evan, and she is crushed. "He'd given her the most intimate and sensual experience of her life, but he didn't tell her who he was."  All she can think about is that her heart has been broken again by secrets and lies.  I am highly anticipating Volume Three to see where these lovers go from here.Each of these novels ends with a cliff hanger, but they are being released close together, so it's not a problem for me. If you hate cliffhangers wait till the four books in the series are released. This mini-series is worth the wait.I received this ARC from the publisher for an honest review. I was not compensated in any way for his review.Pat Fordyce

Evan Michael's, billionaire, inventor and well known bad boy is playing poker with a winning hand but not enough chips to continue......so a side bet is made with Jane Wilcox and Rhett Butler Blaylock from Dare Valley. Spend a month as a "normal" man in Dare Valley, Colorado on a fixed budget, get a job and be celibate. No problem....he's got a winning hand! But, he loses!Margie Lancaster own's a beautiful Victorian home and rents rooms. She is the manager of Don't Soy With Me, everyone's favorite coffee shop. Her ultimate dream is about to come true, she has bought a local bakery and turning it into her own. It needs work, and she's practicing her specialties at home to make them perfect. A very handsome man contacts her to rent a room for a month. He introduces himself as Evan Murray from Paris,  an artist here to try and wake up his muse. Evan is instantly attracted to Margie, cursing his celibate agreement. After getting to know each other Margie hires him to paint her new shop. Not exactly art, but it's a job. Margie is thrilled at the opportunity to spend six weeks in Paris, studying with a renowned pastry chef and as their friendship grows, looking forward to seeing Evan while she is there. Evan wants to confess his secret, but decides to wait till Margie is with him in Paris.This is a very enjoyable start to this Paris mini series. Not instant love, but a growing friendship that offers more. What will Margie do when she finds out the truth? Evan's time in Dare Valley has stirred his long dormant creative juices, is he out of his slump?These questions will be answered in the second story, The Billionaire's Secret, which will be releasing August 12th. Lots of fun to read.....I received this novel from the publisher and author for an honest review.Pat Fordyce.

This novel is a beautiful, emotional feast for the senses. Ms. Florand's descriptions of flowers, smells and scenery make you feel like you are there in Grasse, France. The biggest feast is for your heart.Damien Rosier is known as dark, powerful and merciless, both in business and his personal life. He is the guardian of his family's empire, protecting it from all outsiders. His Tante Colette seems to be working against him though. Colette was a resistance fighter, along with other members of her family in WWII.  They rescued over 30 children and sent them to Switzerland.  She is as strong and feisty as she was  during the war and is now in her 90's  Colette has brought another young woman to Grasse giving her part of the Rosier inheritance. A small shop in the heart of Grasse. This young woman is Jasmin Bianchi. Her father left Grasse many years ago to start his own perfume company. Jasmin is following in his tradition and is now famous for a perfume she regrets selling. Spoiled Brat. It was a sarcastic gift to the world of perfume made by a very young woman who had just graduated from perfume school. It is still a best seller, but she wants to move on. She is overjoyed at the gift of this beautiful old shop from Tante Colette. She is planning on doing only custom fragrances for customers.Damien met Jasmin at a party a few years ago. She was beautiful, shy and dressed in a filmy romantic dress. It was a magical night, no real names were exchanged, and she was gone in the morning. Damien was very disappointed, but the next day he met with a major shareholder of a company he was taking over and shattered Jasmin's  heart. This was HER company, a chance to show her talents. Not two weeks later her father passed away after a long debilitating illness. She couldn't seem to get past the grief, so the letter from Colette Delatour's attorney was a huge step toward coming back to the world. Except, there was Damien and Damien could not forget that night or Jasmin.This is a love story to read again and again. It can be read as a stand alone, but don't deprive yourself of the pleasure of reading all the La Vie En Roses stories.I received this ARC from the publisher and author for an honest review.Pat Fordyce

This novel is an emotional rollercoaster. A family in turmoil; a drug addicted brother, a sister that has suffered through a  tragedy and then is betrayed by her husband and a mother who spends most of her time criticizing whatever her children choose to do.Maisey Lazarow a children's author living in NewYork is returning to her family home in Fairham, a tiny island off the coast of South Carolina. She is returning because her drug addict brother attempted suicide and needs her help. She wants to be there for him, but she needs some help herself. Keith Lazarow is fighting and endless battle against drugs, depression and the inability to make a life for himself. His mother Josephine's constant belittling and criticism, also now focusing on Maisey is making them miserable. Maisey quickly decides she will be staying at the rental cottages her father left her despite the fact they are damaged from a hurricane, she would rather live there than at the mansion with her mother.Raphael (Rafe) Romero is the hired contractor rehabbing the cottages at Smugglers Cove. He and Maisey met years ago at a wild party. She was only seventeen, lied about her age and lost her virginity to Rafe. As soon as he found out her age he was gone.
