Don't know if that will be the case with yours or not.- They are different grits, but four out of five are more or less what I am used to, one side a little courser than the other, but both pretty fine. The fifth is HEAVY grit. I don't know that I'll ever actually use it on my nails, maybe my toenails I guess.I really like these overall. A good buy in my opinion

This is a wonderful tablet/phone stand. I would say this was specifically designed for Apple devices because of the small half circle hole on the edge. It allows me to press the home button without taking my phone out and then pressing it. The inside has rubber stamps that protect my phone from hitting the hard aluminum. The angle is adjustable by pressing the button on the side, so it will stay in place when not pressed. There are a lot of possible angles because of that mechanism instead of just a single angle.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This backpack can be neatly compressed in the pouch that is attached to the bag.It seems to be common style now a days, which is a great thing because it saves a lot of space and makes the backpack easier to carryaround. The backpack is very light but seems very durable to carry around. I can fit plenty of books and even my tablet in there with no problem.For the price, this is a great backpack. But I am a little put off by the material, it seems a little thin but I have had other cloths made the same material that are still holding up to this day.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I have never tried glass nail files before, but this has been a great first experience with them.I love the color and feel and look of these files, not too light, not too heavy. The color is also a nice gradient of blue to white.Works very well, there are 3 sizes to choose from. The end is rough and jagged like sand paper but the part you hold is smooth.Because these use the natural hardness of the glass to file your nails, I would say this is a much better investment than normal files, as those tend to wear out quickly because of the small amount of sandpaper glued onto plastic.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

If you have to hold onto your phone constantly because you:Have no pockets or find it annoying to take your phone out of the purse every time this is perfect for you.The flap is magnetic and secure without needing to annoying to opening and close like a button.I can fit this on my belt and/or my pants edge because the back has 2 belt loops and a plastic latch (which has a very tight grip).Fits my iPhone 6 perfectly because I have a case on, which adds bulk making it 5 inches.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This says it will fit 4.7 inches phones, but because my iPhone 6 has a case on it is slightly bulkier, the fit is very snug it would not fit. If I had a thinner or no case, this would fit perfectly. But my friend has an iPhone 5 and it fit perfectly him perfectly. The latch is magnetic and is not hard to open unlike a button snap latch. The back has 2 belt loops and a tight plastic latch so it can go through your belt and/or latch onto your pants.It seems very secure and will not fall apart.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

The color is a nice bright blue, which is also my favorite shade of the color. I have an iPad mini and this protects it very well because it covers the entire body. You know how some cases only protect the back but not the front? Well this one also covers the screen with the built in protector. I love that there is also a built in stand, no need to purchase a separate tablet stand which can be annoying to carry around.The case is hard plastic and also a soft material on the inside, so it will protect my iPad mini very well. Seems like a very durable and protective case, definitely will last a long time.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

When I had ordered, it was just the smaller orange pouch, but it seems that they included a bigger pink pouch as well now.It is good to have both options, as the pink bag is larger and can fit most tablets, while the smaller can fit most phones.The material is transparent, but waterproof, which is perfect for environments near the water. As it implies, this is great to take along withyou to the beach or fishing. The zipper seal is tight and prevents water from going in. Books fit nicely inside too, because they can also get wet at the beach, but this protects it.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This is a great way to get some exercise into your day without moving from the desk. Very useful especially if you work a desk job.The assembly was very simple, they give you the right tools to do it also. The resistance mechanism is easy to operate and just needs the screw on the top to be loosened or tightened. I took off a star because I found rust, but I contacted the seller and I was told they would send a replacement and they would improve the varnishing process, great customer service!I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I have heard about how much cleaner it is to use a bidet instead of toilet paper, and if I think about it, it makes sense.The installation was easy, they include an adapter to fit into your original toilet water valve, and you need to connect the water hose they gave you to the bidet and the original hose to the toilet. The toilet seat can be unscrewed if you look at the toilet at the ground, there are 2 knobs to unscrew. The water pressure can be adjusted to suit anyone, there are 5 power levels. The best thing is that this does not require electricity to operate, it only relies on the water pressure from your water valve.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Such a friendly case for children. The handle is big and allows them to hold onto their iPad Mini without dropping it.The protection is immense because it is covered in thick EVA foam. This case also always the finger print button to work because it does not cover it. I love that the handle can also double as a stand, too bad it only has about one angle though, but it works very well.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Awesome for a detox period of 2 weeks.Definitely better than those pills and other methods with a bunch of artificial ingredients, this one is all natural.I just need one teaspoon and pour in about 8 OZ of water, I find that I can steep this up to 2 times. The flavor is strong and has a fragrant aroma.I love that it has no caffeine, caffeine is often a powerful source of dehydration and prevents sleeping. I can drink this and slip inside a restful sleep.I was provided a discount/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Comes in 2 layers, a silicone and a hard plastic layer. The plastic and silicone actually fit together like a puzzle though, making it take the space of just one layer. The back of this case has a built in stand, making it great for hands-free viewing. I love that it has immense bezel protections, raising 2MM above the lip. A good worthy opponent to the otterbox for a cheaper price. Even comes with a free glass screen protector.I was provided a discount/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I love the colors black and yellow, so that theme is apparent on this case. Comes with a free glass screen protector!If you need a phone case with protection comparable to an otterbox but not as expensive, I think this is a great choice.The side bezel protection raises 2MM!! That is a lot of ground protection. The sides also have air cushioning, making it defensive from all kinds of falls. I also like the built in stand, it can be plopped back on the case and is flat when not in use. CI was provided a discount/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

The stainless steel straws come in a plastic packaging, like the ones you would find in a grocery store. There is also a cleaner included.The straw is bent around where the rim would be for most cups. Good for being eco friendly, these straws are reusable unlike plastic straws.Edges are not sharp, very dull. They also have a nice polished matte theme.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Awesome for cars without hand straps built in. You can just place this and secure it with your seats head rest. There are 2 small hinges on each side that allow you to place your objects with straps onto it, I use it to place my trash bags (if you have guests that can easily get car sick, this is a good place to always have your throw up bags prepared. They can also hold onto the strap if they need support.)I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

The bottle is made from 18/8 stainless steel and that means it will last a long time without rusting or breaking if it falls on the floor.I can carry this around with my easily or strap it onto my backpack because it has a carabiner. The bottle is also insulated, allowing me to preserve the the temperature inside and hold it without it being too hot too cold to handle because the outside is cool to the touch. If I am looking to drink 8 cups of water in a day, me drinking 3 full containers will put me there. It hold 27ozs, approx. 3 cups in US measurements.I was provided a discount/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This is a very minimalistic case for iPhone users that do not want to add much bulk to their phone.It adds a nice back color to the phone, gold and black. The interior has micro fiber layer to not scratch your phone.I took off one star because I think the securing mechanism is not too well built. I can see it falling apart if you take it out of your pocket if there is too much pressure holding the bottom of the phone.I was provided a discount/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I love this case! It is so cute; the design is like a purse and to be honest if you are far away enough, it would probably fool someone.The handle, and the side pocket are like a purse. I can fit my phone in the side pocket as well, it is held by a magnetic button.The interior is soft and does not scratch, and I like that it uses a housing to hold the case instead of a snap on plastic attachement (you know what I'm saying? It's like the Snugg case, it uses a faux leather housing instead of a plastic snap on. It adds more protection if the iPad drops on the ground because the bezels are all covered.) There are also bumps on the inside to make it function as a built in stand.I was provided a discount/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

If you look closely at the display picture, you can see that there are 2 openings. I have found that there is an awesome use for that when making tea, when your tea has steeped long enough, you can flip the bottle over and remove the strainer and then place the cap back on. This allows you to get the perfect brewing times. There are also silicone o-rings on each cap and I have not found a leak when I screwed them on tight enough. The bottle is also borosilicate and double layered, feels warm to the touch even when the water inside is boiling. Cleaning and drying are easy, if I remove both ends, the bottle has 2 open ends and I can clean with a sponge and have it air dry with air coming from both sides.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I love this because it looks better than the plastic store bottles, but also because it will reduce plastic waste from purchasing those disposable bottles. I use Dr. Bonner's Peppermint soap and dilute it with water. (because the manual instructs to not use soap too alkaline or acidic or it could corrode the steel) The bottle has a dulled polishing and looks wonderful in my bathroom.I was provided a discounted/sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I love the design of this jump rope. The handles are sweatbands and are soft and have a secure grip on the hand.The cord has has a rubber coating but the interior is stainless steel wires, very evident by the way that the cord has no "memory". I hate it when the cord becomes bent and stays a position because I coiled it.The handles have a rotation system that allows the cord to spin without resistance.Overall, the construction is also very solid as the handles are made from stainless steel as well.This will definitely last much longer than your plastic jump ropes.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I received a wrong model from this company, but after some contact,  a day later they sent express 2 day shipping and corrected my order.The case itself is very nice, the headphone opening is sealed by a screw mechanism. The rubber band gasket has a replacement in case the one you receive is defective. The ringer is adjusted by a rotating mechanism. The case has a clear plastic on the top, I used it together with a glass screen protector and it worked without much less responsiveness. The touch id button works because of the clear elastic material.Overall, the case is designed well and is secure without any openings for any water to go in.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This wallet is made from high quality leather.The design is timeless and goes well with all ages. The alligator design is nice but there is also a nice sheen finishing to the exterior.A great fashion statement. The secure mechanism is a button and has lots of pockets inside to fit many cards.There is also a zipper inside, so you can store secure things without worrying about it falling out.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This is a wallet made from durable materials and the design is timeless.It is closed by the button snap mechanism. The interior has a lot of pockets, so you can place many cards and money inside.I like the clear film at the side, I can store a picture of a loved one in there or even a "contact me if lost" wallet card.The material is leather and the finish is matte. A great present for a female friend.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Seriously, youth these days are blasting music on their headphones like no tomorrow. Why even use headphones? They turn it so loud it is like speakers and you can hear it all the way across the room.On the other hand, this is a dangerous practice and it can definitely harm your hearing. Children are especially prone to this.Yes these are great headphones for children:There are no tangled cords to go through, it is all wireless by bluetooth.There is a volume limitation on these things, so the max is 85 decibels.I love the soft head band and the size length adjustments are effortless.The sound is less bassy and more balanced and clear, which can also help reduce ear trauma.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

The earphones come in a hard shell carrying case. There are also many different silicone tips included so that it can fit all ears.I am not an audiophile, but these earphones are definitely better than the stock apple earpods that came with the iPhone.Personally, the apple earpods never fit my ear well anyway and I do appreciate some noise isolation that can be found in IEM's.Overall, the product also looks much more premium, it has metallic parts and gives off a nice sheen. The cords are flat instead of round and tangle less. I like the control board, looks very simple and is easy to operate. The sound is clean and rich, sounds are all very balanced.One problem I found with most earphones are that they have crappy microphones, but this one brings a lot of clarity and the other person on the other line heard me very well.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I really like the concept of this lamp, there are 2 different lights: the base and the top part.The base can open by tapping the shutdown button that looks like a "Q" and so can the top portion.The base can has a color wheel where you can scroll through to select your color. Really cool that it is touchscreen.The gooseneck is flexible and can take on many angles. The top portion has 3 different light settings, "dim, normal, and bright".Awesome for a nightlight, you can just use the bottom part.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

The bag is really roomy, I would say it would fit most small-medium sized dogs.The fabric is woven sturdily and the bottom portion of the bag also has a detachable base. (Just in case he poops, I can clean it easier)The interior design has leopard prints, personally I am not too into that design, but it does seem to have a curious effect on the pets.It seems to add a layer for the pets to look at and to pique their interest rather than having a bland offset color.There are 2 air mesh holes, which they can also look through. One is on the side and another is on the middle.There is also a part on the side where you lift the panel and the pet can peek his head out.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This being my first try at a virtual reality headset, I did not know what to expect. I thought it would be uncomfortable to wear, but that is not the case. The 2 side straps are elastic and stretch, only needed to adjust the top strap. There are also foam covering the parts where your face would touch the headset. The set up was easy, I just installed a VR roller coaster app on my iPhone 6 and slid it into the opening slot. I am not sure about Android devices, but I think this only works for iPhone 5 or later phones. There is a specialized iPhone 5 slide insert included, so there is support for it. There are slits along the sides of the opening slot so you can pass your earphones through it and enjoy a even more immersive experience. Also, there is foam protectors inside the slide in slot, so my phone will not get scratched. When I aligned the screen in the center, it was really fun, I was able to use my phones gyroscope features to look around. Definitely a good starting VR set.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I heard that Chinese clothing sizes were smaller than US sizes, but it does not seem to be case for this one.The material is very comfortable to wear, feels nice on the skin and also has nice air flow.This is perfect for the autumn because it is borderline thick, so it should be perfect for fall winds.The pattern is beautiful and simple, I love the "zebra" strips.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

I think the coolest feature about this smart watch is the ability to work as a stand alone phone.Even then, the mic quality is not the best and sound quality is not too great either. And even if you talk through it, there is no headphone jack, maybe you could use bluetooth earphones but who has time to constantly have them on whenever you make a call?The camera app is honestly not good, the quality is blurry and the light exposure is very dim.It does work great as a watch though, and there are other features on it that are great. Like a sedentary alert and a pedometer.You do need to use a micro sd card for storage though, although it is not included.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This is a good budget smart watch for Android users, (I do not think it is worth it for iOS users. The iOS system is just too restrictive with 3rd party apps and products. Even with the app installed, the functions are very limited.) With Android, the options are a lot more open.The watch charges with a micro usb cable that is included.The icons in the smart watch look a lot like the official Apple icons, so there is definitely charm in that.The volume can be easily configured by tapping the middle button on the smart watch.When someone calls on the phone, you can accept it on the smart watch. You can also play music on the watch, but it is quiet and when it is loud the sound becomes very distorted.There are a lot of useful functions though, the basic one is obviously the ability to tell time. But for example there is a sedentary timer and an alarm. There is also a camera app, but all it does is become a remote shutter button.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Initially, I had purchased a big bag of matcha powder from my local Asian grocery store for only 5 dollars. It is from Taiwan, so there no dangers of radiation from it. When I compared this matcha powder to the one I had purchased from the store, I found very little different in the taste.The main difference was that this powder was a little bit more green. So perhaps this one has more nutrition, but other than that I do not see another difference. I noticed this one clumps up a little less than the one I had, so it might be good for desserts.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

The case has soft and rubbery sides, making it easy to grip in the hand.And the back is clear and also protective, the ports are all accessible.The only reason I took off one star because of the side button for "sleep/wake".This case has rubber tips on the inside of the side buttons that innately push against side buttons to make it easier to press the buttons,it is a nice idea because some cases make it hard to press the side buttons, but this one makes it FAR TOO easy. I put in my pocket, suddenly I get prompted to shut down my phone. Or if I am holding it, suddenly it closes.Very annoying issue, maybe mine is defective or is it just supposed to be like?(Only affects the sleep/wake button not the volume buttons.)I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

They come in a hard shell case but also have a separate pouch and a microfiber cloth.The style is quite nice, and at the side are reflectors that can help warm bicyclists, cars that there is someone there.They protect eyes well, and they are not as dark as other sunglasses. But the only problem for me is that it seems a little too tight.If you consider yourself, like me, to have a bigger head size this might not work too well.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

These glasses arrived in a protective hard shell case. These are 5 different lenses you can pick from, one is clear, one is yellow, one is black, one is blue, and the last one that is on by is the polarized lens. They all fit well inside the case.It is great for both genders and specially for people with smaller heads, as I personally found it a little tight but my nephew fit it perfectly.I would use the polarized lens during the day, and switch to the yellow one at night. The yellow lens limits blue light that prevents you from sleeping when using electronics. Sure you use the polarized lens, but actually most electronic displays are innately polarized and if you looks at it with another layer of polarization, the screen turns pitch black. The clear would be good for color sensitive work like painting or for artists' and even as safety googles.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This glass screen protector comes with a microfiber cloth, an alcohol wipe, dust sticker and guide stickers for installation.Is compatible with 3D touch because 3D touch senses pressure, so you may need to just press a little harder.The screen is water repelling like it said, and cleans easily if you wipe it with water. The home button cut out is on point.Also, please realize that this is not edge to edge, as edge to edge is impossible to achieve on the iPhone 6 or later because of the curved bevel after the screen ends.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

If you are looking for an edge to edge screen protector for the iPhone 6 or later, I did some research and found out that edge to edge is impossible for the iPhone 6 and later because the bezel curves downward after the screen ends. Other than that, this is a pretty good glass screen protector, there are tools that came to help assemble it. A microfiber cloth, an alcohol wipe, and a dust sticker. Sticking the glass on left no bubbles and even if it does, you can easily press it away.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Only the back pocket/larger pocket has the RFID protection, as far as I can feel by the crinkling material.The 2 finger release mechanism is well hidden underneath the fabric, but you can easily reach it. It is a buckle mechanism.Pretty large actually, for scale you could probably fit 10 iPhone 6's in here. The strap is elastic and should fit most people.The zipper is secure and you can also lock it using a external lock.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

Useful when traveling, and the strap can go around your neck making the pouch concealed if you stuff it into your shirt/jacket.Remember that only the front pocket has full RFID coverage, but the back pocket and side pocket also have partial coverage. The zipper is pretty secure, I tried to pry it open by hand but it did not happen. You can actually use a lock to secure the zippers as well.I was provided a sample product for my unbiased and honest review.

This mattress is for those like myself who like to sleep on a traditional spring mattress instead of the all foam type. Recently I purchased a similar product from another brand that is 6 inches and it's been performing wonderfully. When I got this mattress I expected it to be slightly better due to having 2 extra inches of cushioning and I was right. It's a very comfortable mattress with good support. Not too firm and not too soft. I'm not a very heavy person at 130lbs so this mattress works well for me. That being said if you're much heavier your comfort level using this mattress may be different. For the price this is probably one of the best foam/spring hybrid mattresses out there. As far as unpacking this mattress, it was very easy but care has to be taken because it's tightly rolled up and wants to spring open once you cut the wraps off. One thing I did not like was the fact this product does not ship in a cardboard box like my other mattress so it could easily be damaged in transport. Luckily mine didn't have any damage to the packing bag that it came in so the mattress didn't suffer any damage either.

Wow LG knows how to make a beautiful PC! Not only that but whoever was in charge of the internal packaging is a genius. Normally when you open up a box with a large LCD monitor it's very difficult to remove because it's big and bulky. Then you have to find a place to put it and figure out a way to install the stand before placing it on a desk. Not so with this unit since you are able to easily install the metal stand before even taking the monitor out of the box! By the way did I mention this computer is absolutely gorgeous? Even the white keyboard is curved!In terms of functionality, it uses a 3GHz Intel i7 mobile processor so it's very responsive. Also the graphics is via a Nvidia GeForce 840M so it's no slouch when it comes to 3D. System RAM may seem to be on the lower side at 8GB but since the CPU and GPU is very good you won't notice it in normal day to day use. Also Windows 10 is more efficient than ever and doesn't require as much RAM compared to the older versions. Even users who like to have many applications open won't notice much slowdown. The 1TB HDD is on the smaller side in my opinion so I would need to have external USB HDD's for extra data storage. This PC comes with Windows 10 Home 64-bit and it didn't require too many updates out of the box. It has built-in 802.11AC 5GHz WiFi support as well as Bluetooth. The popup webcam with mic is nice but since the mic is integrated with the camera there's no way of using the mic with the camera retracted. This could be an issue for people who are afraid of "hackers" using the computer's webcam to record them.When it comes to visuals, the ultra-wide 2560x1080 IPS curved display is great but it does display differently compared to a standard flat display so it may require some getting used to. For example windows will appear to have curved borders even if they are completely straight. It's kind of like a pincushion anomaly affecting the top/bottom borders. I could see this being an issue when using this display for editing photos/graphics where visual confirmation of geometric distortion and alignment is important. That said the ultra-wide aspect ratio is very nice...it's almost like having two monitors which makes for side by side windows a breeze. The display can be setup for fast response for gaming related stuff but out of the box it is set to medium at the factory. On a related noted my PC was set to 59Hz instead of 60Hz in the Windows display settings so I manually changed it to 60Hz...strange.Anyway the rest of the hardware is fairly standard with two USB 2.0, and two USB 3.0 ports, a SD card slot, dual speakers, headphone jack...though the HDMI input is very useful for split screen viewing. Also the inclusion of an HDMI OUT means this PC has dual display output capability so attaching a 2nd monitor is no problem.Finally the only other "negative" points that I could find are:1. USB receiver for the keyboard/mouse uses up one of the two USB 2.0 ports. On other modern designs the receiver is internal and doesn't use up an external USB port.2. Mouse is LED based not laser based.3. The built-in jog based menu system for adjusting the display looks really crude and pixelly.Overall a really good Windows 10 PC that's not just about looks.

This is a very good video editing package. In the past I've only used Corel video editing products but Cyberlink's offering is on par. It offers similar options but they are different enough for me to want to use both products depending on what I'm trying to achieve. There are quick uploading options that make it very easy to get video onto Youtube and other online video sites.

This tastes pretty good. It definitely tastes better than Coca Cola. I would describe Caleb's Kola as Coca Cola + a touch of Dr Pepper. My taste test was based on drinking this chilled without any ice. I'm not sure I would spend the kind of money this product is selling for. Way too expensive in my opinion.

This is a very nice faucet but at the price that it is selling for I had expected it to be an all metal construction. Needless to say when I realized the sprayer head was made of plastic it automatically dropped the star rating by one. As far as installation goes, it's pretty easy if you're mechanically inclined, if not then it would be wise to hire a plumber or a friend. In terms of operation it takes some getting used to which is no big deal but since it's motion activated even "guests" wouldn't have a problem with it. That said I don't allow my guests to use the kitchen faucet anyway. Overall I really like the convenience of the Motionsense feature.
Very tasty chocolate. I'm not a professional food critic but this chocolate tastes very good. The Pistachios are fantastic.

I've been using PaintShop Pro since version 3 and it just gets better and better. This version is no different. The new features are pretty cool. The best thing about PSP is that it is a very good alternative to Adobe Photoshop which is MUCH more expensive. PSP gives professional results without the high cost so for most people it is more than enough. The UI hasn't changed much over previous versions so you will not have to relearn how to use it. There are also built-in tutorials that even a novice could easily follow.

This LED clock is very nice looking. The curved display is beautiful but it has a high gloss finish so it causes a lot of reflections which can at certain angles make it slightly difficult to read. There is a two level brightness adjustment so it does help but I prefer to keep it dim at all times. The unit is not so big and it's very light so it could be placed pretty much anywhere. That said I was not able to get the automatic clock setting to work. Maybe where I live the signal just isn't strong enough? Anyway I just set the clock manually. The temperature readings for inside/outside is pretty cool and it works well. Cool thing about the remote outside temperature sensor is it uses 2 AAA batteries which is easily replaceable after the recommended 6 months so no wires or power outlets to worry about.

Works great and powder free. It fits comfortably and not so thick so it allows good touch sensitivity and feedback when using it for delicate applications. These are perfect for handling food due to its antimicrobial properties.
Works great and powder free. It fits comfortably and not so thick so it allows good touch sensitivity and feedback when using it for delicate applications.

I currently use a single HDD docking station so I'm not new to these types of devices and can appreciate the dual slot design that this product offers. I mainly use it with my old drives when upgrading to newer larger drives. So far this device has performed very well. I haven't had any issues and it offers very fast data transfers. I like the fact it has a power switch and indicator LEDs for each slot. Inserting the drives into the slots was very easy with a nice tight fit. I have not used the clone function but it is a nice feature to have. Build quality seems pretty good but the plastic used seem fairly cheap and it has a "hollow" feel to it. I think for the price it is understandable.

These are a fantastic value. They work in my J5 without any problems. I have not tested how long they last compared to the Nikon branded battery but since they're a fraction of the cost it doesn't really matter all that much. That said they're rated 1000mAh compared to the factory battery which are rated 850mAh. I have weighed the battery and it is 37g compared to the factory battery at 33.5g which may mean the 1000mAh rating is accurate.

I'm using this little mouse with my little 10" tablet and keyboard to type this review. Sometimes a mouse is just faster than touch and keyboard arrows. Why do I say this? Well for example lets say I wanted to move the cursor accurately on a little 10" screen. How do I do this fast? A mouse. It's very difficult to touch with pinpoint accuracy using a high resolution touch screen especially when running Windows in desktop mode. This Logitech mouse is awesome...very good quality and ergonomics. Battery life is great and since it uses Bluetooth I don't need an annoying receiver using up a precious USB port as well as reducing clutter.
Tastes ok but not enough sweetness and spices for my liking.

This docking station is very useful if you have a laptop or portable device that you want to use as a "desktop" without having to attach a keyboard, mouse, monitor etc using multiple connections. In the old days I would use a KVM box which is keyboard, video, mouse but those days are gone with this device since it only requires one USB 3.0 port. This makes it very convenient but also fast allowing for dual monitor output. The TRENDnet docking station was very easy to setup and it works very well.

I got this keyboard for three reasonsIt's wirelessIt's backlitTouchpadThe built-in rechargeable battery last about a week and is easily recharged with the included micro USB cable. The media keys work well with Windows 10. The unit itself is on the smaller side but the keys are spaced well for accurate typing. As with all Logitech devices it is well built. This is my second unit and it has Bluetooth. I've been using my first unit for several months now and so far it works great. The backlit keys are very useful because I usually use my PC at night.
Works great and powder free. It fits comfortably and not so thick so it allows good touch sensitivity and feedback when using it for delicate applications.

Works great with TWC 300Mbps Maxx service. The unit is sleek and slim offering an all in one solution that saves space and reduces clutter. With the dual band 2.4GHz/5GHz WiFi AC it's really fast. I've tested my AC WiFi capable devices and on some devices like my Lenovo Horizon 2S I get a whopping 200Mbps of WiFi speed via large downloads.

These are basic Latex gloves. Not much here to write about other than the fact they work as intended. They're fairly thin and feel very similar to the material that's used to make balloons. I do like that they're powder free.

So after getting this thing I'm scratching my head trying to figure out how to open the lid so I could install the filter capsule. The problem is the detailed instructions on how to do this is stashed inside so by the time you're able to get to it you obviously would've figured out how to open it already...*facepalm*. After finally having gotten this figured out I try to put the lid back on and it would not stay flush....sigh. Anyway the pitcher looks very nice..it's slim and it filters as designed. I rarely drink plain tap water since it has no taste but this filter could be useful if you want to cook with filtered water.

My 1.5 year old is just tall enough to sit and ride on this and it's currently his favorite toy. We have bamboo floors so it glides easily. I'm not sure how well it would ride on carpet because it does seem to wobble slightly.

My 8 month old nephew enjoyed opening and closing the door and spinning the rattle. I give it 3 stars because it doesn't stand out from the multiple other toys like this. And the suggested age range is up until 36 months but I think it's more suitable for max of 24 months. There are other toys that teach toddlers their alphabet etc that are more portable and interactive.

Easy to assemble and well made toy. My 2.5 y/o and 5.5 y/o enjoyed playing this toy together. My older child helped align the cars for my son as it was a little difficult for him. After multiple car crashes into walls and furniture, the cars still held up well.

Sturdy and cute toy. My 2.5 year old liked the moving parts but was easily bored while playing alone as it was hard for him to simultaneously hold the ship, dolls and move the other parts. I received this toy at no cost but probably wouldn't recommend it since my son didn't play with it much.

Very sturdy toy and the colors are so cute. My daughter likes all the different moving parts and spends a lot of time playing in each of the rooms. I appreciate that the moving parts don't require batteries. Once assembled, it is a little large so storing can be a problem.

When I first got these pedals the first thing I did was spin them to see how freely they spun. I was disappointed that they did not rotate very freely despite being smooth without any notchiness. They're fairly light since the body is cast aluminum with some steel for the clip assemblies. They're also not that big which for me is good since I don't have big feet and my bike is a folder where space is important. In use the platform side offers good grip due to the spiked cage. Reflectors are not included with these pedals so that for me was an issue. It means I would have to search for reflectors that fit and that's an extra cost. Would've been nice if reflectors were included.

This is the first ultrasonic humidifier I've ever owned and I'm really liking it. Let me first say that I love the outdoors, especially that early morning cool moist air which is a pleasure to breath. This product gives you that same kind of air inside your room! This thing was extremely easy to "setup"....just fill the tank, plug it into an outlet and power it on...that's it. Now if you want to make some adjustments there are many to choose. You have a 12hr timer that could be set in increments of 1hr. You also have a choice between cool or warm mist. There's also the amount of mist and the amount of humidity. Best of all the unit is completely silent except when you push the buttons which beeps. This unit comes with pipe extensions so if you place the humidifier on the ground you could pipe the mist up higher. I keep it next to my bed and the pipe extension allow the mist to exhaust over my head. The pipe has a dual swiveling spout allowing two independent exhuast directions. Overall I really like this unit as it performs great.

Overall, my kids who are 5 1/2 and 2 1/2 really enjoyed this toy! There aren't that many toys that they both can play and take turns without fighting and screaming due to the age gap, but they both really liked playing with this toy. They especially liked turning the gears and watching the marbles move. It took about one hour to assemble this toy. All the pieces were coded and it was fairly simple to follow the manual once I was familiar with all of the parts. Once put together, the toy was pretty sturdy and didn't fall apart as the kids were cranking the gears. Both my kids were fascinated with the toy and spent more than one hour playing with it the first day.

These pants are alright, nothing fancy. The fabric is a good thickness and it's not too stiff. Sizing seems to be accurate. They aren't overpriced but they cost more than my favorite Dickies "work pants".

I knew I was taking a BIG risk when I plugged this into my PC after having read other reviews describing blown USB ports on their PCs! Well so far my USB port is still working ok thank goodness. This hub works as described, there's nothing fancy about it. It's white and made of plastic with one blue LED that lights up when any of the USB ports are occupied. I currently have two USB 3.0 devices attached to this hub....a SD card reader and a portable hard drive. Both seem to work ok no errors or random disconnects. Speeds are the same as if they were plugged directly into the USB 3.0 ports on my PC.

I got these to replace the stock Wellgo F147 folding pedals on my Dahon Mu P8 folding bike. These are definitely an improvement because they're a full metal (body/cage) design compared to the plastic/metal hybrid design of the Wellgo. The bearings are a lot smoother too which means less parasitic drag when you're pedaling They are not that much heavier at only 244g each compared to the 230g for the Wellgo. The push button folding mechanism is very easy to operate. Reflectors come preinstalled and the package includes a hex wrench so all you need to provide is some antiseize lubricant applied to the threads.

I got this little flashlight clamp to use with my Dahon Mu P8 folding bike. Initially when I received this product it looked like the handlebar clamp was too small to fit around the diameter of my handlebar, however when I tried to install it I realized that it fits fairly well. The thumbscrew is of good quality with a metal threaded insert. The bolt is metal as well. I was afraid of stripping the screw and/or the nut but surprisingly it didn't happen. I screwed it only tight enough so that I could angle my flashlight by hand but not so loose that it would rotate while riding. I'm using a Coast A25 and A25R flashlight with this clamp and it fits perfect.

I got this to use with my Dahon Mu P8 not realizing that it doesn't work with 33.9mm diameter seatposts. The screw that squeezes the two side clamps together is not long enough when used with large diameter seatposts. I found out that you could get it to work somewhat if you remove the stock rubber bushing/washer and replace it with a thinner metal and/or rubber bushing. The carrier itself is very well made considering its tubular nature. It's made of aluminum and painted or powdercoated. It's very lightweight but stiff and not flimsy. There is a rear plate for mounting a taillight/reflector or even a miniature license plate. The rack is positioned far rearward so it doesn't interfere with your saddle too much. If mounted low enough on the seatpost there is plenty of clearance allowing for adding a seatpost bag. I prefer this design over fixed units that are mounted to the frame. This type is easily removed when you don't need it.

This carbon seatpost is made for various folding bikes which use the larger 33.9mm diameter seatposts such as the Dahon and Tern folding bikes. I got this for my Dahon Mu P8 and it fits perfectly. It's slightly shorter than the stock post by about an inch which is a good thing for me since I like to sit lower. When adjusting for a lower seating position the bottom of the seatpost sticks out the bottom more and you don't want that because it could hit curbs etc. The bottom of the tube has a rubber cap to protect the carbon from chips and dings when the post is lowered all the way to the ground during folding. The carbon tube itself has a very nice non-glossy matte finish. There are white markings on the rear for height adjustment. It is very light about 300g compared to the stock aluminum one at 700g. The quality of this post is very good and the clamp is forged aluminum so it's strong. Angle adjustment is continuous instead of ratcheting. There are two stainless bolts that are mounted at an angle used to tighten down the rail clamps. The black carbon color really goes well with the black components on my mostly silver/white Mu P8.

I got this rear red LED bike light for my Dahon Mu P8. I decided to mount it right below the seat clamp. Since it's not mounted high up on the seat post I angled the light slightly upward. That's one of the nice features of this little light. When mounted horizontally it clicks up/down at different angles. So to summarize....Small and lightweightIt's black and looks futuristic not tackyBright if you want it to beWater resistantEasy one button operationUses modern high performance COB LEDsHorizontal or vertical mountCan be angled up/down left/right with clicksQuick release clip to prevent theft of the unitBuilt-in LiPo USB rechargeable batteryGood run time at standard brightness settingSeveral brightness and flashing/strobe modesDurable case material that could handle dropsThe only thing that I thought needed improvement was the side lighting, it's very dim and can't be seen very well when using the standard low brightness setting. I think if it had larger side light diffusers instead of the two small oval ones it would be much more useful.

As others have mentioned I had to use a 3 prong extension because the adapter partially blocks the top plug on one of my wall's dual outlet. Other than that it was a super simple installation. The two adapters linked to each other automatically after plugging them into the wall outlets. The power passthrough is a very useful feature. In use it works great. This is a great option if your network connected device is close to the wall outlet which in my case is a home theater receiver. My receiver doesn't have WiFi but it does have ethernet so it's perfect.

So I've been reading about other people's experience with this bike and it seems they didn't know what these bikes are designed for. This bike is NOT a BMX style bike! It cannot take the abuse like a normal fixed frame bike. There are many reasons for this. 1. The frame has a folding hinge which is a weak point which means if you abuse the bike it will eventually break in half...simple physics. 2. The tires are very thin and are designed for ROAD use. Since the tires are thin they need to be inflated to a very high pressure which means there's very little compliance so all the stress will be transferred to the frame...there's no cushioning effect. 3. The handle bars are telescoping which makes it weaker...again basic physics. 4. This is an aluminum bike so it's not going to be as strong as a Chromoly Steel bike.Now with that said if you ride this bike as intended it should last for many years. Yes it will eventually break but all bikes break. I got this bike for cruising at the park, beach etc. It is not an urban commuter that is designed to overcome potholes, jump curbs etc. For the price I think it's a great deal for what it offers. It's easily foldable, it's light, it's small, it has good quality components, it's stylish. I myself plan on getting another bike for off roading and urban riding. It will be the Montague Paratrooper Pro 18" Military Mountain Folding Bike. It's also a folding bike but the way it folds it doesn't make the frame weak. It also has front shocks and thick tires to handle bumps and jumps. I love my Dahon but horses for courses.

Not really much to say about these Orbit branded gum other than it tastes good, freshens your breath well and is sugarless. I like them and prefer to buy these whenever I'm at the market. This variety pack is super convenient.

Compared to standard cotton stuffed pillows, these memory foam type pillows are slightly firmer and holds its shape better. I prefer to sleep with my head elevated from the rest of my body so this pillow works great allowing a lot of support.

My favorite dish is Curry...doesn't matter if it's Indian Curry, Thai Curry or any other variation. This Curry paste has good flavor and aroma. It's easy to prepare which is one of the reasons why I like to cook Curry dishes.

This is the equivalent of a motorized toothbrush for your skin and it works the same way. If you've ever used a Sonicare electric toothbrush you'll know what I'm talking about, however if you haven't then imagine a vibrating brush that you move across your teeth but instead for the skin. This works extremely well and it's less labor intensive. It removes oil and dirt much better because it basically "vibrates" the contaminates loose. It offers deeper cleaning which is great for pores. The unit has high build quality and the battery lasts quite awhile. As with the toothbrushes there are different brush heads. This model comes with two heads..one for normal skin and a second one for exfoliation.

This toy set is fairly good. Assembly was slightly difficult due to the small letters that distinguishes where each part goes. The track is also kinda flimsy. Overall it's a fun set and my little nephew liked it but the plane was difficult to align correctly.

A good smelling soap bar that cleans without leaving a sticky residue. The soap also gives a good amount of lather and doesn't require much water. The only thing I didn't like about this soap is the shape of the bar. It's too square. I think a more curved or beveled corners would make it a lot easier to hold when it's wet.

This humidifier works good but when set to high it's fairly loud. You could hear the water boiling as if you had water boiling in a kettle on your stove. The unit is fairly large but it isn't heavy. This humidifier only produces hot steam, it is not able to atomize the water without boiling. This means it is not very useful for hot summer days. This also means it's not safe if you have little kids near it as they could be burned. Personally I find this design too limited for my own use as I would rather use an ultrasonic humidifier that has warm and cool settings.

This is the real thing...and the quality shows. I've been buying XT60 connectors from various online sellers and many of them are copies. These however are genuine XT60s and the quality of the molding and fit are noticeable.
The is a great learning map for younger kids. It's laminated and a good size with lots of pictures and colors to make it fun to explore.

These laminating pouches work great with my Fellowes Neptune3 125 Laminator. They are high quality and durable. These work great with documents that are used on a daily basis such as food menus or training sheets that are passed around from person to person. They have a nice glossy finish and so far have produced bubble free results.

This board is fantastic and I've been using it to write notes for my roommates before I leave home for work. The included mounting tape is fast and easy to use. The board has rounded corners so it's safe if you accidently bump into it. The magnets are also a very nice alternative allowing attachments without having to pierce holes through documents etc.

I tried out this shampoo/conditioner and it works very well. My hair is naturally very stiff but after using this it makes it soft and supple. This product produces a good lather too and the bottle is a very good size so it means I don't have to go out and buy them too often. This has a nice scent to it as well.

This wiper is really smooth and quiet out of the box. There is no chatter and no missed water spots. It seems to be better than the Icons. Installation was very easy...I installed it in the dark while it was raining and it actually took less than a minute.

My niece recently had a baby so I figured this product would be a nice device to carry the baby around without getting tired. It works great and the material is soft and natural. She now takes the baby wherever she goes without needing a stroller or baby  basket. It's super portable and doesn't take up much space at all. Best part is it's very comfortable to carry around the baby for long periods of time. This device is great for traveling with your baby.

This seems like a very good cable both in terms of quality and usefulness. It's very thin and flexible which is a huge bonus if you need a cable that could snake around obstacles with sharp bends. This is an actively powered cable and it is unidirectional meaning the input and output ends are not interchangeable. One end is specific to the display and the other is specific to the source. I've been using this cable for only a few days but so far it seems to work well. No glitches experienced so far but I wonder how long this cable will last compared to a passive cable without a built-in microprocessor.

I was really impressed by this BT speaker when I opened up the box. It's much larger than I had expected and that's a good thing because it means big sound which is exactly what this speaker provides. Not only can it play loud but the sound is nice and clear from the front. From the back is where the bass seems to be coming from so when place near a wall it really produces strong and loud bass. It has built-in SRS WOW HD bass processing too to enhance low frequency output but I've always left that feature turned off because it's not adjustable. To do that requires pressing both volume buttons simultaneously. Overall build quality is very good. The buttons are rubberized but this 805 model is not splash resistant. This speaker comes with a AC/DC adapter for charging the internal 4400mAh battery and cannot be charged via USB. The USB port allows charging devices at up to 2A which is very good. Overall dimensions of the unit are approximately 4 x 2 x 9 inches. This model has a built-in mic/speakerphone which could come in handy.

This is your typical articulating LED desk lamp. It is a pretty good basic model but there are better ones out there. For example the Lampat Dimmable LED Desk Lamp is a better model overall. It's slightly more expensive but it was worth it. That model has a auto off timer and built-in USB charging port. It's also nicer looking and the touch controls are better with better overall build quality. The only advantage the Seville Classics has over the Lampat is the rotating arm. What it doesn't have is a swiveling base like that of the Lampat. Overall this is not a bad lamp but considering the price I would spend a little more and get the Lampat instead of "settling" for the lower cost Seville Classics. I got the Lampat for only $50 so not a significant price difference.

For those of you who like to record videos but have always wanted better sound will like this wireless mic system. The sound is very nice due to the 24-bit 48kHz format and the dual antennas gives the mic very good distance and reliable audio transmission. The Lavalier package comes with a detachable mic so if it gets damaged all you have to do is swap in a new mic. There are different mics you could get from AT that works with this wireless system including handheld models. The receiver has a small LCD that shows Tx/Rx signal and RF power levels. The receiver has a built-in battery that's charged via USB and included is a wall plug. The Rx has a monitor/headphone out jack which is very useful for making sure you're getting the sound to your recording device. The transmitter uses AA batteries which is nice allowing convenient swapping out of batteries. The power switch doubles as a mic mute button. Overall this is a great wireless mic system that is super portable. The camera mount is a pretty cool addition allowing the antennas to get better reception although the receiver has a built-in "belt clip" if you prefer not to mount it on a camera or tripod.

Now this is what I was looking for. I use this to store lithium polymer batteries and it's fantastic. I did line the inside of the case with a rubber spray coating to avoid shorts. These are brand new units and have no logos on them. They're manufactured to MIL-SPEC.

For reference I'm currently using a 22" 1680 x 1050 HP monitor that I've calibrated myself using available software online so it's no slouch even though the resolution is much lower than this DELL unit but first impression is that the thin bezel on this DELL is very attractive and the detachable swiveling stand is quite nice because raising and lowering is linear requiring no forward or backward movement which wastes space. My HP monitor uses up some space in this regard because it uses an angled stand. Both my HP and this DELL pivots so nothing new for me but it's a fantastic and useful feature nonetheless. Touch controls on the DELL are nice but I had to touch them almost on center each time..this is difficult when there are no lights or physical indicators on the touch sensitive buttons. I've found that the best way to activate the touch sensitive buttons is to swipe them with my finger from top to bottom or from left to right depending on if I'm making a selection or just activating the menu from standby mode. Input ports are awesome and I like the fact the USB ports can be set for continuous power output even when the LCD is in Standby. This LCD is not heavy so that's a nice bonus during initial setup. The Displayport cable that came with the monitor is a nice inclusion but since my PC is located away from my desktop display to save space it was too short...not a deal breaker but it means I need to buy a longer cable. Nice thing is my PC has multiple video output types so I used a long 10' HDMI cable I had and it works great.As for the image quality it's very good...DELL even includes the color calibration report printout with each monitor...nice! When set with a black background the LED lighting is fairly smooth with little to no hotspots or edge leakage. Blacks are very nice for an LCD and viewing angles are really good. On Windows 8.1 the monitor's native resolution is automatically detected. The high native resolution means when I'm using programs like Paint Shop Pro X6 I have more room to view and edit an image without having to move tool boxes out of the way. This DELL is now my main landscape monitor and my HP is rotated for portrait use. Oh almost forgot the sharpness setting is great.  I tested the fast response time setting using my Xbox One game console and it seems to improve the image quality by reducing ghosting.

I've never used a pressure cooker before but a little bit of research and I quickly learned what it's used for. This product is pretty convenient since it's designed to be used in a microwave. I've used it to steam food as well as just standard microwave cooking. It's durable and keeps all the moisture and aroma inside until you open it up. This alone makes it a valuable piece of cookware. As far as pressure cooking, as mentioned by other reviewers it doesn't really have enough pressure to be considered a genuine pressure cooking device since not much pressure builds up inside.

This is by far the best table top light that I've owned to date. It's very stylish and the light quality is superb. With 4 light modes and 5 levels of brightness you have plenty of light output options to choose from. With a CRI of over 90 you will also appreciate the accuracy of colors illuminated by this lamp. The swivel and multi angle adjustment works great as well as the 1hr off timer and built-in USB power port. Since this lamp uses only LEDs the power consumption is very low and there's very little heat generated. The LEDs are also covered by a diffuser so there's less glare. The controls are soft touch so they're very easy to use and clean. The base is weighted so no worries about it tipping over. Even though this unit is made of plastic it is very high quality and doesn't look or feel cheap. This lamp should last for at least a decade without needing to be replaced so the fact you can't replace the bulbs themselves is irrelevant.

Metal gears, fast, high voltage and brushless. Works great as a tail servo on 600 or 700 class helis. These servos are also very good quality and reasonably priced. Aluminum mid-case help dissipate heat.

I was lured in by the good reviews and cheap price.  Not only would I not put food into these things, the markings for the measurement are very faint or unreadable.  This is something I would not expect to pay more than a buck for in a dollar store.junk.

I just plugged this in on my Mac running Yosemite and it came right up.  I still went to FTDI's website and grabbed the latest driver anyway - again, no problems at all.This replaced the previous "golden standard" Keyspan USA-19HS which was giving me all kinds of grief on Apple's latest operating system.  Coming out of hibernation, my bluetooth as well as the Keyspan serial adapter would lock up.  Downloading the latest drivers gave me a kernel panic.  I wound up removing everything and starting over with FTDI.The drivers are signed by Apple and appears to be included in the latest Yosemite build as well - just plug it in and check your /dev/ directory to see where it's at.  I like the flat cable and just bought a second one for my Windows PC as well.

This is my second brite-view box, not finding anything better.  I love the fact I can throw just about anything at it, include DVD .iso files and it will play it.  I connect via smb on the Mac and dump my files into a directory then play it back on the TV.  I've given up on wireless anything - wireless printing, wireless streaming, etc so I've got a hard line connected to it.Although it supports a wide variety of HD formats for an external drive, the only format which worked without it crashing was NTFS.  You can power it off, but it does not like to stay off.  It will wake up if it senses any IR commands from any IR remote.  I just put a piece of black tape over the front.Oddly enough, it plays great over UPnP using Serviio once I forwarded the port on the router.  It will connect to my older Mac but not my newer Mac for file browsing and I've lost patience trying to figure out why since UPnP works fine from the same machine.The company still kinda sorta supports it but they're more difficult to find in stock and it doesn't look like anyone is developing updated firmware for it.  If you're looking for something which plays many formats, is somewhat functional, and you are willing to put up with the quirks - you should give this box a try.Perhaps the company will once again invest some money into a next generation product because I couldn't find anything as functional from the competition.

I purchased a refurbished Samsung 28 inch LED 720p TV to replace the 32 inch "SmartTV" which smoked and died after just 4 days in service.  Disappointed with how little I received in exchange for a huge price tag, I decided to go to the opposite extreme - let's get something really cheap, factory refurbished.My first apprehension was that whatever caused the set to be refurbished could still possibly re-surface.  Since I already had to ship back a broken TV, the fear of the unknown was overcome by the desire to save a few bucks.  It was shipped in its original box with all the accessories although the box was covered with shipping labels and looked well traveled.The TV itself was spotless and there was no indication other than it was delivered right from the factory.  It has a USB media browser which was far superior to Samsung's "SmartTV" browser i.e. the downgrade in software was an improvement.  Like other appliances, it did not recognize the exFAT partition but FAT16 came up just fine on the USB stick.There are just enough tweaks to adjust the picture to clarity.  Mind you, watching mp4's on a 28 inch monitor brings out all the motion artifacts (blurry blotches during fast motion).  The sound is decent and has significant low frequency response so I do not feel compelled to run out and buy a sound bar for it.  It's far less quirky and has less picture and sound adjustments than the higher end "SmartTV" yet was easier to setup.Compared to a television costing 3.3x as much, I'm actually happier with this cheaper, refurbished one.One advisory - 28 inch flat panel is good for a bedroom, man cave, or small livingroom while being too large for a kitchen.  If you have a larger area, consider 32 inch to be the smallest you want to go as this may leave you unsatisfied.

It drew too much current to work on a powered USB2 hub.  When plugged directly into the USB3 hub, it worked for less than an hour before total failure.  Removing the drive, I switched to another enclosure and the files returned.  So, total waste of time and money.I suggest buying this instead:  Sentey Aluminum HDD Enclosure USB 3.0 & Esata Aluminum Housing Ls-6310 -Support Esata, Case for 9.5mm & 12.5mm 2.5" Sata-i, Sata-ii, Sata-iii HDD & SSD - For Imac, Macbook Air, Macbook Pro, Macbook, and Mac Mini or Any Pc

In the industry, it's known as infant mortality - that is electronics which tend to fail will do so shortly after they've been put into service.  Doing some quick searches it appears that Samsung needs to investigate their power supply design.  It started as quirky behavior, like the screen suddenly becoming very dim or ignoring my picture settings.  The picture did not always look as good as nice as the LCD which was to replace it, my Samsung LN32B530.  It is an older model, also getting lackluster mid-range quality picture reviews which are probably rumors started by manufacturers trying to sell you 4K TV's.  This new LED set looked better, sometimes.  Other times everything looked odd.I toned down much of the auto power conservation settings and motion smoothing which made the picture look dark and fuzzy.  After a few days of adjustments it still didn't look right... then it died and I needed to return it.Aside from LED vs. LCD, all the things I was trying to improve by upgrading was the "smart TV" features.  The apps - yea, nothing I could really use.  It gave me the 3rd or 4th way to access Netflix, Amazon, and YouTube.  The Amazon and Pandora apps never worked, telling me I was in the wrong country (I wasn't).  The built-in web browser does not accept cookies, making it difficult to navigate.  The mini keyboard and mouse I ordered for the TV never really worked right with it, if at all.It pulled streaming content off my Mac easily enough after I installed Serviio as well as running off the USB hard drive.  But, the media browser would display only the first 8 characters of every filename in a difficult to read tile type display.  I miss that feature, until I figured out the Roku 3 will do all of that and I already owned one.  I just needed to add the USB and Media player channels - and, it's works better, other than the Roku works with a USB stick but not a hard drive.I'm glad the thing smoked and died, forcing me to return it.  Had it been the only set in the house, I would have replaced it with a new one with an extended warranty.  But, rather, I've decided to buy a refurbished set for empty room and keep my older Samsung LCD.  The color is wonderful and it's proven itself.

You get a lot for the money for this cheap action cam.  The audio is great.  The video can be set to one of three different resolutions.  And, it uses SD cards (not microSD).  SD cards are easier to deal with.  Recording inside did amazingly well in low light.  The LCD is low resolution yet provides quick feedback on settings and video.There are some differences between the S300 and the S200.  The S300 is more low profile and does not use a touch screen nor does it have an HDMI output port.  There is also no AV cable provided with the S300.The on-screen menus provide a way to format the card and set the time and date.  Output format is .avi which the Mac has no problems with, but the file size is a bit large.  At VGA low resolution, an 8 gig card provides just under 2 hours of video.

GPS units have come a long way in the past 5+ years but I've been putting off buying one because they look exactly the same and do the same thing.  But, with processors getting faster, screens getting larger, and prices coming down - not to mention lifetime map updates and traffic with no pop-up ads, I decided to upgradeThe Garmin 2797 is just a sweet unit.  In a small SUV I thought the size was perfect, although that big bright screen depletes the battery very quickly.  My last Nuvi 500 I would charge in the morning and it was good to just toss on the dash for a couple of days.  With the 2797, the battery is there just for brief periods of time so you can change the settings and add a waypoint or two with the main power off.It's heavy.  Twice the unit went flying on the bean bag mount when I made a sharp turn.  I needed to tape some non-skid material to the bottom to keep the beast from slamming against the right door on a turn.  Luckily the unit is made very sturdy and is no worse for wear taking a few knocks.I use Basecamp and Google Maps to enter lat/lon coordinates as well as the street address.  Still, the routing feature has difficulties with entrances to malls so it just guesses.  Bear in mind, although they appear intelligent, they're really quite dumb and should be considered a navigation aid rather than being in command of your trip i.e. know where you're going and how to get there and understand it's ok to ignore the instructions being given to you by this gadget.Mine spoke English but I wanted it to speak with a British accent.  Venturing to the Garmin WebUpdater said I could update voices, but only to "fun" voices like Yetti.  I did find an update for the voice, selected it on the GPS, but it went mute.  This was my only question to tech support.  Apparently, to add additional languages, you need to use Garmin Express, drill down to "other files" which hide a few updates with a note telling you that they're not needed.  Ignoring the comment, I installed "English" since there was nothing marked British English.  This did the trick and installed all the English flavours of voices including Australian English.Voice command - meh.  It does better with street numbers and names which it can pull from its street database rather than restaurant names and poi's, which may not even be available.  After a week I turned off the map layer for poi's because it was too cluttered and easily accessible from the "up ahead" feature.  Voice works great for when you're stuck in traffic and just want to tell it, "Go Home!" without taking your hand of the wheel.Keep all your cables as Garmin uses unused pins on the mini and micro USB connectors.  You can hack an ordinary cable up to use with it, but it's nearly not worth it.  The software is running wonderfully on the Mac's Yosemite.  Almost no issues, except that Basecamp's UI gets confused if you update a field and click another tab before updating the value.  Just don't do that.  I also block Basecamp's internet connection because I couldn't find a way to opt out of anonymous data usage tracking by Garmin.  No means no.Map updates were a breeze, although it takes several hours for the full continental U.S. to install.  I have not needed the microSD card as there is tons of memory available.  When I first bought my Nuvi 500, I was able to add points by manually editing the XML files, placing them on the SD card, and rebooting.  The method is still the same, but now done entirely thru BaseCamp.  Or, simply talk to it and tell it the address you're interested in.  It's very good.I love all the information on the screen, which includes the intersection I'm approaching on top with the road I'm on at the bottom.  Additional trip information is available at the touch of a button.  As a turn is approaching, the screen gently zooms in for the best detail, then promptly zooms out after I've made the turn.  If I ignore a suggested turn, it doesn't get all verbose and starts to yell at me.  Rather, the next suggested turn quietly appears as it quietly re-calculates the route.  Every time I start the car the next day, it assumes that I arrived at my destination and doesn't try to navigate me "home" when I'm starting from there.  And, if I start driving, it displays the map without me having to reach over and touch the screen.Oh.. but, I *hate* this feature.  This is where my new travel companion crossed a line with me.  You might ask, What can an inanimate object do to make the hair on the back of my neck come up?  After a week of driving, the GPS learned which waypoint I was traveling to every day, my place of work.  On Friday, rather than the GPS faithfully giving me upcoming intersections, it ASSUMED that I was on my way to work, told me what time I would arrive at work, and what traffic I would encounter on my way to work!  No No No NO!Who are you?  My boss?  Computers are slaves and shall not take that tone with me.  It guessed correctly that I was on my way to work and when I arrived I deleted all the accumulated routing information as it yelled at me for erasing its memory.  It was pretty handy, I admit, but it crossed a line with me.

Who spends this much money on a toilet seat?  I found one "open box" (don't judge me) for a bit less.  I've been a big fan of wood seats, which is the only material I've used at home.  I've tried hard resin and padded seats.  The last seat was really small and I had to wiggle onto it like was sitting on the opening of a coffee can.Since I found it on special, I grabbed the self-closing feature model.  The mounting bolts - everyone has their own design for how to mount the bolts.  These are clever, tho the instructions aren't very good.  I found the best way was to unlock the tabs, push the bolts in, lock the tabs, then mount the seat.  Centering the seat is important before you tighten the bolts which really needs to be done with a 1/2 inch socket wrench.  Forget about using an open end wrench.  Just ratchet tight and the outer portion snaps off once you've reached the proper torque to protect the fixture.  Yet, it leaves plenty to grab to remove at a later time.The color - wow, it was spot-on for the fixture I had, this powder blue.  The self-closing feature?  eh.  yes, You can just tap the lid closed and it will slowly close without making a sound.  But, not the bottom portion - only the lid.  It does come in handy.So, about the fit?  again, wow.  This is the most comfortable seat I've ever used.  It looks great and feels great.  I can't believe they've given me such a roomy seat.Cons?  Just two minor ones.  Since the bolts self-destruct when installing, it would be nice to have a spare set of bolts since the quick-release mechanism is non-standard.  The other is that the plastic appears to scratch easily.  It is comfortable, flexible, and doesn't have that "cheap" feel.  But, it has a gloss finish which appears to scuff easily if it comes in contact with something hard.

I replaced my old OXO scoop which had a peeling and flaked coating.  The replacement has letters etched onto the back to handwash only.  ah.  That must be why my old scoop got all disgusting.  I bought a second one because it has a perfect shape and function.  I have destroyed scoops digging into rock hard ice-cream.  Not this one.  Or, have had to flick sticky balls of ice-cream out of the scoop with my thumb.  Not this one.  It's perfect.Well, except for the coating.  OXO would do well to just give up on the non-stick coating.  There's no need for it, what is known as "over engineered."

If you put all the divers who like purge valves together in a room with divers who hate purge valves you would start a riot.  The problem is not purge valves.  The problem is nobody makes a decent design.Back in the 70's and 80's was this design of a flat piece of glass with a purge valve which stuck out front.  The nose pinch was behind the valve built into the rubber.  The design was fine, but fell out of favor because it looked ugly; called the "pig snout."  Newer designs pushed the lenses back, reduced the volume, and improved peripheral vision.  One gotcha - a protruding soft nose pocket became the standard.  If you wanted a purge valve, it went into the nose - or up your nose and/or prevented you from pinching your nose.  It's a bad design.This design is the best of both worlds.  Now you have the customary nose pocket back, but it's not really a nose pocket.  It's a purge valve pocket - stylish, functional, and does not interfere with the nose pinch.  On my face, I can pinch my nose easily and it makes a great seal.I will be buying a second as a backup.  Great design with a strong solid tempered glass with peripheral vision and a purge valve which doesn't look like a pig's snout.

I have this running on an old Mac Mini with USB 2 ports.  No issues, great value, and the ports are laid out nicely as well.  The smooth aluminum plate looks really sleek on the desktop as well.I did some surfing for the mention of Windows-only Drivers, the UASP protocol.  Fear not.  You don't need it.  If you're on a Mac, you don't want it and you're not missing anything.

I formatted a USB stick for FAT and copied a few movie files onto it from Mac.  It has a nice auto-play feature, but it chokes on hidden files which Apple likes to leave.  Rather than skipping over files it cannot play, it stops and chokes on them.  The only way around it was to run VMWare and mount a USB stick via Windows and delete all the Mac hidden files from there.  The one .mov file I gave it would not play, but once I converted it to .mp4 it runs fine.I am using it to drive a VGA monitor, but HDMI seems to be its preferred mode.  I de-selected the scan-HDMI option to see if I can it to power up and begin playing files VGA without intervention from the remote, which is otherwise always required.  When I first powered it on, the VGA monitor would turn itself on and off forever.  Selecting VGA from the remote got it under control.It's a shame the user interface is so klunky since it otherwise does a good job for the money.

Nice color and light sensitivity for dimly lit and indoor areas.  Just a glint off a car's windshield puts a white stripe across the screen.  If the sensor sees a glimpse of direct sunlight, no matter how small, the entire picture goes useless bright white.  Thankfully I was able to block direct sunlight using a piece of tape.

First let me say the device calibrated my screen quickly and easily on a Mac Mini running Yosemite.  Perfect color.  My monitor never looked so great.  I just wished the software was a bit less annoying.  It's a bunch of little things.I needed to register and activate the software.  This seems a bit obnoxious considering I'm paying for the hardware.  Each time I let it activate on-line, it sent me an email with my activation code while telling me that activation failed.
