Jeepers! The sound delivered by these gamer headphones is amazing. Watch out – if you turn them up really loud they even vibrate a little. It makes you feel like you are at a rock concert standing in the front row about six feet from the stage.Of course, you shouldn’t listen to anything that loud – not for long, anyway – because it can damage your ears and hearing. But I trust your good common sense in that regard.Excellent bass tones and sweeping, scintillating highs. For the price range of this set, the sound it delivers is way more than your money’s worth. If you are using this for gaming, put your bigger cash into your games and get this relatively inexpensive set to handle your sound.However, the incredible sound these bad boys deliver is not the only feature about this gamer-oriented headset with microphone that I found to be terrific.Let me be clear: These must be the most comfortable headsets I have ever tried on!I asked myself: Why can’t all headphone makers go with a design like this? The dual band bridge construction is highly flexible and light weight – you could wear these things for hours and never get that fatigued feeling of something irritating your head and ears.The microphone is so well hidden into the design that, at first, I almost thought it didn’t have a microphone. It’s built into the left earcup and slides out or “flips down” to position just right toward your mouth – it’s not in the way, but gives your voice perfect access.I own four other Sentey headphone models – three of them Bluetooth and one other cord-jack model. I can tell you from experience that it’s a good brand, and they have responsive customer service.One last note: When you plug this set into your computer via the USB jack, they light up with a high-tech looking blue light. It’s cool.So it’s all good. Note that I received this particular set free in exchange for a 100% honest, objective and unbiased field test and review. My 100% honest opinion is that these Sentey Gaming Headset Microphone Artix Black Gs-4561 are a no-baloney honest-to-goodness great deal on a set of headphones for gaming, or listening to music.

This is a basic, good quality belt.The craftsmanship is solid, the stitching is firm and the materials would seem to be tough and strong, yet comfortable -- after you break it in for a week or two. It's a bit stiff at first, but that's okay because it's a solid product. The heavy-gauge metal of the buckle is more than adequate, in my opinion.I like the fact that the holes are reinforced behind with a narrow, extra strip of leather. That means these holes will wear well and remain firm for a long time. Positive points in that regard!It's wide, but not too wide -- I measure it at exactly 1.5 inches wide. The length, not including buckle, is 45 inches. The buckle itself is 2-and-a-quarter inches across.I see little not to like, and after wearing it for about 10 days, it's absolutely fine. I think this belt will be even better when it wears in and  softens a bit after some use -- but all in all, the price is quite reasonable, and I think for around $10 you're getting a slightly better belt than you might expect at that price.I received this belt for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. My honest opinion is that this is a good quality belt, and I recommend it.

It’s often the simple things in life that bring us the most pleasure – case in point, this basic back and body scrubber will not only exfoliate your skin, but also go a long way toward reducing the stress of a long day as you enjoy a hot bath or shower.The product is well constructed and the materials are of sufficient high quality, in my opinion, to make for a lasting scrubber that will give you many sessions of cleansing, relaxing pleasure.You get a soft side of terry cloth and a looped scrubber on the other side which is just textured enough to give your skin a vigorous treatment, without harshness or causing redness.If you have extra-sensitive skin, don’t worry. This loofah will treat you with some real TLC.Note that that the loofah also ships with a matching oval scrubber pad that fits easily in your hand. The primary loofah has a soft rope that makes it very easy for you to get this around to get your whole back, and any other part of your body.This price is reasonable, and this product delivers exactly that it promises, and thus I give it the full five stars, and please note I received a free sample in exchange for a 100% honest, object and unbiased review.

There is much to like about these basic, well-functioning Bluetooth headphones that are affordable, deliver decent sound, including good-enough bass and clear and crisp high tones.This is the kind of set you want for basic daily use at a price that won’t bust your budget. They are simple to use and reliable.  I like the big button “on-off” switch on the right earpiece – you don’t have to fumble to find it.The look of the phones in my view is just a tad “blah” but this is a total a nonissue for me. Other may like the muted, understated blue-black color scheme. For me, it’s all about the sound, easy function and reliability. I don't care if my Bluetooth devices have "bling" or "flash" in terms of looks.Speaking of reliable, these will fit in any ear well because it comes with interchangeable ear tips sizes and bands to help you secure and anchor the buds to your ears. So whether you are just sitting at your desk, or getting in a job or workout at your health club, these will stay in your ears as you enjoy your favorite music, audio books, or whatever.I know the signal is good to at least 20 feet, and maybe further.All in all – a solid product at a good price. I can recommend them without reservation. Please note that I received a pair free to field test and review, provided that my views are 100% objective, unbiased and honest.

I have a lot of different kinds of Bluetooth headsets, from the cheapest “low-end” earbuds to the “higher-end” sophisticated models, and I can tell you that these Sentey V4.0 are not only a fantastic deal for the price, but they also deliver high quality sound that left me impressed.In short, I love these headphones. I would gladly recommend them to anyone. Again, for fifty bucks, these headphones give you a “high-end” listening experience, with a lot of other functional capabilities thrown in to boot – from built in microphone, incredible 15-hour battery life, handsome look, terrific carrying case, obvious high-quality construction, and they look slick.Oh yeah, and they’re comfortable on your head and covering your ears. You get great sound channeled to your ears while outside noise is effectively blocked out.To be sure, I compared these headphones carefully and side-by-side with at least a dozen other Bluetooth models I own. (Three of the others are also Sentey products!) think these are the best.If you love a lot of heavy bass, these phone have that – but you don’t sacrifice some tingling, scintillating highs.One of the aspects I like best about this set is the volume – it goes way up. A lot of headsets actually limit how loud you can tune up, but these allow you some leeway to go as loud as you might dare. I know, I know, listening to really loud music can be dangerous to your ears and can result in hearing loss, but I’ll trust that each one of you is responsible enough to use good common sense in this regard. I like having the option to go a little louder than perhaps I should go, just every once and a while.Pairing was easy and effortless and glitch-free with all my devices, from HP laptop to Kindle Fire and all else.The packaging is attractive. The oval-shaped carrying case is sleek, strong and terrific. That’s one of the factors that will make this a great gift. Unboxing it gives you the impression that your getting a gift that will be really nice, and it’s something you actually want! (Not socks, or a another necktie!)I can’t think of any downside to your consideration of this item. Certainly, you can find all kinds of Bluetooth models for less than $50 – but if you want to start getting into high end sound and comfort without spending more than a hundred bucks, (or hundreds), then get these. It’s just a great deal.Please note that I received these headphones free in exchange for a 100% honest, unbiased and completely objective review.

This scarf is a lovely, elegant item that is at once understated, yet fashionable enough to complete that warm winter look you are going for – depending in your sense of style. It’s all about personal choice, of course, and if this is the look you’re going for, well, you’ll be well pleased.This is a scarf that looks like something a wonderful grandmother would knit for you personally because she wants you to stay warm on a chilly day, and also show a bit of chic panache.It is incredibly soft and won’t itch or feel scratchy at your throat, or when it touches your face.The item ships and comes to you enfolded on its own hanger with Velcro to help secure it, so it’s easy to hang up in your closet, or coat rack pegs.The colors are somewhat understated, yet I really think the bright red provides just the right about of “flash” if you want to make just a bit of a statement. This is also a terrific holiday look.The price is right for an item that is well put together and really looks hand-made with care and personal attention.You’ll be warm, cozy and look great. What’s not to love?Please note I received this item free in exchange for an objective, honest and unbiased review based on actual “in-the-field” test of the product. (My wife handled the testing in this case). She’s all “thumbs up” on this stylish scarf.

This is an okay light that is priced inexpensively and it functions as promised. In short, it gets the job done for what you want it to do, and so I give it 5 Stars.I use it to mostly to chop wood in the dark. I live in a remote region of extreme northern Minnesota where it gets dark early in the winter, and it seems like I am always a bit behind in getting my firewood split up for our bitter cold winter days and nights.I always tell myself that I am going to get all my wood split and stacked during the warm summer months, but you know the way life goes. There is always so much else to do when the weather is warm and nice.EXCELLENT STRAP DESIGNOne of the best things about this item is the well-designed three-pronged strapped that makes for a secure, comfortable hit on your head. It won’t shake or fall off. It’s adjustable so it will fit any head.MULTI-FUNCTIONThe light also has several modes of function. First, you can make the beam “zoom in tight” or spread out for wide dispersal of the light. All you have to do is pull out the lens, or push it back in. No fumbling around.It also has bright mode, a dim mode and a flashing mode. Just “click, click, click” the power button and it moves you through each mode.It raps out at 50 lumens in the bright mode, so this is plenty bright enough for any situation.EASY TILTYou can easily tilt the light up or down to get the light to shine it just where you want.PRICE IS RIGHTI own several of these kinds of head-mounted utility lights – one of them is a $35 model – and that one is far superior to this one. I won’t elaborate, except to say that sometimes you get what you pay for.However, if you don’t want to spend a lot of money, and just want a basic light that gets the job done, I can heartily recommend this inexpensive and simple light that works great.Please note I received this item free in exchange for an honest, objective and unbiased review.

Wow, it’s a real challenge to review these headphones because so many variables come into play.I’ll talk about all that, but just let me jump to my overall conclusion: I rate them 4-Stars.This is an item that has so much going for it:• Super high quality construction.• Solid design that is sleek and modern.• Comfortable fit on over the head and on the ears.• Foldable and easy to store, carry, travel with.• Rich, elegant look. Stainless steel and painted black rubber.• Comes in attractive carrying case and packaging.• Would be a great gift.So why do I detract one star? Well, the reason is somewhat ironic. It’s because I own another pair of headphones made by this same company – Sentey – and those headphones have vastly superior sound.The issue for me is that I compared this non-Bluetooth, (cord-jack-connection only) set side-by-side with the Sentey Bluetooth Headphones V4.0 – the Bluetooth version blows away this jack-enabled version.When you consider that both units are being offered for the same price (as of this review) – both at $49.99, it makes me wonder why go with this corded headphones when you can enjoy the tether-free version for the same price, and with much better sound.Don’t get me wrong – I would call the sound deliver of this model as “adequate.” But again, when you do a side-by-side comparison with the Sentey Bluetooth model, I mean, there is just no comparison.Or, you could look at it this way: This set of headphones is excellent for all other uses besides music, such as pairing them with your smartphone or for other voice and non-music uses. They sound is crisp and clean. But they just don’t have the bass – and the volume – of the Sentey Bluetooth V4.0.It is agonizing for me to detract a star because, overall, this is such a beautiful, well-constructed and well-packaged product. These come out of the box looking easily like a $100 -- $150 set of headphones. So at about fifty bucks, it’s a decent buy.If you are a bass fanatic, and like to turn up the volume dangerously loud, these are not the phones for you. But this is a nice, high quality, well-built headset that will give years of faithful use – if it were me, I would use these around the office while doing business, talking on the phone, or listening to meditative sounds, such as binaural beats, etc. When I want to kick back with some excellent music, I switch to the Sentey Bluetooth model.Please note that I received this item free in exchange for a 100% honest, objective and unbiased review.

Rating this little keyboard has been a very tough call for me.For the most part, I think it is a slick little item – incredibly lightweight, slim, and attractive. I like the snappy feel of the keys. It’s small, but not too small to make for uncomfortable typing. It paired effortlessly with all my devices. I was soon typing away, unfettered and free of cords and cables.NEEDED REPLACMENT: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICEHowever, first one I received was buggy. It worked, but it tended to have some occasional minor problems. For one thing, the indicator lights for the “power,” “Bluetooth” etc., seemed to have a life of their own. For example, the pad could be fully operational even when the power light was off.Sometimes the Bluetooth light indicator kept flashing all the time, even though the pairing was working okay. There was also an occasional blip in the keystrokes – displaying the wrong character, etc.So I emailed the company, and their customer service was beyond excellent. They immediately sent out a replacement, which I had just two days later. The new tablet works just fine in all respects.IMPORTANT NOTE:The instruction say the keypad comes with a “PU Leather Stand Case.” It DOES NOT. I asked the company about this, and they said: “The instruction manual is out of date. The item no longer ships with a leather stand.”MY OVERALL FEELINGAfter testing two of these keyboards, my impression is that, if the one you get works fine, you’ll have a terrific keyboard that should do what you want it to do. Great for traveling, for example, and using with your smartphone or tablet.However, in reading many other reviews, and testing the product myself, my impression is that this product may have a likelihood of being “buggy” or “glitch-prone.” But if you get a lemon, I’m sure the seller will make good on it and give you another.The price is very reasonable. So I’m going with 4-Stars based on all of the above – it may be a 5-Star for some – and for others, it may be “less than.”The only thing I remain uncertain about at this point is how long this item will last – can it take “millions of keystrokes” like the manufacturer says? I’ll update this is a few months to let you know.Please note I received this item free in exchange for and honest, objective and unbiased review.

This is a surprisingly nice set of sunglasses that comes with a set of four extra lenses in addition to the primary set, for a total of five interchangeable lens choices of different color and shades.The design is rather unique, unlike any other sunglasses I have seen.The feature that really struck me is an inner frame just inside the primary lenses -- it's really a terrific idea. It adds a sense of stability and comfort that has to be felt to be appreciated. Trying these on feels immediately great on the face.This clever "inner frame" gives you a feeling of confidence that you are wearing a solid piece of equipment on your nose, and that your eyes are protected by more than just blocking light.SO YOU GET:1 frame5 pair of colored lenses1 adjustable strap1 cleaning cloth1 soft pouch case1 Hard CaseComplete instructions.The hard case is solid and attractive, about seven inches long, and just over four inches wide. It's about two and one-quarter inches thick. It opens and closes with a smooth-glide zipper.The hard case is important for storing your extra lenses as well as the shades themselves. It contains tight-fitting slots for each extra lens set. That way you can't lose them, and they won't get scratched up just sitting around. You also won't lose them if you keep them snug in their case.Of course, you can use the soft case or "pouch" for carrying these around when you're "on the go."The lenses are of five different colors: black, clear, yellow, blue and mirror.It will take you a bit of practice to get the hang of removing the lenses and switching in the others. You might find yourself pulling quite hard -- but just take it easy and use a firm steady motion and don't force anything. A little practice makes perfect. Follow the instructions provided and noodle around and I know you will get the lens removal/attachment process down. It's not rocket science.The most important thing is that this set does an excellent job of blocking out the harsh light of the sun -- and also gives you many choices based on how bright or dull the weather in on any particular day.THE BOTTOM LINE:I say that, for twenty bucks, this is an extremely good deal on a "low end" that almost seem like "high end" set of very cool looking shades that I think any one will find excellent for day-to-day use.Why spend $100, $300 or $500 (and more) for one of those "Big Name" brands when you can get these for twenty bucks -- if you're like me, you tend to lose your shades easily, or sit on them, or forget them somewhere -- I say cheap and good is the way to go.As I said, these shades are almost like a high-end set for a fantastic price, so even if you break or lose them, you're out only a Jackson.Please note I received this set free in exchange for an honest, objective and unbiased test and review process.

This is actually a difficult product to review. On the one hand, for the low price and the simple or "cheap" thrill the product delivers, I could easily see giving these tattoo sleeves a 4- to -5 Star review.On the other hand, this is not a super-high quality item. Do they really look like real tattoos? Not in my opinion. The lights in the room have to be pretty dim to fool anyone into thinking you have a real "arm sleeve" tattoo.The feel of the sleeve is similar to a woman's nylon stocking, I guess. They also tend to "run" like a nylon, similar to the old kind of nylons that women once wore more commonly. (Do women still wear nylons? I'm clueless).But, anyway, I know my niece wore these as part of her Halloween costume and loved them for that purpose.So the bottom line is, these fake tattoo arm sleeves are a certain amount of fun for a very low price. In that sense, it is a great deal. But if you are expecting to fool anyone into thinking you have a real tattoo even for five minutes, you are not likely to achieve that goal with these.I grant 3-Stars overall. It's a tough call. For the price, they might be 4 or 5-Star, as long as you know what you're getting.Please note I received a free sample in exchange for a review.

The first thing I do when I get a bag of ginger like this is open it up and stick my nose in -- you can tell the quality of an excellent ginger if you get that definite "ginger blast" that is really "gingery" but perhaps not overpoweringly so.This ginger product passed my "big whiff" test with flying colors. It's almost like aroma therapy. Wow, this is some really nice ginger.One of my favorite things to use ginger for is cooking a Thai dish, such as a ginger-chicken stir fry. I used two big tablespoons, and I hit it just right. I felt like I was enjoying an authentic Thai dish that didn't taste like some generic premix powder.This ginger is very finely ground, very "powdery" so be careful -- I think you can use a lot less of this than a lower-grade brand because the taste really comes forward easily. You don't want too much of a good thing when it comes to ginger flavor.I can't wait to try this spice in a variety of recipes, especially some baked creations, such as cookies. It's going to be a fun ride working with this wonderful bag of spice.Please note that I received a free sample in exchange for an honest, objective and unbiased review.

This book purports to tell of true events of extraordinary paranormal happenings in a remote region of Utah. The author grants that slight fictional elements have been employed for the sake of telling the story more smoothly.Just a few years ago I would have been mostly skeptical of the strange events described here, but subsequent study and research, including conducting my own personal investigations of similar claims, lead me to conclude that all or most of this is likely true – it all really happened.Telling his story through a ghostwriter, a retired career military man takes a job as a security guard on some property in northern Utah, a 500-acre plot which is owned by none other than Bob Bigelow.If you are a dyed-in-the wool UFO junkie (like me) you will know that anything associated with the name of billionaire Bob Bigelow is inextricably tied to the endlessly multifaceted, layers-deep and conspiracy-infested universe of ufology, government black-ops and secret space programs.The book reports that Bigelow purchased the 500-acre cold, dusty property in northern Utah precisely because of its reputation as a UFO hot spot, not to mention centuries of reports (including a rich legacy of Native American lore/religion) telling of bizarre phenomenon, from orbs and strange energy manifestations, to bizarre creatures sighted moving in and out of portholes to alternate dimensions.Let me just say that the hero of our story in this book has many occasions to encounter much of the above in his job a night watchman on the grounds of this freakishly-haunted property.I won’t go into more details of what this guy encountered because I don’t want to issue a spoiler alert, except to say I was intrigued and did not expect what the “main event” of his experience turned out to be.I am delighted when a book of paranormal phenomenon can surprise me and deliver something beyond all the standard stuff – UFOs, ghosts, Bigfoot — we’re accustomed to reading about. The idiosyncratic nature of the events described here and a rich detailing of the smaller incidentals add to the credibility of the narrative.This book is available as a Kindle Unlimited selection, so if you subscribe to that, this is a good chance to get it for a fast read. It took me only a long evening to breeze through from first page to last. The quality of the writing is quite good – a no-nonsense clear and lucid style just tells the tale, while also putting us into the scenes effortlessly with minimal but vivid description of landscapes and the other minor players, all of whom come alive as “characters” taking part in the strange events.Erick T. Rhetts is the pseudonym of a guy who has produced a number of similar titles on similar topics. Some simple Internet sleuthing reveals to me that Mr. Rhetts is freelance writer located in Patchogue, New York. He claims authorship of this book on his LiknedIn Page under his real name, which I will let anyone here investigate for themselves if they are dying to know.Whatever the case and whomever the author, this is a worthy little gem to add to your collection of titles exploring bizarre phenomenon and paranormal topics.

My "acid test" for a great cinnamon is how well it does in two of my recipes: My homemade apple pie and zucchini bread. The quality cinnamon can make or break these two favorites.This organic Ceylon Cinnamon distributed by Kazu passed with flying colors.My apple pie was infused with that rare combination that delivers a definite "cinnamony" taste without overpowering with the sensation of being too spicy.The aroma of this cinnamon when I was mixing it with the melted butter of my pie filling was heavenly. Sampling some crunchy pre-cooked apples coated in a mixture of cinnamon, sugar, butter and nutmeg is an exquisite taste sensation.My zucchini bread recipe also turns heavily on the quality of the cinnamon. It can either "get lost" in the other ingredients, or enhance and bring out the rest. The zucchini in zucchini bread is basically neutral in flavor, so you want the cinnamon to deliver a punch, without taking over the whole taste regime.This spice is very finely ground -- it's powdery -- and that tends to mean you get a deeper, more integral sensation of the cinnamon. I also feel good about this product because it is organic and free of unwanted chemicals, pesticides, etc.This brand is clearly a cut above the average or generic cinnamon you'll find in any grocery store. It's probably one of the highest quality spices I've worked with in some time.Please note that I received a free sample in exchange for an unbiased, objective and honest review of this product.

This remarkable little camping light proves that a BIG LIGHT can come in a SMALL PACKAGE. This item just barely fills up the palm of the average hand, but easily lights up an entire room.Inside a small tent, the entire interior would be filled with light.I have reviewed three or four camping lanterns here in recent months and, while the others are nice, I have to say this one is by far the brightest, and the one I would choose to take with me if trapped on a desert island and if I could only bring along one light. (Especially if I had a way to charge it with solar, but this light does not have solar capability. That would really make it amazing).COMPACT AND LIGHTThe item is so small and light-weight it adds net to nothing to the load you have to carry around while camping or hiking. This will fit easily into any pouch on a backpack, and can even be shoved into a pants pocket in a pinch.SOLID AND WATERPROOFThe light is solid and well constructed. It's made of heavy, durable plastic -- and oh yes -- it is waterproof! That's a terrific bonus, in my opinion.MULTIPLE LIGHT FUNCTIONThe light has five modes:Press the button once and a small indicator light comes onPress twice and you get the full blast of bright white light that disperses widely.Press three times and you get a dimmer light that uses less battery power.Press four times and you get a slow flashing light.Press five times and you get a rapid strobe light.Press again and the light turns off.HANDY HANGING CLIPThere is a very small clip in the back that folds flat to the surface, or can be turned out to either prop up the light or hang it on something. The clip uncouples in the middle so you can more easily fit it around or hang it on a hook, or wherever.RECHARGEABLE INTERNAL BATTERYThis light has a built-in 1800mAh lithium battery that cranks out 180 lumens at maximum.The battery is recharged with a provided USB cable. You can use your computer, or a one of those plug in chargers with a USB port to give it more juice.BURNS FOR HOURSI know the light will burn at least 4-5 hours on a charge at maximum brightness, and certainly longer on the dim setting.THE BOTTOM LINE: CALL ME AMAZEDI can's say enough good things about this little but powerful camping lantern. I absolutely love it. It's a home run and gets my very top recommendation. Get it for sure ... you won't be disappointed.Please note I received this item free in exchange for an honest, unbiased and objective review.

So far so good -- this LED chandelier bulb is working flawlessly in a handing lamp with three outlets above our kitchen table.It casts a sufficiently bright light, and because LED lights are extremely stingy on power-usage, I feel much better about burning this bulb than I do more standard models. Saving electricity is extremely important for one's budget, but also for environmental reasons. I like to feel good about using the most efficient products in terms of power usage. That's why I like this bulb.I have read in a lot of other reviews that there have been problems with flickering or incidents of "going dead," but all I can say is that the bulb has been performing solidly for almost three weeks now.Certainly, a test of two to three months will be a much better indicator of the quality of this bulb, so stay tuned and come back here for updates.For now, I'm giving this 5 stars, with the understanding that my test is ongoing, and I will keep readers updates if I encounter any future problems.I should also say the item arrives in time and was well packaged in a study plastic cylinder, and that the company contacted me a few days after I received the bulb to check on my satisfaction. So my high rating also reflects good customer service.Please note I received this item free in exchange for field testing it and writing an honest, objective and unbiased review.

I've always gasped with amazement at some people who pay hundreds of dollars, and yes, even thousands of dollars for a pair of sunglasses.I know there is a popular brand (I won't name it here) that sells a pair made of carbon fiber with a titanium spine -- they cost $4,000! What if you accidentally sit on them? Or forget them at the bus stop? What if they get stolen at the beach? Yikes!No, I'm more the kind of guy who likes to pay twenty bucks for a decent, serviceable set of shades for daily use. At that price, these Ponosoon 819 Polarized Sports Sunglasses are a sensible choice and good deal. They even look good.They come with five interchangeable lenses, and a few other extras, too. That includes a solid carrying case, a very nice silky-black tote sack and an "antiskid" rope to hang the glasses around your neck.These glasses feel solid on my face. They are tightly constructed and are made of a fairly high-grade plastic.I must say they don't exactly have the feel pf a high-end set of sunglasses -- I mean, they are NOT dollar-store cheapy in "feel" -- but they definitely don't feel like a expensive custom fit set of glasses either. They're fine.But I really like the way the bows hug my face snugly, and the rubberized nose grip gives a real a feeling of security -- these won't fall off you face, even when doing strenuous activities, such as playing a rough game of volleyball on the beach, or riding your bike or motorcycle.Again, for the price, this is an excellent deal. I was leaning toward 4-Stars, but after wearing these Ponosoon's around for a couple of days, I'm comfortable with giving them 5-Stars -- and especially because of the price. For around $20, this set with five different lenses is a good choice for anyone who doesn't want to spend north of $50 or $100 for a pair of shades.Please note I received this item free in exchange for an honest, objective and unbiased review.

The first thing when I received this bag of turmeric spice is give it the ultimate test: I put a raw teaspoon of it on my tongue, and then closed my mouth to get a sense of the full flavor.My judgement is that this is an excellent spice, a definite cut above the average or "generic" turmeric you buy in any grocery store.This organic and imported turmeric from Kazu has an authentic taste. It's bolder, more pungent, fragrant and the flavor goes deep. For serious cooks who really want to capture the true sense of an authentic Indian, Sri Lankan or Mideast dish, this is the spice you should choose.HEALTH BENEFITSI am also convinced of the health benefits that turmeric delivers as a bonus to the avid spicy food fan. Turmeric contains a substance called curcumin, which is an antioxidant with anti-inflammatory properties.Solid scientific tests show that turmeric can even be a substitute for some drugs. It can help treat chronic hepatitis, colorectal cancer, diabetes, and high cholesterol. (As always, consult your doctor before changing any medications you are taking right now, or even adding tumeric to your diet as a raw supplement).Turmeric is part of the ginger family. Cooking with turmeric is an acquired skill, and it may take a lot of experimentation on your part to find out just how you like to use this flavor and in what dishes.But have no doubt, when you find recipes that call for turmeric, you could do no better than select this brand. It's absolutely excellent.Please note that I received a free sample of this spice in exchange for an honest, unbiased and objective review.

This is a silky-luxurious eye mask that will feel as soft as an angel's wing resting across your eyes. Additionally, a gentle lavender scent will calm your senses and give you a feeling of blissful relaxation.It sounds like a bit of paradise, and I think for many, or most people, it will be. It's a lovely item.For some, this might be slightly less than a 5-Star item because of some minor factors -- they may be minor -- but to be thorough in my review, I'll mention them.First, because this eye pillow has no straps, you can only use it while lying flat on your back. It will fall off as soon as you roll over. This might be a drawback for some.I found the lavender scent just right, but my wife thought is a bit overpowering. If you are one of those people who just can't stand scented items, such as some laundry soaps and fabric softeners, you may not like the scent too much. The scent fades over time, however, and if you heat and cool the item.I'm going to settle on 4 Stars with the understanding that others might easily consider this a 5-Star item. It's definitely well-made of quality fabric and is put together solidly. It will withstand years of use, if you treat it delicately.Please note that I received this item free in exchange for an honest, objective review.

I was all set to rate these glasses as a 3-Star item, but then my wife tried them and said, "I love them!" Darn! what to do now?Here's what's good:The item delivers on its promise. It allows you to lie down and read a book without having to lift your head or crane your neck to see your book. Obviously, this is also a good way to watch a video on your Kindle to favorite computer tablet.The glasses are also well constructed. It's a solid item with decent-grade plastic that is well put together, and which will  last a long time under normal use.The mirror-lenses are also of a very high, reflective quality that delivers a clear and sharp image of what you are viewing.They are comfortable to wear -- and the really do work well. You can be much more comfortable sitting or lying in bed as you read. Your hands and arms won't get tired holding up your book or tablet, and you won't have to bend your neck to watch TV.MY PROBLEM IS ...The catch for me is that I already where prescription eye glasses, and I can't see or read a thing without them. The problem is that I have to slide these Lazy Glasses on over the top of my regular glasses, and this creates a less--than-comfortable situation for me.First, it's slightly cumbersome wearing two sets of glasses because they may pinch your nose and bump against your face in an irritating way.Second, when you wear these glasses over the top of your normal glasses, it creates just a bit of space between your eyes and the mirrors that help you see at a 90-degree angle -- in short, for this renders these glasses far less effective. For me, it caused eye strain that I just can't withstand.That's why I was going to give it 3-Stars. For a person who wears no regular eyeglasses, this is a useful and helpful item. My wife would give them 5-Stars. If you need to wear your regular glasses while you read or watch, these may not work so well.So I am going to compromise between my 3-Star judgement and my wife's 5-Star rating and settle at 4-Stars.

Mankind’s never-ending search for the perfect set of headsets never rests.That search is also my search. Thus, I was eager to test this Soundpeat Q800 addition to a field that is crowded with makes, models and competitors.My judgement: Well, these are darned nice. If they’re not the ultimate, perfect design for a set of Bluetooth headsets, they offer enough perks and benefits to get a high rating from me.Here’s why I like them:• Big, easy-to-find volume controls – most Bluetooth headphones have tiny, hard-to-find and manipulate volume controls, but these have big raised buttons in the shape of “plus” and “minus” signs. You can easily find these buttons in the dark, such as when you are resting in bed in the dark, listening to an audio book, music or meditative tones. There’s little or no fumbling around, or a need to turn on the lights to find the volume controls or skip button. You can "feel" the "Plus" and "Minus" with your fingertips without looking at them. So these would also be great for the vision impaired.• Well-though-out ergonomic design – The main body of the unit rests around your neck like a loose necklace, or collar. This places the unit where it is convenient for you to reach up and manipulate the controls – but it also secures the headset to your body making it tough to fall off or shake off when you are active, especially if you secure them to your clothing with the provided anchor clip.• Earbuds that fit – The earbuds that are pleasantly rounded on the outside and fit securely inside the ear, and you get different sized tips so that you can find the right fit for your unique ear size. The buds dangle from the main frame of the unit, and are positioned right so that you can easily pop them into your ears, or pop them out. This also speaks to the ergonomic advantages I talked about above• Long Range – This headset has a stronger signal than most Bluetooth devices I have tried. When synced with my Kindle Fire, I could hear perfect sound when walking up my driveway – I went more than 30 feet, and did not lose the signal.• Nice sound – The quality of the sound was as good, or slightly better, than many other headsets of this caliber I have tried. The highs are scintillating and the bass is pretty good. I’m not as expert on sound, but these made music sound terrific, as far as my tastes go.• Very long battery life – I used them for at least 8 hours without a charge, and sure they would have kept going. I think they are rated for at least 10 hours play between charges – that’s more than adequate.• Easy charge-pairing – Just plug them into your computer with the provided USB. I synced them to my Kindle Fire with great ease. If a techno-idiot like me can do it, anyone can without a problem.THE BOTTOM LINEWith so many different designs, models, shapes and choices of Bluetooth headsets, this Q800 is a pleasant alternative to a lot of the others that are “more of the same.” It’s a unique design that tries harder to find just the right fit nd comfort level for each person. These are nice to have, especially if you have two or three (or like me, about 10 different sets) to give you a different kind of control and feel for specific situations.I flirted with a 4-star rating, only because I think some might find the dangling earbuds may result in a bit of initial fumbling around to them straight, or they might possibly tangle a bit easily – but here I am just reaching extra hard to find faults just for the sake of making a thorough review that points out all aspects of the item. I’m comfortable with 5 stars, and I think you will be, too.Please Note: I received this headset free in exchange for my honest and objective review.

This is a book about two ordinary young people who suddenly become extraordinary beings.In the case of the young man, he’s not so typical because, for starters, he’s 17 but already on his death bed. Pax is dying from a horrific disease called scleroderma – it involves the tightening of the skin and connective tissue. It’s an agonizing way to die.His only friend, Scarlett, has problems not quite as urgent: She’s a drab, gawky 17-year-old whose lack of feminine grace, good looks and charm means she’s not exactly the most popular girl in school. She’s an outcast and bullied.But the fortunes of both Pax and Scarlett are about the change in a most amazing way: A couple of meddling “super beings” from the astral world are going to transform them into powerful, indestructible entities with god-like powers – Pax’s diseased body will be replaced with solid titanium and Scarlett will be made of “evil energy” and fire.If it sounds like an intriguing premise for a thrilling fantasy/science fiction novel, well, it is. It’s made more interesting because there is a decent plot here – Pax and Scarlett are immediately caught up in a game of inter-dimensional politics which will determine nothing less than the survival of the entire human race.Author John Patrick Kennedy writes extremely well; his prose is natural and fluid. He has a lucid, no-nonsense style. He definitely has a sense of pacing and rhythm, balancing scenes of intense, violent action with periods of serene and calm.And yet, acknowledging all of the above, I Am Titanium left me feeling bland and uninspired, even depressed. I’ll be brutally honest: I felt relieved to get to the last page – much in the way that people are glad when one of Michael Bay’s over-long Transformer movies finally ends.It’s that frustrating feeling of being inexplicably bored while we're embroiled in long scenes of spectacular, intense action and eye-popping special effects.  But we know on some inner level  that all this eye candy is about as nutritious as real candy – empty calories that taste good, but ultimately leave you starved.The action scenes in this book go on way too long, especially the epic battle between Pax and “the monster” in the latter third of the book. It grinds away page after page and quickly wears incredibly tedious. All that, and the “monster” and Pax end up working for the same cause anyway!There are other factors that also seriously erode our reading experience. For example, before obtaining super powers, Scarlett was a typical angst-ridden teen, at odds with her parents, a loser at love (actually, a total nonstarter) and socially alienated. After she gets super powers, she becomes something even worse. Still angst ridden, alienated and troubled in love – even though all on a different level and for different reasons now.Despite the fact that he’s dying, Pax starts out as a hopeful, even positive young man with a meaningful goal – the study of the astral realms -- but after he obtains super powers, he become a typical moody, sullen teen with an endless stream of things to aggravate him, and to whine and complain about.A long bout of losing his virginity (having sex seven times in one session) only results in complicated “girlfriend” problems.His dialogue devolves into a series of grunted monosyllabic phrases liberally seasoned with the “F word.”His own inept actions (such as accidentally killing a street protester) infuses him with existential angst.His rocky relationship with his mother deteriorates to an even lower order.Speaking of mom, Pax’s mother, Dr. Julia Black, is revealed to have a level of humanity barely above that of the infamous Nazi doctor, Josef Mengele. She becomes the focal point of an almost inexplicable series of scenes wherein she interacts with some AI robots – which is at best, tangential to the entire narrative and, at worst, borders on not making much sense.However, for me, what is truly dejecting and saddening about this book is that the mass of humanity is treated as so much insignificant cannon fodder. Uncounted thousands of people are killed, maimed, burned, crushed, eaten, hacked up, stabbed, flung through the air, smashed against walls, mashed into pulpy lumps of flesh – it’s all collateral damage resulting from the wacky adventures of two teen super heroes fighting to save humanity.I found myself wishing that a book that centers on an epic battle to save humanity would display an overall  greater sense or empathy for that humanity.

I like this little potato slicer/French fry maker a lot, but I think for most people this will be a mediocre product, and thus a 3-Star item, in my opinion.WHAT’S GOODI almost never buy pre-prepared frozen French fries – I much prefer to slice up my own potatoes, so for me this is a handy device. It makes the fries just the right size for my likes – not too thin and not too thick.The mesh of blades are just sharp enough to buzz through a small potato with an easy downward thrust. For me, it was a snap – a smooth, easy action. There are no springs or anything like that. This is strictly a manual product that works with your “elbow grease.”WHAT’S SO-SOThere are actually four separate parts: the cutting mesh, a gripper, the external housing and the part you use to press down. I say this is “so-so” because, while it works okay, it is a tad unwieldy in actual use. You have to just sort of balance the gripper on top the potato and then place the “thruster” over the top of this before you push down – and the gripper is kind of wobbly and just a tad difficult to keep positioned just right on the potato.I’m probably making this sound a little more difficult that it is – it’s just a matter of getting all the separate parts together long enough to make that one-stroke cut – it’s not all that difficult, or really not “difficult” at all --  it’s just not ideal.WHAT’S NOT SO GOODThe cutting mesh is quite small – about 3-inhes wide by 2 ¼ inch wide. That means you’ll need a relatively small potato – or you will have to pre-slice larger potatoes to make them fit. This is not exactly the end of the world, but I’m just saying, it’s rather small. Personally, I don’t mind the small size, but others may find it less than satisfactory.Does not cut a sweet potato very easily and not so good for a variety of other vegetables, such as carrots, maybe – I mean, it will cut carrots well, but you would have to pre-slice carrots a lot to make them fit, and that defeats the purpose of a handy “fast slicer.”ALL IN ALLAgain, despite the flaws, I like this slicer a lot because I don’t mind working with small potatoes, and I would not be using this for anything else, actually – just getting some French fries made for a quick lunch is what I value a device like this for, and it takes just seconds to slice up a decent pile of fries, for one or several people.So all-in-all, a solid 3-Star from me – and please be aware, I received this device free in exchange for a fair and honest review.FINAL NOTE:Everything on the outside of the box is written in French, and that includes the instructions (which are printed on the outside of the box). Even so, a simple graphic diagram shows you how to use the slicer, so the fact that everything is in French should not be a problem for anyone.

UPDATE: NOVEMBER 21 -- NOT GOOD NEWSOkay, I received these board in July and as you can see from my original review below, I gave them top marks. I'm sad to say that now some four moths later, all three board have fallen apart -- they splintered and broke down the middle lengthwise -- and this was through just normal use, not heavy use, like pounding on them, etc. I never placed them in a dishwasher.The handles broke off first, and the rest of the board came apart shortly thereafter. They just fell apart.Yes, I liked them while they lasted, but the bottom line is, you'll probably be needing another set of cutting board after a few months. that's my experience.**************THIS IS MY ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW:I never realized how nice it was to have three cutting board of three different sizes all at once … until I got three cutting board of three different sizes. It really makes a difference in the kitchen!And I spend a lot of time in the kitchen. I love to cook.LET’S TALK ABOUT THESE BAMBOO BOARDS:I’ve had my knives and choppers busy cutting up everything from meats and vegetables, to fruits and blocks of cheese. At first I was skeptical that these boards could withstand a lot of cutting and slicing without getting gouged or suffering slice marks and nicks – but so far so good!They’re way more durable than I thought they would be. In fact, they’re tough to scar or mark.I also like the natural wood feel look of these boards – so much better than synthetic plastic or acrylic boards – that’s something of a purely aesthetic quality, but I also think using a sustainable wood product like this is better for the environment.MORE FLEXIBILITY IN YOUR WORKHaving a selection of different cutting boards makes things easier. For example, let’s say you’re making a chicken stir fry and you have just one cutting board. If you cut up the chicken first, then you have to stop and wash off the board before you dice the vegetables.With three boards, you can have the meat on one, vegetables on another, and whatever else you might need on a third. Then you’re ready to get it all into the sizzling oil of the wok!Of course, three boards means more wash up – so let’s talk about that.CLEANINGThese board are not dishwasher safe, which is okay with me because I don’t use a dishwasher. But I just wanted you to know that it’s not recommended to put these boards in a dishwasher.Other than that, it’s just a matter of throwing them in the sink and scrubbing them clean with some elbow grease. Nothing wrong with that. They wipe off easily and scrub clean with a little natural effort.BOTTOM LINEI think this is an excellent deal, especially for the price. These boards are functional, look great and are made from sustainable bamboo. I like that better than some industrial plastic sludge product.Please note: I received these cutting boards free in exchange for my honest, objective review.

I almost never play “grammar police.” I have given 4 and 5 stars reviews to other books where the grammar was lacking. In the case of this book, however, not only is the grammar absolutely deplorable, but the substance of the information being offered  is questionable at best.It’s as if this book was written by a high school student who is getting a “D” in his freshman English class.While the author is obviously highly motivated guy who is working hard to build a strong public image, why he would allow himself to be represented by such a sloppy, poorly-reasoned book is mystifying. I’ve seen some of his video presentations and he comes off as a bright, charismatic and intelligent young man who truly seems to care about helping others.But just about every single paragraph in this book contains a mangled, garbled sentence that is not only grammatically incorrect, but ridiculously poorly constructed. Take this paragraph:“There was a study done with basket ballers who trained for three weeks to see what had the most effect, training physically, not training at all or visualizing in your head. They come back and the people who didn’t train obviously were the worst, then it was physical who trained physically everyday didn’t come close to visualizing.”GAK! That’s bloody awful!Also, it borders on offensive the way the author invokes Albert Einstein to bolster his claims about the Law of Attraction. Dixon amateurishly writes:“Albert Einstein one of the most smartest individuals in the world new (sic) about this secret law and believed that whatever we focus on consistently we will manifest into our reality.”What a bunch of hogwash! How about citing a source from Einstein’s work – a paper, a quote, a book – that says anything about how Einstein believed that people can manifest things into their lives with the power of mindful intent! The author can’t provide a source because there is none.Please note, I’m not one of these narrow-minded skeptics who automatically discount what is suggested by the popular notion of the Law of Attraction. Yes, I think the concept has merit. But I just loath it when certain charlatans make absurd and clumsy attempts to get the likes of Albert Einstein on their side – twisting his work, words, and theories -- and making claims using his great name and legacy.It’s so frustrating when New Age self-help gurus quote Einstein in shallow and irresponsible ways, not really understanding what they are talking about, not grasping what a guy like Einstein was all about, or what he really thought about the workings of the mind and universe.Finally: What’s mind boggling is that this book is the “THIRD EDITION”Wow!One would hope that after three go-arounds that someone might decide to actually go through the document line-by-line and fix all the bad grammar, poor spelling, incorrect punctuation, and more. But I suppose that aggressive, non-stop marketing and hype is always more effective than bothering to produce a high-quality product.

I immediately loved the look, feel and texture of this drawer organizer – the natural, organic bamboo it’s made from just has a natural, warm feeling that you can’t get from some industrial plastic piece of junk.Bamboo is a sustainable material, so that’s a plus for me, too. This item is well-constructed.SIZE AND FITThis drawer organizer can expand to a larger size – when “closed” it is just over 17-inches x 13 inches.When expanded it is 19 inches x 13 inches.It is about 1.5-inches deep on the inside.When closed in smallest form, there are 11 separate compartments. When expanded there are a total of 13.SMOOTH ACTIONPulling the sides out to expand the item to full size feels smooth and gliding in motion, and solid. It’s not rickety and does not feel like it would easily fall apart. It’s well-crafted.ONE POSSIBLE DRAWBACKMost people would probably use this for kitchen utensils, and one problem for me here is that the compartments are not deep enough to accommodate some of my items – such as my larger or wider spatulas – or my potato masher – or my lemon press -- these items just don’t fit well into this organizer.It’s great for flat or “low-profile” knives, forks, spoons, etc. but some of your larger cooking utensils would have to go elsewhere.THE BOTTOM LINEI was thinking of retracting one star for a 4-star rating because of the problem I mentioned above. Again, it will not accommodate some of your larger cooking utensils.However, this item can be used in other areas of your home as well, such as an office desk or hobby room, den or bedroom drawer. You could organize all kinds of things that you collect – and everything looks terrific in this simple, well-designed organizer.I love the warm, “woody” natural feel, and the gentle “nutty” glow of the tawny brown bamboo. The texture of the bamboo grains are pleasing and attractive to the eye. I think it will enhance the look of most drawers, be it kitchen, den, office or other room.Finally, the price is right, so I’m going with five stars..Please note: I received this item free in exchange for an honest and objective review.

I was considering giving this bracelet three stars, but on further consideration, I am bumping my rating up to four stars, and here’s why:By classic definition, this is “cheap jewelry.” At this price, what else could you call it? I don’t mean that in a negative way. A lot of people like  baubles that cost little but nevertheless look good – let the Royal Family of England spend millions on jewelry!The item is stamped with “925” which means it is 92.5% made of silver. The remaining 7.5 percent is something else, most likely nickel or copper. I don’t know which in this case.The craftsmanship is just a little dicey – I mean, just a little bit off center where the clasps meet – but you really have to look hard to notice this.But again, for the incredibly low price, I think anyone can expect something that is not of Tiffany-quality.I bumped it up to four stars because I asked my wife to wear it to work for a day. She’s works for a large company with 3,000 employees. I wanted to see if anyone complimented her on the bracelet. She came home and said that two of her friends spontaneously told her the bracelet “looked nice.”For me, that says “mission accomplished.” This is a fine item for the price.Please note” I received this bracelet free in exchange for my honest, and objective review.

This is a cleverly-designed device that delivers exactly what it promises – a handy, very secure and solid way to mount your cell- or smartphone on the dash of your car, or various other locations.The unit has a surprisingly powerful suction-cup grip that seems to work on a variety of surfaces, and in all temperatures.I think this thing will hold solid even on the bumpiest roads you’ll drive upon.It will fit a smartphone from 2 inches to 4 inches in width. It grabs the phone really well. A quick release button behind the unit caused the “clampers” to spread out automatically – then you just squeeze the clamps to fit the size of your phone. I have an older model cell phone that is 2 inches wide, and it holds it perfectly.Releasing your phone is also as simple as pushing a button, so you won’t have to fumble with it.The holder rotates 360 degrees allowing both portrait and landscape viewing.The back of the cradle has a rubber cushion to help absorb any shock your phone might encounter.It’s made from a very hard, durable black plastic and looks high tech and attractive. It should last for years on end.On the outside of the package I notice a toll-free 800 number you can call for customer support, and also an email for customer support.Has a limited 1-year warranty – so, all in all – this is a high quality product and a pretty good deal.Please note I received this product free in exchange for my honest, fair and objective review.

This is a well-constructed toy of high quality manufacture – it will almost certainly please younger children, but I also discovered that some boys at the age of 12, even near 13, can have a blast (literally) with it, too. Go figure.This toy bullhorn enhances and throws the voice, and is also equipped with a siren. If you have any adults in the house who are prone to migraine or tension headaches, well, use some common sense and make the kids go outdoors with it.The kids love to sound the siren and shouting goofy stuff at each other – I’ve also discovered it helps to have at least two so that more than one kid can get in on the fun.It’s a toy that lets kids play at being a police officer or fireman in a way that seems more real and vivid to them – so that’s good. I like toys that enable kids to run around a bit and go outdoors, rather than sitting in front of computer games.You’ll need 4 AA batteries to power this unit, and they are not included. They seems to be fairly easy on the batteries, however. My nephews and their cousins played with this toy all day and the things were still working at the end of the day.All in all, this is a safe toy with no removable parts that I can detect really young kids might try to swallow. Again, this is solid unit – they are clearly very well made, durable and should last a long time. I think they’ll handle some rough usage as well without breaking easily. Get some rechargeable batteries and hours of fund will ensue.Please note I received two of these units free in exchange for my fair, honest and objective review.

This item is a surprisingly elegant, attractive and graceful item that not only looks beautiful, but functions well to fill any room with the pleasant scents of aromatic oils.I think it would add an element of grace and charm to any home, across a wide variety of decors and interior design schemes.What’s even more intriguing:  It sends up a delicate, pencil-thin column of mist that drifts upward in a way that is almost hypnotizing.The exterior framework is made of real wood; the natural swirls and grain of the wood is pleasing to the eye.In many ways, this reminds me of a “Genie Bottle,” as in that old TV show, “I Dream of Jeannie.” My only disappointment is that the ghostly, heavenly-scented mist that ascends from this bottle does not transform into a real human figure that was as lovely as Barbara Eden!EASE OF USE AND FUNCTIONSetting up this oil diffuser is quite easy. You open up the bottle by screwing off the top. There you will find a water reservoir – the item comes with a small plastic measuring cup that help you pour in just the right amount of water in a central receiving hole. Then you drop in 3 to 5 drops of your favorite aromatic oil, and replace the top.Note: Oil is not included. I happened to have some lavender oil in the house, so I used that.Next you plug it in, press the “power button” and you’ll hear just a tiny - very soft -- whirring of the water turning to vapor inside. A mist begins to emerge within minutes.The mist goes straight into the air – like a little pillar of fog – about 6 to 8 inches in the air, before the top of the mist breaks up and flutters into nothingness.LOVELY LIGHTSWhile functioning, the item also displays two small lights – a bright red light, blue and a green light. The colors only add to the attractiveness of the look, in my opinion. They’re rich and vibrant, but they don’t glare or offend. They enhance  the charm of the product.You can actually change the color of the lights through multiple presses of the start button – you can press the button up to 8 times (with 8 being “off”) – but as you do that, you get the item to display different combination of blue, red and green lights. Again, this is very pleasant.REMEMBER – THERE’S A POWER CORDThe seller’s picture of this item does not show the power cord – I just want to remind you that you’ll need an outlet nearby – and some of you may think a power cord detracts from the minimalist, sleek design of this diffuser bottle – so you should find a convenient way to hide the cord as best you can. This is probably the only slight drawback to the product that I can think of.ALL IN ALLOne of the best products I have sampled in recent weeks. I was delighted by the charm, grace, elegance and function of this product.Please note: I received this item free in exchange for a fair, honest and objective review.

I’m an avid gardener – I’m fortunate to live in a rural area with plenty of space to keep three large vegetable gardens. When you plant a wide variety of different plants, it’s a perennial challenge to keep things straight, and to remember what you planted where.It seems like a simple thing – but it’s just a vexing little problem if you don’t take steps right from the get-go – believe me, before your plants come up, it’s great to know where everything is.STAY ORGANIZEDAnd so, these garden tags are a much appreciated, simple and handy tool that solves a problem. You’ll keep you plantings organized and you stay aware of where things are as they prepare to spring forward for the growing season.EASY TO WRITE ON, WON’T RUB OFFI used a Sharpie to write the names of my plants – it works really well. The surface of these tags takes the writing perfectly without smearing. And once you write the name of your plant on these tags – they won’t come off again! Rain will not wash them off – nor anything else.I was curious to see if I could rub off tags I marked-up with my Sharpie, and found it is nearly impossible to get wipe off what has been written. I used a variety of solvents, from Windex and even nail polish remover -- but I could not rub off the words.RE-USE THEM FOR YEARSYes, that means you can’t wipe them clean at the end of the year – on the other hand, why would you need to?  Just keep them and use them for next year. They are durable enough to last for years, I’m sure.STRONG ENOUGH TO STICK IN THE GROUNDThey are also firm and durable enough to easily stick in the ground; they’re not flimsy, yet they are flexible. Just right, actually.Here is everything I am growing this year:Corn, cabbage, peppers, kale, potatoes (red, white and blue varieties), onions (two varieties), peas, squash, cantaloupe, zucchini, green beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, asparagus, broccoli, rhubarb and celery. I use both raised beds, pots and regular, right-in-the-ground garden plots.I give these tags my top rating because they do what they are supposed to do, they’re handy, durable and they look nice in the garden.Please note: I received these tags free in exchange for my honest, objective review.

I live in a remote, dark area.I’m way out in the country, and I have no yard light. The nearest city is a small town of just 700 people eight miles away, so I am not plagued by light pollution. You should see how brilliant the stars are here on a moonless night!But when I go out on a moonless night, it can be so dark you can’t see your hand in front of your face.DIFFUSED AND SCATTERED LIGHTThus, my location makes for a perfect test site for this solar-powered lamp, which uses a single LED light.That light is diffused and scattered by the frosted plastic housing that makes up the main body of the lamp.A CHEERFUL AURA OF LIGHTWalking around outside at night, this lamp cast a cheerful aura of white light around me, helping me see several feet in all directions. It is so light-weight, you can hardly feel this lamp dangling from your fingers as you carry it along. Thus, if you are out camping, or for some reason, in the dark woods at night, this lamp will be your lifeline to seeing where you are and where you are going – and you won’t run smack-nosed into a tree!GREAT FOR THE CARAfter testing this lamp, I’m definitely going to get a second one to keep in my car at all times. It would be a terrifi, reliable emergency light if your car breaks down at night; hang this on the inside of the hood of your car, at it will illuminate the whole engine as you try to figure out what’s wrong with your engine.It would also prove a great warning light to other motorists – they’ll see this light from a long way off if you are stranded on a dark road at night.INDOOR USE – PERFECT FOR READING AT NIGHTWhenever you can replace any kind of traditional electrical light in your house, you’re saving energy, not matter how small the amount. I like to place this lamp on my bed cabinet behind me so that I can  use it as a reading lamp during the many nights I have insomnia and resort to reading as a way to get too sleep.It casts a soft, but just bright enough glow so that I can read my Kindle with the just the perfect amount of light – not too harsh, and definitely not too dim.EXCELLENT FOR TENT AND CAMPINGI can’t imagine a better light to bring along on a camping trip. Just fantastic for this purpose. Again, it’s so very light-weight, and you want to pack and travel light when you are camping/hiking/biking. This lamp is small enough to fit in a backpack, and so light, you won’t know it’s there. Light up the inside of a tent at just the level of light you want and inside of test to be.WELL DESIGNEDI like the wire handle, which is easy to grasp, but which can also be positioned so that you can position the lamp to recline in a near horizontal position, which scatters the light more efficiently all around.GLOW IN THE DARK ON/OFF SWITCHThe On/Off switch has just a slight glow-in-the-dark sheen that makes it super easy to find in the complete darkness.CHARGING AND BURN TIMEYou can charge using either the USB cable (provided), or just set it out in the sunlight during the day to make sure it had a charge for the night. It will burn for 8 hours on the low setting, and 4 hours on the brighter setting.EMERGENCY LIGHT FOR POWER OUTAGESI can’t think of a better light to have in case your power goes out during a storm at night – if you have this solar lantern on hand, well, you’ll be happy to have it.I give this product my strongest 5-star rating – I absolutely love it – and remember: “Go solar!"Please note: I received this product free in exchange for my honest, objective review.

No one in my household has an issue with cellulite, so I cannot attest to the how well this item will alleviate that issue – however, I will say that this is a dandy item that offers benefits beyond the cellulite reduction claims it makes.That’s because these well-designed units offer a terrific, stimulating, tingling massage, no matter what your body type. If you are like me, and have a lot of aching sore muscles due to arthritis, getting your blood-flow stimulated is always a good thing. I think these devices can really help in that regard.I’m sure also that you can get a deeper skin-cleansing than you might otherwise obtain with, say, an ordinary washcloth or some other form of sponge scrubber. The soft plastic nubbins on this device get a deep penetration into your upper layers of skin, and press against the muscles just enough to “wake them up” – which makes you feel relaxed and energizes at the same time.As I said, I cannot advise you about the cellulite reduction quality of the product; however, I can give it a strong recommendation simply because it’s an excellent massage, skin stimulation and muscle-relaxing tool that you’ll be glad to have after one of those long days working in your garden, or playing tag football – or whatever you do to challenge yourself physically, but get some aches and pains afterword.Don’t pop a pain pill – get your loved one to give you a good once over with these rollers – you’ll enjoy it and feel great.Please note: I received this item free in exchange for my honest, objective review.

As you can see from the photo I attached to this review, I’m a guy with a lot of chainsaws.I got your standard gas-powered model; your plug-in variety and your little battery powered job.Now I have a fourth kind – this one not powered by gas or electricity – but human muscle and sweat.It’s the Pocket Chainsaw!But the question is: How well does it work?Well, let me tell you, if you had your choice, you would always want to use the gas or electric powered variety of course – who wouldn’t!ADVANTAGESHowever, there may be those times when you don’t want to lug a chainsaw around with you, not even the smaller battery powered kind, such as when you go camping, or when you just happen to be out somewhere and you need to make some quick cuts in a pinch.The advantage of the pocket chainsaw is just that: It literally fits in your pocket. In this case, the device comes with a handy pouch that you can wear on your belt. You might also keep this in the cubbyhole of your manly pick-up truck – like my manly ‘66 Chevy GMC with “three-on-the-tree” shifter.WHAT IS IT, BASICALLY?Anyway, the pocket chainsaw is basically a standard chainsaw chain that some dude has attached a couple of straps to. You grab each one of these, loop it around the piece of wood you want to saw – and have at it!HOW EASY IS IT TO USE?Well, let me tell you, if you had to saw a big ol’ pile a wood using only the Pocket Chainsaw, let’s just say you would quickly be developing some awesome forearms muscles, not to mention beefing up your triceps, quads, deltoids and pecs!Yes, it’s a workout!Even so, I was surprised at how easy it actually is to saw through some smaller branches, say, of 3-inch to 4-inch in diameter. You can cut through something like this probably in 60 seconds or less.What about a log, such as, a standard hunk of wood that you would want to toss into your wood stove?Ahhhh … well, not so much. Let me tell ya -- you wouldn’t want to be sawing bigger logs with this thing. You would be so hot and sweaty after getting through a bigger log, you wouldn’t even have to build a fire after cutting that log because you’d be plenty hot from all that work!That’s not what this is for, though. This is a handy tool for those occasions that you can’t predict, or for situations where you are away from home or in the field, or whatever.GREEN WITH ENVYI know one thing, all your buddies will want to have one as soon as they see this thing. How do I know that? Because I have shown it to a bunch of my buddies and they all say: “Hey! Where can I get one of those?” It’s weird, but your pals will be green with envy when they see your Pocket Chainsaw – and the fact that you have one and they don’t. There’s no explaining the way some guys think.Well, that’s about it. I give this nifty item 4 stars.And I am required to say: I received this free in exchange for my honest and objective review.

You know lately, I’ve had earbuds coming out of my ears!By that I mean that I’ve been sent four different models of earbuds or headphones for review in recent weeks – and this is the third set of Bluetooth wireless earbuds I’ve tested in the last two months.These are my favorite so far. My last set was an even more slightly higher-end model, the A1 also from Soundpeat, but these Qy7 model has them beat.WHY THEY’RE GOOD:• They fit in the ear beautifully, and it helps they provide you with a variety of different earbud caps to match the size of your ear. I think anyone will be able to find a comfortable, tight fit that won’t fall out.• Lightweight. You hardly know they’re there.• Sleek modern design and look. This is just aesthetics, but why not look good when wearing earbuds, especially when you’re out in public.• Great sound. Maybe not the rich bass tones and scintillating highs of an expensive cover-the-ear model headsets, but the sound these deliver is clear, sharp and pleasant all around.• Come with a variety of clips and grasps that really help you get a secure fit; also a clip to secure this to your collar so they won’t fall off.• Easy sync. These paired with my Kindle Fire in seconds – no problem there.• Voice alert to tell you when you’re out of range.• Generous 5 hours of play/talk time.• White noise feature that helps eliminate ambient sounds.• Easy to manipulate and reach volume control and skip button.In short, these are fantastic. I absolutely love them. I’ll use these all time and leave the 10 or 12 other types of earbuds and headsets I have in the drawer.Please note: I received this item free in exchange for my honest and objective review.

The first thing I want you to know that these cups are “COPPER-COATED” – as in: “NOT SOLID COPPER.”Rather, they are stainless steel coated with a layer of copper. Thus, if you are expecting a solid copper product, this is not what your getting.While these cups are “sort of nice” -- I’ll be frank and say I was a tad disappointed. That’s because I was expecting a heavier gauge copper product. I don’t mind so much that they are only copper-coated, but they have almost a “tin cup” feel to them, although to be completely fair, they do rise above – just slightly – that “tin cup” feel.If they had been made of a heavier-grade stainless steel underneath and then copper coated, that would have gone a long way to pleasing me more – but they are just a bit too light-weight to give that luxurious weighty feel in your hand.I am also not overly impressed with the handles. In a copper cup, I prefer a handle that is slightly flattened. These are round “wire-like” handles – yes, they are just a tad fatter than “wire” but, for me, the handles are too narrow to get my full approval.I struggle with giving these cups two stars or three. I settle on two because, at $25, I don’t think they are quite solid, heavy and durable enough to command that price – but you might disagree. I almost awarded three stars because, well, they’re “sort of nice.” That’s the best I can say about them.Please note: I received this two-set of these copper-coated mugs in exchange for my honest and objective review

Let me tell you, I have owned dogs for all my adult life. Over the years I think I have gone through 15 to 20 different models of these retractable leashes, and they are definitely all not created equal. Some of them break in a day or two, others sort of hang in there, while some have been solidly built and have lasted a year, or two, or three.This retractable dog leash from Pet Magasin is certainly the best I have ever encountered.Believe me, I thoroughly tested it on my extremely rambunctious, speed-demon, bounding Australian Shepherd/Border Collie – if there was ever a “destroyer of leashes” it’s this guy.This leash can handle even him.WHAT’S GOODI like everything about this product. It’s solidly built and the ergonomics are excellent. Fits very comfortably in the hand, a rubberized coating on the grip makes it easy to grasp and hold onto. The button which controls the intake and outtake of the retractable leash is perfectly position and works smoothly. It’s easy to “brake” or let the leash fly loose with a press of the button.The leash itself is flat and bright yellow, which helps with visibility for night walking.ALWAYS A CONCERN:I have found out the hard way that these leashes can be dangerous – if you have a strong dog, the leash can give you a screamingly-bad abrasion burn if you happen to grab onto it with your bare hands when your dog, say, sees a squirrel, and lunges for it.That’s less of a problem with this leash because it is flat (not like a round rope which can give rope burns). However, getting an abrasion burn is still a distinct possibility even with this design. That’s just something anyone using this kind of leash really needs to be aware of.Also, never get any part of this leash wrapped around your body – especially a finger!IMPORTANT:!!!!  Definitely do not let children, especially young children, use this with your dog, or even play with it without a dog! It can cause serious injury in a worse-case scenario. !!!!TO BE HONEST:To be honest, I prefer to use these kind of leashes with smaller to medium-sized dogs. The bigger the dog, the harder they are on these kinds of devices, no matter how well built. A big dog can break the internal spring mechanism, or even break the rope, etc.For smaller and medium dogs, this is one of the best pet inventions of all time!Yes, you can use it with bigger dogs effectively – I’m just saying you’ll run into more problems with larger dogs, both with damage to the unit, and potential danger to yourself.NOTE: THIS UNIT IS DESIGNED FOR MEDIUM SIZED DOGS.THE BOTTOM LINEIf you are going to buy any retractable leash, I cannot think of a better model than this one. Again, I have tried perhaps 15 to 20 different brands and models, and this is easily the best I’ve ever used.As long as you use good common sense and take basic precautions against rope burns and getting your fingers, hands or wrists wrapped around the leash, this is the very best way to walk and control your dog.Please note: I received this retractable dog leash free in exchange for my honest and objective review.

I absolutely love devices that are extremely simple to use – while working perfectly.Just give me an “On” switch and an “Off” switch, and get the job done. Period!That’s what this nifty little device does. It looks like, acts like and is a normal USB flash drive, but its main function is serving as an excellent voice and sound recorder.I plugged this into my computer to charge it up.
