But West begins to confide in her and she has chosen him as the one she's ready to speak to.The only good thing I can say is I liked that Maggie was the reasonable one in the end and that she didn't end up knocked up like all of Glines' heroines do.If you're interested in reading something similar with more depth try The Sea of Tranquility by Katja Millay. But I'd pass on Until Friday Night.**I listened to the audio version**

What a great book. I can't believe I waited so long to read it.Kea and her brothers recently lost their mother and then discovered all of her secrets. The main one being her primo pot farm. Now the siblings have decided to continue her business. Kea also discovers some journals and learns exactly what happened to her father.Blake works for the competition and he's been assigned to shut Kea's business down. But what's the hurry? He has time for some fun in the sheets with Kea first.I liked the pacing of how everything unraveled. I liked the action and the scenery. Grey did a great job taking me to Hawaii. I liked how loyal the siblings were to each other - all the way to the end, even when it meant making difficult choices.Grey left just enough questions unanswered to make me excited for the next book but answered enough questions to not drive me crazy. I really enjoyed it. Well done!

This story started out great. Felicity's friends talk her into going to a Sugar Baby party. That's where wealthy men and women meet no-so-wealthy beautiful people and exchange companionship for gifts. But when Felicity gets there she's not into it and starts exploring the house. She meets Theo Darcy, owner of the house and CEO and owner of Darcy Entertainment Company. However, the party is hosted by his brother. Theo is smitten and so the chase begins.Now we enter Cheeseball City. Population two. There was nothing Felicity couldn't do. She could play the piano, compose music, dance ballet (and clog), act, show up bratty teenage girls, and chew out famous people. And every one of those scenes proving her talent was c.h.e.e.s.y. Oh brother.I may have given up on this book but I was curious enough to find out this twist I've been hearing about. That's when it started to feel like a completely different book to me. And then there was a twist within that twist. I like that McAvoy took it in a more serious direction but it honestly didn't do anything for me. I thought there was too much going on. Didn't hate it, didn't love it.

*Originally read November 2012**Reread August 2015*Evie is starting her first year of college at Crestwood. Weird things start happening right off the bat. She meets a charming, southern guy named Russell who she immediately feels comfortable with. Like they've known each other forever.And then she meets a cocky and rude older student named Reed who tries to get Evie to quit school and go back home. Which guy do you think he wants? Reed, of course! Since Evie isn't giving in to his demands he decides he's going to protect her. Along the way Evie figures out that she's different.Now that I've read it again I can't believe I missed so many subtle clues that are to be revealed later. I thought Evie was a little too quick to accept everything that was happening but at the same time Evie's favorite word was "why." It got a little annoying after awhile.Still love the book though. On to my reread of book two!

**I received an ARC through Netgalley courtesy of the publisher in exchange for an honest review.**What a fun read! It's been awhile since a book has made me laugh so hard - like the spit my drink out, tears in my eyes, I can't breathe kind of laughing. I loved everything about it.Sydney Porter has a huge chip on her shoulder but she gets to work out a lot of her frustration as Sunday Lane - gossiping, people bashing, radio personality and as DJ Sinister - DJ extraordinaire.Two years ago Sydney and Gray Peters - football QB and hot man on campus had one incredible night together but a misunderstanding makes them mortal enemies. Now that Sydney's little brother, Jack, is on the football team, Sydney is having more run ins with Gray. Let the games begin!The pranks were funny until they weren't. Germaine was excellent with the timing. She knew when we'd have enough and were ready for feelings to come into play. The characters were amazing. Even all of the secondary ones. Germaine has a knack for dialogue.Even if NA isn't your thing I highly recommend giving this book a shot. What a pleasure. Bravo!

*4.5 stars*I'll keep it simple. Beautiful story. Esteban's childhood with MaMaLu had me in tears. I loved the reunion. Some parts in the beginning were hard to read but as far as dark books go this was fairly mild. My only criticism is I thought everything was pretty predictable. But it didn't ruin my enjoyment. Well done.

It's George's turn to be leader. Simon wants to be supportive but George's bad decision lands Simon in Faery. This is where he meets Mark Blackthorn - desperate to learn news of his family and how his Shadowhunter rescue is coming along. Simon's not sure how to answer. Mark helping Simon is just one more argument that not all Downworlders are bad. I really hope Mark is reunited with his family one day. Good installment.

I was excited we were getting a Shepley and America novella and it did not disappoint.We get to see how they first met but the majority of the story is present day. America definitely wears the pants in the relationship but she's starting to feel like a tyrant and Shepley feels like a doormat. They're both working on it but Shepley is also desperate to marry America and she's in no hurry. This is putting a strain on the relationship, especially since Travis and Abby are flaunting their wedded bliss. I loved how much Travis and Abby were in this novella. It made me squee.I wanted to smack America for the dangerous situation she put herself and Shepley in despite all of the warnings against it. But all's well that ends well. Everything ended as it should've. I enjoyed it.

Wow. At the end of King you had some theories about the direction Tyrant was going to go, right? Throw them out the window. You're wrong.King and Doe spend some time apart at the beginning - King dealing with Eli and Doe, now reunited with her family, desperately trying to regain her memory. But there's no doubt they still belong to each other.Piece by piece Doe starts to remember and every scene is either heartbreaking or shocking. Frazier excels at building suspense and tugging on your heart strings.Scenes with Preppy and Doe's father completely did me in. I was a mess.This book had everything - suspense, violence, hawt sex, surprises and twists, wrapping up an awesome love story. Even better than book one. Bravo, Ms. Frazier. I loved it.**I bought my copy of Tyrant from iTunes**

*2.5 stars*Felicity lost her brother and almost her own life in a house fire. Ryan introduces several interesting characters and weaves a solid whodunit. I was kept on my toes trying to figure out who the arsonist/murderer was.But...this story was not without problems. Felicity had quite a few TSTL moments, she just wanted to bury her head in the sand. Aspen confounded me, I didn't know which way was up with her. Every few chapters Ryan would reveal a new piece to the puzzle but I was usually just left more confused. There were some technical inaccuracies regarding the law. I just kept shaking my head, "Nope, that wouldn't happen." The ending was lackluster. I was left thinking, "Oh, is that it?" I kept waiting for some kind of twist to pop up.I liked Hayes's grand gesture, I thought it was romantic.I know it sounds like I had a lot of issues but I didn't hate it. Overall, Red Nights was an okay story but it's not one I would reread or think to recommend.

Late last year Armentrout held a contest for her fans to vote for Roth or Zayne as Layla's love interest. We found out pretty early on in this finale how the vote went.Layla has grown in confidence and she's come into her very unique abilities. She spends ample time with her man but she also needs to fulfill her potential and save the world by stopping the Lilin while trying to find a way to save Sam's soul.This story had its moments but mostly it was incredibly predictable and Layla's solution at the end has been done to death. Plus there was no happy resolution for the jilted man. I was sad for him.Overall it was okay but I expected so much better.

If Thicker Than Blood hadn't ended the way it did I might have liked this story better. We learn all of E's background, who he lost and how. But it never really endeared me to him. He's still just an angry bully throughout this book. He only cared about what he wanted - to hell with everyone else. Some may say Autumn healed him but she was just something else he wanted to keep for himself and would do anything to make it so. He just happened to treat her with more tenderness than anyone else.*** SPOILERS! *** SPOILERS! *** SPOILERS! ***I really hate that E never paid for what he did to Evelyn and Alex. He didn't even seem to be sorry. I was hoping that Liesel would show up at the end and stab him. The ending was just too "happy." Nowhere near as emotional as TTB.Having said that, I have to say I did like Autumn and I'm glad she found her courage in the end. That was a great scene. The writing was solid. If there are more books in the series, I'll be reading but with BB&B I was too disappointed with the injustice.**I was gifted my copy of BB&B**

At first I was skeptical about reading Sydney's story. I stuck him in the friend zone of book boyfriends so I wasn't sure if reading his sex scenes was going to be like reading your little brother's. Awkward.But no. I thought Reyes did a great job balancing "nice guy" Sydney that we all know and love with "grown up" Sydney - a confident, successful man that knows what he wants.The story begins with twenty-nine year old Sydney attending the wake of a good friend (not a major character) and here, after an embarrassing first meeting, runs into twenty year old Emilia, Olivia's sister. The two have an obvious attraction but Sydney is leery of the age difference but that doesn't stop them from being friends. They talk, they hang out, Emi cooks for him, and they see other people. Just when you think you're going to die from the jealousies and sexual tension, Reyes puts you out of your misery. Squee! But it doesn't last.I can't tell you how much I love  misunderstandings such as these. They're so delicious. But not only was Emi left in the dark, so were we. I couldn't put it down. I had to find out what was really going on. This book had all the feels - laughter, giddiness, anger, tears, and back again to happiness.I have to say job well done to Ms. Reyes for keeping these stories fresh a hundred books in. Please keep 'em coming. Bravo.

I was a bad girl. I read out of order. I read Changing Course but then I went straight to Fighting Silence. Then after Fighting Shadows I couldn't wait any longer, I had to read Slate's story.I'm glad I did. I really enjoyed it. I had no idea Erica went through something so brutal but I wasn't at all surprised Slate was such a good man. I think I'll continue reading out of order and jump into Leo's story. Well done!**I was gifted my copy of Among the Echoes**

*4.5 stars*I'm sure Cole felt the pressure to do Flame's story justice - and she absolutely pulled it off.I liked how focused this story was. There were a few scenes with the Hangmen, there was some external drama, and there was just enough setup for Cain's story but mainly this book just featured Maddie and Flame and how they healed each other.I liked the pacing. Maddie and Flame had a long road ahead of them before they were able to make love. Cole took her time getting them there.  She made me squee like a schoolgirl at the simple act of hand holding. It was very romantic."So you may think you cannot be loved. But in my heart, in my healing soul, I am begging the question, how can you not? Because for me, you are truth. My truth. My heart, is all you."Like the other books, there were some scenes that were hard to read. We learn everything we wanted to know about Flame's background. All of our questions were answered. We were even introduced to a new character. He made me smile. Also, as Flame's two closest brothers, we got to know AK and Viking better. Love them.My only criticism is that I thought Flame growled and roared a little too much. Ky is still my favorite Hangman! But, otherwise, I thought Souls Unfractured was a beautiful, unconventional love story. Bravo, Ms. Cole!

**I received an ARC through Netgalley courtesy of the publisher in exchange for an honest review.**We know from the previous books that Tracker and Lana have an undeniable attraction but Tracker has been warned to stay away from her so he's settled for a pseudo-relationship with Allie.Tracker's End begins one year later where Tracker breaks it off with Allie because he's ready to stake his claim on Lana - Anna and his brothers be damned. But Lana doesn't make it easy for him. She's spent too long watching Tracker with Allie and Tracker cheat on Allie to know getting involved with him is a bad idea. But what do you do when the man you've been pining over is relentlessly pursuing you?We learn some secrets about Lana. And I absolutely loved it. I kept thinking this going to be good when everyone finds out. And it was. Dra-ma!Tracker made a few bonehead moves that I thought Lana was a little too quick to forgive but for the most part this was a great read. I really enjoyed it. Highly addictive! Well done!

**My review contains mild spoilers**Not as much drama in Flame as there was in Spark. But I think that's because of Dakota. She's a cool girl. A laid back, go with the flow kind of girl. She's on a break from college, ready to hook up with her regular sex buddy, Rory.  Which she does.  She's a young girl looking for a good time, not ready to settle down yet.But she gets knocked on her a** when she meets hunky James Levi, Motocross champion, who's in Breckinridge for his cousin/best friend's wedding. Dakota is old friends with the bride so she and Levi get to know each other over the weekend.Levi isn't ready for it to end so he invites Dakota to join them on the bus for two weeks on their way to New Orleans. Dakota, being the spontaneous girl she is, agrees.They have a wild couple of weeks together where they become closer but what I loved most is that Dakota stuck to her guns. She wasn't willing to sacrifice her plans and dreams to follow Levi across the world. She was a great heroine.I wish there were more scenes with the Shevell family. I fell in love with them in Spark but don't worry Grams is still entertaining. Also, it felt like Gunner an Emilia already had this back story that I missed out on. Did I? If not, I hope Noelle writes a novella about them, especially featuring the you-know-what. *waggles eyebrows*I loved the epilogue. I'm looking forward to Denali's story. That one is going to be tough. I liked Spark better but Flame was still an enjoyable read. Well done!**I won a copy of Flame in a release day giveaway**

*3.5 stars*Lots of characters. Even more drama. It took me a bit to figure out who was who and what their story was so it was hard to get into. But once I got the names straight the story was actually pretty fascinating.Lane has come home after two years to divorce his manipulative, gold-digging wife and to win back the love of his life, Lizzie, the family's gardener. But he gets more than he bargained for when he also realizes the family's bourbon business is in trouble.The book also features povs from Lane's brother, Edward, and his sister, Ginny, who have equally tragic love lives.It read like a soap opera where even the "good guys" had their despicable moments. The Bradfords are one messed up family. The cliffhanger ending wasn't too bad, all of the immediate issues were wrapped up but I am looking forward to book two.**I listened to the audio version**

I thought this was just going to be a simple male pov novella. I should have known better.This story is told from Jake's pov, yes, but it takes place a year after the epilogue from The Dark Light of Day. Jake's deeds from the epilogue have caught up with him and this is where we meet King. Jake reminisces certain scenes from the book but the one thing I really wanted to know during Jake and Abby's sharing game was who he was spending time with while they were apart. Especially since he insisted on knowing who she's been with.But in the grand scheme it didn't really matter. Kudos to Frazier for the creative way she put this novella together. Well done!**Dark Needs was loaned to me.**

I received and email that was sent to me by mistake and when I contacted the sender he asked if I wanted to review this organic coconut oil in exchange for my review and I accepted. And I have to say that I do not like coconut but I love how coconut smells. So I kept some for myself to use and gave the rest to my Mom. She has been using it in just about everything from baking to adding a few drops to her favorite moisturizer. This is not a jar that I received, it was a 54 ounce jug and will last a long time. It was liquid form when I received it but now is a soft solid. It will take time and a little trial and error and some internet searching to find the right combination that will work for you but you should enjoy it too.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

I was contacted by the company to review this product and I thought it would be perfect to test it at my parents house. They have recently moved to the country and the installed doorbell does not work and I thought this would be great for them. Well it is great with the two receivers that plug into any electrical outlet. There are 36 chimes to choose from and my niece and I had a blast picking out one for them. It seems to not work all the time when pressing the button on the door, although it does light up but with one of the receivers close to the door we can tell it does not chime. Other than that it is a great product.**Product provided by the company at a discount in exchange for my honest review**

I have always wanted one of these rain shower heads and when I was contacted by the company to try it, I jumped at the chance. I had to buy an extension as I have an older shower with the shower head close to the wall and I wanted this more away from the wall and once I got it placed where I wanted it, I love it. The gallons per minute is 2.5 gallons and I received the 8 inch size. It is stainless steel ultra thin and looks great even in my older bathroom that I am remodeling a little at a time. I would recommend it and if you don't like it, there is a 12 month warranty.**Product received at a discounted priced**

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. This book started off HOT from the very first page and only got hotter from there and I though my kindle might catch fire. Heath Wild is not looking for a relationship. He doesn't have time for a clingy girlfriend. So when he was at a medical conference, he saw this girl and they seemed to want the same thing. And spending one night together was all each of them was after. Until he touched her. He could not get enough. But for Dr. Heath Wild, he didn't know what to do with the feelings, so he asked to she her for a second night. And when the weekend was over he had her phone number. Ally didn't do relationships either thanks to cheating boyfriends. But their was something about Heath and it scared her. She didn't think she could trust her feelings or maybe she couldn't trust him. What happens when they find out they live in the same city? Will they give the feelings they share a chance? I loved Logan's story but I have to say that I loved Heath even more. I wonder if each brother will make me love them more. At least there are only two more brothers to go. If you love a story that will have you laughing and crying, then you need to read this series because these Wild brothers will definitely have your heart racing.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

It is hard to choose a favorite Hellion but each story has me falling in love more. Rex is the over-bearing, over-protective, over-sexed VP and he doesn't do relationships. He hardly ever returns to a girl twice, that is after Tessie. Now that Tessie is with Shooter, where she belongs and Rex is getting to know his son Axel. When Caroline, a college friend of Dolls, needs help, Rex is there and will do all he can to protect her. But can he save his heart from falling for Lux? Will Lux let the Hellions help her so her future will be what or will her past always be around? I love this series and can't wait for more. If you are looking for an awesome MC series, then check out The Hellions Ride by Chelsea Camaron, you will love it too.

This is Shooter and Tessie's short story on the way to the alter. While he is ready to marry her, Tessie is dragging her feet. She has always depended on her mom and herself. She doesn't know how to let Shooter take care of her, Axel and her mom.  Can he make her see just what he feels and why he wants to take care of them? Will she finally accept her future with him? What will Axel think of their future? I love Chelsea Camaron and her Hellion series is one of the best MC series out there.  So pick it up and enjoy it yourself.
This book was really good. Can't wait to start The Education of Caroline! I read this back in February 2013 and just realized I didn't post my review here.

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. I wondered just how much pain and heartache Kim Karr was going to put Elle and Logan through even if they were not meant to be together in the end. But you never know what will happen when you are dealing with the mob, gangs, drug dealers, and addicts. And yes this story will have them all. This story is full of waiting for the drama to unfold. Just when you think you know who is behind all the drama, guess what? You are wrong, I thought it was a few people and in the end I was so wrong. I never guessed who it really was and was surprised in the end. Will Elle and Logan survive all this and be together in the end? Will they be able to protect each other? Will Elle find her sister? This story will leave you wondering what the hell did I just read and where can I find more of this awesome story? I love Kim Karr and her writing style pulls me in every time.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. Stella "Stormy Knight" Krane is running from her deadly past, and ex-boyfriend that wants her dead. And she is counting the days until he is released from prison. She is working at a bar in New York and getting ready to run again to try and stay one step in front of Kutcher. When a man walks into the bar that she can't stop looking at. He is gorgeous, easy going and very easy on the eyes. Logan Wild is a private investigator and is very good at his job. He can't stop looking at Stormy. He knows she has secrets but he will not push her to know them. Will she be able to tell him or will she run from him too? Can Logan and Stella help each other heal from both of their past? This is a great story and I loved it. I can't wait to start Heath's story. I have many stories by Melissa Foster but haven't taken the time to read them and I don't know what I am waiting for.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

Living in the country without any type of yard light is always so dark. I love solar lights and this solar motion sensor light is the best. It was easy to install and the light is very bright LED lights. Also includes mounting hardware. I love the idea of not wires to run and living in South Mississippi the sun shines most of the time so charging is easy.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

When Holly finds out the her soon to be husband has cheated on her, she does the right thing and leaves his sorry butt. While he is trying to manipulate her into coming back, Holly realizes that he was a cheater all along. After several months of wallowing in self pity, she now finds herself going away for the weekend with her best friends Bernie and her husband Leo. When they get to a camp ground, she can't believe she sees Josie, who is her ex-finance's cousin. The weekend turns out fun but leaving Holly with a fractured hand when she punched Stewart, a friend of Leo's, that she went on one date with and he wanted more and when she said no he called her names, so she punched him. When it was Jake that took her the the E.R., Holly was mesmerized by his good looks and he was the perfect gentleman. They seemed to be drawn to each other and the sparks would fly. After that weekend, Jake couldn't stay away from Holly. Although she would only see him on the weekends, since he was training to be a doctor. Turns out his whole family was a doctor of some sort. When Holly finally met his family, she loved them all, even his mother who had a weird request for her. So when she passed out at a local restaurant, Jake took her straight to the hospital. And surprise to them all when they found out she was pregnant. Jake and his father were happy to the point of crying during the ultrasound. His mother would be a different story, when she found out. Well his mother didn't take it so well and when Holly went to meet Jake at his mother's so they could all talk, Jake wasn't there but his mother told Holly his feelings. When Holly finally realized that she was saying that Jake wanted her to abort their baby, Holly left his mother's, packed her clothes and went to the only person that could help, her father whom she hadn't seem in over 10 years. She cut all contact with Bernie and wanted nothing to do with Jake or his family every again. This story does start off a little slow but what part of hear-break is ever easy. And the pain that Holly will go through will have you crying like a baby. This story is full of heartache, pain, love, fun, devastation and loss. I loved everything about it and can't wait for the next part of the story.**Copy provided by the publisher through NetGalley in exchange for my honest review**

Getting things through Kellan's POV was excellent. Although I found Keira was more wishy washy from his POV. Still I loved everything thing about it. Thanks  S.C. Stephens for giving us more Kellan. Can't wait for Griffin's story to be released.

Kyle Houseman is about to give up on love and stay single forever. He lost the love of his life while she was away and the really bad thing is that his drunken mistake was with her sister. When Olivia came back to Whiskey Creek, her sister Noelle had her claws in Kyle. After Olivia got over her hurt, she found Brandon and knew it was true love. Not to mention that Brandon was Kyle's stepbrother. So after Kyle finally decided he had had enough of Noelle, he divorced her. Now after five years, she still calls him to solve her problems. Kyle is tired of it and can't figure out how to make her move on without him without getting the brunt of her revenge. When he decided to rent one of his houses, he didn't expect it to be to a famous country singer. Lourdes Bennett has come to Whiskey Creek to get her creative juices flowing and try to get her career back on track. What Kyle and Lourdes' didn't realize is that they are perfect for each other. Can Kyle get her to stay with him? Will Lourdes go back to Nashville and her cheating ex-boyfriend/manager? If you are looking for a series that will leave you wanting more, then you should be reading this one. Although I haven't read all of the series, I am loving it and need to make time to catch up on the rest. Brenda Novak knows how to write a love story with a twist that will keep you glued to each page until the very end and leave you wanting more.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

Logan McPherson lived a different life. With one grandfather worth millions and the other grandfather the head of the Irish Mob, he was pulled in both directions. He wanted nothing to do with the mob until his father was in trouble. He would do what he needed to do to keep his father out of jail. When he meets Elle, he begins to feel things that he has never felt before. He just wanted to protect her. When things begin to look as if she will be pulled into the dangers surrounding her missing sister, Logan has to do what he can to keep her safe.  But at what price will it cost him? Will Elle she what he is trying to do or will the mob get them both?  This is an awesome story and I need more now. If you are looking for a story that will keep you glued to every page, then you should read this one. I love anything by Kim Kart and I can't wait for more of Elle and Logan.

This story is full of suspense and will leave you wondering what will happen next. Emma has turned to selling her time and body to help pay her college bills that the scholarship will not cover. After she gets a few regulars, she is confronted by Chris who turns out to be stalking her. He has her wallet and cell phone so he knows more about her than he should. When Emma ends up with Peach, Chris will do all he can to save her. But can Emma trust him to save her and not hurt her in the end? Will she believe him when he tells her the truth? This is a great story and I loved it and a first for me from Emma Soule and I can't wait for more from her.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

This is an awesome series and I loved every part of it. It will keep you glued to every page until the end. Sit back and enjoy it and see if Ginny and Tristan can make their relationship work while they are Oceans Apart.

As a girl growing up, I loved helping my dad work on our race cars. We never had a garage but the weekend racing was the best. While Quinn is doing what she loves which is working on cars, she is trying to save the family garage. Her mother died when she was young and her father couldn't handle losing her and he drinks to cope and that leaves Quinn taking care of him too. When Tazen Watts, the famous car builder, shows up at her garage, she has a fan girl moment until he insults her garage. Why is he there? Will she be able to cope with what he is planning? Will she give in to the sparks that are flying between them? And what will happen when Tazen learns about her father? Will he give her a chance to show him what she can do with a car or will they keep fighting? Another great story from Bella Jewel and the best thing about this series is that each book is a different couple and I can't wait for Hard to Forget which is book 3 in the series.**Copy provided by the publisher through NetGalley in exchange for my honest review**

When being a bounty hunter is all you ever wanted to be, can Grace show the men that she can do the job? She is tired of all the small jobs and she wants to prove herself. When she is given a big case worth $30,000, will she be able to bring the guy in? While her bounty is Raide a fugitive, can she bring him in? After all she has met him and he is large and by far the sexiest man she has ever seen. SO to capture him, she is gonna seduce him so she can bring him in. When her plan seems to be failing what is she gonna do? If ahe ask for help, will the men that she works with still treat her as not an equal? Raide noticed her from the first time he saw her and he wants her but he must not trust anyone, he has to keep his mind on finding the man that killed his sister. Can Grace make him see that he must turn himself in and let the cops find the truth? Will Raide see that Grace is trying to help him or will he see it as a betrayal? I have only read a few stories by Bella Jewel and I loved them and this one I love too and can't wait to start the next one.**Copy provided by the publisher through NetGalley in exchange for my honest review**

I have been looking for the perfect desk lamp and I have finally found it with this one. It has three brightness levels, easy tough on/off  with no switch to search for. Has an adjustable neck to give you the best lighting, the LED light doesn't hurt my eyes. It comes with USB cable and an AC plug so you can used any household plug or a computer to power it. It was easy to set up and a breeze to use. It is the prefect desk lamp.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

This is an awesome massage roller. After using it for about a week, I am loving it. Mom used it the other day and the threatened to take it. I guess I will have to get her one before she takes mine. If you do a lot of walking or just need a great foot massage then this product is for you.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

I love these USB car chargers and this one is even better. It has two USB ports which means I can charge my phone and my kindle at the same time. Well made of plastic and metal and is lightweight. Everyone needs a few of these and I highly recommend this one.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

This works great on strawberries and tomatoes. It is easy to use and easy to clean up. Great product and I am looking for more ways to use it.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

I am always looking for ways to improve my Yoga routine. I need help with better flexible and using these straps are a good way to do that. I don't think I have used them to there full potential but I am using them every time I stretch. There are two straps and they are made of 100% cotton, with buckles attached, they are sturdy and easy to figure out how they work. Great product, I didn't even know that a product like this was available.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

With the way book 3 ended, I wasn't sure what would happen next. Angela is finally seeing what Thomas is, a nut job that is obsessed with her. He will stop at nothing to have her including hurting or killing those that would get in his way. And with Kim still after Steve, what will these two do? Can Angela get away from Thomas before it is too late? I don't want to spoil it for anyone but just let me say that Karma is a witch (yeah change the w to a b) and the ending of this series is perfect. If you are looking for a fantastic suspenseful romance then this series is for you. I can't wait to read more from Kylie.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

This story is full of suspense and will leave your head spinning for a bit but once you figure out each part and the people involved, you can read right along. It starts with Ginny going back home with her best friend Jacob. When a tragic accident happens, one will not survive. There are more than a few couples that are tied together but you have to remember that this is a small Texas town and everyone knows everyone. This is a really good beginning to a new series (although it is done in episodes) and I enjoyed it and can't wait for more.**Copy provided in exchange for my honest review**

How can a person named Elizabeth Bennett not want to find her Mr. Darcy? A few years ago Elizabeth was attacked and dealing with the pain and guilt she felt, she slit her wrist. And when that didn't end things, she put rules to live by in place. NO relationships, no second "dates", one night stands was her thing. Until she meets Declan Blay,  there was a connection between them. She wanted to fight the feelings but Declan would not give up. Will Colby come after her again? Can Declan make her see that love is just what she needs? Will she give their love a chance? This is a great story and I loved it. Wonder if there will be more, maybe Dax, Declan's twin brother.

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. At 23 years old Alex Collins is trying to make her life her own. Being raised in the South and the only remaining heir to her mothers side of the family. With her father dead and her mother remarried a man that Alex hates as he wants to control everything she does. When Alex and her BFF Chelsea go on a one week get-away, Alexandria/Alex are gone and she is Charli with an 'I'. While she thinks that this week is a time for her and Chelsea since Alex is going to New York for law school and Chelsea is staying in California. When she meets Nox, she isn't sure what she wants, he has taken over her mind and body. When they agree to spending one week together without learning anything about the others lives or past, Alex/Charli thinks why not? She will never see him again. After she goes back home to Savannah and learns what is expected of her, she can't believe what is being pushed of her to do. She will not give up law school and her parents can keep her trust fund, she will get a job. She goes to New York and ends up staying with her cousin Patrick and his lover Cyrus. When she learns what they do and how they can afford a place on Fifth Avenue, she is indecisive but the money is too hard to give up. Can she join Infidelity and make her own way? Will she ever see Nox again and if she does what will happen? Will her parents continue trying to pull her strings and making her do what they want? This is an awesome series and I need more, have to find out what happens next. I fell in love with Aleatha Romig anf her writing style from the beginning of the Consequences series and I have to read anything she writes. If you are looking for a great story that you will not be able to put down, then this one is for you.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

Can you walk away from the only man you would ever love even after he broke your heart? Jordan Wright has given up on her happily ever after. She thought that Gage Varo was the one for her until he broke her heart over the phone, he couldn't even face her to tell her it was over. So now months later she is happy with Brock Hannon, or so she thinks. While Brock is handsome, smart, wealthy and can take care of her, Jordan knows that he will never be Gage. She has to stop thinking about Gage because she is marrying Brock. When Gage shows back up into her life, all the pain and hurt she felt when he ended it all came crashing back down on her. Will she give Gage another chance or will she marry Brock? Why is Gage still getting the threatening letters when he hasn't seen Jordan? Will they all learn the truth before it is too late? I loved Nina and Tristan and couldn't wait for this one, now I need book 2 for Gage and Jordan.

What does a young girl do when she is kidnapped and chained to a bed and must do as she is told? She lets her mind go blank and does what she is told until HE walks into her room. Megan Wilder had the perfect life, her parents were beyond rich and she was a trust fund baby, just having a good time until the worst happens. When Ricky kidnaps her, she thinks her life is over. When Skin shows up, he promises her that he will return for her. What she will learn is that Skin never breaks a promise. When he saves her he will also steal her heart. Can she make her parents see that he saved her more than once? What happens when others from a rival MC comes back for her? Can Skin save her when it really counts? I loved this story and if you haven't read any of these MC series that have some ties to her others series, then you need to add them to your TBR list, you will not be disappointed.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

Oh no, you can't end it there, WHY???? While Angela is trying to figure out what has got her feeling so weird, Thomas thinks that what he is doing will make her fall in love with him. And look what Kim is doing to Steve! I can't wait to see just what Thomas and Kim get and they both deserve it for what they are doing. After a trip to the doctor, Angela is finally seeing what Joanne and Steve were warning her about Thomas. And the ending of this one will leave you screaming and ready to throw your kindle but don't you will need it for the next part. Write faster Kylie, I need more NOW!**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

Being part of the Fire and Steel MC has it's advantages and it's disadvantages. You can never have a normal life, normal as others would say outside of the MC but perfectly normal being on the inside. The men of Fire and Steel are trying to change the public view of their club, they help neighbors, schools, businesses and even hold charity events. While those in the neighborhood know what they do, those outside the neighborhood only see the bad. While Thrash, Demarcus Fletcher, is at a local gallery, he meets Nora, the artist, and can sense her pain and her toughness. He knows that he wants to get to know her better. While Nora has her own demons from the recent past, she wants to get to know him too. When she finds out he is part of Fire and Steel, she wonders if she can handle all that will come up between them? She meets Layla and Emma and they help her see how some things go? With Rage and Wrath by his side, Thrash will go undercover to take down Bones, then man who left their MC to start his own after killing Sean, Layla's brother. Will Thrash escape this or will he be found out? Can Nora accept his way of life and live it with him?I love this series and can't wait for more. I would suggest you read the others in this series so you will know who most of the characters are in this one.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

OMG.....You can not end it this way, I need more NOW! While Angela is trying to stay away from Steve and Thomas, she is trying to find a place of her own. When funny things start happening with the apartments she is planning on looking at, she can't believe her luck. While Joanne wants her to keep her eyes open with Thomas, he is trying to make her really see him. When she realizes that she needs to talk to Steve, will she be able to restrain herself and take things slow? Will Thomas finally push things too far and Angela realize the truth? And what will happen with Kim her boss? Once I started this part of the series I couldn't put it down and after a few hours I am done and wanting more. If you are looking for a series that is full of suspense, a kinda who done it and leave you wondering if love will win in the end, then this series is for you. Although I would suggest you wait until all parts are released because there are big cliff hangers that will make you want to throw things and pull your hair out. I can't wait for part three.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review*

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. Paranormal stories are not my usual go to read but I do love a good Angel/Demon story. When this one came up on the list to read and I am so glad I read it. I loved everything about it. With Willa and Rax being from different realms and fighting each other, I hoped they would work things out to be together and that is what happened. They were drawn to each other and it is a great thing that they were. With Willa learning new things about herself and he future, can she trust Rax to be by her side through it all? Rax and Willa are to be mated and when that happened things will change for them both. Can you trust that D.H. Sidebottom will take you into the other realm as if you were there? YES she can. This is a first for me from D.H., not to say that I don't have other books from her, because I do and I need to read them too. I can't wait to see what she has in store for the rest of this series. So if you love a great paranormal story then you should grab this one and hang on, it is worth the ride into another world.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

As this is a first for me from this author, I was ready for this story after reading the synopsis. I started it late last night and didn't want to put it down. It is a fast read and will leave you begging for more. Angela Black is starting her life over, after the death of her husband she needed to start over in a new city. With her husbands best friend Thomas helping, she moves to L.A. Thomas is a friend to her too. Also living there is her female best friend Joanne. While Joanne sees what Thomas is like, Angela believes he is only looking out for her as a big brother would. When Angela meets Steve, she can't believe her bodies reaction to him. When she sees him with someone else, she tells him to leave her alone. While Thomas is trying to win her over, can she see what is really going on? Will she give Steve another change when he convinces her that he is not seeing anyone else? What links will Thomas and Kimberly go to to get what they want? I need book 2 NOW and Kylie Walker is my new go to author and I want everyone to find this series and I hope you love it too.**A copy was provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

This is the second story in the Fire and Steel MC series and I loved it.  Aiden is looking for some place to belong. After years in the Army and losing a leg, he has been home over a year and is still lost. With nightmares every night, he needs a release. Emma is going to college full time and working as a bartender part time. She works at her cousin Kat's, a strip club that is protected by the Fire and Steel MC. When Aiden sees Emma they are drawn together and her independence is one thing he finds he likes most. Their relationship is full of sparks, trust and love. After Aiden finds himself in with the MC, can he keep Emma around or will she make him choose her or the MC? Can Emma watch him leave and maybe one day he will not return? This is a great story and I can't wait to read the next one.**A copy was provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. This Extreme Risk series has become one of my favorites since the beginning. With each story about one of the four best friends and their extreme snowboarding skills. Cam Bradley is the only female in this group and Luc Jennings is her best friend since second grade. They talk about everything and anything. Then one night they drink too much and cross the line between friendship and more. Cam freaks out and runs and Luc can't believe he let it happen. So now months later and they are still avoiding each other. Can they work things out? It would be hard for them to go back to being just friends. And how will Luc handle Cam's secret? Will the other friends and their girlfriends be there for them? I love this series and Tracy Wolf, she has a great writing style that seems to pull you into the story. And I can't wait for more.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. Rory Kavanagh is a retired MMA fighter, he was forced to retire after a really bad accident during a match. A year later the only thing helping with the pain in his leg is booze and pills. That is until he meets Clare Ivers. While Clare is in New York trying to escape a bad relationship and her ex-boyfriend, she doesn't want a relationship with anyone. So when Rory keeps showing up to walk her home after work, she sees it as him trying to take care of her and yes she is beginning to like that idea. Rory can always be seen with Ace, a dog he rescued from the shelter who was used as a bait dog in a dog fighting ring. Ace is a very good judge of character because he doesn't like bad or mean people to be around Rory. Will Rory change his ways to be with Clare? Will he help train his brother Kane for his first match? Can Clare trust Rory with more than her safety? What will happen when her ex shows up? I love MMA fighters and when this one came up on the review list, I knew I had to read it and I am so glad I did. I loved the story and loved Rory too. Can't wait for more from this series. This is a first for me to read from Sarah Robinson and I will be reading more from her.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

I became a big fan of Chelle Bliss after meeting her this year.  And have only read this ALPHA series and couldn't wait for this one. Frisco Jones is part of the ALPHA PI group of investigators and he loves his life. A little work, a little time spent with friends and all the women her wants. He doesn't believe in love, not since his ex-girlfriend cheated on him. When he is introduced to Georgia, a friend of Suzy's,  He wants nothing to do with her. She is too young and innocent for him to mess up or so he thinks. When he learns her secret, it freaks him out but he can't stay away from her. Can they make it work? Will Georgia be able to show him what real love is? Will Frisco realize what he is feeling? Another fantastic story from a great series and I loved it. I can't wait to see what happens next.

I am using this solar powered light to light my porch. I live in the country and do not have a yard light and the outside light on my house works at times. This light is bright and helps me see the porch better which will help in not falling. I love the shape of it and the on and off switch on the back of the solar panel is easy to use. It came packaged well and was easy to install.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

I am using this solar powered light to light my porch. I live in the country and do not have a yard light and the outside light on my house works at times. This light is bright and helps me see the porch better which will help in not falling. I love the shape of it and the on and off switch on the back of the solar panel is easy to use. It came packaged well and was easy to install.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

There are not enough stars for me to rate this book or this series. Sam and Nick along with Scotty and the rest of their families make the perfect story to read about. I hope their story never ends. While Sam is trying to get her mojo back after the attack, Nick is dealing with his own demons, he worries about Sam even more now than he did before and it is messing with his sleep. Which he isn't getting any at all. This book will leave you heartbroken, laughing and crying in the end. This review is short because I don't want to spoil it for anyone. All I want to leave you with is this: if you haven't read anything by Marie Force then start with this Fatal series, I can bet you will love Sam and Nick almost as much as I do.

How do you trust someone that you know is lying to you? If you can't trust them to tell you the truth, you can't trust them with your heart and soul. April is falling more each day for Sean although she know he is keeping secrets. But when he tells her the truth, it really is hard to believe that Simon would leave a fifty million dollar life insurance policy with her name on it but she knows nothing about it. While Sean believes her, the man that hired her doesn't care, he just wants his money. They both have noticed they were being followed. What happens when a ghost from the past shows up? Can Sean keep April and Parker safe? Will April tell Sean her secret? So glad April, Sean, Parker and Charlie are getting their happily ever after. Another great story from Lacey Silks, I can't wait for more.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

A hot and sexy short story that I can't wait for the next part. Lauryn is working the Firefighters Ball and everything has to be perfect. Cruz O'Brien is the firefighter that gets all the ladies. His captain wants him to meet and greet but keep it in his pants. When he sees Lauryn dancing he has to dance with her. Their bodies fit together and he wants to get her alone. Lauryn can't believe this sexy man wants her. After spending the night together, can they make a go at a relationship? I enjoyed this one and can't wait to read more.

This is a fast, Hot story that ended way too soon. Madeline needs to sell a piece of property and soon or she will have to move. When she is asked to show a few properties on a Sunday, she can't believe who wants to see them. Liam is from her past, it was seven years ago when she was a freshman at college and he was a senior. He was the man that all women fell for and now he is even better looking. Will he remember her, probably not. She was a no body, not much to look at.  When he wants her in his bed, she is shocked and also turned on. Can she do this with him? What will happen if he remembers who she is? I loved this and can't wait for more.

When I learned of this boxed set last week, I knew I had to have it. I totally fell for Colton and Rylee and have read their story a few times. But this box set has the Raced chapters in the right places so now when you read it you get Colton's POV right where it should be. Also there is an excerpt from Hard Beat which is Rylee's brother and is due out November 3rd. And even better you get the prologue from ACED which is the 10 year gap with Rylee and Colton and due out January 2016. So sit back and enjoy the roller coaster ride with Colton Donavan, sexy, bad boy race car driver and Rylee Thomas the woman who will tame him. Kristie thanks for sharing this fantastic story with us. I Race You ♥

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so her is my review. Deputy Laney Briggs and Texas Ranger Gunner Wilson are at it again. Either they are fighting or loving each other. And once again Laney is hating Gunner right about now. She wants to know why he has arrested her long time friend Luke Wagner. While Gunner keeps secrets, Laney is beginning to wonder who she can trust. But with her weakness being tall, tattooed and sexy as hell cowboys, she has to be careful who she gets help from. Can Gunner get her to see that he was keeping secrets from her to keep her safe? Will Laney ever learn the truth? Will Luke tell the truth about the one night that Laney can't remember? And will they all survive what comes next? Will Laney and Gunner get their happily ever after? I love this series, it is funny as hell, full of suspense and a few sexy cowboys. If you are looking for a great fun series then join the ride with Laney, Gunner, Luke and Colt. They will catch the bad guys one way or the other.Wicked Reads Review Team**

While Kira is is trying to live her life without her manipulative father, Grayson is trying to revive the vineyard his father left him. But who will loan money to a man who had committed murder. When Kira overheard Grayson talking with the banker, she can't help but listen. Kira has always come up with plans to help people but most of them blow up in her face. So what does she do, she proposes marriage to Grayson. In exchange for getting half of the money her grandmother left her. There was enough money to help them both move forward. While they are convincing others the marriage is real, they both have feelings for each other. When her father strikes by freezing both bank accounts, secrets will be revealed that will destroy them both. Will they both be able to take back the words of hurt and betrayal? Will their love triumph over the pain? Will Grayson realize that he loves and trust Kira already? Will Kira ever be free from her father? I loved this story and if Mia wrote a cookbook I would devour it because she is a fantastic author and I love her and anything she writes I have to read.

The God-King and his Queen are at it again. In the Warlord's Concubine, Mirella switched bodies with the Princess and was taken as the God-King's wife. While the God-King is in love with Mirella, he must use the rest of the concubines to make his family larger with as many children as he can. While Mirella doesn't like this idea, he must do this. After he services the concubines with Mirella helping him, his true feelings rise when he is alone with Mirella. So when he has to takes his army to fight and leaves the Queen to defend the city, Mirella commands and enlarges the troops with the help of the common people. There are too many of the Army that wants to take over the city that Mirella will try to win the war on her own if she has too. Will the God-King come back in time to help save the city? Will the real princess come back to get her revenge? Will the God-King and his Queen continue to rule over the city and try to rule the world? I really enjoyed this story, it is set in a fantasy med-evil time that will have you hanging on to every word to see what happens next. If you are reader that enjoys the fantasy, si-fi type story, then check out this one but please read The Warlord's Concubine first. That way you will not miss anything with the God-King and Mirella.**A copy of this story was provided by the authors in exchange for my honest review**

In the small Texas town of Shelbyville, Allie Shelby is the town princess and she owns Personal Assets. She is not just a sex therapist, she is a confidence builder and a helper of women to make their lives better and happier. A way for women to learn how to be more satisfied in all ways. When Allie is challenged to take her own advice, who would she pick? Earlier in the week Allie found out the Cameron Wright was back in town after she literally run into him. Cameron is back in town to make is dreams come true, opens a auto body repair shop and working on old muscle cars and making them new again. So who better to help her but Cameron, he is good-looking, helpful, protective of those he loves and would be perfect for her project. When Allie propositions him, he can't believe it, since they were in school he knew she was way out of his league. Now it is all he can think about but can they keep their feelings out of the deal? Will Allie's father keep her under his control and make her lose Personal Assets just so it make the town look better? With Cameron, Jamie, Roxanne, Eden and Cameron's mom Emmalee, can they all help Allie before it is too late? I am loving this new series (Texas Nights) by Kelsey Browning and I can't wait for more.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

Ryker Evans is a goalie for the Carolina Cold Fury hockey team, he is older and may not have many more years to play. After a fight with a former team-mate, Ryker finds himself and his two daughters in Cold Fury country while his soon to be ex-wife travels with the man Ryker hit. While Hensley cheated and her marriage to Ryker fell apart, he is ready to move on and try to find love again. Gray Brannon is one smart lady, no she is a genius and the new General Manager of the Fury. While some thinks that a woman has no place in hockey, Ryker is the first to accept her. But can he hide the feelings he is beginning to have for her? While Gray is feeling things for Ryker, they both want to keep it quite for a while. When a few people find out, Ryker wants to shout it from the rooftops and Gray was to keep it quite still. When Hensley shows up at Ryker's house and Gray is there, will they be able to keep a lid on things before Hensley tells their story? Will Ryker and Gray ever tell the world how they feel? I have loved each of the Cold Fury men in this series but I find Ryker has stolen my heart. He has a heart of gold, two beautiful daughters and will protect anyone he loves. I hope there will be more men from this hockey team. I love Sawyer Bennett and her writing style, she has a way to draw you in at the very beginning and not let you go until the end and will leave you wanting more. If you haven't read anything from Sawyer yet, then start with this series, the Cold Fury men are yummy, protective and will steal your heart right before your eyes.**Copy provided by the publisher through NetGalley in exchange for my honest review**

This is a fast paced story that will leave you wanting more. Dean Hunter only knows one thing, how to fight. It is the only time his mind is at peace. There is booze and women but it is the fighting he needs. That is until he sees Saylor, step-daughter of his boss and girlfriend of his right hand man Ace. When Dean is heading home after a fight, he witnesses Ace and Saylor arguing and he steps in to save her. But what is he really doing, he craves her like no other and he has to protect her. Can they survive together or will Roman send his goons after them?  This is a great story and I can't wait for more of Dean and Saylor.

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. This is the end of Amy and Liam's story and it is full of love that can never be Unbroken. While it begins with the burial of Chad, Amy's brother, the heartache she feels is so real because Chad might be alive but they have to stay away from each other to keep everyone safe. So with Liam and Tellar their bodyguard, Amy will fight to get their lives back to normal. So when she is confronted by Gia and Jared, both turned against Chad, will she be able to keep her secrets from them. While Liam wants to keep her safe, he will have to pick his fights with her. Amy is tired of running and wants to be happy with Liam. So they will have to pick a few people they trust to help and that will help keep them safe. Will their be a wedding, a brother back from the dead and a love that will last forever? I have loved this whole series, it is full of suspense, heartache, trust and love. A great series if you are looking for something that will keep you on the edge of your seat, I recommend you read them in order so you will know what is going one and I hope you will love it too. The reading order of the Secret Life of Amy Bensen is 1-Escaping Reality, 2-Infinite Possibilities, 3-Forsaken, 4-Unbroken.**Wicked Reads Review Team**

I have a few of these MP3/MP4 players that I have given as gifts and this one went to a friends daughter who doesn't have the change to get electronics. So I thought this would be great for her. It is easy to charge and after learning how the buttons work, she is now listening to loads of music and it was well worth giving it to her just for the smile that was one her face. And she loves the color as red is her favorite. She said that it was easy to load her choice of music and it goes everywhere with her. This is a great MP4 player and I love the smiles it produces when I give them as gifts.**Product provided by the company at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review**

This is not your everyday tire gauge. It is not flimsy or cheaply made. It is sturdy, heavy-duty and fits nicely in my hand. It had a rubber cover that makes it comfortable while using it. The head will turn 360 degrees so you can use it in any position. There is a reset button on the neck of the gauge that will hold the last pressure you took or to rest it altogether. The dial is easy to read and goes up to 60 PSI, so if your tires are of a higher PSI then this one will not work for you. I have a digital gauge that I compared this one too and this one is easier to handle and read because if I am checking pressure in the sun, I can not read the digital one.

With adult toy stores about an hour away, it is not easy to go there most of the time. When I was contacted by the company to review this product, I thought why not, this would save me a trip to the store. With seven levels and the curvy design, this was made for fun. It came in a black box which was inside a cardboard box and was discretely shipped. It comes with a cloth bag to keep it in. Needs two AAA batteries which are not included. It says it is water-proof but not to use it under water. If you are looking for a different type of vibrator, them give this one a try and enjoy by yourself or with a partner.**Product provided by the company at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review**

I purchased this MP4 player for a co-worker's daughter and she has fell in love with it. She is 13 and music is her thing. She had loaded some music and was listening to them in a very short time. She did tell me that the instructions was not for this model but after playing with for a few minutes, she figured out how it works and come to find out that the pink color was her favorite.**Product provided by the company at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review**

I am fairly new to using essential oils and I am loving this French Lavender so much. This is only the third scent I have used and the lavender is by far my favorite so far. It is very relaxing to use after a long, tiring day from work. It seems to be helping with my migraine headaches because it soothes, calms and relaxes me which helps out a lot with headaches. It comes in a dark amber bottle, to protect it from the light, only a few drops are needed in my mister.**Product deeply discounted by the company in exchange for my hones review**

This is a great flashlight/lantern that is easy to use and very easy to charge. This is much more than a camping light, I have been using it around the house and love that it has two light modes that will work in any situation. And it is rechargeable by using the USB cable or the crank handle. It comes with instructions and two USB cables. I love this light and will be telling my family and friends about it so they can be prepared too.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

I loved this series and I am glad we got to learn more about Sydney and Rhett. Although Rhett is the town man-whore and Sydney knows she should stay away. It seems they are both drawn to each other and after Ben's death, Sydney needs a distraction and Rhett can fill that need. But she never saw it coming that she had feelings for him. While Sydney's brother John was against it, Sydney knew she was still gonna see him. The thing for Rhett is that from that first kiss a few years back, Sydney was the one that he couldn't forget. It took him a short time to realize that he was falling for her but what was she feeling for him? Can Rhett change his ways to be with Sydney? Will Sydney only use Rhett when she needs a distraction? I can't wait for more, I need to know why Ben faked is own death and has been hiding in California. Another great series from Sarah Darlington that I highly recommend but you need to read the books in order to understand what is happening now.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

This is the end of the Coming Home series and what a way to end. It is full if suspense, scary times for Carrie and Amy and all ends with love. While Amy is being held captive, Carrie happens upon her and is trapped with her. She will try anything to get the both free. And after what seems like days, it turns out that Carrie has been missing only a day. While Le Brujo thinks he is untouchable, there are so many people looking for Carrie and Amy that he will not see it coming. Can Mark get to Carrie before it is too late? Will Allie, Chase and Drew save them both? I loved Allie and Chase's story and loved Carrie and Mark too and I can't wait to see what Meli Raine has in store for Drew. Once you begin this one, you will not stop until the very end.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

I was contacted by one of the authors to read and review this book and I sure am glad I accepted. This story is fast-paced, well-written, full of suspense and surprises. Well worth every minute it will take to read it. Veta Kellar works for her brother, lawyer Peter Kellar as his assistant. One day while running late and anything that could go wrong does, when she gets to the office late, she is soaked from the rain. When she goes into Peter’s office to hand him a file, she sees a man that takes her breath away, leaves her speechless and with sweaty palms. His beautiful green eyes pull her in. Caden Poe is there for Peter to represent him in a murder case. Cade is being charged with murdering six women and the news media has dubbed him the “H2O Killer” because the victims are drowned. Cade is sweet and tentative with his attention for Veta and she is falling for him all too quickly. This story is present day during the trial and will go back to the day Veta met Cade and their time on the run before they are caught in Bali and returned to California to stand trial. If you love a great romantic suspense, then this one is for you. So grab it now, you will not be disappointed. I loved it and can’t wait for book 2, For the Love of my Life, I need more NOW! This is a first for me from these authors and I will be reading more from them.**Copy provided by the authors in exchange for my honest review**

An awesome beginning to another series from Lacey Silks. I will read anything she writes and I am loving April and Sean. After a few years of nothing but work and her son, April needs a vacation. And her best friend Millie has the answer. But who knew Millie would book them at a nudest resort. While Millie is alive and free in her nakedness, April tries to cover herself and she hopes that no one is staring at her. So while Millie mingles with other guest, April goes to the beach where there are not others around. When she is awoken from sleep, there is a man kneeling down and his "package" is right at her face. April can't stop starring at him. She is drawn to Sean as he is drawn to her. When something happens and they have to leave abruptly, Sean puts Millie and April on the boat while he heads to another one. Will April ever see him again. She doesn't even know his last name or where he is from. I can't wait to start Perfectly Seduced to find out what happens next.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

With all the trauma or more drama, will Pepper and Gabe be able to move past it? He decides a little alone time away on the boat will help them both. But when a dangerous storm comes, will they both survive? And if they do, will he ever be ready to move forward and ask her to marry him? After the accident on the boat and both of them in the hospital, can they recover? And what about his job? He will need weeks if not months to recover? Will Bobbie Jo continue trying to take over his job? With Pepper and Gabe, all their families are around for support and moving on with their lives too. If Gabe asked, will Pepper agree to marry him? This series is so good and gets better with each book and I can't wait for book 6.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

I love that Ellie got her own story and that she was confused about her feelings. Was she wrong in living her life as a lesbian and it took the right man to come along to help her decide? Nate West is an actor that is well know and Ellie loves his show. When she meets him on a plane, it is his voice that gives him away. While Nate is drawn to her when he first sees her, Ellie realizes that she is having feelings she has never felt before. She is attracted to Nate Wast. Who knew she was bi-sexual. Will she give in and spend more time with him? Will Ellie be able to talk her brother Ben into coming back home after everyone thought he was dead? We have all the friends and family in this story too, more from Noah and Georgie, Rhett and Sydney. This is a great series and I can't wait to start Pulled Under, book 3.

What happens when you meet a sexy God-like guy on the beach? Cordelia finds out and when she realizes that the Chris she met on the beach is her new stepbrother, she has to stop herself from giving herself to him. Chris Cleveland is a Navy SEAL and he is cocky, self-assured and goes after what he wants. All his life he has used women and only for one night. That is until he meets Delia on the beach and she seems to work her way under his skin. He doesn't know what to do with these feelings, so he will give in to them and see how long it takes to get them out of his system. While his wash-up, has been mother Evie has married Delia's father Bruce, Chris is waiting for her to fall apart as she always does. Can Delia and Chris stay away from each other? Will Evie ruin them all with her manipulating ways? Will Bruce finally see what Evie is all about? And what happens when Chris has to go on a mission? This story was one of those that was hard to put down. I will read stepbrother romance stories although it is not one of my favorite genres and it is by Nicole Snow, so I had to read it. I love her writing style and can't wait for more from her.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

Once in a while I will read a college aged story that will leave me wanting more and this is one of them. Lia is in her freshman year and has no friends and she is lonely. Other than her dorm-mate Greer, no one really notices her. Until she runs into Julian, the hottest guy on campus. He is a senior and they have a film studies class together. When she runs into a girl and the girl is nice to her, Lia can't believe that Vanessa is Julian's  twin sister. While Vanessa and Lia's  friendship grows, so does her feelings for Julian. While they keep their "lessons" a secret, the feelings between Lia and Julian grow. It is a shock to them both when Julian seems to want more. But now with his graduation a few months away, Lia learns about a job offer he might not take because he wants to stay close to her. Lia can't let him do that , he will regret it one day and will blame Lia for his regret. So now Lia has to do the one thing that could destroy them both. Break up with him and break both of their hearts in the process. Will Julian hate her because she doesn't tell him the truth? Will Vanessa understand what she has to do and keep her secret? Can Lia ever forget her first love and move on? This is an awesome story that will leave you in tears and wanting more. I can't wait for book 2 to come out, I need to know what happens with Julian and Lia.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

This is the seventh and final book of the Kelly Brother's series and it makes me sad. I love everything about this series and wish it would not end. Gideon Kelly is the youngest of the Kelly boys and he is an actor in L.A. Without the help of "Red" his personal assistant, he would be lost. But with her by his side for the last three years, Gideon has come to realize that he has fallen in love with her. Back in October when he mentioned them being more than friends, she ran and after a month she came back with the intention of leaving and doing her own thing. Which is being a fashion designer, something she has been working on lately. Gideon doesn't mention more with her for fear of he leaving him for good. Which he would not survive. So now they are in Vegas for Gideon to film a movie while she keeps him on track. When things get a little off track with the help of Gabe Harrison, Gideon's co-star, can Gideon make Red see the truth? And one wild night will lead to something Gideon wants more than anything but will Red feel the same way? And will per hast come back to haunt her? I have loved each of the brothers in this series and I hate to see it end. Maybe there will be one with all of the brothers to see what everyone is doing a few years down the road. And with Mrs. Kelly, mama bear of the Kelly brothers, it would be another great story from Crista McHugh.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

With the way book two ended, I wondered how Rebel and Joe could ever be together, with others interfering and trying to keep them apart. I felt for Joe and wanted her to show her independence and that she would not be controlled all the time. Rebel was possessive and controlling and he needed Joe to help him change. Turns out they needed each other to make the relationship work. With Joe going to work for the company that Rebel works at, she wanted to show him she was moving on after she received those photos of him and Florence. You can try and guess who sent them but you might be wrong. Ransom wants to be friends with Joe but does he have other ideas? What will Florence do to try and win Rebel back? Will she finally understand that he never loved her and now he is with Joe? Will Joe finally realize that the feelings she has for Rebel is actually love? Can Rebel admit that he loves her too? This is an awesome story and I would recommend it to anyone. I hope you give it a change and love it as much as I do.**Copy provided by the author in exchange for my honest review**

The title is a perfect description of this story, it is Dirty, Bad and Wrong. Please heed the warning if you are not sure you would like this story. There was one part of this story that I didn't like but that is my opinion and you should not let it change yours if you want to read it.**Warning - this novel contains graphic sex, and hardcore elements of BDSM. There are scenes of violence (consensual) as well as sexual practices some readers may find offensive. If you aren't turned on by dirty bad wrong sex then please walk on by. Thank you.***Now for my review: Lydia Has left her relationship with Stuart because he got drunk and slept with a co-worker that is now pregnant. Stuart can't believe he has done this and thinks the child may not be his. After that admission, why would Lydia stay with him. Turns out that the relationship has been on a downward spiral for a while now. Lydia realizes after she has left that she wants a change. She goes to work with her suitcase and she is early. While in the break-room, James Clarke CTO of the company, walks in and sees her crying. Funny that seeing a woman cry does things to him. After spending time on a friends couch, James suggest that Lydia move in with his friend Rebecca. While Rebecca in bi, this doesn't bother Lydia. When Rebecca takes Lydia to a BDSM club, Lydia sees Masque and wants him to hurt her. Will Rebecca give in and introduce her to Masque? Can Lydia really take the pain that Masque will put her through? Will James see that having a relationship with Lydia will not break him but loosing her will? This story may be hard to read at times but I couldn't put it down and I didn't want it to end. This is a first for me from Jade West and I will be reading more from her.

This type of mobile inverter is perfect for traveling and is a must for everyone. I have used it to charge my phone and my kindle and have had no issues with it. All you have to do is place it in the cup holder, which it fits nicely, and plug the charger into the cigarette lighter and it is ready to charge any device. It is well made and sturdy so it will not fall over or pull out while things are plugged in.  It has multiply places to plug in different device, --One 110V AC outlet, USB power port offers 2A max power for laptops, smartphones such as iPhone, Samsung, HTC, LG, and Nokia, portable DVD players, etc. So if you are looking for a mobile inverter, than this is a great one to have. I have different one that I have used before but this one is so much better.**Product provided by the company in exchange for my honest review**

I found Oswalt neither funny nor perceptive and his weirdness merely weird. The short pieces on his jobs, before and after he became a comedian, would be of interest to his acolytes but aren't unusual enough or funny enough to have been of interest to me. His thesis of his generation based upon the classifying of Zombie, Spaceship, and Wasteland was mildly interesting or else I'd give the book one star.I've liked him from the little I've seen of him, mostly in guest spots but the more I learn of him the less interesting he becomes.
