His recommendation of "The Horizontal Man", as one example, furthers my confusion about him. I'm a huge fan of mysteries from Poe, to S.S. Van Dine, through Rex Stout to today but that one, Yech.

It took me three tries to get this. The first two times they sent me the vertical model by mistake. That version fits the S6 snugly. This horizontal version is sized to fit the S6 with some kind of cover. It does not work on a belt unless you are standing all the time. The holder is too deep, by that I mean if you are sitting the bottom of the pouch will press against your hip pushing the clip off the belt. When you stand up it's loose and falls to the floor.
Got them for my Wife, she has a narrow foot so, as expected, they are too wide but she likes them a lot.

Three of the best Fields shorts. I bought it to give to my Dentist who'd never seen "The Dentist". However, I hadn't seen them in 60+ years and I'm afraid they don't live up to my memories. Some good bits but overall just O.K.

I bought a horizontal Turtleback and received this by mistake. It is very well made but the phone (w/o a protective case) fits so tightly it is very difficult to remove. It would be almost impossible to get the phone out in time to answer a call. I returned it for the case I did order.

As a fan of the author's Sharpe series, one of the best series I've ever read (other than the India prequels) this was a real let down. No character to really get interested in or attached to. I wound up skimming the book to see how it ended. Some interesting historical tidbits but a mediocre read.

Really well constructed BUT it does NOT fit. Bought for my Wife's new, 2016 MX-5 GT from local dealer and it does not fit. Notch for mirror is not wide enough to fit around mirror. Very disappointed in Mazda. Returned it.
Excellent, the only thing missing is a USB port which I, mistakenly, thought it had.

Perfect, hard-to-find, size to fit in the dash cup holders in my roadster which only fit small cups. I was using a 10 oz. recycled Tonic bottle, but this bottle has the pull spout which makes it quick to use. The aqua matches my rims.However, the nipple is hard to open. Too difficult for a young kid. You need to work it back and forth until it gets easier to open.
Attractive and, most importantly, as it says: QUIET! It's in the Master Bathroom and, unlike it's predecessor, can't be heard in the Master Bedroom.

Seems to work well and the stick form is a very convenient way of applying sunscreen. I keep it it the map pocket of my roadster in case I've forgotten to apply sunscreen at home. Small enough size to keep in a pants pocket.

I've been a fan of traditional Bluegrass since the '60s and wanted to branch out. I have some Bela Fleck CDs and had heard good things about "New Grass Revival" so thought I'd give them a try. I do appreciate their effort to try to expand the genre. Terrific musicians with terrific voices but I can't say the same for their songs. Boring melodies and uninspired lyrics. There's only one song on the album I want to listen to again.Obviously this is a matter of taste but I'd certainly advise listening to cuts before you buy it.
Unbelievable plot. Unbelievable character, marine biology the best part. His adventuring not so much.
Really non-ticking. Attractive case and face. Very happy with purchase.
Good quality long laces, just what I was looking for.

I'm afraid one has to compare this book to Tony Hillerman's The comparison does not come off well for Chapell. The mystery plot really makes little sense, the archaeological "secret" is not that secret for the time and place and certainly not important enough to cause the action that takes place. The characters aren't well-defined, the three Navajo males are interchangeable. None of the protagonists act very intelligently or with any common sense given the threat they face. The other characters are all one dimensional. Even the archaeological information is poorly done and "the theory" not currently given much credence from my online research after reading the book. The clincher at the end, similarly makes no sense.Also, unlike Hillerman, the author really does not evoke much sense of the place.I haven't read Hillerman for quite a while but just started reading "The Great Taos Bank Robbery, and other true stories" and learned more about the Navajo/Ute/Zuni/Anasazi excavations from one story than from this book, and the writing was a joy to read.I had no interest in reading more of the author until I read some reviews here that believe this is one of his worst books. But then I read reviews of the first two and found negative comments similar to mine for this one so I'm done.
Great collection of the big name groups of gospel and lesser knowns. I'm a big fan of this type of Gospel and this helped fill in my collection.

I usually use Rain Bath but it wasn't carried at CVS so I bought this. Big mistake. Doesn't work up to a lather and has a disagreeable smell. I used it for two weeks and threw it out. I got Costco's Rain Bath-ish product and I'm very satisfied with it.
Small, convenient size. Works well. (and Blue matches my Wife's Kitchen Decor)
Good quality, nice color, and the length I needed for a hat chin string. Good price.
Good read, decent plot. Main character is kind of a macho jerk but meant to be, I guess. Not good enough for me to want to read more by the author.

Second of the series that I've read. Lots of detail about Tibetan Buddhist traditions, some conforms to what I've known, some more extensive. I don't know how accurate it is.Interesting but a bit repetitive in plot line I won't be reading any more.
Just what it says: The Collected Works and at a reasonable price. Now I can sort through and sample Dickens.

I've been buying Puma sport shoes, on and off, since I bought a pair of soccer shoes in 1959. I have a C width foot and they always fit perfectly.These "sneakers" could not fit me better. I bought them for driving shoes and they have a stiff, non-slip, sole which is ideal for that. They also have a rounded heel excellent for driving.The sole is fairly thin, has little cushioning, and very little tread pattern, so I don't know how useful they would be as all-purpose "Sneakers"The only con is the side could be cut a little lower under the ankles. They rub a bit on me. I deducted a star for that.
Got these to replace the stock brakes in my 1995 Suzuki Sidekick. They don't seem any better. Perhaps they will be when they fully break-in. If so I'll revise my rating.

To my ear, "The Commitments" did better cover versions than the original performers. Terrific movie and terrific sound track. I especially love Maria Doyle's voice and am disappointed that her later albums are of a different genre.

I bought the Dual Lock awhile ago and am not certain which type it is although I believe it is the 400. The locking between the tapes is fantastic but the adhesive is the Achilles Heel. I used it to attach a picture to the wall of my Motorhome and it has worked well for about five years but I just found the picture on the floor of the stored home because the adhesive had melted in the 90-100 deg Nevada Summer weather. The strips came unattached to the picture/wall but stayed attached to each other.

The lock that this provides is fantastic. I've been using it in my Motorhome to hang pictures on the wall and they don't vibrate off. It's Achilles heel is the adhesive. Today I went to my Motorhome which has been in storage this hot, 90-100 deg., Nevada Summer and one of my pictures, which has been hanging up for about five years, had fallen off because the adhesive had melted, tho the locked pieces of the fastener strips stayed together.

For it's purpose I find these to be excellent. They fit my ears well and are quite comfortable. I have not run or exercised extensively with them so can't say how they'd feel after a workout but I have listened to a lot of music stationary or walking. I find the sound quality to be very good for buds, much better than the standard iPod/iPhone buds. I  don't find a problem with Bass but didn't listen to anything Bass heavy, Bass sounded great on Guitar and Vocal tunes.

This has proved to be extremely useful on our wood floors (as well as tile and vinyl) in our home. It's also a basic cleaning tool in our Motorhome. Rather than buy the dry refills we've started using microfiber cloths which, if attached properly, give you four surfaces per side and then can be cleaned and re-used.Bye-bye dust mops.

Swingline no longer makes staples for its staple guns and the staples are wider than the predominant Arrow, Stanley, Bosch, etc. These are made to fit and saved me from throwing out a good staple gun.
But much, much, easier to use. A terrific system but bags are hard to find, locally. We use both quart and gallon sizes a lot. Can be re-sealed several times.
Replaced the stick on pads that always came off and left glue on the floor with these. Work well, we'll have to see how they hold up.

Got this for my 2010  Mercede-Benz SLK and it fits perfectly. I've had several of this type of spring loaded sunshade over the years, I like how light weight and compactable they are. This one has little corner flaps beyond the spring circumferences which work really well. The fabric between the circles fits around the mirror nicely, too.

As a Native New Yorker, I've been reading "The New Yorker" since 1953, I'm a big fan and the staff writers have always been idols to me. I have to say that reading the earlier pieces and re-reading most of the later pieces, they are truly boring and not very perceptive. I'm having a very hard time getting through the book despite how short the articles are.

Very interesting perspective of a Copperhead living in a predominantly abolitionist area. Good, period detail, good plot but perhaps too happy an ending to be realistic.The Kindle edition is a joke, typos galore, numerals stuck into pages with no apparent reason, sentence breaks, and paragraph shifts. It's all too obvious that a human eye never edited it, it was all left to a computer.

Hard to find in 4GB size. I needed it for a car stereo. The manufacturer said no more than 4GB and heat resistant and this has worked perfectly. I got Pink because I downloaded my Wife's tunes library on it.

Bostich and Stanley are the same company and this looks identical to the Stanley TR150 which gets excellent reviews on Amazon. I bought it to use as a stapler and it has been OK for that.Pros: Comfortable ergonomics, Easy to squeeze,  Hard and soft setting for punching power, Easy to insert staples.Con: Staples don't penetrate evenly, one side is almost always not flush with the surface of the item stapled so I had to use a tack hammer to get the staples flush.I've just spent three days trying to staple fabric onto outdoor furniture seat cushions. I started with a 50 year old Duo-fast which jammed constantly, requiring it to be disassembled frequently, but eventually did a good job with even penetration. I then tried a heavy duty Swingline stapler but the staples were too long and neither Home Depot or Lowes carry the staples which are NOT interchangeable with Arrow, Bostich, and Stanley staples. Consequently I bought this stapler to complete the job. I've since learned that Office depot carries the Swingline staples.

Great color, nice snug fit, no shedding from interior, like the snaps better than Velcro. I first bought the Pratt & Hart gloves and they were a big mistake: ugly color, loose fit, constantly shedding interior and Velcro which always stuck to itself when gloves were removed. I didn't want holes for knuckles and these two were the only options.  The Riparos are a couple of bucks cheaper.

Really not "putty" at all. More like  a glue. Consequently it's difficult to fill a hole as it smears. I had six screw holes in a plastic bumper and it was impossible to get them filled and smoothly flush to the surface. The UV hardening was nice, tho.

Not bad but four issues. I got the "Tan" and the light color is a pink flesh color, just different enough from the photo to be dissatisfying to me. I'd go with Brown, instead. They are a slight bit wide in the medium size and slightly short in the thumb. The most annoying thing is that when I take them off the inside sheds and little flecks of leather stick to my hands and then transfer to the car surfaces. There are tiny specks all over the cockpit. I don't know if this is normal for any deerskin gloves but it's annoying. The Velcro is annoying, too hard to put the gloves on quickly. You have to first pull the Velcro apart. They'd be too loose around the wrist if the straps were removed.Seem to be well constructed. Can't beat the price, though.4/19: Well, I've had to downgrade my rating. The gloves continually shed. I turned them inside out, wore them and rubbed my hands together for an hour. There was still loose flecks. I tried sandpapering them with different grades of sandpaper but they still continue to shed. I think that they always will and that is unsatisfactory to me. I'd give them one star but I can use them Off Road in my dirty Sidekick.I got a pair of Riparo Gloves which are everything that these are not and are two dollars cheaper.
Dogs love them and Blueberry smells very enticing for humans. Whether they help remove tartar is hard to know. I don't feed them regularly.

Another great book in the series that is set in WW1 but from the unfamiliar perspective of an Officer in the Austrian-Hungarian "Empire". The great irony of WW1 is that it was started by the least competent of the Great Powers which was completely destroyed by the war. The series describes the familiar armaments of WW1, submarines and aircraft, but of the little studied Austrian varieties. A well-drawn and interesting main character suffers from dealing with the ultra-conservative and hidebound Dual Monarchy bureaucracy. I highly recommend the series.
Works well, just as designed. Not much more that one can say about it.
Didn't read it when it first was published but it's just as brilliant and relevant to the race situation in this country today. Vey eloquent and perceptive Author. I intend to read more of his work.

We've been using these for years. They are a great and more practical alternative to expensive vacuum seal machines. These can be re-used a few timesThey were more available in stores in the past but we now have to resort to the internet to get a good selection.

I'm a big fan of Phillip Kerr's character Bernard Gunther, the Berlin Detective whose life we follow from pre-WW2 through post-WW2. I was hoping for something of the same caliber. Well, Connell is no Kerr. The book isn't bad but it shows how hard it is to rise above mediocre. The main character is not very engaging, the supporting characters, as well as the villain of the piece, are cut out cliches, the plot, O.K., somewhat formulaic, but the story could have taken place anywhere and any time. The only advantage of the immediate post-Nazi era setting is that we are made aware of the magnitude of the Nazi experimentation and vivisection of human victims which give us a wide range of suspects. I'm a child of WW2 with a lifelong interest in it and was well aware of the horrors of the Nazi Concentration Camps and the inhuman experiment the Nazis performed but I had no idea of how wide spread they were, assuming that Connell's book is based on fact.I had a very hard time keeping interest in the book and only continued reading it because I agreed to review it for Vine. I can't recommend it.

Goes on easily and conforms to top to bottom curve of door. Fit snugly and then glue kicked in. Will repost if glue becomes a mess in Summer heat. Got it at O'Reilly Auto Parts for a little more than half this price.

I liked it for two years and then the remote stopped working. I bought a second one and, out of the box, its remote doesn't work either (the light on the remote doesn't come on when you press any button). I'll be replacing the second one since I bought it from Best Buy.

I found this book referenced on the SLK Forum website that Id used when I was researching information on the SLK prior to buying one. Unfortunately I found this AFTER I'd already purchased the car. I bought the Kindle version but if one is interested in buying a SLK I'd recommend getting the hard copy as the tables and information are more readily accessible. My one complaint is that the Author is a bit too pro-Mercedes. The 280 engine had a serious manufacturing defect which caused very expensive engine repairs (a fact I'd learned independently and which caused me to avoid buying a car with that engine). While discussing the defect the Author refers to it dismissively. Later on, however, while discussing how to buy a SLK he states that he wouldn't buy one with that engine. So the reader might not appreciate the significance of that defect.

These stories are moderately interesting to a car guy, really only so if you know the author. Anyone with any involvement in cars has their own stories that are as, or more, interesting, than these. I have the Kindle version and there are countless errors. The book really needed a good proofreader for the frequent typos, omissions, and duplicate insertions, and a good editor to rearrange the stories so that, at least, they are in chronological order. Clearly they were published separately and later compiled, although I can't imagine what commercial publication would have carried them other than a small town newspaper looking to fill space.As a Car Guy, my conclusion is that the ideal reader for this book is not a car guy, but someone who wants to get involved in a personal relationship with a car guy. There is a lot to be learned from that perspective.I keep the Kindle in the toilet and the stories works well to divert me from my exertions and my exertions keep me from falling asleep reading the stories.
Much better than Monopoly, I wish I still had the game. Have looked for one used and can't find it.

Wow, I've been mulling over this review for weeks since I finished the book. I'm a huge Levy fan. I bought two of his "The Last Open Road", one for myself, one to loan out. I gave away other copies to relatives and friends. I bought his tee-shirts and bumper stickers. About twenty friends read the book and car lovers and non-car lovers alike loved it. The sequels, while not as good, in descending order, were still great fun. So, twenty years later a new Levy book? It must be terrific, right? Well... being a Levy optimist I kept shoveling hoping to find a good book under all the dross. Eventually I found half a good book but had to dig through too many unnecessary extensive descriptions. Of the "Ford" (under a pseudonym) offices, "Mrs Ford's" decorating skills and her house, for examples, and the repetitious musings of the main character as to how difficult it is to write, how inexperienced he is with women, and other cries of the heart. Levy's cutsie-pie style of writing with sentences containing almost endless strings of nouns, gerunds, or adjectives got very tiring after awhile.The basic concept is a great one. The original series was about sports car racing in North America. This is an expansion: Ford's foray into international motorsports as well as its introduction of the Mustang, with extensive asides into international motorsport events. Levy crams all the details he can into each event. Again, repetitively. We read about the list of cars and drivers at Sebring at least three times, yeah we got it.While Buddy was interesting as a breathless young mechanic diving into the wrenching of exotic foreign motorcars in the original series, the hero, herein, as a knowledgeable writer for "Car and Driver/Road and Track", is really unsympathetic. He's amazingly naf given the understanding of motorsports politics that he's shown to have.The Kindle Edition is the only way to go for two reasons. Tapping the page to skip though the extensive padding is a delight, and the book and read is not worth $35.00.The book was truly in need of a ruthless editor and should have been a combination of the two, I assume, books in the series. As it stands now I have absolutely no interest in wading through the second book, despite knowing that, historically, it should contain the more interesting bits of Ford's involvement.Given the 18 years he's had since the end of the last series, Levy had more than enough time to develop the story and revise and polish it to produce a real gem. Instead he's given readers a reason to think he's called "B.S." for a reason.
Adds some humor to the use of a pacifier. Decent construction, worth the price.
Decent WW1 trenches background and a decent murder mystery plot. Not good enough that I'd read more by the author but certainly worth the cost of the Kindle read.

Good short view of what being a Battle of Britain Pilot was all about. I'm a big WW2 buff and have read most of the autobiographies of the British Pilots so learned little new but a good book for someone just delving into the area.
Does the job at a good price.

A great, dare I say definitive, collection of "Doo-W*p". All the famous and several not so famous songs of the era. I already had most of the famous songs but it was good to rehear the less famous and to realize why they were less so. Took me back to my teenage years growing up in NYC.* "o": Amazon won't let me post the real name, I don't know how other reviewers did.

I'm not a Young Adult but got this because it was an Edgar Winner. I'm no longer using that as a serious criteria. Not a bad little book but I suspected the murderer early on and wasn't sympathetic to the young protagonist who did not seem worthy of becoming a Samurai. The feudal setting in Japan was of interest and it's a quick read. I gave it to my young teen great-nephew of the video game generation and I'm eager to learn if he actually reads it and, if so, his thoughts.

Maybe you have to be Australian to like this book. I'm not, I didn't. I bought it because it IS Australian and I thought that'd be a nice change and because of the good reviews here.The lifestyle and former occupation of the heroine are certainly different. They didn't put me off. What did was the extensive padding and extraneous details provided and the fact that the heroine wasn't clever, rather she's fairly stupid and very lucky. The way she puts herself in mortal danger you'd think she'd train in Martial Arts rather than in running and drinking Champagne. I now know the slogan on every Tee shirt she has and about every outfit she owns as well as the fabric of every outfit of almost every other woman encountered in the book. I skimmed an awful lot of the book to get to the actual plot. Not finding her at all likeable that was the only thing that kept my interest.Two stars for the Australian setting and plot. No stars for the rest of the book

Just what it says. The series produced by the Army to educate the service man in what to do and not do in a "spoonful of sugar" way. Of interest to anyone with an interest in WW2 or the U.S Army. One of the most important films produced by Hollywood military volunteers in service in WW2. See "Five Came Back" about five famous Hollywood Producers who joined the Military and their efforts during the war.)

Loaned to be by General Eaker's nephew, I found this book to fill in the gaps about my knowledge of the U.S.' Daylight Bombing Campaign against the Germans. I'd always believed that it was only marginally successful, and a flawed concept, as the British believed, but learned that it was effective. Eaker's interview with Speer after the war confirmed that, and that the concept was sound, it just required more heavy bombers to make it more effective. Unfortunately the Eighth Air Force's need was rivaled by that of the anti-submarine campaign (see:"Black May" about the anti-U-Boat campaign) which drew off a significant, and necessary, number of Bombers. The U.S. could only produce so many.Since it's written by one of his aides, the plus is that there is much accurate detailed information about Eaker. The minus is it's a bit hero worshipping.

As a child of WW2 with an interest in it from the earliest age. I always believed that U-Boats were highly effective as a weapon. This book reveals the truth. Once the Allies got their act together the U-Boats weren't, and as counter measures improved the U-boats cost the Germans more than they were worth. An excellent book with comprehensive details about the anti-sub campaign. Well written and a good read. Dovetails with the biography of USAAF General Ira Eaker, "Air Force Spoken Here", who had the competing need for long range bombers for the Daylight bombing campaign by the Eighth Air Force against Germany.
Didn't care for it and exchanged it for a Kindle Paperwhite.
Not the greatest arm rest but better than without it. After a few years the screws holding the top in place came out. Luckily they could be found in the storage compartment and replaced.

Disappointing in that there are no subtitles for the foreign cartoons, which I understand would be expensive to do,there are brief liner notes explaining some of them. However, another DVD in the series, "Private Snafu", had copious, and overly extensive liner notes not really needed. Shouldn't have been hard to come up with some sort of translations.Update: I found the subtitles but they just showed how boring the foreign cartoons were. The U.S. Cartoons can be found elsewhere, i.e., "Private Snafu" which I already had so I find this collection marginally interesting, at best.
Mediocre, nowhere good as the Sharpe prequels or Kipling. Not a very believable or interesting main character. Not terrible. I won't look for other books by the author

I'm not a zombie fan but this isn't really a zombie book, it's a post-apocalypse book. How does civilization deal with a cataclysmic crisis. I thought it was well written, characters well drawn and highly believable.

I'm a huge fan of Bernie Gunther and have read six or seven of the  books in the series. So far, this one is the best. A great, complicated, yet believable, plot and Bernie figures it out by terrific detective work rather than just by stumbling on the answer. Few, if any, nits to pick. Typical of the series, but especially good here, the Nazi historical background which revolves around Reinhard Heydrich, who was, I believe, the highest Nazi Official to be assassinated (other  than by fellow Nazis) in WW2. Very good character studies of other top Nazis of the time and place.

I started this series because of my interest in WW1 and the unusual perspective the author provides of the war from that of the Hapsburg Empire, the dysfunctional Dual Monarchy. I only read this book because it was the last one of the series left to me and I thought I'd be bored because it takes place before the war begins. How wrong I was. A terrific piece of writing, it is difficult to believe that this is not autobiographical and that the author did not experience first hand what he wrote about.I've always had an interest in sailing and have read a significant number of works that describe sailing in a square-rigger but I learned so much more from this book. The research that the author must have done to write this book (as is true of most of the books in this series) is prodigious and he imparts that information skillfully and engagingly.

I have had a great interest in WW1 since the '60s, mainly the airplanes and air war but also the insane war itself. I've read most of the first hand accounts of the land and air war from British, Americans, French and Germans and many Histories and analyses of the war. I bought this because of the subject matter and because of the uniform terrific reviews. After starting the book I went back and looked, again, at the reviews as I could not understand how people opinions could differ so radically from mine. At first I thought that the reviews must be from friends and relatives of the Author but, checking, the posters' review histories that did not seem to be true. One poster clearly had not previously read anything about the war which could explain his enthusiasm but another had read substantially. There is no accounting for taste, or, as my Grandmother used to say: "Everybody has their own taste said the Old Lady as she kissed the cow."I have had three retired friends who decided to write novels which were mediocre, at best, and this could have been one of them. The author has some familiarity with the period and the War, it appears that he has done his research, and he's ticked all the boxes but his characters are all the same and one dimensional. There is no real sense of the settings, either, despite the author's long-winded efforts. I found myself skimming the first half which describes the protagonist's childhood and relationship with his Father and Girlfriend. Nothing unusual or interesting. Yes, Dad beats him but in no way more than in many boy's lives in that period, and for that matter, today. Dad did not come across as the Ogre that the Author seemed to wish to portray.The protagonist was not particularly interesting, engaging or sympathetic. The dialogue was not of the period but contemporary. The descriptions of his service from training through combat are repetitive in showing he was cold, tired, and hungry but are done in a very pedestrian way. Similarly, I skimmed his life after his demobilization. His wartime service was only slightly more readable, again checking all the boxes as to how horrible combat in the front lines was. A slightly different perspective here as he served in the Artillery, not the Infantry, so did not have to leave the trenches and attack enemy positions.To me it was very poorly written, totally unengaging, and a complete waste of time and money. I only finished reading it in order to see if the ending justified all the great reviews.I'm certain that I'll be soundly lambasted for my negative review but wanted to make certain that anyone else looking to read this book be aware that there is an alternate opinion of it.

A great collection for DooWop lovers and youngsters new to the sound. The only reason not to buy this set is if you already have all the songs which is highly unlikely as there are several included that were less popular and not available elsewhere.
Gerald Adams' review nails it! Nothing more needs to be said. I'm a huge WW1 Air buff, have read extensively on the subject, and this is one of the best books that I've read.
My wife loves these and has worn the brand and style for years. This was a Christmas present.

DeMuro starts off by telling us how his friends and family think he's insane for giving up a great job with Porsche to become a freelance writer. After reading this book I concur. He writes some clever similes and metaphors but he really is nowhere as clever as he thinks he is. He's also a slow learner. If there is one takeaway from this book it is: don't buy a car without getting a good mechanic to give it a thorough evaluation. DeMuro doesn't, continually buys cars with major problems and then gives them bad reviews, surprising, no? I've been a car buff since 1958 and enjoy humorous writing but there's" little there here". Not offensive, and cute, but barely worth $2.99. I certainly would not spend money to read anything else of his.

This review is not going to be very helpful but here's why I'm writing it. I'm a huge dog lover and I just got the book for Christmas from a dog loving relative who loved it and gushed over it. The title seemed vaguely familiar but I kept my mouth shut because if it was the book I recalled I hated it. Well it is, I read it years ago at the glowing recommendations of several dog park friends and hated it, so much so that I've managed to submerge it into my subconscious and can't recall why I hated it. I just recall how upset I was that I continued to plod through it and wasted my time.I might have concluded that it's a book that women like more than men, all the recommendations that I've gotten came from women, but my wife hated it, too.I book that has 40X as many five star reviews as one star reviews should be a must read, This book isn't, and I had to add the puny weight of my one star review.
Well made and attractive. Good price. Don't know how well it will hold up. Purchased as a gag gift for someone who wears a Waldo-like shirt but who doesn't like hats.

Enjoyable read of an "Ellery Queen"-like collection of stories by Canadian authors set in the city of Toronto which was originally named York. A few very good ones, most just O.K. Probably of more interest to Canadian readers.

This appears to be the same as the Emerson Lantern which is sold for $34.00. Mine was sold under the brand name Yorkshire at CVS for $9.99. It's O.K. but is not very bright. As a power outage emergency lamp it'll do. I wouldn't spend more.

I bought this for $9.99 at CVS to have a back-up lantern in case of a power outage. It's O.K. but is not very bright. For the price I paid it's better than nothing but its not worth more. Amazon sells a Shift Lantern that also looks identical for $9.95.

You get a lot for your money with this case.  The  lightweight stylus, screen protector  and cleaning cloth are all useful items, and the case itself comes in two parts.  I prefer using just the main case, which is pretty sturdy by itself with nice grips that help protect the phone and make it easy to hold. When my grandkids ask to use the phone, I put on the second extra sturdy backing! The holes on the case line up well and I have no problems using any of the phone's features. The seller sent me a free sample and asked for my honest review.

I'm usually very happy with Belkin products.  The good news here is that it charged my Iphone 5S without a case quickly and without issue.  It looks nice and has its own wire to plug into a usb port. I gave it 4 stars for the fact that technically, it works well.  However, how many people walk around without a case on their phone?  I have two cases, and neither are compatible with this charger. I know other reviewers have cut off the plastic base of the charger in order to use a case, but its just strange that Belkin didn't design the base  the "modified" way themselves. They could have also made the plug longer and designed a flexible base that could hold the phone. I'm just not going to pry off my case every time I need a charge. I like the idea and hope they change the design.

This book has several types of problems to solve. I gave it to my 8 year old grandson and he has worked on a few puzzles already.  I told him to try each one, and if he can't solve it, make notes and come back to it, since that's how I solve these type of challenges, since I often buy adult challenge puzzle books myself. When I last looked through the book, I was happy to see notes on a few problems.  Some of the puzzles are harder than others, so I think most kids will enjoy this for a long time.  One improvement I would make is in the answer section.  It is just very easy to see the answers when you flip open the book, and that makes it tempting for kids to "cheat".  Small print would be better.

I use these supplements regularly for my fibromyalgia and arthritis.  This brand combines them all in each tablet and the manufacturer's suggested dose is 3 tablets a day. Since switching to this brand, I have had no change in pain levels, that is to say this works as well as taking each ingredient separately. It also includes turmeric, boswella and hyaluronic acid, which are also suggested by some for joint issues, although the doses seem fairly small here.  Hyaluronic acid is also supposed to be good for the skin.  This product is made in the USA, is cruelty free and comes with a 100 percent warranty is not satisfied. The seller send me a bottle of these tablets and asked me for an honest review.

I've tried several BB products, and like the all in one idea because it's a timesaver. This is a bit thick but a little goes a long way. I had no skin irritation at all. The fair/ medium was a bit darker than other products I've used so I had to make sure to blend it in well. It does cover pores and slightly covered a few age spots. The biggest issue I had was with it flaking on my nose and chin. I was pretty noticeable each time I used it. Everyone's skin is so different that you may have a better experience, but for me the flaking was a deal breaker.

The benefits that this product is intended to be used for include stress reduction and help for the immune system.  Reading up on it, I found it is often taken for relief from fibromyalgia as well.  I thought it would be a great product to try, and the seller sent me a bottle for free and asked me to write an honest review.  First of all, these medium sized capsules have no odor at all, in case you are sensitive.  I found them easy to swallow.  I like that they are made in the USA and especially that they are cruelty free. For me personally I don't think they are suitable.  I have been having a lot of pain in my joints and muscles, the opposite of the benefits I was hoping for with my fibromyalgia. This herb is intended to improve the immune system, but I suspect it may be putting mine into overdrive, which causes my body to start hurting as if I'm fighting something off.  I dont know for sure if this is what's happening, just my best guess.  I also did not feel any benefits for anxiety or stress. Not every product works for every person, and Im reluctant to give the impression it does not work, it's just not a match for me.

My liver enzymes are often elevated, but not to the level where the doctor feels more testing is necessary.  I asked him if taking Milk Thistle could help, and he said that although there's no definitive proof, taking a reasonable dose is probably a good idea.  Milk thistle is also purported to help with high cholesterol.  Again, it's not proven, but since I also have that issue, I have been taking it for a few years, with  occasional breaks.  I was offered this brand by the seller and asked to evaluate it and give my honest review.  I feel better using an organic product so I was happy to do so.  When I opened the bottle, I took a sniff and it smelled fresh. Capsules are medium sized, and contain 500 mg., a bigger dose than other brands I have used. I haven't used them long enough to say if my blood work shows any improvement, but in general both my liver enzymes and my cholesterol has gone down while taking this herb. (I take cholesterol medicine, so I cannot say if the herb is also helping.

Once you learn how to use the controls, which I found  a little confusing, I think you'll find the player works as well any in this price range.  Sound and video quality are good but I really can't see watching very  long  on this small screen. The biggest advantage I see is the mini sd card slot which creates a lot of flexibility and the fact that it  comes with a class 10 32GB card. I was sent a sample of this product by the seller and asked for an honest review.

My two dogs rarely want to eat dry food without some scraps or wet food mixed in. This one they eat right out of the bag.  I think it might be the small kibble and mild scent,  but whatever the reason,  I'm happy to find a food that they like that has quality ingredients and does not cause any stomach distress.

This bottle opener is definitely cool for anyone with arthritis or other issues that make using an old fashioned opener difficult. It also is great for opening lots of bottles at once.  They make this opener in a few different colors, so if you're interested, be sure to check them out. When I open my friends' bottles, it usually gets their attention, and they ask where I got it.  I was sent this item by the seller for free to evaluate and review.  I have to add though, when I tell people the price most say they would not spend that much for this type of product.

At my age, it's important to really keep up with my skin routine, but it's worth it.  I use sunscreen moisturizer during the day and at night, I clean, tone, apply serum and moisturizer.  I was sent this product by the seller and asked for my honest review. . I was a little nervous because I have pretty severe allergies, and this product contains several flowers, including dandelion.  Not to worry though, it hasn't caused any issues.  This night cream is thick and I make sure to gently rub it completely into my skin.  This product works for me to keep my wrinkles at bay and makes my skin soft. I have not seen any real reduction in color of the age spots on my face, but as of yet I have not found a product that can do that.

This toner really cleans the skin.  As long as I apply serum and moisturizer, my skin is really soft and younger looking.  This product has a light scent, but I found trying to spray it on my face was really messy business and I didn't like the smell going up my nose. I use the more traditional method and spray a cotton ball and clean my face.  The dirt and leftover makeup left on it after first cleaning my face tells me it gets into the pores and cleans them.  I was sent this toner by the seller and asked to post an honest review.

I have two toddler grand daughters and this toy cracks them up, even though most times the balls don't pop very high.  They like to play with the balls,  and being toddlers, this keeps them occupied for a while.  With balls coming out of top and bottom, there's a little sense of anticipation.  This toy gets repeat play, but only for a few minutes at a time.  It plays music but the girls don't seem interested in it, and it would probably be better if it didn't.  I'm really surprised this takes so many D batteries to operate. It's expensive for what it is already, and those batteries really raise the cost.  The batteries aren't included either, so you have to be prepared before the kids can play.

I was sent this bag for free and asked for my honest review.  I'm always as positive as possible with my reviews, but this time, there's just too many flaws.  This should have been a hit.  It's as cute as it looks in the pictures, with a retro 70's look.  However, the snap for the front flap broke off the first time I opened it.  Stitching could be better and the lining is very thin.  Both the inside and outside zippers have issues.  The inside one is really cheap looking and poorly stitched and the outside one keeps opening on its own like it doesn't have any "stay".  I would love to see an improved version come out, since it really has potential.  It's fairly large and I can still use it to tote stuff to the beach, but don't feel it is sturdy enough  to use for other occasions.  -

This is a solid multipurpose tool with a metal handle that has a built  in knife, fire starter and whistle. The shovel blade side has a sharp edge that will function as an ax and another side with saw teeth. The shovel blade folds for storage and locks straight for a shovel and at 90 degrees for a hoe. It comes with a sheath for the blade and a pouch for the disassembled tool. The handle is short for hiking or camping but  looks like it will hold up to rough use. I was sent this shovel by the seller for free and asked for my honest review.

I was a bit nervous buying one of the least expensive tillers, but wow this works great! It's easier to use than a gas tiller, since you don't have the weight of the gas engine to drag around, and no gas to buy.  To be completely honest I do have fairly sandy soil, but I broke up a 40 x 20 dead lawn area down to about 6 inches making a couple of passes at different angles in about 45 minutes. The handle folds for storage. This model costs about the same as 2 rentals and looks like it could last for years.

I received this cream for free and asked for an honest review.  I love the smell of lavender but don't get that from this cream.  The scent is nice but has a slight chemical or medicinal smell.  It feels cooling going on, and any stickiness goes away in a few minutes, leaving skin soft and moisturized.  After a week of use, my skin is looking softer but it's still quite lumpy, so I don't know that this product is much better than a good moisturizer.

This is a cute and colorful bag.  It comes with a stylus which seems an odd accessory.  The stylus works well though, and made me think that this would be a nice sized bag to carry a small tablet around, with spare room for a few other accessories.  Personally, I plan on using it to carry my lunch.  It's got ample size for a sandwich, piece of fruit or a drink.  I've only used it a few times, and have gotten compliments already.  The zipper works fine and the handles are comfortable.  I was sent this bag by the seller and asked to give an honest review.

I was prepared for the worst when I first tasted this Mushroom drink, but while delicious doesn't come to mind, it's not bad.  It's a bit gritty and it's hard to keep the powder from settling to the bottom.  When you think of the benefits of the ingredients though, you realize it's worth it to drink a glass.  You might try adding it to an ounce or two of pomegranate or cranberry juice, it adds nutrients and make it taste lots better. Not only is this a healthy drink, the fiber makes you feel full for a long time, and I try to drink it about an hour before dinner to curb my hearty appetite. I wish I could comment personally on the immune system boost that this product is supposed to provide, but research does indicate mushrooms have that quality, so I imagine it is dong my body good there too. Research also suggests that you take a break from immune boosters once in a while, so you might ask your doctor for an opinion there.

I have two baby grand daughters, so I was happy to try these washcloths which the seller sent to me for free to review.  I didn't expect any surprises but these are so exceptionally soft and easy on the skin and remain so, even after washing.  They are environmentally a good choice since they are made of bamboo, and I guess it's just hard to believe  that they would be so much softer than cotton, but they are. One of the babies has eczema and I could never use a washcloth on her face because it irritated her, but now i can use these without an issue.  These come nicely packaged and would make a great gift for a new mother.

I received the 12 Piece set with the Dot design 4 dinner plates, 4 salad plates and 4 bowls. This is very elegant china that can and is being used as an everyday set. I'm very happy with it's weight, lines and size of the pieces. In particular the salad plates are rather oversized at 9" diameter. I have boys that most of their food consumption comes from cereal, soups and salads so the size of the bowls are very convenient and practical.Lenox is a very well respect brand and this 12 piece set is no exception. My expectations prior to delivery were very high and I was not disappointed. The shape and thickness is what you would expect from a service set of china. The set very much aligns with our existing formal place settings.The quality of this is what you would expect of a Lenox product. I had no issues with the shipping and the packaging was well done. No damage to any of the 12 pieces during transport.

This is a nice time piece that has a very impressive look to it. The face of it is an oversized style with a very nice leather band. It was initially difficult to work the wrist clasp, which is the one thing I downgrade this watch for. I found the putting on and taking off of this watch rather clumsy because of the way the wrist band operates. With all of that said it is a very nice looking watch, comfortable and the operation of it is very easy. I was pretty excited when I first saw the watch box but unfortunately there was slight tear damage to the box which I assume happened during the shipping process. It wasn't enough to damage the watch itself but was somewhat disappointing.

Luxury,elegant, expensive, understated yet attention grabbing. Where to begin, I love this bag! Coworkers love this bag!  I have one woman who came into my office three times to run her hands over it and look it over. Just stunning.TUMI has outdone itself in designing a luxury daily use backpack that also makes traveling a breeze with a strap on the back to slip on the handle of your carry on. Doesn't matter how you adjust the straps, never is there anything loose hanging. The gold zippers on the three outer pockets are heavy duty quality with gorgeous added design . The long zippers for the laptop and larger inner compartment are hidden, waterproof not really visible. The tabs on the zippers are leather, the loop handle at the top of the bag is quality black leather. The straps are quilted padding only on inner side outer side being the same smooth black as the rest of the bag.Can be custom engraved with your details. Just understated elegance. Good job TUMI

Easy to set up and dogs use it----which is not always the case. I was concerned about it being a plastic bowl versus steel or ceramic but it wasn't an issue. So far so good! Saves me from constantly changing out the water. a+

High quality backpack that attracts attention. The first day I used it I was stopped and asked what the make is because the woman walking behind me liked it so much. So the feel is like a canvass cotton with a nylon bottom but the details - make this an exception. The flaps on the pocket are a different shade of green than the rest and on the straps there is two shades of green. Straps are comfortable, bag holds a lot but is not large or awkward. Opening the top flap there is a nylon drawstring keeping everything dry inside. Back laptop slot, middle pouch (which I use for my tablet) that holds my smaller electronics safe and the larger front portion which has a inner mesh zipper pocket on the inside front panel as well as lots of holders, pockets to put everything you need. Really nice bag.  Stands out as different.
Beautiful scarf with the low key mischka design.absolutely a gorgeous scarf.

Affordable large screen multi function smart phone. Touch sensitive, easy to use, loaded my tmobile SIM without any issues. Wonderful. Only negative e is camera, wish it was better. But overall for call quality, apps, texting and socialmedia A++

I'm not a huge fan of Mega Bloks but my boys love Halo and Mega Bloks has Halo. With the size and number of pieces to this item you can expect to spend a serious amount of time assembling it. I don't particularly like the way the Mega Bloks fit and are expected to stay together. Whenever I've worked on these in the past with my kids the pieces just don't seem to fit together and stay together very well rt they tend to come apart very easily when connecting multiple pieces. My boys love the small Halo action figures in this collection and sometimes I think that's all they really want out of it. I do like what the overall product looks like and it was a fun experience building it with my boys. As long as Mega Bloks has Halo this will not be my last one.

This is a very nice product. We have been using it for my youngest child to take his lunch to school and it works great. It has allowed us to get away from the frozen squares or disc that we have stashed in the freezer taking up too much space. The description claims that it will keep items cold for up to 10 hours as external temperatures have an effect. We live in the Pacific Northwest and for us this lunch bag will keep items cold for a much longer time. It doesn't take up a lot of room in the freezer when storing as it is rather compact when folded. I would guess that the only drawback is that this is strictly for carrying cold items and keeping food/drink cold. We sometimes like to send our little one with a hot dish or soup in a small thermos. I do very much like this product and will be getting a couple more real soon.

Beautiful sound from this Bose Speaker. I've been looking for just this type of system and it is phenomenal. It was easy to set up and is a very nice looking product. For our family it fits perfectly in our open kitchen area and provides us with unbelievable sound. I download the Bose SoundTouch phone app on my families android phones and have made it very easy to sync whatever myself or my family is interested in listening too. The Bluetooth connectivity is very sharp and the sound is what you would expect from a Bose product. This has just really opened up our home with the ease of having such a wonderful wireless speaker to play music throughout our home.

This all-in-one printer from Epson is great. I was replacing an older model Epson with this model. I was looking forward to using it based on the new style ink cartridges and filer method. With the way the ink is stored for this machine it makes it so much easier and less expensive to not only refill the ink but also allows for greater ink storage capacity and no changing out of ink cartridges. You are also able to monitor the amounts of ink remaining in the ink containers more easily. The set up of this machine was very quick, approximately 10 minutes. I was able to print documents from it right away and the copies looked great. I was able to get it to sync with my wireless internet and was ready to connect it to my desktop computers, laptop and was printing documents from my Android phone Epson iPrint app in no time at all. We use the copier, printer, scanner of our all-in ones at a fairly high volume for a normal household. So far this Epson Workforce ET-4550 is even better than I was expecting. The reason for the 4 stars is that I'm curious to see if the ink level will actually provide as many copies as indicated. If it prints out the type of numbers it's advertised than this will be upgraded to 5 stars and is definitely worthy of the rating.

Doesn't slip- 1st bonus. Wide 'shelves' and looks very nice. It's powder coated, no open seams or joins so I would be very surprised if this rusted down the line. Sturdy, easy to clean, holds everything securely, not at all cheap looking. A+

My family and I have used Belkin products before mostly as covers for our Kindle Fire's and this seemed like a nice product to try as an addition to the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 that we have. I have been looking at possibly purchasing a new laptop or just getting a keyboard for my Galaxy. I decided to try this keyboard case in hopes of getting something that would keep me from shelling out big money for a new laptop and just see what I could accomplish with this keyboard case. Hopping that this would cure me of wanting a new laptop. I was pleased with the design of the case and the keyboard itself was very sturdy even though it didn't seem to add much additional weight to the overall product. In other words, it didn't seem overly bulky or cumbersome.One of the issues that I had was that it didn't seem to pair very well with my tablet and connection kept dropping. Even though it started out as something I was very interested in and wanted to really be happy with it ended up rather disappointing. It does have a QWERTY keyboard with the functions of most laptop keyboards and the case itself fit very well. I was happy with how the case set up in the open position but when I was just using my Galaxy for reading I would just take it out of the case. Ultimately, even with some nice features,  I found that it was something that I really don't see myself using very much.

This is a great device with several use applications. I found it very easy to use both dry and in the shower when wet. It has 2 different head attachments that are easy to change out and are of different trimming lengths. I prefer to use it as a dry trimmer versus the wet or shower way. I'm really pleased that it is a battery powered device rather than a rechargeable one, i don't need or want another power/charge cord in the bathroom. I have several Philips Norelco products that I use and I'm very happy to add this one to the list. This is exactly what I was hoping for when I ordered it, which is always nice.

I was really looking forward to using this grill and see if it was a viable alternative for a propane grill or counter-top grill. There are many pros for this particular grill which I really like. First this is that it was very easy to assemble and easily transitions from the kitchen counter-top to the backyard or tailgate. It gets to temperature quickly and I was surprised at how much food can be grilled at one time. We used it on our kitchen island counter-top and it was easy to use and cooked our burgers and skewers very well. It is also very easy to clean and showed no initial signs that the coating will burn off or easily damage. As a tailgating or camping grill it is a nice alternative to propane or charcoal and if you have access to outlets or a generator it is much more travel friendly and easier to cool down and clean up. Some of the cons of this grill is that it is rather large and is not something that you would be able to leave out on your counter when not in use. The stand for outdoor use is plastic and doesn't seem very durable. In fact if camping or tailgating I would probably just set it on a table for use. Even though I was surprised at the amount of food that you can put on it at one time I don't see this as a grill that could crank out a large volume of food for a big group. But, if you're just using it for a few people it would be more than suitable. I'm a fan of the George Foreman grill products and this is a good one for my family of 6.

I have been looking to get a device like this for quite some time. When the opportunity presented itself, I jumped at the chance. As someone who is dealing with HBP this device makes it so easy. I couldn't be more pleased. It was easy to figure out and the smartphone app that pairs this device with my phone makes it so nice to be able to store and monitor my BP readings over a period of time for my physician to be able to see and for me to be able to monitor. Considering that it is a wrist device versus an upper arm device I was a little worried that I would be able to get true readings but it is a very accurate monitor and is so easy to use. Another good feature is that it comes in a small case that makes it easy to carry when and if I'm traveling. I would highly recommend this wrist product for anyone that needs a quick, easy and accurate way to monitor their blood pressure.

Really enjoyed this read and will look for more from these authors. Two Soldiers sheds light on the violent gang life in Sweden. I believe that the downvotes here are from people who look to connect with or even like characters in a novel, and this is not a pretty packaged read. I loaned this to a friend of mine who enjoys foreign reads and she disliked it because there was no one character that she liked and she found it depressing. I, on the other hand, loved it.

I'm always looking for new coffees, I'm not the type of person that finds one kind and sticks with it all the time. So, I was very interested in trying this brand of coffee. For an everyday coffee I prefer a medium roast and was looking forward to trying this blend. One thing that I don't like and I guess it's more of a Keurig issue than an issue with this particular coffee is that this type of k-cup does not work with the Keurig 2.0. Nowhere on the box does it say that it doesn't work with the 2.0. It does say on the amazon product page that it doesn't work with the 2.0. I have a Keurig 2.0 at home and keep my single serve Keurig at my office. The Cafejo K-Cups are well package and I've had no problem with unusable cups. Cafejo makes and offers a French Press specifically for their K-Cups. It seems like a good idea but it's not something I'm interested in right now.The coffee itself is just ok. Rather mellow for a medium roast, It didn't blow me away or make me want to go out and buy it. Given that I can only use it with one of my Keurigs doesn't make it something I have to have.

First of all I have used several EAS products both in the past and currently so I trust them to make quality products. I'm not a competitive athlete anymore, those days are long since over, but I like a good protein shake to give me a little extra that I might otherwise be lacking in my overall diet. I like the consistency and taste of this protein. It gives me what I'm looking for in a relatively low calorie and complete protein supplement. The packaging of this is different than most huge tubes of protein and the " scoop in lid" does make it a bit easier to use. Either way what I'm really looking for is what the product has in it, does it mix and taste good enough that I'll want to keep using and buying it. With that in mind I really like this protein powder. It mixes easily and has a good taste. I usually have all of my proteins in a vanilla flavor so that I can flavor it myself with fruits in my smoothies or just a plain old vanilla and water protein drink. Overall, I like this product very much, it doesn't make me feel bloated or sluggish and as a kind of meal replacement or snack during the day I found that gives me a nice boost.

Lightweight powerful hair dryer. Good cord length. Buttons on the handle were clicking off till I became used to it. Hair clips were useless, could not hold up even small section of hair, round acrylic brush is not something I would use with wet hair. Hairdryer itself I recommend.

Some reviewers had commented that the Ten-Eighty was really narrow----not the case. I was actually worried till it arrived but it turned out to be an awesome buy for the price. My five year old -it was his birthday present- was rolling across it on his scooter and his older brothers and neighborhood kids were flying across it on bikes, scooters and skateboards without an issue. Sturdy, quality product, more than met my expectations. Nothing cheap about it. Very Very happy with this purchase!
Bought to use with Pacon 5850 Kraft wrapping paper. Really added a beautiful unique touch to the presents. It's a large roll, great quality and will go far. A+

I bought this roll of Pacon Kraft Wrapping Paper because I had purchased a bunch of large hard to wrap items - as well as some small stuff - for my son's fifth birthday. So instead of spending a whole bunch of cash on decorative wrap, instead I bought rolls of different ribbons (jute ribbon looked great) and bows, even decorative duct tape. I received so many compliments, it was incredible.

This is not a thin velcro wallet which would make it difficult to fit in a child's pant's pocket. Ordered this for my five year old's birthday - his 11 yr old brothers both have slim velcro wallets- and it's ok. Not able to be carried in his pocket, not slim enough of a profile. But it's ok for now.

This is the same item that you can find for a dollar at the dollar store. The back of the bow is not even flat to tape to a package, it has a cheap circle back that would probably be next to impossible to attach to a package.

There was a less expensive model that was rated ok but I went ahead and bought the EatSmart Precision Pro because I wanted a scale that I could count on for my calorie reduced diet and the informational booklet was a bonus. I use this scale along with the myfitnesspal app to effectively track what I eat and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. Easy, easy, easy to use and accurate. A++

Ordered on Tuesday, delivered Saturday. Button looks way better than picture. Great quality, nothing low rent or crafty about this.  Purchased for my son's 5th birthday -he loves it- his 11 and 12 yr old brothers and their friends think it looks super cool and they all want one, which makes my little guy even happier. Really pleased, beyond met my expectations. Highly recommend and will purchase again.

Good suction - things go in and stay in - excellent battery life, easy to clean and empty. Charging stand/cradle made of flimsy lightweight plastic, so definitely use the provided screws to secure it in place. The design on the Black and Decker Max Pivot is pretty awesome, very easy to use to access awkward places, and the built in tool in the nozzle pulls out to narrow the suction for smaller areas. It folds in on itself to charge, has minimal space requirements to store. Overall A.

Regularly need an extra bed for guests? Order the JAY-BE Kingston and you'll be set. This is a quality folding bed that is an investment that will last for years. It arrived in a box inside of a box, perfect condition and was set up in under 20 minutes. The only things that needed to be attached were the headboard (two screws and tool included) and four spinning wheels that attached to the bottom of bed when folded to allow for easy moving from place to place, small wrench is needed, (instructions called for a spanner which I assume is the British term for a wrench) however I just finger tightened the wheels for now and they work fine.The bed folds in on itself with the headboard at the top and two side clips to keep it from opening. It is fairly compact but not narrow enough to be stored behind a bedroom door. All you need to do to set it up is pop off the clips and lower each end to the ground - legs fold out automatically, nothing suddenly drops, all very controlled. The mattress is not your typical cheap mattress, it is very comfortable, meets high environmental standards, has zero smell/odor and can be cleaned with the wipe of a cloth. The slats on the bed give great support and again are at a level of quality that I am surprised to see in a foldaway. I like the headboard, it keeps the pillows in place and takes it up a notch for guests. Also when folded the headboard is an extra flat narrow table if something needs to be placed, such as blankets, toiletries etc. I recommend buying the cover for the bed when not in use.

Fits well. All adjustable straps are secured in and just need to be sized to child's head. Comfortable. The coolest thing about the Captain America Marvel Super Soldier Helmet is the red lights around the eye holes, which is why my son when wearing it likes to gaze endlessly at himself in the mirror. The detachable side shooter sides on and off easily, and it's a 'meh' addition. We'll get the other add-ons and see if they add play value. Good quality, great mask.

This concealer comes in a container that looks and feels like a lipstick container. You use it in the same way. I think that is nice because you could easily carry it with you in your purse.I've found it easy to use and effective. I use it to cover up some "age spots" and blotches. I've used it with and without foundation and it works with either. It isn't super creamy so you do need to blend it in a bit. I have fairly light skin but it has blended in well -- doesn't look too light or too dark or "articifial."My experience has been that is lasts for the bulk of the day. If I apply it in the morning, I don't need to reapply throughout the day.If you're looking for a compact, easy to carry concealer that works well, this would be a good choice and worth trying. As with any make-up product, I think your results will vary depending on your skin tone and condition.

I've been using this case for about two weeks now and I like it. It is slimmer and less obtrusive than the other Otterbox cases I've used in the past, but it offers similar protection from drops. (At least I'm assuming that ... I've never had the guts to actually put any of the cases I've tested to an actual drop test since I don't want to find out they failed!) In the past, I've been frustrated by the Otterbox cases because -- although I want to protect my phone -- I feel like I lose all the lightweight slimness of the iPhone 6 design. (Honestly, there have been times I've removed my case and been shocked at just how thin and slim and light the iPhone 6 actually is.) But I recognize that I need a decent case to protect my phone. So far, this Otterbox has been the least obtrusive of their cases that I've tried.What I like:* Slim and lightweight design but with Otterbox protection* Clear in the back* Fits on iPhone 6 pretty seamlessly (camera and speakers aren't blocked; easy to access the "ringer" switch, headphone jack is open)* Easy to install and remove but snug on the phone itself* Bright color makes it easy to see* You can get a pretty good grip on it despite the fact that the sides are smooth and, at first glance, seemed like it would be "slippy. (No accidental drops yet.)What I Don't Like:* Although the case is "red," it feels like an orange red rather than a true red. I thought it would be more of a "bolder" red.* The case feels a little too much like "plastic." It doesn't have an "upscale" feel to it.Overall, I think it one of the most minimalistic Otterbox cases yet. Keep up the good work, Otterbox!

Our family is a huge fan of the Blue Orange "Spot It" games so we were eager to try this game. Although everyone thought it was "fun," we still prefer Spot It over Ring It! Part of the reason is that Spot It is more challenging so it ended up being more fun for us. However, if you are a family with younger children, this might be an easier game to play. However, it was a fun game that would probably be more fun in larger groups (we were playing with our family of three).A few observations:* My husband felt that someone could get hurt slapping down on the bell. (Note: My ultra-competitive husband was often the one slapping down on the bell very very hard so take that with a grain of salt. The bell is flat and plastic -- didn't seem like it could really hurt someone. The hurt would come from another ultra-competitive player slapping your hand in a race to ring the bell.)* If you have slow reflexes (like I do), you're going to be a serious disadvantage playing this game. I would often be getting ready to "clap and ring" and my husband or son was already done doing it. FRUSTRATING! (But all part of the fun.)* We played with a smaller group (3 players). We felt that smaller groups should deal out more cards than just 10 as the rounds went by too quickly.* We didn't play any of the suggested variations but I love how Blue Orange includes suggestions for other ways to play their games.Overall, a fun, fast-moving game that would be good for larger groups and parties. I would imagine you would have the best results if everyone is equal in the reflex department. ; )

This review was written by my husband since he was the one that used the shaver:* Uses regular batteries -- this is nice if using for travel becuase I don’t need to carry cord to recharge if it does dead. And, if needed, I can go out can purchase batteries anywhere* Foil cover will be easy to use* The switch takes a little pressure to turn on, but I'm concerned it might get turned on in travel. The travel razor I had previously had a sliding cover which prevented accidental turn on.* Nice and compact, would be better if it had a small trimmer as well. Good for travel shaver but I wouldn’t use this as my everyday shaver.4 Stars

I really wanted to love this vacuum but I think it fell short in a few areas, which kept me from really loving it. While I think it vacuums OK, at this point I think I actually prefer my old Hoover upright (which came with a small canister vac) to this one. Here's a few comments on what I found while using this product.* The user manual could definitely be better. The images are a muddy gray, and there were a few times when I felt a "close-up" of the area in question would have been helpful. For example, when they are telling you where to store the tools on the vacuum, I could barely make out which tool went where. A bit of detail (a photo/drawing of the tool and then an arrow pointing to where it should be stored) would have fixed this. In addition, nowhere in the manual did it show a photo/drawing of the different tools and tell you when and how to use them. This seems like important information. Also, when I went to look at the online instructions, they didn't have them for this particular model. Now I'm not sure if this is because this was a review product and the final manual will be better and the online instructions for this model just weren't posted yet, but this was a problem for me.* Tool placement wasn't intuitive and I found the tools kept falling off as I tried to vacuum. Now this isn't just this model -- I have this problem with every vacuum I've ever had that has multiple tools and tried to store them on the vacuum itself. I'd love to see a vacuum company master the art of storing tools securely on the vacuum! (If Hoover can't do it, then who can?) I did what I always do -- I removed the tools and put them in my "vacuum tool" drawer (with the tools from my steam cleaner). Most likely, I will forget about the tools and never use them but that is partly my fault and partly the manufacturer's fault for not mastering tool storage.* The vacuum seems to do a good job vaccuming so that is good (since that is what it is made for). However, I did think the width was smaller and narrower than other vacuums I've had, which made me feel like I was having to vacuum more.* The part where you step on the vacuum to pull it down so you can vacuum seems awkwardly placed and I always had to try it a few times before it worked. This was annoying!! A simple push lever in the back like other vacuums would have been better.* I tried using the dusting tool to clean my ceiling fan and felt the results were middling. It wasn't all that easy to use and I won't use it for that again -- I'll just use my Swiffer duster.* The dirt cup is easy to remove and empty. I like that you don't have to buy bags. This is a definite plus and one of the primary reasons to get this vacuum (or one like it).* You can easily clean and reuse the filter -- another plus.* You can turn off the brushroll when vacuuming hard floors, which is a nice feature. (However, I sometimes had a difficult time telling if I was turning the brushroll off or on when I pressed the button.)* You can remove the canister part of the vacuum and leave the "upright base" behind to use it to clean stairs. This was OK but I still found it more awkward to hold and carry than an actual small canister vacuum that is made to be portable. (Like I said, the Hoover Upright I have comes with a small canister vacuum and I just LOVE both of them. By the way, I have the Hoover Platinum Collection Lightweight Bagged Upright with Canister, UH30010COM. You might want to consider this version if you're looking at this one. It requires bags however.)* I didn't think this vacuum was super lightweight. It wasn't super heavy but I didn't think it was incredibly light either.* The cord is very long and I appreciate that.* The vacuum did maneuver pretty well, and I liked that it was small enough to fit under the edges of my kitchen cabinets.Overall, I would would have to say that I wasn't a super big fan of this vacuum. True -- you don't have to buy bags for it and it can function as a canister and an upright but like I said, I don't think it did either one well. I actually prefer my previous Hoover over this one. But if bagless is important to you, then I guess you might want to consider this one. For all the reasons I mentioned above, I'm giving it three stars.

We've been through a few outside furniture covers and I have high hopes for this one. (However, only going through a full winter or two will really reveal how good it is. I will try to remember to come back and update my review after it has been in use for awhile.)What I Like:* Material is more of a heavy canvas versus the "crinkly" like material that we had on previous covers (and are often found on grill covers). My experience with the "crinkly" covers is that they don't stand up well for a long time -- they tend to crack apart and reveal the soft insides. I think this heavy canvas will hold up much better becuase it can't "crack" open.* There were two buckle straps that you can use to attach the canvas to the chairs/table legs. This seems much more secure than the velcro straps that we had on our previous covers. (Note: It would be nice to have four buckle straps instead of two but I'll trust the manufacturer knows that two is more than enough.)* There are two bungee-type cords that you can use to pull the cover closed more securely at the bottom. I'd never seen that in a cover before so I thought it was nice touch.* There are air vents (really vents built into pockets ... they aren't on the outside so water could come in) built into the cover. I'm assuming this is to allow better ventilation and circulation and I thought it was a nice feature.* There are at least two handles sewn into the cover to help you lift and manage placement of the cover.* I like the two-toned tan cover -- much more attractive than the black or gray covers we've used in the past.* The design seems to be for a longer rectangular table but I was able to place it around our large round table with five chairs with no problems.Overall, I think this is an attractive, well-made cover with a good material that will last us a long time. As I said, the true test is time so I'll try to come back and update you on the condition of the cover after it has been in use for a full winter.

My main issue with the Triple Treater Totter (great name  by the way!) is that you are very limited in the type of treats that you can put into it. For it to work, you can only put in small, hard treats -- basically something like kibble. My dogs don't view kibble as a treat -- they like softer things like chews or Beggin' Strips. (Note: I tried to rip up these types of treats and use them in the Treater Totter but it just didn't work well at all.) The design is for small hard treats so I would recommend thinking about what you're going to put in this dog treat toy before you purchase it as not any treat will work.Other notes:* It comes fully assembled.* My dog was able to "master" getting the treats (despite the fact that I didn't have the right kind of treat).My recommendation is that if your dogs are used to getting small kibble-like treats, then this might be a good puzzle treat game for them. However, I had better luck with the multiple compartment dog puzzle that permits you to use any type of treat and makes your dog open a flap and then turn the tray to get to them. Not only do I think that type of puzzle is more "user-friendly" as far as treat types that can be used, but I think it is also more challenging if your goal is to give your dog a bit of intellectual stimulation.

NOTE: This review was written by my husband Scott, who handles the more "technical" reviews for me.The setup for the projector is pretty simple. I prefer using the included remote rather than the controls on the unit itself as they are more self-explanatory. This unit includes the VGA cord, but not an HDMI cable. There is also an extra little plastic piece that was in the package and was not listed on any contents or “what’s in the box” list. After skimming the manual, it turns out this is the holder for the optional wifi dongle that is not included. I am not sure why they include this and don’t mention it, it should just come with the optional dongle itself.I tried the computer output using both a Chromebook and an HDMI connection, and a Windows laptop with the standard VGA connection. Using the recommended 800 x 600 resolution, the picture and text look very good. It is sharp and bright, even in a lighted room. Once you begin increasing the resolution, the text quality begins to suffer.
