It is still readable, but I wouldn’t recommend using at more than the basic resolution, which should suffice for powerpoint presentations.I also tried the HDMI connection using an AppleTv. The text portions were not very clear, but the video picture was very good. This would be really good for watching movies or tv shows, and the sound came out of the unit itself. The sound was basic quality but good enough to watch a movie or show.I wouldn’t call this unit portable, but it is fairly light for its size. The instant off feature is good if you are constantly moving from location to location, although the side of the unit does get a little warm even with the fan running. The fan noise is not too loud.It comes with a quick setup guide which is enough to get you started. I did look the manual up online, but only to try and find out what that little plastic piece was. Other than that, there wasn’t a need for the full manual.This seems like a good entry level projector for business applications and also to be used watching movies or video.

This shelving system was incredibly easy to put together. No tools are required and even someone like me (who struggles with Ikea furniture) could assemble it without reading a manual.The material is a metal mesh -- very similar to the desk organizer I have on my desk. The openings in the mesh are fairly small so you could put smaller items on the shelves without worrying about them getting caught or falling through.The unit is a decent size for a small bookcase. Be sure to read the dimensions to ensure it will fit into the space that you want it. It is fairly "low" once it is set up so I think it would be possible to place this on top of a table and use it there instead of keeping it on the floor.You can set-up the bottom shelf to have two sliding file cabinet drawers. I was able to put my hanging folders in there with no troubles. The drawers do fit into some simple tracks but you could easily pull them out and remove them if you wanted.There is no way to anchor this to a wall so I make sure to load this carefully and keep it from getting too top heavy or bottom heavy as this is a fairly llightweight unit.Overall, if you're like this type of look (open black mesh) and want easy set-up, this would be a good option to consider for a small shelving unit. I think the best use might be in a small or home office.

This is a basic surge protector that had a featuresI hadn't seen in our other surge protectors -- a cover that slides over to cover the outlet holes if you aren't using them. (Seems like that is good for both safety and for dust!)The look is pretty basic and utilitarian (gray color ... looks like a regular surge protector). It provides you with 6 outlets but seemed shorter and more compact than our other 6-outlet surge protectors. This can be both a plus (great if you have a small area) and a minus (the more compact space might not work great if you have a lot of big bulky plugs as it might get crowded).There is a lot of technical information on the description that I can't speak to (I basically buy surge protectors because I need to plug in more stuff than my wall outlet lets me).The price is very affordable. All in all, if you're in the market for a basic surge protector, I don't think you can go wrong with this one.

We use vinyl gloves in our house quite frequently -- for weeding in the garden, picking up dog poop, working with cleaners/chemicals, painting, etc. So we go through a fair amount of vinyl gloves in a year, I'm sad to say.These gloves serve our needs perfectly. The XL size fit both my hands and my husband's hands (though they are loose and not skin-tight ... but we're not looking for skin-tight). They are durable (I wore them when doing a lot of weeding and they didn't rip until about an hour in and that is probably not a fair use of these gloves since they aren't "gardening gloves" per se). They don't make my hands too hot or sweaty. Neither of us had any kind of reaction to the gloves.In short, I think these gloves are a good value for the price and would meet the needs that outlined above. (By this I mean that we aren't using them for food preparation or anything medical. We just use them to protect our hands while doing household chores.)

The big thing about this printer is that it come with two years worth of ink. Now obviously I can't give an opinion on whether the ink really does last this long, but I will say that you get a TON of ink with the printer. So that is the headline .... now how does it work as a printer, scanner, copier, etc. Here is what I experienced during 24 days I've been testing and working on this review.SET-UP (** -- 2 stars): The actual physical set-up of the printer was easy and straightforward. The directions were easy to follow and I had no problem filling the ink tanks. Where we had problems was getting the printer (which is supposed to be able to print wirelessly) set-up on our home network. The big issue was that this printer requires a network that supports 2.4 GHz,. Now we have a dual band network that supports both 2.4 and 5.0 GHz. We even had them named as XXXFAMILY2.4 and XXXFAMILY.  However, this printer couldn't connect to the 2.4 GHz until we changed the SSID to be the same as the one for the 5.0 one (which seemed counterintuitive to me). This proved tricky to set-up, and I (as a layperson) couldn't make it happen. I had to have my husband (the computer expert in our family) step in and get involved because I don't know how to make changes to the router. (in fact, I hope I'm explaining this correctly from a technical standpoint.) Making this change to accommodate this printer then caused us to have to change other things that were already set-up. A real pain! It seemed to me like this printer should have been able to connect to the 2.4 GHz network that existed without us having to change the name. What was super annoying was that after we went to all this trouble, I discovered that this version of the printer doesn't offer Apple AirPrint like our other wireless printer.  (We're an Apple household with iPads and iMacs.) You have to use the Epson app, which just seemed to add another layer of difficulty to what should be easy to do. (And the app wasn't all that great.)  The fact that all the others printers in this Epson line do offer AirPrint seems ridiculous to me. Obviously Epson can do it so why withhold that aspect from this particular printer?SCANNING (*** -- 3 stars): I tested the scanner and it worked fairly easily but I don't think it is intuitive. To scan from the printer, you have to press the two copy buttons at the same time and it will automatically start scanning to your printer. (IF you don't scan often, I think it would be easy to forget this. There is a graphic that shows you on the printer but it would have been better to have the word SCAN as I didn't realize this was what the graphic meant at first.) However, the catch here is that it will only scan to a PDF file when you do this and you can't mess with the settings. You can scan using your computer's scanning software to get other formats. I wonder why it only scans to PDF? Lots of people scan photos and I think the option to get it as a JPG might actually be more useful to these people.COPYING (**** -- 4 stars): I tested copying and this part worked great. You can choose to scan in color or B&W. (At least here, the buttons were pretty intuitive -- the black and white copy button is in white and the color one is in green). I scanned a color document and it copied great in both modes and was fast.PRINTING (***- 3 stars): The printer prints fairly fast and the quality for regular printing (documents, etc.) was OK. We printed a few photos for test purposes and didn't think the Epson did as good a job as our Canon. We printed an 8x10 of a vacation photo and the one printed on the Epson had a "pinkish" hue to it (by this I mean the white clouds seemed a little pink when compared to the Canon-printed clouds). So, although the photos printed fairly well at first glance, when you compare the quality to another ink jet printer, the print quality seemed lacking.FINAL THOUGHTS: The big draw here is that you should potentially save LOTS of money on ink with this printer, which is a big deal. However, I think Epson could make some improvements to make the user experience better and should add the AirPrint capability to this printer too. Because we were given the "baseline" model to review for Vine, I'm wondering if it would be worth it to pay a bit more and get one of the higher end models (the ones that offer AirPrint and have more info on the printer itself) f you're going to order this printer for yourself. These printers might offer some of the capabilities that I feel were lacking on this printer. But as I only have this model to review, I would say that if saving money on printer ink is the primary issue for you, then consider this printer seriously. However, if other factors are more important (quality of photo printing, scanning, easy wireless printing from tablets/phones), then I might not go for this printer but consider a different one or a higher level one in this same line.After averaging all my stars out, I think this printer gets 3 stars but I would hope that the higher end ones might be worth 4 or even 5.

When I saw this product come up in my Amazon Vine queue, I knew I had to try it. Stinky poops are a major issue in our household, and this seemed like a godsend. When I told my husband about it, he said he'd heard about it on the Howard Stern show and they seemed to like the product. If you don't know, this is a spray that you spray into the toilet BEFORE you go. It then keeps the smell of your business from wafting out and disgusting others. A few sprays before you go is all you need.Well, Poo-Pourri definitely seems to work! We have some major stinkers in this household, and as we've been testing the product all week, we haven't smelled a single horrible foul smell after they've "dropped kids at the pool." All you smell is the Poo-Pourri.Which brings me to my next comment -- the smell of Poo-Pourri itself is kind of strong. (At least this particular scent -- Lavender Vanilla--is.) And the thing about this scent is that NONE of us particularly liked it all that much. My husband and I definitely preferred the scent over the scent of a foul-smelling crap, but my 11-year-old son actually said he would rather smell poop! To be honest, it is so strong and cloying in a way that it kind of turns me off.  he strong smell of Poo-Pourri itself also makes me wonder if you're totally advertising what you're doing in the bathroom anyway -- just with a different kind of almost unpleasant smell. So there is that to consider too.I decided that I liked the concept of the product enough to order another scent. Perhaps the Lavender Vanilla is just not a good fit for our family, and another Poo-Pourri scent will be more agreeable. If anyone reads this review and has a suggestion, please let me know if another Poo-Pourri scent was more palatable for you. I placed an order for the original scent, which I believe is more citrusy. I'm hoping it will be less cloying than the scent of vanilla mixed with lavender.UPDATE TO REVIEW: Since my initial review, I've tried three more Poo Pourri scents -- Rose Geranium (much lighter floral smell), Juniper Woods (attractive woodsy smell) and Original (citrusy). All three scents were MUCH better than the Lavender Vanilla and I think we shall stick with these in the future. Of the four scents we've tried, I would choose Juniper Woods as my favorite. Therefore, my recommendation would now be "This Product Works But Find the Scent You LIke."

It is a testament to Sarah Vowell that she can keep me interested in reading a book about something I have little or no interest in -- in the case of this book, the Marquis de Lafayette and his contributions to the American Revolution.Vowell's snarky, fresh writing on what I would consider "dry" historical topics is what keeps me coming back to her books over and over. This was one of the first books where I read the  book instead of listened to it on audio, and I was concerned that I would miss her idiosyncratic voice. I'm glad to report that her voice comes through on the printed page. (But perhaps it helps to have "heard" her before.) I was happy to see her opinions, modern-day observations and wit intact. As they say "a spoonful of sugar makes the medicine go down." For me, history always needs a dose of sugar -- and writers like Vowell and Bill Bryson are my "historians of choice."What I got most from this book is a better sense of what the patriots that fought in the American Revolution were like and what they were up against. I felt like I was really taken "inside" these people's heads. George Washington became a real person for me when reading this book. Nothing like reading snippets of someone's letters to give you sense of their personality. And the hardships that the Continental Army faced became less abstract and more real. After all, Vowell's description of bloody footprints on snow provide you with a better sense of what the patriots at Valley Forge experienced versus a textbook saying "It was cold and difficult for the troops that winter."As my son gets older and begins to study U.S. history in greater detail, I plan to give him Vowell's books as a way to get history presented to him more in-depth and fascinating way.Bottom Line: If you'e a Vowell fan, you'll enjoy this. If you've never tried her before, give it a go. Not only will you truly get a glimpse at our country's history in a meaningful and interesting way, you'll be entertained too.

This may be the easiest product I've ever had to review -- my dogs LOVED these right out of bag. (And they are PICKY about their treats.)  Loved them so much that they sat and barked at the spot where the bag was put away until I gave them another one. These treats seem almost "human" quality (if you like Slim Jims, these might actually be tempting to you.) The ingredients are Beef, Salt, Sugar, Citric Acid, Cultured Dextrose, Paprika (for color), black pepper and garlic powder. That's it! (Note: As I'm writing this and looking at the bag, my dogs are sniffing and begging for them.) Yes they are a little pricy, but if you adore your dogs, these might be a treat that you give them once a week. Or even split between smaller dogs as a way to extend the bag. Bottom line: Your dog will thank you for getting these!!The only possible downside is that my dogs seemed a bit gassy afterwards but they are gassy ALOT so it might not have anything to do with these treats.

INSTALLATION: Fairly easy overall. However, two problems. 1) One of the screws they provide to hang the rail was unusable (no head on it to screw in). 2) We hung the rail in our garage, which has studs that are 16" apart. With the 32" length of the rail, this made it difficult to center the rail on the studs. We wished the rail had been a little bit longer (maybe 34"?) to better center the rail on the studs.USE: The rail looks good when mounted and seemed quite sturdy. Using the starter package of hooks/bins, etc., we hung a stepladder, a level, a few tools, and a bin of light bulbs on the one railing. It seems like it would be fairly easy to install another rail and keep on going if we need more room in the future.OVERALL: This seems like a viable storage solution for garages or sheds. It would be easily customized to fit your needs. Though there were a few small hiccups, it seemed like a quality product.  As for the price,  it seems a bit high for only one rail. But if you need storage system that is flexible and can adapt to your needs, this seems like it would do the trick. I haven't compared it to other systems however so I'm not sure how this compares in terms of price.

This laminator is wonderful for someone who needs to laminate basic items that don't exceed 8.5" x 11". It doesn't take up much space (the cord tucks away under the unit when not in use), warms up quickly (it took mine 3 minute and 52 seconds to warm up), operates quietly and does a great job. I laminated several sets of maps (two 8.5 x 11 pages laminated back to back) for an upcoming trip and was able to get the laminator up and running within minutes. The laminator did a wonderful job -- the seal is tight and the job was done quickly. What more could you want? The laminator comes with two pouches, and we ordered a set of 50 more via Amazon for the low price of $9.99. So if you're looking for a compact, efficient laminator for personal use, this would be an excellent choice.

This kit gives you everything you need to make 36 s'mores -- a bag of standard size marshmallows, four packs of graham crackers (9 crackers in each), and 18 full-size Hershey Bars. Now of course you can buy all this stuff individually (and most likely cheaper), but I like the convenience of getting this kit (I buy 2 or 3 every summer) and keeping it in the pantry until it is "S'mores" time and knowing that I have everything I need in the box. If you're like me and often forget what you have on hand, this kit ensures you have it all ready to go for whenever you need it. Like I said, I usually buy one at the start of the summer and then replace it about midway through. (We usually only do s'mores about 2 to 3 times in the summer/fall.) And we've never once felt like we didn't have enough stuff and ran out. 36 s'mores is more than enough for most families ... and if you need to make more, then just buy a few kits. Another plus is that if you are taking this camping, it all fits conveniently together and doesn't squash the crackers or the marshmallows.I usually buy this in my local store and this was my first time getting it from Amazon. I didn't have a problem with the chocolate bars melting but I could see that this might be an issue.Also, I didn't go and price out each component and compare if it is cheaper to buy everything individually (though I imagine it would be). Basically, you are buying convenience by getting this in "box form." It isn't something I buy often but I usually get a few each summer and keep them on hand for the inevitable s'mores request.

Wow ... this is one small fan!! I thought it was going to be bigger and was suprised by how tiny it is. It isn't much taller than a coffee mug. And, with only one speed, it isn't super powerful. However, if you just plan on using it close by (like on your desk ... running off your USB slot on your computer), I can see it being effective. It gives off enough air to cool you down in the face/neck area if it is just a few inches away. It is also fairly quiet and can be adjusted easily. And it doesn't take up a lot of room.It runs off batteries or a USB (and it can be plugged into your own USB AC adaptor like the ones that come with Apple products). I didn't use the batteries but other reviews seem to indicate that the battery area isn't well constructed so if you plan on using it with batteries, read other reviews. I used it running via the USB and plugging it into the adapter I got with my Apple products.In short, if you need a small quiet fan to cool you off while working near your computer or workstation, this fan would probably do the trick. However, I don't see it effectively cooling off more than one person or your whole body (for example, I can't imagine it being powerful enough to cool me down while sleeping).

This is a CLASSY looking phone case. You'd never guess it was an Otterbox by looking at it. The fit and finish of the case are very well done. It fits my iPhone 6 like a glove and all the controls are easily accessible. I like that it has a little card slot in the front folio. However, you really can't fit more than 2 cards in there and if you put more than one card in, it starts to get hard to close the case. The front of the case stays shut nicely with the magnetic latch. I think this is perfect when you just want to carry your phone and your ID and maybe a credit card. The color is a nice burgundy like reddish brown that I found very attractive. It does add weight to your phone (obviously) but most protective cases like Otterboxes do. My husband decided not to use it for that reason (he likes very slim, light cases) while I didn't mind it. I like that the front of the phone is protected but without having to put those annoying screen protectors on. However, it can be difficult to take a photo with one hand with the cover flap open -- another issue that my husband had. However, if you're looking for an attractive looking case that offer Otterbox protection, this would do the trick nicely.One note: I'm a little leery of keeping my credit card in the card slot with the magnetic latch. Would it mess with the information on the card? I'm assuming they tested that it wasn't a problem but it still gives me pause and I prefer to keep "non-essential" cards or ones with information on them in the case. That is really the only drawback that I found.

I remember this program from AGES ago (perhaps back in the 1980s??). It was the program that taught my father to type ... and that is saying something as he was a hunt and peck typist for years and years before learning to type from this program. So when I realized that my 10-year-old son probably needed to learn how to type (I guess it isn't a high school skill anymore like it was when I was in school), I was thrilled to see that good old Mavis Beacon is still around to help him out too.The program has undergone some updates since my dad used it (as is to be expected), but I suspect that the basic method is still the same (although I can't say for sure since I don't have my dad's old copy of Mavis Beacon ... nor do I think we have a computer that could run it.) This version is very customizable (there are user settings up the wazoo that you can set to your liking) and it walks you thought the basics of learning how to type. The box says you can learn how to type in just 8 hours and I can't say I know this is true as my son hasn't had a chance to start using this program yet due to the large amounts of homework that 5th grade seems to require. However, once he has a chance to start using it and learning how to type, I will try to remember to come back and update my review and let you know how it goes.As it is, I tried out the program for myself so I could write this review. However, it is hard to assess a learn to type program when you already know how to type. It really needs to be done with a novice typist. What I did see was impressive though. There are videos you can play, audio prompts, screen shots that show you the keyboard and lots of other aids that make using this program seem very similar to being in a classroom environment. I liked that it covers posture as well as the basics of keyboarding. I like that you can customize the program to how you like to learn. For example, if you don't want the audio prompts, you can turn it off.Overall, I think this is  quality program that I know has been around for a long long time. One of the reasons it is still around is because it works. After all, if Mavis can teach my dad, she can teach anyone!

This kit was super well-organized.  Each project comes in its own little clear bag (except for the items that are too big to include and the tape), which makes it easy to find exactly what you need. There is even a little sticker of the finished product on the bag so you know exactly what project is inside.The instruction pamphlet is easy to follow -- large colorful pictures show you exactly what needs to be done. All supplies are included so you don't need to find anything else to make the crafts.There are 9 different projects included in the kit -- ranging from a banner to a crown to several animal crafts. My 10-year-old son made two of the proejcts himself--the Lion and the Lizard/Dino. He was able to follow the instructions on his own and make the crafts independently. They both came out wonderfully and looked very similar to the photos. He was quite pleased with himself that he could do these projects by himself and follow the instructions -- a big deal for him. Although the kit is geared to preschoolers, he quite enjoyed working on the projects so I think the kit could be used by any craft-minded child aged 10 or under.I thought this was a wonderful craft kit that was well-organized and put together. What more can you ask for?

I've been searching for a shower caddy that has all the features I'm looking for, and although this one has many of the features I want, it still falls short. Here is a list of the pros and the cons:THE PROS* Lots of room to store multiple bottles of shampoo/conditioner, shaving cream, etc. This was always a problem with other caddies we've used as we couldn't fit my husband's stuff and my stuff in the same caddy.* Several hooks for hanging accessories -- like razors and loofahs. You can never have enough hooks. (Well, I like at least 2 to 4.)* Attractive finish (not cheap looking chrome ... as for resistance to rust, I would have to use it longer to determine this)* Includes a suction cup to help secure the caddy to the shower wall.THE CONS* No flat area to store your soap!! (This is a major problem for me ... it seems like a major oversight. They could have replaced the last set of bottle areas and made a flat shelf)* All the container areas are slanted to the side -- which works OK for ones you pour out but maybe not so well for "pump-style" shampoo bottles. Again, this would be solved by having a flat shelf on the top.The bottom line is that this caddy coud use some flat shelving in addition to the slanted slots used to store bottles.Basically, it is an attractive caddy that can store numerous

Because I am not a technical person, the following review was written by my husband:This review is for the TP-LINK AC1750 Model Archer C8. Opening the box, this router has a larger footprint and was about 3 times heavier than my current router (Linksys E2500). It is also designed to be upright with 3 antennas at the top, so it is more noticeable than the E2500 which is black and lies flat.The setup was very easy. I somewhat followed the quick installation guide, but the instructions didn’t quite match, where you had to change tabs for the quick setup, and they didn’t say that for those that are less technical.I checked for new firmware and updated to the latest version. It does says you may lose some configurations, but I didn’t realize I would lose all my settings for SSID, password, etc. I recommend upgrading the firmware prior to changing any of the default settings.This router has a guest network, which I like better than the one on the E2500. For this router you access the guest network just like any other wireless network, for the E2500, you needed to enter the password in an HTML screen which was a little confusing for some of my guests.Here are some unscientific performance information I gathered to compare this router to my E2500 using my MACs wireless diagnostics.  RSSI  NOISEE2500 5GHZ  -73  -88ARCHER C8 5 GHZ  -57  -92E2500 2.4 GHZ  -47  -84ARCHER C8 2.4 GHZ  -41  -85The MAC indicated the E2500 signal quality was GOOD, the Archer EXCELLENT.I copied 5 Simpsons episodes (about 1.39GB total) from one MAC to another MAC.E2500  7 Minutes 21 SecondsArcher C8 1  Minute 55 SecondsOverall I am pleased with this router. I had never heard of TP-LINK before but it was easy to setup, and has what seems like good performance.

Our first exposure to the Spot It! games was with the "regular" version that has pictures only (http://www.amazon.com/Blue-Orange-00411-Spot-It/dp/B0039S7NO6/ref=cm_cr-mr-title). I was curious to see how this "word and pictures" version varied. My verdict? It is MUCH HARDER!! Your brain has to work on two levels as the one match could be picture/picture, word/word, or word/picture. (It was surprising to see that this was rated for younger age by a year as this version is more challenging.)The game was still as much fun but definitely added another layer of challenge to the game. Do you need to know Disney Princesses to play the game? No ... but it sure helps as we all repeatedly found ourselves calling out "That girl ... with the blond hair." (And then the Disney Princes expert at the table would sigh in exasperation "That is Rapunzel.")The Bottom Line:* Spot It is an awesome game and I highly recommend it -- tons of fun and flexible* This version of Spot It was more challenging because it includes words and pictures -- adding a new layer of challenge* It helps to know the Disney Princesses but isn't required to enjoy and play; however, this version would have more appeal to someone who IS interested or knowledgeable about Disney Princesses. There are more themed versions of Spot It so if the Disney Princesses aren't your thing, check out the other themes available.Final thought: It occurs to me that if you are playing with younger children/girls, this might give them a bit of an advantage over any non-Princessy adults, which might not be a bad thing to "level" the playing field for a family game with the a gap between different ages/genders.

When we first got this game, I thought it was going to be too simple and easy and it seemed like a waste. Boy was I wrong!!! When we played it for the first time at a family gathering, we had SO MUCH FUN! At points, three of us were laughing so hard that we couldn't see. Then, as we read through the directions and saw different variations on how to play, I realized how the most simple games can be the most rewarding and fun.The concept is easy: You get a tin of 55 cards. Each card has about 8 pictures on it. Any card is ONE (and only one) match with any other card. The goal is simply to be the first to find the match between the two cards. Sounds simple, right? Almost too simple. Well, when put into action, the game becomes a ton of fun.When we played, it turned out my husband was some kind robot who could immediately find the match between his card and the others. The rest of us were screaming and trying to find a match -- often with hilarious results (witness my own attempt to get out "little orange man" that came out "bibble man orange" in a crazy voice or my son's brief but hilarious "baby bottle" run that netted him three cards in a row.) All the adults thought it would make a GREAT drinking game ... and we started coming up with our own rules. (If you call out something you don't have or is not on the card, you have to give back one of your cards, etc.)There are a few different ways to play:* flip over 2 cards at a time, whoever spots the match between them get the cards, most cards at end wins* everyone gets a card, one person flips over the rest of the cards one at a time, first person to spot the match between their card and the card in the middle get the card, most cards at end wins* deal out all the cards to whoever is playing and put one card in the middle. Players look at their cards one a time. First play who find the match between their card and the middle card puts their card in the middle and now that is the card you match. First player to get rid of their cards wins.I would highly recommend this for a party game. It is fun, changes with every play, and can be played by anyone. We played with a mixed group of kids and adults and the kids held their own and the adults found it more challenging than they thought. We  saw there are different versions of the game so look around to find the one that might fit your particular needs/interests. However, I don't think you could go wrong with this game. SOOOO FUN!

If you're not great with math (like me), you'll find the electronic scoring device to be very helpful and handy. However, it is the only thing that is "improved" or "better" about this version.First off, electronic scoring doesn't mean the board or tiles calculate your score automatically. (When I told my son I was trying Electronic Scrabble, he thought the board would be electronic and you would place your "smart" tiles on the board and it would calculate your score, etc. And, to be honest, I think this would be a TRUE version of electronic scrabble for people who still want to play the game as a "board game" but without all the pesky figuring out of scores.)  Electronic scoring for this game means a small handheld device (runs on two batteries) that allows you to keep scores for up to 4 players. The unit is easy to learn how to use and easy to set up. You simply indicate how many players and turn the wheel at the bottom to add or subtract points for a player. When you hit the check button, it adds or subtracts the score automatically. If you make a mistake (as we did during our test games), you can go back and fix it. (Though I think you could only go back to the previous player.) The device also includes a timer that allows you to keep the game moving by having a 60-second timer that starts to beep to keep game play moving along. (People taking FOREVER to play their tiles is a pet peeve of mine so I appreciated this feature -- which we only started using once game play started to slow down.) The device shows a star when someone has the highest word score so far in the game, and it shows who had the highest word score at the end of the game. I thought the device was nifty and handy but if you don't have a problem keeping score the "old-fashioned" way, there is no real reason to purchase this version of the game.Other than the handheld device, the only real changes were the color and feel of the letter tiles (red and plastic vs. brown and wood). Everyone who was playing the game with me preferred the "old school" wooden tiles and felt the plastic ones felt flimsy and insubstantial but it certainly didn't prevent us from playing the game and we all "got used" to them.However, my opinion is that this is only worth buying if you really hate to keep score during a Scrabble game and want an easier way to do it. Otherwise, there is no other substantial reason to purchase this version of the game.

I often feel like I'm replacing batteries every few days -- either for the video game controllers, a wireless computer mouse or keyboard, a board game buzzer. Since I try to be environmentally-friendly and budget-conscious, I always feel a twinge of guilt for how fast we go through AA and AAA batteries. Although I tried rechargable batteries in the past, it felt like it wasn't good to keep them plugged in and ready to charge all the time. So when I saw this Intelligent Battery Charger, I knew I had to try it.The unit itself is quite compact and we keep it on our "charging" table (where we plug in all our phones/tablets to be charged). The unit fits right in there without taking up too much space. It can fit either AA or AAA batteries (which is what we use about 99.9% of the time --- although you can get an adaptor for C and D batteries if this is what you use the most). Basically, you put the batteries in and they charge and the display indicates when the batteries are full by saying "FULL" on the display screen. EASY! Best of all, the unit features technology to keep things from overheating so you can just leave the batteries in there full-time without worrying. I like that as there are always batteries ready to go. I used a cute little box to store the rechargeable batteries in and place it next to the charger so I know where all the batteries are. I keep uncharged ones in a baggie and charged ones loose in a box. (You do have to buy your own rechargeable batteries ... I picked up a pack of 10 AAs and 2 AAAs from Sam's Club for about $20.)The manual is not the most user-friendly but the unit is user-intuitive and even a non-technical person like myself could set things up easily and quickly. There is a diagram for optimum placement if you are only charging 2 batteries so I appreciated that.Bottom line is that if you want to start using rechargeable batteries, this intelligent charger does a nice job of providing a worry-free to keep them charged and ready to go at a moment's notice. If you can get a discounted rate (Amazon is currently listing it for $30.99 instead of the retail price of $50), I think this would be a no-brainer purchase. I'm thrilled with it and am glad to feel like I'm being more environmentally friendly with the use of this product.

We literally "road-tested" this item on a recent 1,200-mile road trip and it worked perfectly! On long road trips, there was always competition about who would get to charge their rapidly depleting device. With this charger, both my husband and I could conveniently charge our iPhones and/or iPads to keep the electronics working throughout the trip -- essential for providing entertainment options for everyone in the family (audiobooks for me, movies for my son/husband, and several travel game apps). We were able to charge both our iPhones 5 with the charger with no problem -- and it charged up my husband's iPad Air as well. Charging didn't seem slower because it was charging two iPhones at once either.The charger plugs into a cigarette lighter so make sure you have one available before purchasing. Also, the charger only comes with ONE charging cord (USB on one end and lightning connector on the other). You will have to use one of the USB connectors you got with your device to charge the second device. (I imagine this shouldn't be a problem for most people. Another option is to purchase a second connector if needed.)Before purchasing, be sure to verify that the charger is compatible with your specific devices.Because my husband was paranoid that the device might drain the battery if plugged in all the time, we removed the charger from the cigarette lighter at rest stops/meal breaks, etc.Overall, we found this a very helpful tool for keeping two devices charged up on a long car trip. Highly recommended.

Here is a list of observations gained while using this camera over the course of 2 to 3 weeks.* Camera unit was bigger than anticipated. I'd estimate the camera part is about the size of a softball (versus the size of baseball that I expected). (It might even be grapefruit size.)* The power cord is nice and long.* You can hang it on the wall but you would need to hang it pretty high as the camera only tilts down and not out.* It was easy to switch the camera ring to blue or pink depending on what you prefer.* You have to create a MyD-Link account to use the app but it was an easy process. In fact, the entire set-up was easy and painless.* It is somewhat difficult to use the focus wheel because you have to hold the camera to adjust it and it can difficult to see what is happening on the screen while working the camera.* The time on the camera view is five hours ahead even though we synced the camera multiple times and the setting time shows up correctly This is quite aggravating and makes it hard to figure out what the actual time is that something was filmed.* The picture is decent -- you can tell what is going on and it isn't fuzzy. If you require a super clear picture, then you'd probably want the HD versus the SD.* Night vision is in black and white -- not "green."* Motion sensing and sound sensing both worked fine.* Was able to record video on to an SD card when camera was activated by motion. However, due to problem with the time setting mentioned above, it was difficult to tell when something happened.* The lullaby and talking function worked fine -- with a lag time of about 25 to 30 seconds.* So far, we've always been able to view the "live view" of the camera using the app without any problems -- despite being far from home or in the car.Overall I would recommend this camera -- the only real problem was the time setting, which we found very frustrating that we were unable to fix. Should note that we use this to observe our dogs when we aren't home and not a baby. However, we don't see why it wouldn't work excellently as a baby monitor. Could also be used as a low level security camera in a house if you wanted.***** ADDENDUM TO REVIEW: A few months after writing this review, my husband stumbled on the reason why the time was 5 hours off. Apparently, you have to set your time on your mobile device to the MAJOR CITY in the time zone you want. We had it set to Philadelphia and it didn't recognize this. When we changed it to New York City, the camera's time issue resolved immediately.

I'm always making my own homemade labels for my son's stuff (using regular labels and putting shipping tape on top)  so I was anxious to see if these work. So far, I've found that they do what they say they will do. I put a few on my son's water bottles for camp and they are still on, still legible and adhering fine -- despite being through the dishwasher a few times already. If you're looking for a label for your kid's stuff, this would be perfect. I've only used it on plastic things and not fabric so I can't speak to how it would work on clothing or bags but it works great on water bottles and metal Thermoses.

What I Like:* Clear plastic lets you put important information under it so you can see it for easy reference without having it get in the way* Size is perfect for a regular desktop -- not too big and not too small.* Allows me to write on my desk without getting groove marks in the wood (a problem for me -- a "heavy" writer.)What I Don't Like:* It doesn't stay in place and easily moves all around. I thought the product description said it was non-skid but I didn't find that to be so -- despite trying it on both sides. This keeps it from being a 4-star or even a 5-star product.

First of all, a disclaimer: I am not an expert in tee ball or baseball or anything. I'm just a mom whose son expressed an interest in baseball so I accepted this tee for review from Amazon Vine. So this review will be written from that point of view.First off, the tee didn't come with any instructions for set-up. Although it was relatively easy to set-up, there were a few things I was unclear about -- how to tighten the thing on the bottom that keeps the base attached to the tee and how to adjust the tee up and down so it doesn't slip. I went on the SKLZ web site and there were no instructions there either. You have to email customer service for it. I'm a big believer that all products should come with instructions regardless of how simple the product. Companies should assume the worst -- like a mom who has no inherent mechanical skill whatsover.As far as I could tell, the tee seems pretty sturdy and durable. It feels substantial. I do like that it comes with a compact little bag and can be easily folded away for storage or transport.As far as usage, I used the tee with 2 10-year-old boys and myself. We each hit about 40 balls off of the tee. It worked well for the most part, but near the end when it was being hit quite a few times, the tee part (the fabric part where the ball rests) kept flying off. It didn't seem to me like that was supposed to happen -- but like I said, I'm not an expert in tees so I wasn't sure if this was normal or not. Since the tee part just rests on top of the pole, it seems like this would happen quite often if you're hitting the tee and not the ball (as can happen with new hitters.)  The tee also got knocked down a few times but that is to be expected.Overall, it seems like a decent tee. However, I'm not sure whether it is worth the price and what other tees are like in comparison. It does seem like it would last for a long time but do expect that the top tee part to come off. Whether the fabric will unroll remains to be seen.

This dry erase "learn to write letters and numbers" board is well designed, sturdy and very helpful. The size is large enough that beginning writers have enough space to write but isn't so large that it is too bulky. I like that there are a mix of "learning" pages (graphics on how to draw upper and lowercase letters and numbers with the diagrams and arrows found in instructional writing books) and "open-ended" pages (where children are asked to write a few sentences and draw). There is one page focused on simple addition, and a page devoted to drawing shapes. (The shape page has a neat little area where children are asked to make a fun picture with the shapes you just learned -- some examples are provided on the left to get them started.) This combination of creative and open-ended mixed with instruction makes this an interesting and versatile teaching tool. The board comes with a black dry erase marker, but I would recommend getting a few colors to make it more interesting for the children. Overall, a well-designed and constructed learning tool that would be wonderful for beginning writers and artists.

When I married my husband, I didn't have any preference for dishwashing detergent -- I just bought whatever was on sale or smelled nice or hit my fancy at the time. My husband, however, grew up in a "Dawn household" and insisted that it was what we had to use. Not caring much one way or the other, I agreed. Since then, I have become a Dawn devotee as well. It cleans really well, doesn't hurt your hands, and comes in a variety of scents and colors with attractive bottles. Best of all, if I burn something or have a tough pan to clean, I know that I can just soak it in Dawn and it will come right off. Plus I like that it is gentle enough to use to clean oil off of animals, which you can read about on some of the marked Dawn bottles.

Marisa de los Santos is one of my favorite writers, so I was excited to check out this collaboration with her husband. Lucas Biggs is a corrupt judge who has just sentenced Margaret O'Malley's father to death for a crime he didn't commit. His true crime? Daring to blow the whistle on the corrupt Victory Fuels Corporation, which runs the "company town" of Victory, Arizona. Determined to help save her father, Margaret decides to use her family's gift for time travel -- despite her vow of forswearing (a promise never to travel in time.) However, desperate times cause for desperate measures and Margaret takes a chance and travels back to 1938 Victory, Arizona in an attempt to stop the event that caused Lucas Biggs to start down his path to corruption.Each chapter takes place in a different time and has a different narrator -- Margaret and her friend Charlie in 2014 and Grandpa Joshua and Margaret in 1938. (Grandpa Joshua is Charlie's grandfather and a childhood friend of Lucas Biggs.) I enjoyed the flipping back and forth between times as both stories are developed slowly and reveal a bit more of the puzzle of what happened that turned Lucas Biggs into the person he became. Some parts were a bit choppy and confusing -- mostly in the 1938 sections narrated by Joshua. I felt a bit disoriented about his story sometimes so I suspect middle grade readers would as well. However, overall the positives outweigh the negatives and I think it is fine addition to the time travel genre.As for the time travel itself, I thought it was handled really well. The description of how time travel works and the effects it has on those who practice it are described creatively and wonderfully. Also, the fact that time travel has severe consequences was a good message. In fact, the repeated statement that "history resists" reminded me of Stephen King's excellent 11/22/63, which also dealt with time travel and is one of my favorite examples of the genre.If you're looking for a smart, well-written time travel book for your middle grade reader, I think this would be an excellent choice. I plan on giving it to my 9-year-old son to read and I'll have to come back and let you know what he thought of it.

There is nothing super special about these binders that I haven't seen elsewhere. I do appreciate the easy open hinge and the ability to put your own custom covers and spine inserts. However, the plastic covering felt a little "cheaper" to me than other brands. If you're in the market for an all-around decent 3-ring binder, this would be a good choice but it doesn't offer anything that isn't available elsewhere.

This is a fun book that is focused on inspiring girls to consider pursuing science -- though it is done in a very low-key and interesting way that won't necessarily make them realize they are being "positively influenced." My 9-year-old son read it with me and found it enjoyable -- though he thought a better title would have been "My Teenage Grandpa." That is because that is the fun "hook" of this book. Ellie is an 11-year-old girl who is having some difficulty adjusting to middle school life. Her best friend seems to have developed interests that don't include her and now her mother has brought home an annoying teenage boy to live with them. But something about this teenage boy is quite familiar -- and he doesn't necessarily ACT like a teenage boy. He acts, in fact, like her crotchety scientist grandfather.Told in the first-person, the book is a fun, easy read that kept my reluctant reader son interested. When I asked him what the best parts were, he said "the parts about science." Mission accomplished! I think this would be a worthwhile middle grade reader for boys and girls alike, but I think girls might get a bit more out of it than boys.A Note: Ellie's parents are divorced and both parents have creative careers in theater -- a pursuit holds little appeal to Ellie. The divorce is handled matter-of-factly and there is no real tension between Ellie's parents, who are quite friendly and amicable. This is in keeping with the light-hearted, slightly madcap aspect of the book (though there is an occasional focus on some deeper themes such as the "circle of life" and the importance of aging/grief).

With a new puppy that can't quite master potty training (yet), I've had to become quite the consumer of steam clean machines and cleansers. This one by Bissell does a good job and leaves a pleasant scent afterwards. However, it didn't completely get rid of the pee stain ... but after using a variety of cleansers, I've come to the conclusion that NOTHING really gets rid of a pee stain. However, it did get rid of muddy paw prints and left a pleasant scent and that is probably all I can ask for.

Back in the day, I read a few of Lisa Scottoline's novels and didn't fall in love so I never sought her books out again. Then I found her collection of humorous essays (Why My Third Husband Will Be A Dog) and decided to see what it was all about. I thoroughly enjoyed her voice and point-of-view. In addition, the short length (no essay is more than 3 to 4 pages) made the book perfect beach reading. Since then, I've read/listened to a few more of her essay collections -- both in print and on audio (my preferred method as it is just fun to hear Lisa and her daughter Francesca's own voices). "Have A Nice Guilt Trip" is another enjoyable visit with the "Flying Scottolines" -- and one of my favorite parts of the book are the photos that are interspersed throughout (they have some SUPER CUTE dogs). If you've never tried Lisa Scottoline's humorous essays, I'd recommend them as the perfect choice for summer reading. I shared a copy with my neighbor and she enjoyed them just as much as I did.

The18k Gold Plated Cubic Zirconia Twisted Love Knot Stud Earrings look even better on my ears than they do in the picture.  They are elegant, just the right size and I love wearing them.  It was a pleasure to receive them as a free sample in exchange for an honest review.My ears are double pierced and the Twisted Love Knot Stud Earrings look great in both the upper and lower piercing but I prefer to have them in the upper one where more notice can be taken of how good they look on me.  As I get older, I find I like stud type earrings better than the long dangling ones I wore when I was younger.  I love being able to wear different earrings everyday so having a new distinctive pair of Lok Knot Studs added a new look to my collection.  I wear these at least once per week and will continue to do so.

My copy of Snow Puppy came with an audio CD so the children in the preschool room can listen to the book with sound effects at our listening center in the library in our room.  It increases children's enjoyment of books to hear them read aloud and then be able to hear them again on an audio tape.  Snow Puppy is a favorite in the winter season.

The How & Why Sticker Book of Snakes gives information on many types of snakes. The pictures are drawn with good color but the size differences between varieties is lost. This book is appropriate for upper elementary children with the pages of detailed information on many kinds of snakes. Over the years of using this book with children, the stickers have come loose and are lost.

I have used Holly from Hatteras: A Tale of Saving Lives in my North Carolina classroom.  Stories about the state children live in give them a sense of where they live and many of the children I have taught have visited the Island of Hatteras and seen the lighthouse, so this is a favorite.  It is appropriate for older elementary children.  Holly the girl in the story has very poor eyesight but her hearing is exceptional, so this is an opportunity to teach children that when people have what appears as a disability, they often have other abilities that are better than average.

One of the hardest things to deal with as a teacher is the death of a family member or friend of one of the children in class. Over forty years of teaching, this is one part of teaching that I found never became easier. I did find that a book that talked about life and what it means to be alive and our purpose for being here will help children understand loss. One of my favorite books dealing with this difficult time is The Fall of Freddie the Leaf. The photographs are excellent to go along with the story. The Fall of Freddie the Leaf is a book for all ages and brings comfort.

It is a fun time when we read Giggle, Giggle, Quack to the preschool children. They love the animals eating pizza and watching movies and find the story very funny. This is a great book to talk about imagination and pretending with young children and how to make that part of a story. When you point out what authors do to get a story written, it gives the children ideas how to do the same thing when they tell stories and make up play situations as they interact together. We are a farm community so they know ducks don't write and pigs don't get bubble baths, so they appreciate the humor of this story.

Rumble in the Jungle draws children into the book with an opening rhyme about the animals waking up and each page is exciting as an animal is discovered. The illustrations are bright and colorful and the children in my classroom love the pictures. It is a favorite at storytime and when they are given free pretend reading time. They anticipate each animal and what they will do as the rhyme continues to the end of the book with a good-night.

A Dolphin is Not a Fish/Un delfin no es un pez is a comparison book that compares dolphins to fish and gives children to observe differences in animals that live in the ocean. It is an excellent book for our preschool science center with the simple text (my copy is bilingual English/Spanish) and opens discussions about both fish and dolphins for the children.

Powerful Polar Bears shows pictures, maps and graphs about polar bear facts. It is written for upper elementary age students as a fact or nonfiction book about the member of the bear family. It mentions what they eat but does not show them eating to upset children and this allows teachers to talk about facts and how this bear adapts to its cold environment.  The book includes a glossary to build vocabulary and comprehension questions to help children problem solve.

When Annie Watson came home after a hard day at work, she just wanted to relax but found her boyfriend in their bed with another women. With months to go on a shared lease, she turns to her best friends for support and works out a plan in her head for Winning Back Ryan, with the shared lease keeping them tied to an expensive apartment.The friends provide support with lots of drinking, keeping her safe when she spins out of control and giving her time to heal and come to grips with Ryan's betrayal that has been going on throughout most of their two year relationship. The guys, Brian, Ben, George and Max offer support and try to convince her she is better off without Ryan but deep down she finds if hard to give up the first guy she has been with that she planned to spend the rest of her life with.Ryan's behavior keeps getting uglier and uglier with public humiliation, calling her fat and blaming her for his behavior and finally an act of violence.I found the behavior of this group of young adults to be rather immature at times, sometimes funny but mostly they are one confused group of people about what is important in life, although they are figuring it out quickly when the need arrises. Winning Back Ryan is full of emotions and conflict within the group of friends as they pull together to help Annie, which is the saving part of the plot.

Where Do Insects Live? / Donde viven los insectos? is a simple book with great photographs of insects and where they live.  It is in the science center of the preschool class and often leads to discussion and more questions from the children.

Migración/Migration is a simple photographic book that tells young children about migrating animals with pictures taken of the animals. My bilingual Spanish/English copy is popular in our preschool science center. It is a good book to open discussions about animal behaviors and the reasons they behave in certain ways.

"You'll be Sorry!" is a short story that starts with two eight year olds, Lisa and Mark dealing with two bullies. They grow up together, get married and work hard to build a good life together.A stray dog enters their lives and the adopt Herman. Everyday Lisa takes Herman to work with her at the local bank where she works as the bank manager. Mark has a crop dusting service. This is the build-up for the story that develops quickly and has a great plot in a refreshing style.

Roped tells the story of Katie and her fascination with watching two Doms at the Purgatory Club using ropes to control submissive women.  She has an adventure with them after hours until the twist at the end of the story.  The twist made the story, although this is the start of a series it left me satisfied with where the story is headed...

Set in Indiana, Rush to the Altar is a story about a young widow, Maddie Goode and a NBA Basketball star, Jake Hart.  Maddie is still in shock from the sudden death of her husband in an auto accident leaving her a single Mom to their son Max.  She suddenly found she was an unemployed single Mom and had to move back to her parent's home.After an incident at a Racer's game she becomes a charity coordinator for the Indiana Racers NBA team, until the truth about her late husband comes to light.  A weekend trip to New York, a Las Vegas Elvis wedding and the truth about Brandon Goode becomes public and pressure from the team give the newly wed couple a very rocky start.  Can they overcome all the obstacles and will the marriage survive?Rush to the Altar is a good romance and full of sports action, plus an interesting plot full of public pressure for this talented pair.

I was offered the Anti-aging Facial Sheet Masks - Intensive care serum to help reduce the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, hydrate & moisturize your skin. Box of 5 individually wrapped & disposable facial treatment ¡K as a sample for review.As I get older, my face has a few new lines each year and a good mask helps to keep them from coming too fast.  These mask were simple to use, felt great and my sensitive skin was soft with no irritation when finished with the treatment.  I had a great experience with these mask and honestly can recommend them to make your face feel very nice.

De oruga a mariposa/Caterpillar to Butterfly is an excellent book for preschool age children to learn about the lifecycle of butterflies. The pictures show the entire lifecycle and in simple text explains each of the four steps in a butterfly's development. My copy is bi-lingual Spanish/English and we often read it in either language in our preschool room.

Ballenas/Whales is a simple non-fiction science book for young children with simple easy to understand facts about dolphins. My copy is bi-lingual Spanish/English which works good in my classroom where about half of the children have Spanish as their first language. It is important to have books in the home language of all the children to develop literacy skills in both English and the first language. The pictures are excellent to give children an idea what whales look like and some of the varieties.

Delfines/Dolphins is a simple non-fiction science book for young children with simple easy to understand facts about dolphins. My copy is bi-lingual Spanish/English which works good in my classroom where about half of the children have Spanish as their first language. It is important to have books in the home language of all the children to develop literacy skills in both English and the first language.

Moostache is a funny book that children in elementary school love to hear and one I have used when I have been a substitute teacher and when I taught third grade one year.  Younger children do no have the experience to realize how funny a moose with an extra long mustache is but as children mature and learn to appreciate humor this book is a hit.

I was happy to receive the offer for RFID Blocking Sleeves (10 Credit Card & 2 Passport Protectors) Top Identity Theft Protection Travel Case Set. Smart Holders Fit Wallet, Purse & Cell Phones (Men & Women). Shields Radio Frequency ID as a sample.  I purchased my husband a new wallet with RFID protection so his cards are protected and wanted to get the sleeve type of protection for my cards because I have an almost new wallet that works as a small purse and like it.  I still needed the protection the RFID blocking for my credit cards.  We have not used the passport sleeves but I did try them and they fit perfectly.  The passports are now stored in the sleeves ready for us to grab for a trip when we need them.The credit card sleeves are a snug fit on credit cards and fit in my wallet slots perfectly so they are in place doing the job they are intended to do in protecting my identity and cards.  It does take an extra step when using credit cards to remove them and put them back into the sleeves but it does give me peace of mind to know I am protected.

Sea Lions/Los leones marinos is a simple science non-fiction book for young children to learn more about sea lions. My copy is bilingual English/Spanish and useful with the half of my class that has Spanish for their first language. Young children see English in print and sometimes find other languages interesting when they discover them in books. Sea Lions/Los leones marios is part of our science center library in my preschool classroom and has excellent pictures for the children to see Sea Lions in different settings.

Tigers/Los Tigres is a short and simple science book that gives facts about tigers and encourages children to visit them at the zoo. I have this book in the science center to help start discussions and expand their knowledge about tigers. The photo pictures are great and expand their knowledge about an animal that most of them have not seen but can relate to a cat, only much bigger. I like having bilingual English/Spanish books for the children as about half of my class has Spanish as their first language and they can see Spanish in print with these books.

Snakes/Las Serpientes is a short and simple science book that gives facts about snakes and encourages children to visit them at the zoo. Most of my preschool children are interested in snakes and I have this book in the science center to help start discussions and expand their knowledge about snakes. The photo pictures are great and the kids love seeing all the different kinds of snakes. I like having bilingual English/Spanish books for the children as about half of my class has Spanish as their first language and they can see Spanish in print with these books.

The Micro USB Cable, Magic-T Braided Cable 0.3m/1ft Data Sync Charging Cord Durable Flexible Nylon Fabric for Samsung Galaxy, HTC, Motorola and More Android Cellphone [4-Pack] (Orange/Green/Pink/Blue) are handy short cords that come in handy to transfer pictures from my phone to the computer, to transfer modi files to my kindles and are easy to carry when I travel.  I love the colors and it makes them easy to locate in all the different types of cords that I own.  I was glad these were offered as a sample for an honest review and that is what I have written.  These are nice colors and work great.

I received the The Memory Journalists Best Selfie Stick, Bluetooth Remote Shutter Extendable Pole Monopod for iphone 6 Plus ,6, 5s, 5c, 5, Android, Take a Selfie Photo and Video, Photo Booth with Selfie Sticks as a sample and let my adult daughter try it with her new iPhone 6.  She takes pictures with her phone many times per day compared to my minimal picture taking habit.  After two weeks and over one thousand pictures using this selfie, she says she loves it.  It holds the phone securely, works easily for her and she is getting lots of great pictures of my grandkids, which she is sending me.  She has three other Selfies and is keeping this one and giving the other three to her kids because this is, "The best one ever."  The others had issues with the larger new iPhone and the kids have either older version iPhones or Smartphones being adult college students on budgets.  I was happy that this worked so great for her and I am enjoying all the pictures.

I was offered the Emjoi eRase e60 Dual Opposed Heads 60-Disc 2-in-1 Electric Epilator Tweezer with Shaver/Trimmer and Sensitive Attachments in Pink as a sample in exchange for an honest review.I have never used an epilator tweezer before and expected it to be really painful but found if almost pain free with just slight tiny pulls on the hair that lasted less than a second.  I use it on my legs and found it helpful because due to my poor eyesight shaving in the shower has become a blind  adventure.  If I wear my glasses the water steams them up and I can't see and I can't see without them to even tell if I have hair on my legs so this is a handy alternative.  It works on the underarms too.  I also keep the back of my neck trimmed between hair cuts (the back of my hair is kept short and my neck is exposed and now that the hair comes in gray, I like my neck clear of hair.  I am finding over time that I have less and less hair on my legs especially.  This is not painless but it hurts far less than waxing in my opinion.

Control: Dangerous Desire is a setting for the rest of the story and leaves the reader with a cliffhanger. The writing is good, the story plot set is excellent (so far ~ totally incomplete) but short installments are not my cup of tea with all the full-length books available. Thanks for the tease but no thanks for yet another high priced series.

Helpful Paws is a short story about a guy taking care of his friend's dog, Priscilla, an English Bulldog and having the dog go into labor the first night.  The only vet in town, is Dr. Silver, who is his next door neighbor and not fond of him after catching him skinny dipping in his pool on numerous occasions.  What is a guy to do in an emergency but call the only vet in town?  The puppies come along find, all six of them and the two men become special friends.

I was given a sample G.G.Martinsen Crystal-faceted 16 GB Mini Usb Port Slim Small Multi-lingual Selection 1.8 LCD Portable Mp3/Mp4, Mp3Player , Mp4Player , Video Player , Music Player , Media Player , Video player ,Audio player With Photo Viewer , E-book Reader , Voice Recorder ,Games & Movie,a Slot for a micro SD card in Black in exchange for an unbiased review.One of the features that I like is being able to put a SD card into the slot and be able to see all of the twenty-one grandchildren and now one great grandchild.  This is the first music and media player that I have tried with the photo display ability.  I also like the e-book reader although again the screen is very small and I need to remember my glasses to read the small print.  The voice recorder is another feature that I like and use to record children telling stories.  I love to surprise the parents of the children in my class with what they say and tell the teachers, mostly the good story telling but it also helps with discipline issues too as anecdotal notes to back up what I observe.  The music player has average quality sound and I enjoy listening to music while gardening with this small player.  It isn't perfect but it does the job and is worth the purchase price in my opinion.

Fallot Dijon Mustard is a lovely balanced, true French Dijon Mustard that complements food beautifully. It goes very well with sandwiches, in deviled eggs, potato salad, vinaigrette, etc. It doesn't have extraneous flavorings or additives.  If you are looking for the classic French Dijon mustard to complement your cooking or your meals, this is it.  It comes in a glass jar inside the cute metal pail. The pail can be used as a decorative plant pot, pencil holder, etc. in the kitchen.

I purchased this licorice (Yashti Madhu) as part of a wholistic approach to healing my overly fatigued adrenal glands.  After reading several books on adrenal fatigue, I added licorice root in the morning with my other supplements.  It is definitely helping to prevent the breakdown of cortisol in my body, giving me more energy and helping decrease pain.I have purchased several supplements from the Himalaya company, and have been pleased with the quality & cost-effectiveness of their products.  I will continue to purchase this supplement and others from them.

It works now that I fixed it.Many of the curved shelf pieces were manufactured with the incorrect curvature, resulting in the metal strips not being parallel at the attachment points.  This resulted in the bolt holes not aligning properly and quite a few of the screws breaking when attempting to put together.  The company did send replacement screws, but that took a little over a week, making several shelves unusable during the waiting period. About eight of the curved pieces needed manual bending in order to be able to put the whole thing together.  Now that that's done, it's great!  Would certainly recommend buying the other Enclume stand, the one that is already put together, so as to avoid this frustration.  Spend the extra $30 and purchase the one already assembled & welded. Ours is both functional and beautiful, however, now that we've worked out the assembly problems.

This ice buster was the only thing that could chop through the 2" of ice on the North side of our driveway.  Although we had it plowed, the combination of thawing and freezing left a thick layer of ice that nothing could get through but this.  Lighter tools didn't work on ice that thick, this does, albeit with a bit of work on my part.Pro:  It's heavy enough to chop through thick ice and solid enough (solid metal throughout) to last forever....plus Amazon delivered it rapidly to my door.Con: It's heavy so your shoulder/upper back muscles will feel it, lifting this over and over again as you use it.  Consider it a targeted workout of those muscles and be glad they're getting stronger.  ;-)

I purchased this duvet insert to use in the spring in the North East.  I already have a warmer weight winter comforter, but needed an all-seasons weight insert, and this certainly fits that bill.  As my husband needs more warmth and I like it cooler at night, this is a good midpoint for us.  It came a couple of days after I ordered it and arrived in a vacuum-sealed bag.  After opening it, it pouffed up nicely.Pro's:  light-medium weight insert, good price, all season use (depending on temperature you keep your home at night.  As another reviewer has said, this would work well in a 55-65 degree bedroom),  the light weight feels nearly weightless during use.Con's: noneUpdate:  we put our heat down to 56 degrees Fahrenheit at night.  This duvet insert keeps both my husband and I comfortable, using nothing more than a comforter cover and a cotton sheet.  Although I expected to use this only in the spring and fall, it will stay on the bed during the upcoming winter season.  For the price, this is a good product.I hope this information can help you in choosing whether or not to purchase this insert.  If this review has been helpful to you, please click "yes" below. This table cloth is not really what I was looking for.  It is your basic white vinyl table cloth, but I wanted something nicer.  This will be useful for protecting the table during soap making, etc., but I will continue to look for the thick white vinyl table cloth I saw in a restaurant that really looked and hung like linen.

I go through wood & bristle brushes rather quickly because I don't feel that they really get clean enough after use. I purchased this and put it on, thinking that it was a lovely, yet light musk oil.  Five minutes later I thought it (the scent) was gone, but I was wrong.  I was out and about, doing errands and was told by a few people that I smelled great, and they inquired what scent it was.  Still, I could not smell a thing, but they could.  Evidently, I am anosmic (unable to smell it) to this musk.  This may be a large molecule musk and some people may not be able to rsmell it on themselves, hence the anosmia (inability to smell it), but others can.Regardless, I rarely get such compliments on any other fragrance, so even though I cannot smell it on myself, others do evidently enjoy it on me a lot, hence my 5-star rating.If this review has been helpful to you, please click "yes" below.  Thank you.

These shoulder pads are great!  They are thin enough to be effective as shoulder pads, yet they are not noticeable through clothing.  I have small, sloping shoulders and these help to 'balance out' my physique.  Recommended.

Sebamed Clear Face Antibacterial Cleansing Foam is an effective cleanser for skin with active acne.  I have hormonal acne with very sensitive skin.  Some acne products, even those designed for adult acne, can irritate my sensitive skin and further inflame my skin, causing more breakouts.  This cleanser is a thin liquid in a foamer bottle.  I use one pump of cleanser on my skin in the morning, during my shower, and two at night.  In the morning, I leave it on while  washing my body, shaving, hair conditioning, etc. and rinse just prior to leaving the shower.  At night, I do an oil cleanse method with castor oil to remove makeup, apply a warm, moist face cloth and leave on just until it cools, then apply the Sebamed Foam Cleanser.  With the foam on, I then brush & floss my teeth (this takes 3 minutes).  As the suggested contact time on skin for this product is 3 minutes, I rinse my face just after doing my teeth, and therefore no time is wasted "waiting around" for the foam to be on my skin.  It takes no more time or effort than any other cleanser, but is so gentle and effective.  Sebamed products are all excellent, and this one is no exception.  I wish it were not  so expensive ($25/bottle), but it is effective.

This is the second package of these that I've purchased.  The bras are very good for what they are; decent, cheap, comfortable, and sufficiently supportive.  Are they the same as a $150 bra? I wouldn't wear this for running or other active sports requiring a sports bra, but for everyday use, they can't be beat.  Thank you for taking the time to  read this review. Lerosett Clay mask is a great weapon in your acne treatment regimine.  It's used twice a day for two weeks straight.  At first I thought that there was no way I could possibly be compliant with these instructions, but when I realized that I could put some on upon arising in the morning and rinse it off in the shower, it was doable.  The tube makes it easy to use quickly as the product is already mixed and ready to use.  I knew that I'd want to skip using it if I had to mix a powder and water and then get lumps out.  The tube makes it fast and easy.  Also,  as it is quite transparent and not so noticable on, putting it on for 10 minutes in the evening at home was doable, too.  It leaves your face clean, soft, and glowing.  I applied Lerosett's Moisture Matte after washing it off.  There are minerals in the clay which help to decrease sebum output and calm inflammation, as well as the absorbtive power of the clay itself, making this an excellent anti-acne product.  My pores look smaller and my skin is quickly clearing.  I recommend this product highly for not only younger acne sufferers, but adult acne sufferers as well.Update:  Well, I used this as instructed and was pleased with the results for a couple of months.  Then life got a little hectic and a lot stressful.  I stopped using it.  Yes, my skin again became inflamed and had profuse breakouts.  So I got my jar out (I purchased the large professional size jar for cost savings after the tube was empty) and just put a thin layer on twice a day.  I left it on longer than 10 minutes because I just put it on while having breakfast in the morning and again when relaxing at night.  I also bought Gunilla of Sweden's oral skin supplement, ClearPoint, and added that to my treatment regime to help heal the acne and decrease sebum output. My skin calmed down again.  It works if I use it and it doesn't work if I don't.  That's how I know that the product line is effective for my skin.Acne has such deleterious effects on self-esteem.  I did this review and added the update so that others who have this condition might find healing from this skin disease.If this review has been helpful to you, please click "yes" below.  Thank you.

This little toilet brush holder fits discreetly behind the toilet, holding a toilet swab and is perfectly sized to hold the swab.
