The book is just a monologue of moves.  It is an opening manual of just the move in database in print form.  .since the book is from the 80s it sort of makes sense since computers and hence computer chess database programs where not rampant at the time.  Ok if you are looking to learn the b6 defense this is not the book for you.  If you are looking to learn theory on the defense this is not the book.  .there are no explanations of the moves.  All you get is a collection of candidate moves and replies.  Is this a bad book?  For many who grew up in the computer age you may not like studying the b6 defense in an old school fashion.  Having said that there is a unique use for the book.  .since there is not much written on the defense and not much in the way of modern databases on this defense, the you may want to add the book to your collection for this opening.  I play b6 about 90% of the time in rapid chess tournaments and have had great success with the defense since many are not booked up on it.  Since implay it a lot Also know not much is out there on the b6 so when i see something on the opening i get it.  .this book is not for learning the  defense, but i use to create my own opening book.  that is i look at the monologue and I enter the moves into my database, as I enter them I also have stockfish analyze the moves and make notes from it on my database program.  So used in conjuction with a modern database and chess engine you may find usefulness for this book.  .as a standalone for todays players may not be a great book.

New in Chess published an excellent book called Chess training for post begginers, which is an excellent book for those looking to start studying chess from a positional point of view.  What I found lacking in that book was the few excercises that came with it after each topic.  Well since it was overall a great book I decided to order this book.  What I noticed is that this books covers topics in the Chess Training book but builds on them as well as cover some other topics.  So its like a level two of the Chess Training for post begginers.  Overall this is a great book.  You will cover positional ideas in chess that come into play many times but often miss by players who only think tactically.  What I mean is lots of time people can calculate long force lines and find a good move, but when forced lines dont exist they feel stuck.  More advance players already know that if there are no readily available tactics, to look for positional moves, like restricting an enemy piece on one side of the board and then attacking on the otther wing.  .this book will cover ideas like that as well as other positional ideas like when to exchange a piece when not to, who to take advantage of colors (eg when the position dictactes a weakness on an opponents color) and many more topics.  .this is a great book for move advance players looking to get into positional understanding of chess.  If this is your first time diving into positional chess you may want to start with Chess training for Post beginners or My system before jumping into this book, as either  of those two books will give you a foundation and this book will build on it.  Again i see this book as a part two of the other book written by New in Chess.  So if you liked the other book you will like this one too, as it builds on the that books and adds a few more topics.

This reminds me of the book idiots guide to chess, but in a lecture format that covers a bit more topics.  This book is probably best suited for Chess coaches who teach at yhe scholastic level and want a guide.  .or a self learner who is learning about chess for the first time,  It will cover all essential knowldge begginers should know, like basic tactics, combinations, pawn structures, development.  The chapter has excercises at the end and also has move by move discussion of a game.  My only real issue with the book is the font.  The book I have is 2013 version but it uses a dot matrix font which makes its harders on the eyes, so i deducted a star for quality of the print.  Overall nice book for begginers, and chess instructors looking for a guide.  Stronger players may not like this book.  I have attached a picture of the font used in the book.

I have a few other Capa books, but I hate the otherw mainly because it is written in descriptive, so i end up putting those books down a lot.  This book uses Agebraic notation which is one big plus for modern day chess players.  The book is excellent and well written.  You will go through the games of .capablanca having the moves explain and why some other candidate moves fail.  The book is written is a style that makes its an enjoyable read, some people may not like this some will.  What mean is that unlike other books where it feels like your reading a computer printout of tons of lines, this one tries to keep you engaged on the game.  So if you want just give the answer and get to the point book, you may not like this book.  If you like to be entertained while learning this is a great book.  The book follows the move by move pattern which makes it an idea book for people trying to improve positional understanding in chess, and what better way to learn positional chess than to study the games of classical masters.  I personally find its easier to learn positional play from classical games rather than modern day champions because many relied on grey matter rather than computer  aided lines that todays master use.  Dont get me wrong there is a place for studying modernmasters, but if you are in the developing phase of positional play it will be a lot easier to start with classical games.  This book will help with that.  The other nice thing about the book is that it is also interactive, the author will ask you questions during critical phases in a of a position, a question and answer format.  i really like the question and answer format that are used because it another way the author keeps you engaged in the book.  Too often I have read other annnotated games only to find myself drifting bc the reading was dull.  So this is a great book, well written and very instructive.  For those looking to study games of masters this is a good book to stary with.

not good at all the sucntion is too weak, Does not take much to pop them off.  And often they just fell off.  Wont pull a dent, wont stick to glass well, and poor quality, after a few tries the black portion is seperating from the orange.  Poor product.

This is a very good book.  But it is not one I would recommend to a beginer.  Mainly dues to large analysis lines the author gives.  This is a nice book for someone who has already gone theough My System, Art of Attack, and Chess Training for Post begginers.  If you already comfortable with the topics in any of those three books, this is a nice book to use next,  If you are new to positional Chess, I would stary with one of the other three books first.  Just this week we had a tournament in my town and walking around seeing others play I quickly notice that there are players who had a better position but gave it up, or failed to take advantage of it.  One person who was playing a higher rated opponent did not pick up the initive after the stronger player wasted two moves in the opening, instead he wasted two of his own.  Another match a person had a plan, and the opponent decided to counter attack, yet the guy with the plan failed to ignore the counter attack not realizing his attack was superior and decisive.  This person had a mate threat, or have his opponent lose a queen to stop the mate, yet he got fixated on the counter attack, and fixated on losing a pawn that he decided to postpone his attack and defend the pawn, i  doing so his opponent spotted the mate threat and moved away from it.  So this one person settled for a draw rather than a win.  My point is that many people seem to get fixated on an idea or two and forget about the big picture.  This book is rather refreshing in that it will illustrate the big picture, you will see games where you can ignore a person threat, when your threat is even bigger, it will show you why what looks like an obvious move to non masters, is often ignore by masters eg.  a master/grand master not taking a hanging piece and making some positional move instead.  The book will show you how you can maintain the iniative when you have it and discuss standard attack plans as well as understanding pawn structures.  the book is basically an attacking manual similar, but not the same as Art of Attack, this book is more advance.  I guess an analogy would be Art of Attack is to Pre-Calculus as Sacrifice and Initiative  in Chess is to Calculus.  Very good book, but not for a begginer,  or someone not yet comfortable with any of the three books I mentioned earlier.  The book can be used in several ways, the games are given to you from stary to the end, and then there will be a diagram with the key position.  Before I read the book, I just went to the diagram sort of like the puzzle and see if  I could figure out the move before reading the annotations, so my first week with the book I used it as a puzzle book,  I later went back read the book and the analysis and played the games out on my pc.  The analysis part is detailed and I recommend you use a computer or a chess board when looking at the alternatives lines discussed in the analysis section as well as the actual game.  Again Excellent book for more advance players that enjoy playing aggressive games.

Terrible product.  Here is my experience.  First I got the device and when I first turn it on, it says must have power button on ON position.  I had it on the ON position and the screen never changed.  It was defective.  Well in the package there is a little card that says if you have issues with the device to call them and not return it.  I call the number and I am told I can Purchase some sort of warranty.  I told them it does not work out of the box.  So I decided to take it back to walmart for an exchange, thinking maybe it was just this device.  I got a second one and same issue the computer says there is something wrong with the device, and not even the two songs that came in the device can be played.  The other thing is they have a link to a website that has tutorials on how to use this device and when you go to the site, its not the same sitye and the device is not one of the listed devices.  Save your money.  I never even got to use this, since non of the two work. Well ended up taking it back for a refund.  Garbage of a product.

Excellent book.  I have many chess books and people in my town who play chess at different levels always ask me to borrow a book because of a certain need.  One common thing I get asked is how to formulate a plan, and its usally stronger beginners and intermediate level players (1700 and below) .  .what .i have notice is many seem to have a good understanding of tactics and calculating forced lines.  .the problem seems to be what to do when there are no good forced lines.  In this case you should be looking for a positional advantage, when no readily available tactic exist.  The problem is what to do.  There are two books I recomend for this and thats this book and Nimzovitch My System.  The feedback i get from many beginners regarding My System, is that is still a difficult book, to understand.  Intermediate level players love My System.  With This book I find that both beginners and intermediate level players really like this book.  The book is written in an easy to understand and follow manner.  It will teach you who to formulate a plan, and who to determine "true" value of a piece.  For example many see the value of a rook as 5, queen 9, pawn 1.  And while this rule work well in many situations, there are situations when say a rook is worth 3 points based on its position.  So lets say a rook is on one side of the board, and is in a spot where it cant get into play readily, the book will tell you to focus your attack on the opposite side of the board.  You will learn what to do when the king is stuck in the middle of the board.  How to spot weak square and weak pawns, and how to exploit them, and many other things to look for in a given position.  This is a great book for both strong beginners and intermediate players looking to learn the positional side of chess.  If you are looking to start studying chess from a positional perspective I recommend this book or My System (ideally you should study both at one point)  But if you are not certai  which to study first, .i would start with this book first.  Great Book.

I have the first volume and I liked so I ordered  the second volume.  Lots of puzzles that are challenging.  This is a great puzzle book for those looking for intermediate level puzzles.  By intermediate I mean puzzles that dont give you a clue, like clue you in on what to look for Mate in 3, find the pin, find the fork etc...  So if you already have an understanding of basic tactical motifs you will like this book.  If you are just starting off and dont have a grasp of basic tactics then you may not like this book at this stage.  What is really apealling about the puzzles is that you are not always going to get a mate or go up a big piece.  Many of the puzzles involve creating a threat and going up a pawn and a few puzzles you need to recognize the position is lost and go for a draw.  And in real play you will find one pawn can be the difference between a win and a loss.  When I was first working out the problems I was thinking They were using the same puzzles as the previous book, but I did not find a duplicate and realize that its my pattern recognition that has improved. The puzzles are from real games and if you are a clubhouse/coffee shop player your going to see these motifs appear a lot.  It is an excellent book, lots of puzzles and great practice.  like the first volume, this is a nice book.

I play a lot of coffee shop chess and notice that many people rank in the 1200 to 1400 have days when they play real well and days when they just cant finish correctly.  And it seems like the issues is they are not sure on how to formulate a plan.  At the same time I find that many in the range of 1800 tend to use the attack methobs in this books.  So what i tell those that are lower rank is to study this book, especially for those that love to play 1e4.  The book is a tactical and strategical book in one, but not like a puzzle book.  You will be studying games and taken to a key position, where you can launch the attack.  The book will show you what the requirement are for an attack what weak squares to focus on and what your opponents most likely replies will be.  You will learn how to attack the king that has yet to castle, how to attack the castled king and even how to bust up the fianchetto.  This is basically an attacking manual.  What i have notice is people that were lower rank, tend to jump up in rating quickly, because they are learning how to formulate a plan, and since the illustrative  games are attacking games the games are not boring.  The nice thing also is that you are taking the first steps in positional play, and you are starting to study annotated games, so your killing several birds with one stone.  I recall when I first read this book, many years ago I was  only 1200 and my rating shot up to 1500, and I was giving 1800 a hard time getting the win because i starting to recognize the attack formations and waited to a critical moment to mess up their plan, while I was still losing to 1800 during this time it was not because they killed me in the middle game but because i lost in the endgame.  But I took it as a personal win because I was no longer getting crush in the middle game.  This is an excellent book and one that people showed read.  You will learn a lot from this book, you will take steps to become a positional player, and you will become better at formulating attacking plans.

Excellent book.  There Arent  very many books on this opening so this fills in a nice void.  I play unorthodox openings in rapid chess and have had great success with it in rapid chess.  This book is well written and very easy to follow, it also has a question and answer format, where you are asked question regarding certain moves.  It covers areas to focus on, where weakeness exist, where traps exist within the game you are covering.  Like some of the other .excellent books from Cyrus Lakdawala, I would recommend this as your second book.  There is an older book written by andrew soltis, who wrote a small book on this opening, it covers than main candidate moves and most common repies with out deep analysis of multiple subvariations.  so andrew soltis book is a great book to start with, and its one that if you have the time you can finish in a week,  .once you have finished with that book this is where This books works nicely, it will give you the thoery behind the moves you learn, so once your opponent is out of book you know where to attack or concentrate your forces.  so these two books I feel work well together.  Once you are done with these two books you can build on your knowledge and learn subvariations then you can move one to play 1b3  a book written by new in chess, ilay odessky.  The third book is more complicated, and it will probably be easier to learn with the first two books I mentioned.  There is another  book on the opening called nimzo larsen attack from everyman chess.  The fourth book is horrible in my opinion, white does not win half of the illustration games in the book, so you wont  learn to win with that book (which is sad bc i suspect most that buy that book want to win).  Well back to this book.  Again this book is well written and simp,emto understand, you are given the theory of the move, what the players are trying to do and whether they missed a better opportunity, it is not bloated with subvariations whoch is good when you are first learning the opening, bc you can spend a long long time just studying one variation.  .the question  and answer  portion with have you actively involved in the game you are studying.  When you are done, you have have a good understanding of the position weaknesses, strength, and how to launch your attack and where your opponent may attempt a counter attack.  While this may not be the best opening at the grandmaster level, many of your non grandmaster opponents will not be booked up on it, will not have much memorized and will have to rely on their skill rather than memory.  Also if you play rapid chess, you may end up with a huge time advantage.  In Blitz matches I have been averaging about a two minute time advantage when using thisnopening as white bc by opponent pauses to think and all the time the clock keeps thinking.  So enjoy this book and enjoy the opening, and have fun racking up rate points.

I found this program at a office supply store for $10 so at that prize i was ok taking a chance.  I have a few chess programs already, hiarchs, shredder, and chessmaster 9000 and now fritz.  I will say out of all of them Chessmaster 9000 (I tried the newers CM versions and dont like them) is my favorite for ease of use and analysing my own tournament games.  The user interface is not great on fritz.  Its difficult to figure out, and it has very little features like chessmaster 9000. About the only things I like the program for is for its ability to read other Chess base cd.s  Chessbase the owners of Fritz sell a ton of cd's  add thatnwill work woth this,  for example, a chessbase cd on the sicilian opening will work with this program.  so if you are looking to get some of the other chessbase cd this may be a cheaper way of using them rather than buying the expensive chessabase and then the expensive add ons.  Other than that i am not impressed with this program, its ok.  I find the older chessmaster program a lot better and user friendly and better game analyser.  When I talk about analysing im talking about entering my game into the programs and having it annotate it for me telling me what opportunities i missed, what defense i missed etc, in a simple, easy to understand manner, chessmaster 9000 does this, if Fritz does it I havent figure its out.  Also by analysis im not talking about being given a ton of lines with different scores.  im talking about a simple what move did a miss analysis.  So if you can get it this program for under 10 like I did the  .i would say get it for its ability to run other chessbase add ons otherwise get the free stockfish instead of this, which will do more than this version of fritz and is just as strong as an engine.

I have a few chess programs, this one, Fritz, Shredder, Hiarchs, stockfish.  Out of all of them this one is my favorite.  It is not the strongest chess engine but for me it works well.  It is the easiest of all the programs to use. the Main reason I like it, is for Analyzing my tournament games.  My other chess programs have their place, but it seems to fall short in analyzing my games in a SIMPLE manner.  When I try to analyze games on the other engines, It is just too deep, and gives too many sub variations so much so that i can spend days going over one game.  With Chessmaster it cuts to the chase.  It will annotate your game tell you if you miss an attack or left a piece hanging, simple.  It will tell you when you went out of book, in plain simple language and without a boat load of sub variations.  Lots of people prefer the other engines for deeper analysis, but again like I mentioned earlier, I just want a program that tells me what opportunities I missed, if l left something hanging simple stuff.  I guess the best way to describe it is Chessmaster is like Using an Apple device (intuitive) and the other programs is like using a Linux device(not intuitive), if that helps anyone.  Again there are benefits to all these programs but for analyzing my own games I like Chessmaster for its get to the point annotation of my game.  The program has a lot of other features, which you can read about in the products description section.  Initially I was not sure about how to rate this program.  The program itself is a 5.  I was not sure if I should lower it because its 2015 and I  read that some people had issues installing it on modern PC.  I had owned this program years ago and lost the disk but I liked its ability to Analyze my games and I still have a Windows XP desktop in my garage so worst case scenario for was that I get the xp out again.  Initially I installed the program under windows 8.1.  And its started to run and just stopped.  Then I saw the cd case say windows 98/ME so I changed compatibility mode on my windows 8.1 to windows ME... Well it ran but a minute later would crash all the time.  I almost gave up and was going to head to  the garage to get my XP out when I decided to run it in windows XP (service pack3 ) compatibility mode and it worked. So I decided to give it five stars, since it works on my window 8.1 desktop.  Another issue you may have during installation is that it may ask to insert disk one and it still wont work, so I put disk two and it worked.  If you have issues try running it compatibility mode for xp service pack 3.  I included a picture of a screen shot and you can see the analysis of a game.  I made random movesfor both sides and let Chessmaster analyze the game and in the picture you can see the analysis it gave for the fourth move for black.  So if you are looking for the strongest chess engine this is not for you.  If you are looking for a multitude of sub variations and scores for those sub variations, this program does it but the other ones like Fritz are stronger and deeper, so you may not like this compared to the other programs.  If you  are looking for a program that is strong yet simple to use this is a great program.  If you are looking for a program to analyze your games and give you a simple to understand analysis and what you missed, what a better move should have been this program is great.  It also has some tutorials in it, so if you are looking for that you will like this.  Great Program, great price...

I enjoy playing tons of rapid chess and as a result I like to stay stay sharp.  This book is excellent lots of puzzles and like other reviews I agree that  its better than than first (which is also excellent).  The book is for intermediate level players, that is you are not given clues like in begginers tactic books where you are to, to find a fork, skewer etc.  No clues are given, and this is how chess works.  The puzzles are not from .grandmaster games same as the first book.  But, This is exactly what I wanted, Bc at the clubs and local tournaments where I live ratings range and I end up getting paired up with players with all sorts of ratings, and its nice to spot mistakes in their games and quickly take advantage of it.  This book has a ton of puzzles with all range of difficulties and since  they are not GMs many arouse from a bad move (not necessarily a blunder) and after a while you will spot mistakes, and this will carry over into your personal games.  In Rapid chess being able to spot mistakes quickly and take advantage of it can be crucial since Time plays a big role, being able to spot them quickly can give  you an advantage.  After working through this book you will see the rewards in your games especially if you like rapid chess like I do.  Like the first book, if you are looking for Puzzles from GM games this book may not be for you.  But if you are looking for a book where a bad move was made and you wanna spot the exploit quickly this book will be an asset.  .Again this is good for intermediate level players, but I should clarify, intermediate level players in the USCF range 1200 to 1400.  The book may not be great for advance players or intermediate level players approaching advance.  Having said that, I personally find this book to be very good for its intended audience, and I myself use the book to test how fast I can solve the puzzles. So there is a use for the book if you are advance and want to test how fast you can solve the answers.  I really enjoy this book.

Very nice book.  I have a ton of different chess books and this one i like a lot.  Lots of puzzles and I got at a good prize.  This puzzle book is excellent for intermediate level players.  people ask me what i mean by that and when I say intermediate I mean its puzzles that dont give clues as opposed to tactics books that clue you in on what to look for, eg chapter on forks.  This book assumes you already know basic tactical motifs and its your job to find it.  I dont call it advance because I personally classified advance puzzle books as those requiring prepatory moves and or have multiple subvariations (each several moves deep) that can work but has one best move relative to the other varitions.  Dont get wrong, this book has a nice portion of difficult puzzles.  The puzzles are also not grandmaster games, which is what i was looking for (some people prefer GM game puzzles so if you are looking for that this book may not be to your liking).  I play a lot of blitz  and rapid chess games and many times you will get positions from your opponent that are not perfect and its nice to spot it quickly and take advantage  of it.  Some of the postions in these puzzles may appear in one of you rapid chess games.  overall great book for those rated 1200 to 1400 who already have the concept of tactics, but want to practice spotting them with out clues.  Advance players and stronger intermediate may find the puzzles too easy, but thats should not be a reason to not get the book.  I personally use this book for pre blitz tournament practice.  I time myself to see if I can solve so many puzzles in a given amount of time (spped test) So it can be a useful too for advance players that like playing blitz tournaments.

I play B6 a lot and have many books on this opening.  I enjoy it for its shock value, and for taking my opponent out of memorized lines.  I play this opening in rapid chess tournaments as my main defense against most of whites openings and I have had great success with it.  While 1...B6 is not considered a great defense at the grandmaster level, at lower levels many are not booked up on this opening and it ends up being a great defense.  This book is excellent for someone looking to take up the opening, I would recommend this as your second book and not your first book when first learning this opening.  The reason is the book winning with the english defese (the b6 defense) by Andrew Soltis is a good primer on the opening and once you have gone through that book, then this book should be next.  This book will discuss games that have been played and describe the reason for each move.  It will explain why a certain candidate move is bad, why another is better, where to focus your forces where to look out for counter attack, and what your position should look like.  The book is well written and has many question and answer format as well.  For example after 1e4  b6  2nc3 Bb7  the book will ask you a question on why the "natural" move Nc3 is bad.  As you read the answer you find out that the move allows black to set up a nasty pin and a potential trap.So as you play through the games you will learn a lot at each step of the opening.  This is an excellent book.  Again I would use this as my second book to study, if I was learning it for the first time. And the every man version as the third book to study.  The reason is Soltis book on the opening is a small book but gives you the main candidate replies and moves, you can finish the book in a week or less and have a good idea of the common replies.  Envetually you want to learn the reason for the moves and this is where this book works well, you will play through games have the moves explained.  Finally when you are done with this book I would  move on to everyman chess book on the opening, Play B6 (the one written by Christian Bauer) the last book has a great deal of subvariations that you want to learn after you have the core of the opening down.

I have used this to carry my se cards and worked very well.  Very protective, but I found a second use for it and thay was as a wallet.  I removed the padding and modified the inside with parts of a previous indestructable wallet that somehow i managed to destroy.  This case is a lot stronger than my alluminum wallet was.  So it can serve multiple uses.  Excellent for holding sd cards and for other things you can imagine.

I really like this book as an initial book to start studying endgames.  I have several endgames books some easier and some more difficult.  Pandolfinnis book so far is the easiest endgame book i have but it seems geared to children.  I wanted something about emdgame basics but not a book written for kids,  and this book works well.  The book actually starts off in the intro, and here it describes to you each piece and its strength and its weakness in an endgame.  for example a knight on B2 vs Rook is in big trouble...  So if you have the knight you want to avoid it and equivalent square, if you have the rook you want to force their knight to that square or an equivalent.  (if this doesnt make sense, then this is a good book to start with as it will all be explained).  I have attached a picture and if the picture does not make sense when you first see it then this book will help you a lot.  The book main focus is to get the basics down packed.  The chapters give you theory,  then examples, and then some challenges for you to try.  What I have noticed is that other endgame books have more in depth analysis and variations, but assume you already know the basics.  So if you dont understand the basics the more advance books may not make sense.  After reading a chapter in this book,  I like to set up the challenge position on my computer and play that position against the computer at maximum strength.  If you got the concept down, you should be able to defeat the computer at maximum ELO, with no problem. The other nice thing is that if you find yourself in a bad spot, it teaches you how to go for a draw as well.  Very nice book for someone looking to start studying endgames.  If you know what the picture is that I attached you may find is book to basic for you.  if you dont know what the picture is about then this is a good book to start with.

This is an excellent book to start off with the English.  Other books are filled with so many subvariations that you can spend ages trying to learn just one line.  Here you are given the main candidate move and most common replies, informed of common traps, and where to focus your pieces.  .this is a very good book the start learning the opening.  .once you mastered this book then go to a book with more subvariations.

I have always heard the best way to improve in chess is to study endgames.  this book has helped out a lot.  Initially I was playing very tactical games, which I enjoy, but I seemed to have plateaued.  I have noticed from my own games that I struggle in the end game and decided it time to strecthened this aspect of it and hence .i got this book.  The book is well written and described the ideas of the moves as well as give you a,ternatives moves and why they fail.  Intially the studying endgame was dull, since most of my chess studying has been based on attack techniques.  Since taking up this book, my methob of strategy has changed, I find my self trying to get to an endgame rather than playing in the middle game when I recognize the winning endgame position.  Also studying this book has had other benefits, I noticed I play closed games a lot better, and my depth of analysis has increased a lot as a result of studying endgames with this book.  .my only issue has been that its a slow process, for example I can finish a tactics puzzle book in one week. This book took me a lot lot longer since endgames require deeper thinking.  The book is excellent, well written and teaches you what is going on in the endgames played by GM.  .it explains why other moves where bad and is excellent when used in conjuction with a chess engine.  Imwould study one chapter in this book, when I felt confident about the chapter I would set up the position against shredder at maximum elo and try to beat it.  You will be suprise who much your game will improve when you are done with this book.  You may not see the benefits in the short term but in the long haul, it will pay a lot of dividends...,  Excellent book for those who want to take it up another level.I have the paperback version I dont have the kindle version but it says kindle format next to my review.  So my review is for the book version

Good book for self learners.  I took Logic over 30 years ago and I wanted to re teach myself.  A text book is just too long for me to work with because of time constraints and since I had an idea of the topic i just needed to work out problems seeing the steps.  I am the type of person that learns math by seeing the sets and rather than reading about it.  So its a great book for people that learn by doing and wanting to see the steps.
very nice patch.  I used them to customize a jersey and on custom shoes I made.  Good quality for the price.
worked very well and good price

I was initially intrigued by the price and it being a quad core tablet that runs windows.  One day one I noticed that it does not run like a quad core and lags a lot.  It felt like I was running an atom processor net book rather than a quad core.  Second thing I notice is that the keyboard that comes with it does not work well some letter did not work unless I pressed several times until the letter appeared.  The touchpad on the keyboard is also buggy, It turns on and switches other screens and features when all I want to do is scroll down a page.  My other issues is in desktop mode they inverted certain functions, stuff that was once right click is now left click and vice versa, really annoying switch.  The computer works in two mode in window mode and in a tablet mode.  I find out easier to work in the desktop mode as tablet mode is not very intuitive like on an android or ipad as well as being buggy especially when all you are trying to do is scroll down.  As a tablet I would say it sucks as a netbook it will work ok if you use a wireless mouse rather than the keypad.  If you are looking to run big application other than Office dont buy this.  Also the tablet has some quirky habits after a month, there are times when it just does not want to turn on or powerdown.  And random times the screen just goes black.  The built in camera is bad.  Every picture I took come out very dark regardless of amount of light.  Also the quality is bad very fuzzy pictures.  Its like taking a picture with an old school digital camera that is 128 byte pixels.  (not mega pixels)
must have if you have a tone of old drives that you need to access.
Its like taking soap infested beef jerky and scrubbing your.  Left face clean so it works well at that, but will not remove blackheads.  Not dissolve them.

Nice high school econ book.  I have read a few econ books college level and high school. As a college level book, I would not recommend it, because it lacks the mathimatical compoment required for college level econ.
It cracked.  I had the screen replace, everything went well but the screen is a cheap qualoty that the heat generated by the ipad cause a small crack which eventually grew.  Not very good.
did not last a week.  After a week a plastic component snapped and its useless.  Poor quality product.

Very nice.  I actually have ordered a few emblems.  one for my car.  One for a custom phone case I made.  And some other Green Bay Crafts. terrible gloves, They are not warm.  They are so pourous, your fingers ski  actually touch the screen and the yarn.  Since they are so pourous it really is useless, unless your the type of person that thinks 70f is cold, bc anything below that they are worthless.  Also the touchscreen aspect is not very good. Here is my story.  As I would drive i notice the the car appeared to suddenly shift.the shift wasnt hard, but enough to notice it, no check engne light was on.  About two months later i notice in the morning and at slower mph it started to shift harder.  Eventually the check engine light went on.  I decided to take the car to a shop and they told me they would have my car fixed in no more than two days.  Two weeks had gone by and I called to find out the status of the car.  I was given the run around.one guy told me that havent looked at it yet (after two weeks) and another told me they are waiting for a missing part.  Anyway i noticed at the shop that my car hadnt even been moved.  Because it had rain earlier and my car wheel left a dent in the dirt where i parked it.  That dent in the dirt by the wheel was still there after two weeks only the dirt was dry.  I decided to just take the car to a different shop.  The guy took the code reader to the car when I asked for it and then drove the car to me.  I noticed he deleted the check engine light.  I drove the car to a new shop and it started shift hard and accelerate the rpm with out increasing speed, but check engine light was still off.  The  new car shop said with out the code the price can range from any where from a few hundred to a few thousand, so to drive it until it turned on again.  The first shop somehow deleted the history too.  Well I had an issue in that I am leaving the country for two months and if the repair took more than three days i wasnt going to be in town.  the check engine light had  not gone on.  But it kept shifting hard I added lucas fix and in a few minutes the hard shifting stopped.  Months after the incident the issue has not return. Im sure the problem may still exist but with out the code its hard for the mechanics to know what the exact problem is.  So still driving it with  no issues.  lucas Trasmission fix seems to work well.

best phone ever.  i traveo between usa and canada a lot so dual sim is great.  one phone that has two Numbers one usa and one canadian.  the phone is fast and very responsive its like 3 iphones in one. the battery life it last a long time the perfect phone.  with this phonenu dont need a samsung or an iphone.  this phone is what the iphone 8 will be. way ahead of its timeUpdate Feb 3 2015.Originally I gave the phone 5 stars.  two months into having the phone there are some issues.  Biggest issue is the phone has done a few full resets on its own wiping out all data and apps.  At first I taught i may have pressed a wrong button, but after the phone reset set itself a few times On its own, its a glitch in the phone.  Second issue it the sleep button does not always work.  It is very random.  at times it works at times it does nothing.Third issue many times when the ohone goes to sleep it wont wake up and cant even be powered down so you have to wait for the phone to stop acting up which at times can be many minutes, so your  stuck with a phone you cant use.So be carefl with this phone and data you store on it. The other issues is there are times on a self reset where the phone freezes and is unresponsive text written in Chineese.

i got this jacket for work in Artic Bay Canada (polar Bear Country)  and as you can guess it gets cold.  i had applied for a job and I was hired, and only given two day notice to get to Canada. Living in AZ, Getting cold wear is impossible on short notice.  So I looked at this product and Canada goose.  Canada goose could not deliver over night which was important as i had to be in Canada i two days.  Refrigiware guaranteed delivery and came through.  Initially i was skeptical of the jacket working bc it appeared thin compared to canada goose.  But it worked very well, but you have to buy the cap seperate which could be a negative for most, but when you compare the price of this vs goose, you still save hundreds.  My first day in the artic I was not sure what to expect, so i layered a small fleese jackect and a small wind breaker under this coat.  As I walked five minutes to my work location, I noticed .i was sweating (so i was over heating)  since its only a few minutes no big deal.  But at -40celcius i did not need to layer two small jackets.  the avg temp while i was in artic bay was -40 celcius and the jacket with the cap sold seperately worked very well at keeping me warm.  A nice feature of this vs Canada goose (my colleague had a canada goose)  was the big pockets.  I had a bunch of stuff in them that my friend could not carry bc the goose pockets were small relative to refrigiwares jacket.  The thing to keep in mind is that the jackets acts like a thermos (keeps  warm warm, cold cold) so if you putiton indoors it retains that temp while if you put it on ina colder temp, its going to stay cooler longer.  My only con with this is the cap. Its sold seperate and not the greatest cap.Pros-  kept me warm at -40celcius average temp when i was there and even when the temp dropped to -50 celcius-  big pockets that come in handy.  I housed a ipad mini in it- can be layered easily.  (my friend who had the canada goose complained of cold and tried layering but then found movement restricted.  I had no issues with movement, if anything thing i was getting hot at -50 celcius when i layered so i over layered)- price vs the popular choicecons.-The cap is sold seperate (but even purchased seperate still hundred cheaper than the copetitor)-  the cap is not best design.  it worked for me.  I recommend using a neck warmer if you have a big skull like i do ( i have a large cranium so i always have issues with all types of hats hot fitting well) (my friend who wore the canada goose also had to use a neck warmer) but neck warmers are inexpesinve so not a deal breaker.Overall the jacket worked very well at keeping me warm in the artic. For the price its an excellent jacket.

I live in the United States and applied for a job in Nunavut Canada, Artic Bay.  I was suppose to start work in a few months, but had recieved a call from my employer if I could start in Two Days.  Well because of short notice I had and living in AZ this was the only glove I found in short notice.  The gloves are rated for -10 f or -23 celcius.  I had no issues in Artic Bay when the temp dropped to -50c which is about -58f.  The gloves kept my hands warm.  Initially they appear stiff, but once they break in they functioned well for me.  the only thing to be careful of, is that the gloves retain tempature well.  So if you put the gloves on in a nice warm room, it holds that temp well sort of acts like a thermos (keeps cold stuff cold warm stuff warm)  If you make the mistake I did of taking the gloves off outdoors to take pictures of the sceneary with bare hands and then put them back on into the gloves it can take a while for you hands to warm up.  so dont make that mistake with any gloves you get.

Nice textbook.  Intially I was not sure if i should give it a four or a five.  The reason is at times it can go off on a bit of a tanget by describing something in more detailed than is necessary for the class.  I then recall my time when I was in college and seeing a term and not knowing why its important or howit relates, so then i discovered the reason for the authors doing this. So for those who find it uncessary it may be because you already have knowledge of other science fields like biochemistry and it may seem like over kill, but if you have not been exposed to other advance clases than this will help explain why its an important piece of information.  So  i could not gove the boom four stars for having more info than necessary, more info is better than lack of info or incomplete information.  I remember when I took the course manynyears ago i got to the topic erythorcyte disorder, and the book gave examples of disorder, like sickle cell, polycythemia etc.  I recalll seeing polycythemia and wondering what is that?  But bc i had other classes all i did was memorize polycythemia is an example of erythrocyte disorder...  With this book she explains that is is a disorder, and why, so that little bit of information helps in the learning process, rather then the old way of memorizing and not even knowing what the term is or howmit relates to the topic.

i travel between Canada and the USA a lot, and as a result i have a cell phone there and in the US.  My plans allow me to receive call and send calls in either country, so if a Canadian calls my Canadian number it will ring in the US, if an American calls my US number while im in Canada, it will ring in Canada.  But I was carrying two seperate phones.  This phone made it easy to combime both phones into one.  I took the sims out of the other two phones and put it into this one.  Now  I only carry one phone, with two different phone numbers one Canadian, and one American.  I also like that it is slim and fits in my pocket.  a nice feature is that the quick on button is on the top rather than pressing any key which helps prevent pocket dailing.  as a smart phone I would not call it one.  Its got some features but water down, if your looking for apps and all that smartphone stuff this is not it.  If you are looking for a dual sim phone for mainly calling and texting this is an excellent phone.  The price was nice too.  The only drawback was the instruction were not English, but i found the phone easy to figure out.i was going to give it four stars bc of the instructions, but in my case i was looking for a good inexpensive dual sim phone and it hasnt let me down.

I dont own any new cars.  All the cars I have have been what most would call clunkers.  I have a 1999 oldsmobile intrigue, when I first got it  I paid under a 1k for it and was told its sold for parts and i would be lucky if i got a 1000 miles on it.  At first the car was very loud, and burnt oil.  repairing would have cost more than the car and at the time i was down on my luck and really didnt have the money to do a complete fix of the car.  Well My retail store started selling this oil for the same price as the other synthethic  brands so i decided to use this brand instead.  Well the result was my car got quiter and bc the oil can handle higher temps, the burning was gone.  if I put conventional oil back in the burning return.  so I continued to use thisnbrand.  Long story short, when i got the car hoping to get at least 1000 miles on it the car had 120k miles.  Today its still running and I have over 300k on it.  And my dad has been using it as a daily driver to work.I have a 2002 caravan, when i got it had 90k on it, today its still running well with over 200k on it, and my mom uses this as her daily car.My hyundai had 80k and now has 150k and running strong, this is my daily driver.I havent done any major work on any of the card other than routine work like radioator flush, fluid changes thats it.  While I cant say definative that the  reason the cars are still running well is because of the oil.  I have to say i think its a major role. I live in AZ  and we hit 114f  here and i travel from phx to yuma frequently and i dont think many other oils will handle the long drive at those tempatures very long.  so i think this oil played a big role in keeping the cars running like when i first got them.

For a novella this book packs one heck of a punch! From being to end the reader will not be able to put this book down.  Track of Her Tears is a sequel to the Rogue River Novellas which I would recommended you read before you tackle this book. Its a Novella so it doesn't have the number count to go over the last few books so please read the others before reading this book.Melinda Leigh as the ability to pull at readers heart strings with her stories. Each book builds on the Relationship between Seth and his wife Carly and her family.  The authors ability to tell such a great story in a short amount of words has me speechless.The killer isn't a secret but its the story that will have the reader unable to put the book down.The suspense in this book will have you reading all afternoon and once the reader finishes the novella they will go back and reread the other novella's.ARC Netgalley and from the AuthorHeidi Wimmer

I will start off with I am not much into cliffhangers when it comes to books. I need a complete book from beginning to end with some sort of resolve otherwise I feel short changed. Yes the author Tess Diamond did give you the kidnapper but I still feel like if she wanted to have a cliffhanger she could have given a little more meat to the story.The ending of the book was a nail biter but it felt more like an episode of 24 than a compete novel.Meggie our female lead was The best FBI hostage negotiator but when things go wrong on her last case Meggie leaves the FBI. Meggie former boss pulls her back in for one last case a Senator daughter has been kidnapped. While in search of the daughter former special forces security expert Jake O’Connor tries to push Meggie out of the way until they both realize they need each other to find the missing daughter. Yes sexual attention is in the air but they both know their job to find the missing girl. I enjoyed the gym scene it gave the book a little more light when Meggie suggested Jake was a meat head.With the book being a cliffhanger I needed more meat to Meggie background her kidnapping and why she joined the FBI. I personally felt it was skimmed over to quickly in this book.It is a quick paced story that keeps the reader hooked. Tess Diamond keeps a great pace so the book never has a dull or slow moment which will keep the reader hooked until the end.Tess writes like the style of Kendra Elliot but lacks the polish that will set this book apart from others in the same genre.Thank you to author for providing me the E-copy for my honest review.

Here I go again provides a new twist on the time travel to fix your lifegenre.  Too often we see the protagonist recognize that somewhere along theway they really screwed up their life.  Than through some mystical meansthey are able to return to the days it all went wrong, make changes, andthen all is well.  Think Peggy Sue Got Married or even Back to the Future.Jen Lancaster’s twist is quite unique and well told.  The heroine, LissyRyder, is quite a self-centered, thoroughly distasteful individual; andeveryone at her 20th High School reunion has no problem sharing that withher.  Playing on the Whitesnake song name, she is able to return to herhigh school “glory” days and relive it one more time.  Hopefully a littlebetter this time.So we have the classic tale of repentance and redemption, but with a twist.The story explores how we are all interconnected with those we share thisplanet with, and how what is best for us isn’t necessarily best for all.Ultimately the message is we need to fix ourselves where we are, right now,and not waste our time looking for a shortcut.  It won’t be easy, but itwill be worth it.On the downside, it seems to me a lot of the book was a Hollywood infusedmasturbatory fantasy about what popular girls are really like; at least howthey think.  My experience is most super popular people (or aself-contained clique, like jocks for example) really do not think about,or care about those outside of their group.  Most of their teasing,bullying, and physicality is directed to within the group than without it.It is when someone on the outside tries to get to the inside and isrebuffed, they perpetuate the belief that the group is out to get them.  Bethat in thought or deed.  Thus all behavior exhibited by the group becomesa self-fulfilling prophecy to their belief it is all about them.  (Pleasenote there are always exceptions as the occasional sociopath can turn upanywhere).Side Note: I listen to this book on CD as I drove to and from work.  Theauthor decided to read the book herself (probably because most of herprevious work has been memoirs, so more appropriate), so good on her fortrying.  But unfortunately outside her own voice she was sorely lacking thevocal acting skills to pull off the various characters and accents.  Ittook me several discs to not be too bothered by it.  It would have helpedtremendously if she had hired this job out.

he keystone to this book is being on the side of the anti-hero,Henry Hayden. Everything seems to be going his way until it suddenly isn’t;and instead of trying to repair any damage he decides to double down on hisbad behavior.As he keeps riding his bets, a wide path of lies and death is left in hiswake.  I like the portrait of a human unencumbered by any sense of moralsor general decency.  He is totally motivated about what is best for him inthe moment, nothing else. By all rights the reader should despise Henry,unless they are a sociopath themselves.I came away with ambivalent feelings about the hero.  I should have hatedhim for such violent hedonistic behavior but I didn’t.  I didn’t like himeither.  On the larger book I felt that way about all the characters,neither here or there on them.  They die or they live; things work out forthem or they don’t.  I just didn’t care. That said, it is a very talentedauthor that can get you to think nothing about Henry.This was a fairly short book that could have done with an extra 50 pages ofcharacter development.  A good story without any character I could rootfor. I believe the characters would play well on the screen, where thenonverbal communication would be screaming.

Well if  you like Mary Higgins Clark you will enjoy this book of short stories - I found it easy to read and since the stories were short it was easy to put down and walk away after reading one and then coming back and reading another.The stories are old and some felt dated - but I love Victorian romance and that is dated- right?  Well they were all good - some better than others - the first story was a bit longer then I think was needed - but it had suspense.One story was sad and yet uplifting at the end - I read that one first off - I decided to skip around as I read this book and the airplane story is a good one and I hope I would be willing to risk everything to save a life if needed.I enjoy reading mystery authors and this one is good - I also really enjoy her series with Alafair Burke-  Short stories from an author you know and love -I received this item for an honest review.

A solid mystery with plenty of twists to keep the reader guessing.The crime is witnessed by a police officer and caught partially on videotape, but initially nobody is quite sure what has happened or who thevictim is.In true police procedural style, methodically following each small cluefrom insight to insight, the case opens up to encompass a much larger andsurprising conspiracy.  It also demonstrates the simple choices of regularpeople can lead to complex results.The B plot involves the protagonist’s recent transfer and subsequentblending issues with his new team.  As he deals with the inherent mistrustamong his new colleagues as the try to get along, he finds himself callingon his past friends for help.  It shows how prejudging others can reallyscrew things up; especially since history has taught us we are rarelycorrect in our assessments.  As a sometimes reader of this series, I didfind the B plot a little hard to follow because I am not up to date withthe multi-book character development.A good mystery best served when read in series with the other books by thisauthor.Sent for a review.

The thing about a Murakami book is you can read it and spend tentimes as long thinking about it.  I have read all of his books andthoroughly enjoyed every one of them, but I would be hard pressed to tellyou exactly why I love them, or what it is that make them so compelling.They just are.Tsukuru is a quiet kid who is in a close knit group of friends in highschool, three boys and two girls. The other four have some sort of color intheir name (think Clue characters) while he is just colorless.  This quirkyfact colors his whole experience with life, pun fully intended.  Anyway,they all grow up and finish school, but Tsukuru is the only one who choosesto leave their town to attend university in the city.All is well until one weekend trip home none of his friends will talk tohim, until ultimately he is told we never want to see or talk with you everagain.  No explanation is ever given and none is ever sought. So Tsukuru’spilgrimage is one of loneliness and denial as he bravely tries to face theworld after this emotional devastation.After many years of trying to be okay it is the love of a woman that openshis eyes to the internal damage this event has done to him.  That he cannotmove on with life because he is forever stuck in this moment in time.  Hemust face his fears and know WHY.This book is compelling and will have you contemplating the minutia of yourlife and relationships.  Such is the greatness of Haruki Murakami.

Here I go again provides a new twist on the time travel to fix your lifegenre.  Too often we see the protagonist recognize that somewhere along theway they really screwed up their life.  Than through some mystical meansthey are able to return to the days it all went wrong, make changes, andthen all is well.  Think Peggy Sue Got Married or even Back to the Future.Jen Lancaster’s twist is quite unique and well told.  The heroine, LissyRyder, is quite a self-centered, thoroughly distasteful individual; andeveryone at her 20th High School reunion has no problem sharing that withher.  Playing on the Whitesnake song name, she is able to return to herhigh school “glory” days and relive it one more time.  Hopefully a littlebetter this time.So we have the classic tale of repentance and redemption, but with a twist.The story explores how we are all interconnected with those we share thisplanet with, and how what is best for us isn’t necessarily best for all.Ultimately the message is we need to fix ourselves where we are, right now,and not waste our time looking for a shortcut.  It won’t be easy, but itwill be worth it.On the downside, it seems to me a lot of the book was a Hollywood infusedmasturbatory fantasy about what popular girls are really like; at least howthey think.  My experience is most super popular people (or aself-contained clique, like jocks for example) really do not think about,or care about those outside of their group.  Most of their teasing,bullying, and physicality is directed to within the group than without it.It is when someone on the outside tries to get to the inside and isrebuffed, they perpetuate the belief that the group is out to get them.  Bethat in thought or deed.  Thus all behavior exhibited by the group becomesa self-fulfilling prophecy to their belief it is all about them.  (Pleasenote there are always exceptions as the occasional sociopath can turn upanywhere).Side Note: I listen to this book on CD as I drove to and from work.  Theauthor decided to read the book herself (probably because most of herprevious work has been memoirs, so more appropriate), so good on her fortrying.  But unfortunately outside her own voice she was sorely lacking thevocal acting skills to pull off the various characters and accents.  Ittook me several discs to not be too bothered by it.  It would have helpedtremendously if she had hired this job out.

If you ever thought you might want to be an accountant this book isan absolute must read.  Even as a non-accountant involved in business thiswas an eye-opener.  All I can say about accountants after reading this bookis “Who Knew?”The author makes a very compelling case that there is a lot more to beingan accountant and accountancy than balancing your checkbook. They areheavily involved in all aspects of business, and this book was riveting.It also offers an inside look at the accounting scandal of Arthur Anderson,giving a side of the story never seen in the media at the time.This book is a requirement for all future accountants and I highlyrecommend it to anyone in business.

Billy Makes A New Friend is your typical teaching book for kids between the ages of 4-8. This book teaches about feelings a child might not understand when they refuse to share their toys or when they do share their toys. The book rhymes nicely so your kindergarten-3rd grader will be able to read it with ease. The illustrations flow nicely with the story and with simple drawings that tell the story as well as the words.I read this book to my 4 and 6 year old daughters who said the book was good but she shares her toys all the time with her friends. Than we talked about her sharing with her sister and maybe it would make her feel happier if she shared with her toys.  She nicely informed me that sharing with friends is totally different than sharing with your younger sister.The story does have an older brother who shares as well but that went over my daughter's head or she simply ignored that part of the story.The author writes in simple terms so your kindergarten would be able to read and follow along or your 3rd grader is able to read it to his younger or her younger siblings.A perfectly simple book for your children to understand the importance of sharing and you will be sharing the importance of reading with them.Currently on Kindle Unlimited.

This is book one of five books about the small town of Crazy, Virginia. The Crazy Virginia town Sheriff is a single, 35 year old by the name of Littlepage Eller or Lil as she is referred to and she has a feral cat, Boris, which she adopted. The cat serves as her working partner and can be quite vicious when protecting her from harm. She is the offspring of a Littlepage and Eller union and as both families detest each other is shunned by both. The two families are very rich and the first two families in the area and constantly try to outdo each other.In the story a Littlepage daughter  is murdered and so the investigation begins. It is resolved after a fashion but not necessarily to everyone's satisfaction. I thought the Lil was a very believable character and one I could identify with. She recapped the life of a small town Sheriff very well. I enjoyed the book and would read the other four in the series.I picked up the book because it caught my interest for its location in small town Virginia in the Blue Ridge mountains. As a native Virginian and being raised not far from the Blue Ridge Mountains how could I not and I was not disappointed.I rated the book at four stars.I got the book from Kindlebuffet.com.Thanks Frank for this review.

I loved the 1st book in this series and was looking forward to reading this book - here is my review of Shadow on the Crown -  Well this book did not disappoint - it is a good book that continues the story of Emma -Queen of England and her family - her children and the King's children as they grow and the country comes under fire from the Danes.I love her writing and the way she is bringing history to life - I read the disclaimer of sorts at the back of the book about what the author put in as her spin on things and what is actually known about that time in history.  Kings Queens Princes and Princesses - fighting for love- for honor - for life - for title and money - land and country- what a tale this author weaves for her readers - now I just have to wait for the final book to find out what happens - will it be happy?  I do not have a clue at this point.I say who cares what really happen when the author makes such a great story around these characters and their lives - I am rooting for Emma even if things are going to get worse before they get better.  I love how Emma puts position above all else - how she is the Queen and she must be strong for England as their Queen - Intrigue - murder - death - birth and all while England wars with the Danes and the Vikings - who is going to come out on top and who will be beaten back?  Will Emma and her children be safe and will she ever have the love of her life or will that be another sacrifice for king and country?  Read this series to find out and if  you love historical novels this is one for you.A beautifully written book and now I am stuck waiting for the next one to see what happens to Emma and the great country of England.This book was sent from the publisher for an honest review - well I honestly love this series and wish the next one was out so I could read it today.

I have to say i am somewhat disappointed with this speaker. And that is a first from an aukey product.First let me say sound is surely subjective to a degree, i understand that and you should as well. What sounds good to me won't sound good to everyone. Now that being said, sound being subjective doesn't matter when something is missing bass as this speaker is. Further more, my taste for the rock and metal that i mainly listen to is highs.As i said  I like my crystal clear highs or (treble) And this speaker delivers Crystal clear highs at high volume with no real distortion to speak of. And this speaker also has respectable mids as well. but there is just a massive lack of bass that would be expected from a speaker of this size. We are not talking a little pocket speaker where you might expect to be lacking.The overall design of the speaker is nice, with a rubber / silicone like outer shell except metal speaker grill. The top features easy to follow red an blue led light, and four buttons, a phone button for answering or making calls, a play pause button for .... play and pause of course. And the multi function - and = button that control both volume and track.On the back you will find an on and off switch, micro usb charge and line in port for aux. This unit also features a line out port..... Not sure what one would use that for, unless possibly to also send sound to another speaker as well?And on the side you will find a plastic eyelet for attaching the metal carabiner. Im not sure as to how well the plastic would hold up to extreme use but should be fine just to carry it around clipped on a backpack or something.Before someone comments that i have expectations set to high. There is a speaker from another company, i won't mention, that still sets the bar for sound quality in speaker of this size and price point. And i use that speaker as a measuring stick. And even the previous aukey models of this size had better sound quality.Like i said the over all design is nice but as beautiful as the highs are on this and they are REALLY great, the missing bass is just bad.I had considered only knocking this one star, except for the fact that unless i got a broken unit (unlikely) i think that some of the other reviews may have been a little too nice for fear of no longer receiving product. so i'll help balance that out. Is what it is.I received this product for no charge, and promised to write an honest review. And that is obviously done.

This is by far the best thermometer i have used. i have used quite a few in my quest to find a real instant read thermometer. Far too many of them say instant read and yet the temp. jumps around as the probe is staying still. I like that the probe folds out of the way in a switchblade fashion. The Lcd is large and easy to read.The include temp chart is nice to keep close to the grill, as i forget sometimes what i am shooting for. (hell getting old)And even better is right on the unit itself it has the temps to the most popular meats making it that much easier to get it right.Next to the lcd screen the unit features 2 buttons, on/off  and hold.I like the added magnet to this orange model. I keep it on the side of the fridge to grab before walking out to the grill. While the other red one sits in the drawer next to the stove for stove use. This model also features an easier to see and read meat temp chart.While i am a little confused that the title seems to imply that this will read out both Celsius and Fahrenheit, i see no button like on the previous red model as well as no mention of how to switch in the instructions. Perhaps they have a Celsius model that they send to those countries that woudl use that measurement? Still, I love this thermometer and intend to buy a few more for christmas gifts and such.Product provided, honest review provided also

I have used a pair of automatic wire strippers in the past, way back when i did car audio installations, so at least 7 or 8 years I remember liking them however they were a novelty item picked up from a store of like harbor freight reject tools. So i remember they broke after 2 or 3 days. Since i had a pair of snap on strippers still working away, i never cared to look for another set to replace them.Now i am out of that field and do it only occasionally for friends. Now being in construction, im not an electrician, so i rarely need to use these in my daily life, however i am remodeling my 1950's home room by room that does include a complete rewire, so i can see these being handy.Honestly i've never had a problem with normal wire strippers. I have never looked at them and said... "oh there has to be a better way". Why i do like these however is that even my expensive snap on strippers, have a built in crimper for attaching terminal ends to wire. (this would mainly be for 12v wiring applications, like cars and such) however they are terrible on my other wire strippers. Often not getting a good crimp on either insulated or uninsulated terminals. This set however does a better job. Note i didn't say great job, if you were doing a bunch of terminals you would want a dedicated set of crimpers, but for just a couple ends at a time every once in awhile these do an ok job. I believe a big part of this is due to the placement of the crimpers being up a little higher and therefor you have a little better leverage when squeezing.Other than that, they do a nice job of auto adjusting to the size of your wire. allowing you to strip the ends of a wire or even in mid wire for attaching things to a wire such as an remote wire for an amp. The cutter works just as every other pair of strippers ive tried. They all seem to struggle getting a clean cut even on twisted strand wire. MY snap on's, Kleins, and these all cut equally poor on standed wire that has had the insulation already stripped. (multiple small wires combmined to make a big wire) leaving a few wires still hanging. I don't ding it a star because i figure if the big over-priced manufactures can't figure it out either.... I guess that kind of sets a standard. On non stranded wire these cut just fine.I also like that these are adjustable  so that over time, as things get knocked around or worn, you can re calibrate it to in theory return it to normal like new performance.As a tool in general, these feel solid in the hand, not cheap like the previous auto strippers i had. The weight is nicely balanced as well, not top heavy like i thought they might be.So all in all i give these 5 stars because they perform as advertised and work as well as my big over priced name brand strippers.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. Solar powered lights are really becoming one of my favorite categories, there are now so many different types and styles that you can do so much both inside and outside of your home, and because they are solar powered, you don't have massive power strips loaded full of plugs, or wires running all over the place. That's not even to mention the obvious green side of things.These lights are really cool. I expected them to be sort of hollow shells that could easily get messed up over time or crushed, however they are solid, with air bubbles inside that provide a very cool effect.The solar panel itself has an attachable stake included in the box that could be used to stake it into the ground, however if you were wanting to do a wreath on some other place, you could also just mount the solar panel with double sided tape on say a door or something.just under 20 ft long, you get about 15 ft of actual light, and then 5 feet of lead from the solar panel before the light globes start. This is great for not  drawing attention to the solar stake by having the lights start right away.Over all i was impressed with the light that these give off, certainly more than expected, not going to make say a porch look like daylight, but definitely provide some solid mood lighting. I really like these, and would recommend to anyone. This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. I am not a wine drinker, however my wife is, and rarely does she actually polish off the whole bottle in a single sitting. When she did, her somewhat slurred excuse was that it would go bad before she would finish it the next go round. While i'm under no illusion that this is not just an excuse lol she did state that the wine stored after using this pump, was still pretty good a whole week later.While others have said that the instructions were in Chinese, my package was entirely in english, with a sticker over what was probably chinese instructions on the back. I would recommend to anyone and have bought sets for gifts for this holiday season.

But i will be comparing them to each other.They are pretty straight forward although this one requires an initial "pair", after that, you press the button that matches what you are trying to find. While this unit is definitely much quieter than the other unit, i was still able to hear it from 2 rooms away. It's not just the volume of the beeping but the high pitch in the beep that helps it carry and be heard. I like the slim cradle that this has to store the remote more than the docking station of the other.However if you don't need the 5th finder piece, i would recommend the other set because, it is louder, and i like the beefier key chain hook. While this set has not broke yet, it does seem like it would be a little more fragile and prone to breaking if your keys are just getting thrown in a pocket.Again not that this is a bad unit, but i am already hard of hearing,and the extra volume of the other unit required less concentration to hear from farther distances.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is by far the best thermometer i have used. i have used quite a few in my quest to find a real instant read thermometer. Far too many of them say instant read and yet the temp. jumps around as the probe is staying still. I like that the probe folds out of the way in a switchblade fashion. The Lcd is large and easy to read.The include temp chart is nice to keep close to the grill, as i forget sometimes what i am shooting for. (hell getting old)And even better is right on the unit itself it has the temps to the most popular meats making it that much easier to get it right.Next to the lcd screen the unit features 3 buttons, on/off c/f and hold.I love this thermometer and intend to buy a few more for christmas gifts and such.Product provided, honest review provided also

With the high cost of phones, and the hassle of sending phones in and such under insurance plans, i was looking for a good case for my work phone. I am in construction, so though i try to be careful, my phone does get dropped, bumped, tools sat on it, etc. And thats not even counting the saw and drywall dust.I like the look of this with black and "stainless steel" look. And i like the all around solid protection, with flap like covers that cover all the buttons and ports, really helps to keep the dust and dirt out. I have seen no loss in image or video quality from either camera.However, i like others do find that occasionally its hard for the phone to recognize some touches on the edges in particular, on account of the screen protector not making perfect contact. Because this is a work phone it doesn't really bother me too much, i am not usually browsing the internet or playing games on it.So all in all i gave it 4 stars because i could see that touch screen hiccup really effecting someone that uses this for their daily driver phone.I would still recommend it to people who, either don't do a lot of games or browsing on their phone, or as an occasional case for say, hiking camping trips etc.Sample Provided in exchange for an honest review.

This thing is awesome. I have tested a few of these now, and this is by far the nicest.Most feature just 3 or 4 led's that let you know the battery life status of the device, and that's it.This comes in a very nice padded box type case, for easy storage. Comes with a wall adapter for charging the unit, a car accessory plug for charging. A usb multi port adapter that features old generation iphone/ipod charger, lighting cable, a micro usb for androids, and mini usb for some older electronics. Of course you could still use your own usb cable too. Then of course you have the vehicle jumper cables to actually jump start your car.And for the main attraction we have the actual battery pack jump box itself. This is a nice aluminum heavy duty box, not some cheap plastic box. it measures about 3in x 5.5in, features one 5v2a usb output and takes an input of 15v 1 amp through barrel type connector. It also features a dual mode flashlight with a respectably bright on and attention grabbing strobe mode.And last but not least my favorite part is the LCD screen. This tells you all the info you might need to know. A battery icon with 5 bars to indicate remaining charge. also with a percentage number of the battery life. and an output gauge to shows you the level of power being output. Really cool information center.Hands down my favorite car jumper power bank. I really really like the design and the time that went into it.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review.
