Surprised at the initial shave quality. I am not one for usually taking an off brand set of spinning blades to my throat, however i had to try to do the review, and i must say that i am quite impressed, it cut well, and did not once cut my neck skin. Of course i have some red bumps here and there, as i always do if i shave it clean with any electric shaver for the first few times as my skin isn't used to that. This goes away after a few shaves, as your skin gets used to the slight abrasion.The built in battery bank, while honestly it initially made me think why on earth anyone would want a battery bank, i then kinda realized that this would be great for those who travel, and maybe forget a charger or need the space. Essentially it doesn't hurt anything to have the capability, and in return provides for quite incredible battery life.How well and how long the shaver will hold up, only time will tell, and sure it doesn't compare to the $100 + shavers from the big names, but it does a good job so far, at a fraction of the cost, and surely has its own niche market at least. I had to knock it a star because it doesn't come with any kind of charging cable or plug. Sure it uses the same micro usb cable as android phones, tablets, and most other small electronics and you have 302 laying around, but seems like it should still be in there.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. I often have need for head lamps however often, the batteries that run it are dead when i need them and i don't have them handy or have them charged.I love that this has a built in port for charging that in itself is great, HOWEVER you have to supply the rechargeable batteries for it to work. These are not just standard AA batteries, They are 18659 batteries, they are great batteries like a AA on steroids, however they for a descent set they run around 10 bucks a piece and you will need 2 of them. That brings the total cost of this lamp up there pretty high. however this is more of a pro grade light compared to say your $10 walmart specials.The light is very bright in a fixed beam pattern, and does tilt up and down 90 degree both directions. Why they chose the purple color for the lens ring is a little perplexing, though i don't really care, others cant see the color with the light shining in their eyes lol.I also like that the battery pack is located at the back of the head with amply padding to really help balance the weight of the unit.All in all a nice light. I have to knock it a star because the title and immediate description on amazon could lead people to believe that it is rechargeable right out of the box with batteries built in, and because it takes such expensive batteries.  But still a nice performer.

This is a good performing caliper. The digital screen takes the guess work out of it. Making it easy to measure precise measurements of things.At first i was a little confused at the point or logistics of having it be solar powered, but as i've used it, i realize that it stores up the energy, and its easy to set in a window and charge it up occasionally, so much better than trying to find batteries and never having the right ones. Not to mention that you don't need the sun to charge any bright light will make it function.Solid performance at a great price. I like this tool.

Very nice case, at a great price. Holds the tablet well, and does not feel loose.The suede like material inside prevents scratches to both the body and the scree. The Simulated leather outside, looks nice, and doesn't feel cheap. And i like that cover flap is held by a simple but effective magnet.I love that the cover over the screen can be bent to act as a stand when the tablet is open, making use of the tablet for watching shows, listening to music or typing on with a keyboard very convenient, almost allowing you to use your tablet as sort of a laptop.I have reviewed a few products from EasyAcc and so far at least they always impress me with quality, I would recommend to anyone without hesitation. And at such a low price, it has to be one of the better values on amazon.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. While i love the idea of a shower speaker, And i know that typically Taotronics ALWAYS exceeds expectations, I did try out the suction cup on my travertine tile shower, and it sticks REALLY well. And i like the layout of the buttons, that is unfortunately where it stops.While this speaker is at a nice price, the speaker i received had a blown speaker and therfore poor sound quality. From working in the speaker and audio field for quite sometime, the speaker seems that it would have very nice sound quality, without a blown speakerThe other issue i had was that even though sitting right next to my cell phone bluetoothed in, it would get quiet, and fade in and out or sometimes stop making sound for a second all together. These were not, notifications or anything this was a speaker issue.Typically i Would recommend Taotronics, products to anyone, and i have no doubt that i simply received a faulty unit. I have an email out to Taotronics, and i will update my review should they choose to send me a new unit to review.I see that this has gotten many good reviews, and i can believe it but, i cant really rate it good how it stands.Sample provided for honest review. If i helped you please click the helpful button, it helps me out a lot. ThanksEDIT:Taotronics, sent me new speaker to see if that was an isolated incident, and indeed, it seems to have been. I am having none of the previous mentioned issues with this speaker and am thoroughly enjoying this in the shower.If it helps someone, i was impressed this is sticking to my sealed travertine tiles with no issues.

While i really like the light feature and the form factor and overall looks of this speaker, that is unfortunately where it stops.While this speaker is at the right price, the speaker i received had rather poor sound quality, with nearly non existent lows, and muddy mids. I tried rap, rock, jazz, metal, and acoustic music through it to get the overall performance grade, and all of them produced the same result. With Rap, and heavy metal being the worst.Typically i Would recommend Taotronics, products to anyone. I have tested many many bluetooth speakers, from both them and other companies, and typically Tao tronics delivers, better than what you would expect from a package.I have of course taken into account, its, specs, 3 watts, and as i stated previously, having sampled literally at least 20-25 different bluetooth speakers of all shapes and sizes, i had a very reasonable expectations for this speaker, and fir the first time Taotronics didn't deliver.Skimming the other reviews, i saw a lot of great reviews of the speaker, i typically, in general on amazon, figure that around half of all the sample for review 5 star reviews are done by people who just want free stuff, and then the other half are by people like me that give honest reviews, of how the products rate, and the reviews are what they are.Now that being said, Even ignoring half of the positive reviews, that still gives this speaker a great rating, so  it is very possible that i got a defective unit or it got broken in transport. I have an email out to Taotronics, to see if they want to send another, and if that happens, and the experience is different, i will surely update this review.As it stand however i would not recommend this unit to anyone. there is better to be had for the price from Taotronics.Sample provided for honest review. If i helped you please click the helpful button, it helps me out a lot. ThanksEDIT:Tao tronics, sent me another unit, and this one doe sound a lot better. Still not awesome bass, but sounds right for this speaker size package. i like the lights. So this has been upgraded to 4 stars. Like i said, right in line with sound quality expected for a speaker in this range.

These are great sounding bluetooth earbuds. NO these are not going to be beats ( i actually dont like beats so i think they do beat them myself) or bose but they sound really good and would easily be worth double the cost.These have the wings to really help to hold the earbuds in during activities. And i was glad to see that they include 3 different sized earbuds to find the perfect fit for you. I thought this was standard practice however have received a few that did not. And one size does not fit all. I also like the flat charging cable. More companies need to switch to this style as it helps keep the cables from becoming tangled, and thereby kinked to where they lay all over the counters looking terrible.Sound quality wise these deliver nice highs good mids and respectable bass, good for almost all types of base. And the battery life is very good allowing you to go farther and work longer without having to recharge.I would recommend these to anyone. You would be hard pressed to find an equal sound quality including bluetooth and a mic which makes crystal clear calls, and for the 17.00 price tag its a real steal.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is a nice cover with plenty of room. I like my cover to go all the way to the floor on my grill, and this does just that on my weber spirit 310.Has held up nice through most of winter, and this summer, no signs of cracking or wear. Nicest cover i have owned.

This is a relatively nice option for those people that need a wireless doorbell.Ours didn't work when we bought our house 2 years ago and it will need replaced, however i am going to wait until we remodel the living room rather than tearing into the walls. does exactly as it should. Connects to most z wave hubs and reports real time energy usage. This will work to cut power to anything, however if your wanting what is connected to actually turn back on by itself be sure it supports this feature, by simply turning it on (say an air conditioner) then , unplug it for a few seconds before plugging it back in. if it starts again your good to go.Most things that feature a manual control knob for instance, will work with this, but if it features buttons and a digital screen they are hit and miss, so be sure to test as mentioned above.If it helps someone, i can confirm this works fully with the almond + router/smart hub.If this review helped you or you found it informative please click on the helpful button below. It helps me out a lot. Thank you

This is a nice value priced radar detector. No this isn't going to perform as well as a $450 dollar unit and shouldn't be expected to.But this seems to do the job well enough.I recently used this on work trip, and for the first time in my life, i wanted to see a cop and despite the 150 miles one way trip THERE WAS 1 COP total there and back. lol. This did give me a warning, however, as with all radar detectors, the issue is, for me at least, i like to have my music, relatively loud,and therefor cannot hear any sort of radar detector. The normal solution to this is the light up display, however when i am on unfamiliar roads with people who apparently got their license back when they were just giving them away.... (Yea im talking about most of the people that drive the 495 beltway) The last thing i would do would be to look down frequently to check the radar detector.So in my 300 mile testing, i found that highway mode worked reasonably well, with the occasion "false" alarm. I say false in quotations because i fully believe it picked up some signal from the k band, it just wasn't a warning i cared about. Many programmable road signs, will send an alert for instance.Best i can tell this detects h,x,k,KA,Str La bands. What any of them are i have no clue though the road signs that triggered alerts were all on the K band.However in city mode i surprised that this did not go bananas as they used to when close to a stores theft detection tag sensors at the door.The unit comes with a clear gel grip pad to help hold the unit in place, a car adapter that features an on and off button, instructions in both russian and english, and of course the radar detector.It is nice and low profile so it wasnt so blatantly obvious it was there despite sitting in the middle of my dash. The unit features a nice small display that shows what band it is detecting as well as the signal strength to help you gauge distance.  and 3 touch buttons, 2 for volume up and down, and 1 to cycle between city modes and highway mode. ( i assume the different modes help to skip some false warnings.The speaking, if i caught it correctly said" position ahead" in an accented but clear English voice. By the point it had gone off i had decided music was more important, as i rarely excessively speed anyways (10 mph over on highway)I have only 3 slight reasons it loses a star. While it is at a great price, it is missing the detector-detector featured on the similar cost cobra unit, and the barrel power connector is almost 2x the length it needs to be, causing the silver barrel to stick out even when properly seated, messing up such a sleek appearance.  And lastly, the manual. I think that this manual is more of a generic manual that is sent with a few different models, and while not overly complicated to operate the manual almost makes it more confusing. I am fairly confident that the russian language manual is more detailed showing which bands are supported and what looks like what those bands would be.Still  dollar amount considered, i give this 4 stars.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is a nice solid performing power bank.I like the deep red accent band that helps it stand out a little from the normal all black or all white boring ones you find.I also like that the outputs are clearly labeled 1A,2.1A, and 2.4 so that you clearly know which port you are using as opposed to some that say, ipod, android, ipad. type.1 A is great for the little things, headphones, gps, mp3 players. 2.1 and 2.4 are great for fast charging even the most power hungry phones and tablets. And with the Auto IC it will help make sure your device is getting the right amount of power it needs to charge most efficiently. And the 3 ports can charge 3 devices at the same time, which is nice with the growing number of devices we use.This is a nice size back up as well. the 12000 MAH would allow you to charge your devices multiple times, without ever needing to recharge the power bank for instance:Galaxy S5 4.25 times full chargeGalaxy S6 just under 3.5 timesIphone 5S- just over 7.5 timesIphone 6  roughly 6 3/4 times.You can easily see what you can expect by typing in google your phone model battery size MAH then devide 12000 (mah of this power bank) by that number so... Using S5 for instance: Google (S5 battery size mah" give the answer 2800 MAH then 12000 / 2800 4.29 rounding so just over 4 1/4 charge time.The built in flashlight, while certainly not a lets use this for camping or navigation by choice is certainly nice as a emergency light source. Tapping the only button on the unit once will light the 4 led lights to show how much charge is left in your power bank, double pressing the button will cycle between full brightness led light, half brightness, sos mode, and then light off.So this is a solid performer of a power bank and although the light leaves a lot to be desired, it is not its primary function, which it executes very well. So this still earns 5 stars.

This is a versatile little clamp light. Though i find the title slightly misleading, the only way this is rechargeable is if you put rechargeable batteries (not included) in it. While it is extremely handy to not have to take the batteries out to charge them, i half expected that this was going to have a little self contained battery because of the title and other reviews. Someone please correct me if im wrong.However this remains a very cool little light. I like that each little antenna is bendable an able to be positioned exactly where you need it to be. Each of the "bulb" shaped ends features actually 2 leds for a total of 4 that can all be cycled on and off. So 1 led on one 2 on the other or 1 and 1, 2 and 2 etc. all controlled by 2 buttons (one on each bulb)The clamp has good spring action for nice clamping strength. and doesn't feel like it is going to break if you look at it. Also the bottom of the clamp army has a little swivel head with a pad on it to help grip whatever you need it to.I like this light and have already used it for my grilling since the back porch light never seems to hit where i need. I would recommend this to anyone. Especially at this nice price point.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. A simple easy to use motion activated light. 3 triple A batteries allows you to use this anywhere it wont get wet.The slight twist of the back plate reveals that battery compartment, and also allows you to remove the plastic hanging eyelet seen in the picture if you wanted to hang this with double sided tape.The 5 led's are sufficiently bright enough to be used for path lighting in say a hallway at night.At just under 1 inch thick, this could also be stuck out of sight under cabinets. This item does as it says. While i would not consider it necessarily commercial grade, it doesn't carry the commercial price tag either.The top of the unit features :Optional power input not included)on/of switchvolume buttona switch to cycle through the different songs that are played.and a switch to select from song, alarm, or voice.at first i wasn't sure where someone would want such a motion detector, as many of the songs are children's song (twinkle twinkle, old mcdonald etc) So it did occur to me that this might have been very handy to put above my boys crib when he was younger to play music if he started to stir and wake up.The greeting is at first in what i assume to be Chinese but there is an English "Hello" option alsoThe sensor worked well and the volume seemed sufficient. Let me start by saying, I struggled where to rate these. As i write this i am still torn on 3 and 4 stars.While i wouldn't go so far as to say that im an audiophile. Having worked in a car audio installation garage for quite a few years, dealing with the tuning of systems and such, i like to think that i have a pretty good idea of what things should sound like. Now of course that is considering that sound is somewhat subjective.Im not sure if i have an over sized head or what, but these seem rather tight fitting. To the point of my now 15 minutes of testing on ear and they are beginning to really annoy me. And this smashing of my ears also seems to be a major part of the audio quality downfall.In fact when i hold them out ever so slightly and relieve the pressure a little bit they immediately go to a 5 star for the price rating. And even though they are clearly labeled r and l ears inside the headband. I find that if i reverse them and put them on backwards, they actually seem to sound slightly better, i assume due to the no longer perfect fit.But as they sit, I sampled music, from classic rock, heavy metal, rock, jazz, country, acoustic, and classical music. And the result was all the same. Very muddy mids, with drowning highs. I was able to clean this up a bit by fiddling with my phones eq, but still not to what i would normally call good.Now on the flipside. These are $17.00 on ear bluetooth headphones, With a built in mic. They have a surprisingly well written detailed instructions, and a very nice build quality to them. The integrated buttons have a nice feedback feel when pushed, Battery life is good, and they seem like these would last a while. Hence the struggle of rating these.well its decided, these are worth 4 stars. and possibly 5 stars if these happen to be purchased for a child or young teenager. I think that with the smaller head , and therefor less tight fitment, these absolutely become 5 star headphones for the money.But for an adult these get 4 stars, upgraded from 3 because of that price tag, you can hardly find cheap wired on ear headphones for this price, and these are bluetooth with a mic.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. I am not sure why other post refer to these model as being wired. The hd-p2 is a wireless bluetooth selfie stick. I think there must have been a page error or something that has them posting a review for another aukey selfie stick in the place. none the less my review of the hd-p2 wireless bluetooth selfie stick from aukey followshe Hd-P2 selfie stick features a very nice design. While i personally have never taken or intend to take a selfie in my life, i know far too many people that do. And once i completed testing it out i actually keep this in my tool box as you'll read below.This model features a collapsible shank that extends from just over 7 inches all the way out to 32  inches. combined with your arm length and you can get pretty far away. Could be handy for including more scenery in your selfie.It's light weight and small enough to throw in a beach bag, your purse, your man purse, your moms purse where ever and take it anywhere.The handle features a nice rubberized typed grip that definitely helps improve grip to get that perfect orientation. And right on top is an easy to reach shutter button to snap the camera.I find the weight of the battery is perfect because it helps counter balance the weight of a your phone when the stick is fully extended. This was a feature quite a few stick lack so i'm told. And the simple charging mini usb charging port on the bottom is nice that it uses the same charging cord as everything else so you're sure to always have a cable. And the wrist lanyard helps make sure that you aren't dropping your phone.The clamp expands well to fit most any phone out there. No problems fitting my old note 2 in there. and it really seemed to hold it securely i have complete faith that my phone was safe.As i said i have no desire to take selfies, i do however keep another selfie stick around to use my old phone as an inspection camera when i need to see what is blocking the gutters, or what is going on just out of reach. As if you put your camera in video mode, this will start the recording.While i would have loved to use this for the same with that nice long reach i decided it was too nice of a unit to sit around in a toolbox for use a couple times a year.So no matter if you want a makeshift inspection camera or to take 1 too many photos of your duck fish face, this is a nice stick that will get the job done.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. I have never been into solar power that much to be honest. Not because i have something against the sun, but most things were either diy mad concoctions or pretty expensive. And no matter what you could count on them being somewhat fragile.When i opened this ravpower 9 watt charger however, i immediately notice how it folds up into a nice well protected portfolio. At roughly 9.25 x 5.5 inches, its small enough to take anywhere. unfolding i was suprised to find that the solar panels themselves seemed thick and well protected. So much so that i wouldn't hesitate to take this outdoors on a hike, mountain bike trip and anything.aside from being able to open and prop this up in many configurations due to its 3 panel design, it also includes an eyelet at each corner, allowing you to use the included carabiner clips to hang this an many configurations as well to be sure to get the best angle of the sunlight.In the easy to follow instructions, it tells you you can store your device in the pouch sewn into the case, and while you certainly could for some devices, i found that having the charging cable attached to my Galaxy S5 made it a bit of  tight fit. So much so that i would be wary of doing that ofter for fear of messing the jack up.In my test of charging my S5 on a cloudless PA day, using the usb 3.0 phone cable that came with my phone i was able to charge my 2800 mah battery from 71 % to 77 % in 10 minutes of direct perfect sunlight. So i cannot complain about that, as we know batteries tend to charge a little slower once they are closer to full.I do really like this and find myself using it frequently. I also pair this with rav power power banks that allow me to charge my phone anytime with the sunlight. I would REALLY love to have see this include a built in battery that you could allow it to charge whenever and use that stored power anytime. Its the same as you would do with a battery backup but with less wires and less to carry and forget.All in all however, this is cool i like it, i use it and would recommend to anyone in the market for something like this.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is a cool little device. It took me a little effort to get it to function properly, however that was more of other people's misinformation. More on that later.This little headset takes your phone and basically holds it inside the case, and anything that can be displayed on your phone (doesn't matter if your phone is 3d or not.) and gives you a private little screening room.The instructions are a little hard to follow as many are, again in broken english however, it is a very simple concept to use. After reading this you'll be all set.All you need to do is google or torrent (legal or not depends on copyright blah blah blah check your local laws) anything even some you tube clips. What you need is 3d-sbs (stand for side by side) What side by side will look like is 2 of the same images on the screen at the same time. Not one image with red and blue lines like the old 3d books. not one blurry image. It NEEDS to have 2 of what appears to be the same image on the screen. Double vision.The problem for me is that when i searched youtube for 3d sbs i got a lot of 3d video results that were labeled as sbs that were labeled incorrectly. I started to doubt my knowledge of 3d and thought perhaps the headset was just not working. the different 3d formats all have a name. And sbs or side by side should have what looks like the screen split and half with the same image on both sides.open it on your phone, turn your phone landscape ways put it in the box, close it. now with the unit strapped onto your head you may need to adjust the eye pieces using the 2 small sliders just on top of the box, I could see the center divider of the box and it hurt my eyes to look in until i found an actual correct sbs. then my eyes focused properly and it no longer hurt.This is a cool little gimmicky box. My boy who is nine really seemed to love it. While we never got big into 3d i can see it is still growing slowly and more content is becoming available.So i would have no problem recommending this product to someone who was into this kind of stuff. The build quality and function is there. I would love to have seen either a notch for headphone wire or perhaps an aux port to allow for some headphones, that could really create a little mini theater experience.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This Controller is very cool. This being blue tooth allows you to connect to most electronics today, phones tablets, amazon tv boxes and sticks, laptops, desktops (older models of computers may require a bluetooth dongle. They are inexpensive.)While this probably wouldn't work on some game apps that require frequent tapping, (think candy crush, clash of clans) it would work great for fighting games, racing games etc.The real gem of this is in emulation. While legal in some places and illegal and others i would give you the ol wink wink "be sure to check for legality before following anything i speak about in this paragraph." You can download from google play, Apple app store or, for computers, a simple google search for snes emulator Will act as a super nintendo system. Then another simple search for SNES roms, will provide you with every game (in this case Super nintendo) that you can download as a small file and by opening the emulator and hitting load, pointing it to where you downloaded said rom. Will launch that game in all its 8bit glory.While this may be shaped like a Super nintendo controller, it certainly is not limited to controlling super nintendo games, following the emulation crash course above you will find there are emulators out for most early gaming systems. up to the playstation, however you might need those thumbsticks for some games. And of course many games and apps on the app stores work well with this.The controller is wireless which is nice other than it no longer has a leash when i die, and throw the controller across the rooms like i am still 10 lol.It includes a nice flat tangle free type charging cable and syncs effortlessly. The instructions could use a little work as the broken english could be a tad confusing for some, however they really arent needed as it is so easy to sync.This is one of those few products i have been fortunate enough to review that i will use often, and recommend to friends frequently, because it is easy to use, wireless, nice weight that feels right in the hands, the buttons have nice feel and response. Just a great controllerThis was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is my review for the An-sh001 kids handheld shower wand.Upon opening the box, both my 9 and 5 year old saw the vibrant colors and were excited to figure out what it was.When i finally hooked it up this thing has some real water power, i was actually afraid it might almost be too much pressure, I have really good water pressure at my house, but due to my shower knob being all one, i cant just not turn the water on full blast as it would be all cold.Then while writing this review i noticed that in the picture there are 3 white disk, and these appear to be water retarders, changing the pressure from "pressure washer" to a much more mellow spray that would be good on younger children. you simply select one of the disk ( i wish they were marked with some kind of gpm rating or something, they all seem slightly different in spray but no way of knowing which is which without testing each.) and insert it in the handle before attaching to the shower hose.Apparently these had shifted under the bag during shipping and were not noticed by me at first.That evening i gave both boys  a shower with it, and they loved it, they said it did not hurt at all and they liked that they could hold and control where the water was being sprayed.This does not come with holder which i really would like to have seen but they can be found online for a couple bucks. You will also need to either reuse or purchase separately the hose to hook to your shower. I would recommend the Ancheer 2 meter hose found at this link: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00YULD2XCThe unit is made of what feels like a durable abs colorful plastic that should have no problems lasting for years. and i had no issues even at just barley snug with any kind of leaking.With the included bag wand and water retarders the only thing missing from this package is the aforementioned holder, though as it is not mentioned in any description or picture it should not be expected. And i still give it 5 stars because it uses the disk system allowing more options over the spray intensity.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is AWESOME. As with any "waterproof" item i surely wasn't going to through my galaxy s5 in and hope they were right. In fact when i first received the item and saw how that latch clamp system worked i was kinda sure it would leak a little at least. And in all honesty, i think because i thought it would leak, i may have went a little overboard trying to make it leak lol if that makes sense.First i put tissues in it and held it in the bottom of our kitchen sink, with a full bleach bottle. After an hour the tissues were completely dry.So i thought well, thats just a small sink, so i took it with us tissues still dry and intact to the pool, with some weights i and dove it down to the 9ft deep end, with a 15 pound weight on it. I left it there for a few hours while we swam, forgot about it and retrieved it the next day, Tissues again bone dry....TO THE HOT TUB thinking the warm water and the jets may have some leaking effect on the bag.... Long story short, i was outsmarted by this bag, Seriously, im not proud, and i kind of felt like the coyote trying to catch the roadrunner. Now to write this review i saw someone using this bag to make there iphone 5 and underwater camera and it took great video right through the bag. a lot cheaper than a gopro.At this point i was willing to put my phone inside, thinking well it still kinda sucks to have to take your phone out to use it.... Then i find out that i can use all the features of my phone right trough the bag.! awesome. I typically use bluetooth but the added feature of a leakproof Aux out cable on the back is just a bonus. The lanyard and the armband also allow me to take this with me wherever i may be going because they attach securely i have no worries.I can honestly say this is one of my favorite things i have tested, and as someone who has lost quite a few phones due to falling in the water, (i think i have lost a phone in every form of water now, from the ocean, (saw a shark make a call with it on sharkweek) to the creek to the shower, pool, river.... etc i got them all) I will never be near a body of water again without this. IT really is awesome. I know at least 3 friends have already ordered some, and i am ordering one for my nephew being deployed to Afghanistan in September to protect from the sand .You really can't go wrong.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is a very nice inexpensive desk or night stand led light. Piano black finish will fit with most decors well and the interface is quite simple.The base is nice size and weight, providing nice stability to the light without being to bulky and taking up too much room. On the base you will find a total of five touch sensitive buttons. A power button, and 4 preset dim levels arranged in a slide type pattern. Although they are preset the 4 modes seem to cover every lighting level one could want.The back of the base is where the removable wall wart plug plugs in as well as the 5v 1A usb output for charging phones or anything else that has a usb interface charger. This is a big reason i knock this a star. I really wish companies in general would charge a couple dollars extra and upgrade the usb output level to at minimum 2.4A. With much of our technology and even phones getting more and more power hungry the need for a lowly 1A charge is gone. I want something that i can plug my phone in and at least get close to the charge level i would from the wall. Even if the product cost another couple dollars, i think most would find it worth it. While 1a would probably charge most phones in an overnight situation, someone like me that sleeps in short shifts, or maybe takes a nap, it can be a little slow.Onto the actual light and light arm, the arm itself does not pan but will go from standing straight up all the way to laying forward 180 degrees to be perpendicular with the table surface.  at the top of the arm is another short arm that extends out. It tilts in the same fashion, from sticking straight up in the air to 180 degrees down collapsing on the lower arm.And finally the actual light part will spin clockwise 90 degrees and 180 degrees counter clockwise so combined you can rotate that around in any direction.Worth noting that upon receiving the light neither the upper or lower arm would hold itself up when i contacted aukey they responded over that night that this was intentionally left lose for packaging purpose, the the 2 screw that were visible would just need tightened. They also inform me that they would be including a small screwdriver in every new package. I snugged the screws up and have not had any issues since, however, those screws being tight have absolutely no bearing on how the light folds upon itself for packaging, and to confirm i have repackaged the item in the box with screws snugged and sealed it up flawlessly. So that explanation leaves me a little confused.All in all however this is still a nice light, and even if you need to tighten the above mentioned screws (took literally like 10 secs) it performs well and lights well. The color temperature is warm, and not hurtful to eyes that may have been adjusted to the dark. And this light is a good value, at the cost, i would still recommend it. As aukey seems to be a great company, and releasing quality products at a great price point.Now what I really want to see, is a lamp similar with a built in bluetooth speaker. That would be very functional and great to see from a quality company.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is another cool desk lamp from TaoTronics, While most companies are moving toward the slim design, and TaoTronics has them also in their line, This is a cool almost retro with a modern twist design. My son pointed out it reminds him a little bit of the pixar lamp from the beginning of all their kids movies. :)The base is rather heavy and i love that, keeps the lamp from being remotely tipsy, even at a tall extension. And the rubber like material on the bottom keep it from wanting to slide off a surface if bumped.The light itself has 3 points of articulation varying height and position forwards and backwards of the lamp. With one of them being right behind the dead, that allows you to tilt that to aim the light where you need it most.  All the joints have a locking mechanism, so they will stay in place where you put them. Just remember you will want to loosen them before adjusting otherwise, you will wear the joint down to where it no longer will support the lamp eventually, though given the light weight i would imagine that would take quite awhile.Where the light post attaches to the base is a screw that fits into a channel allowing a little side to side movement without re positioning the base. I really like the actual shade style, it is black plastic but does not have a cheap look or feel to it and the bulb itself has a lens over it, that is not see through, adding a little more sophistication imo. While that lens helps with aesthetics, i am pretty sure it is there to help with light dispersion as we all know led lights are typically directional.And last the switch. In keeping with the classic modern vibe, there is 1 simple toggle switch to turn on and off. No touch buttons, dim buttons, popcorn button, just a welcomed simple switch. while I also enjoy all the modern touch interfaces, and dimming this and that, I was pleased to see that they went with the switch, as i i feel those would have wrecked the aesthetics that this light  offers.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. Pretty cool little dongle. I have sprint so while i am unable to use this because i don't have a sim card,(the same for verizon users) I was able to borrow a friends during a recent visit to check this out.Basically, in case it wasn't clear in the description what you have here is a usb dongle that you can hook up to your say laptop, insert a sim card from your cell phone provider and create a wifi network allowing other devices say a childs play phone gameboy, a tablet etc. to connect to your cell phones data plan.As a bonus with a micro sd slot, you could store movies, music pictures and such while allowing any of the connected devices to access them.Setup is relatively easy which is good given the lack of directions. Insert the usb in a computer, it will load drivers, and after a minute will open up the user interface tab allowing you to make the network name, add a password and such.I give this 4 stars, because while it works well during the time i was able to test it,i have no way of really testing the device for an extended period of time. I also, feel like there should at least be some basic instructions included with the item.However it performed well and would recommend someone in need give it a try.

I must admit the only thing i hated more than the windshield suction mounts was always the vent clip mounts. Both only ever seemed to hold until the most inopportune times and then would fall crashing your device off of center consoles, or worse under gas and break pedals.This is the first vent clip i have tried in a while, and after using the Aukey suction mount to much success, i hoped they could surprise me again.And THEY DID!The mount installs easily, right on any air vent of your choosing, so your not blocking any part of your windshield view. Also looks a lot less tacky in my opinion. And still gets your phone up to where you can see what is going on and easily follow say your gps app. The rounded vent clip also seems to hold this in place even if you tilt that vent to direct the air flow.The Large C clamp that grabs the phone, it opens all the way to 4.5 inches and has 2 ridges to help accommodate many device sizes,  and keep the phone from popping out.While the 360 ball joint allows a tilt of roughly 90 degrees and can be turned to position your device in portrait or landscape mode.So again i was actually very impressed by the strides that at least aukey was able to make with the vent clip style system. This has gone from a product that i might have reviewed and tucked away somewhere to a product that is going to stay mounted in my Jeep.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. When i opened this package i was completely lost at first. I thought... who makes a cellphone case that blocks the Camera?Looking at the description, i remember thinking that the magnetic pieces they were referring to was the typical band strap closure.Then i realized the actual phone cradle itself is magnetic and removable, and immediately thought "that is genius" While some may be slightly annoyed by this, as someone who has had their camera lenses scratched and thereby ruined in the past with a "protective" case on, i love this little feature. Also i have found that usually over time the case material in other cases will start to fray around that camera cut out and you end up with alien looking threads in your pictures of grandma at her 89th birthday. Having the phone cradle removable also means that your not holding a big bulky wallet and everything up to your face to talk on the phone.The overall feel of the case is nice and what you have come to expect from the PU simulated leather material. The stitching was all good, and tight with no frays or random threads, that i have seen a lot of on these many cases even though new.The cradle grips the phone well and is low profile enough that it doesn't feel bulky or cumbersome in the hand.2 credit card slots and a larger pouch for cash and such. Really the 1 credit card slot, is more of an id slot as it has the clear view window. the pouch is welcomed, for those rare occasions i actually have cash. Some cases seem to forget they still make that stuff.All in all this is a nice case. I feel it does provide a good bit of protection, even though, the inside cradle may shift if dropped just right, i don't think it will fall out, and it won't shift far.And it's at a reasonable price so you still have some money left to store in it.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. I am not a runner, but as a frequent beach and pool goer, i see plenty of uses for this belt.The material for the pouch is very similar to the material of an air mattress, and the belt is very stretchy with a broad adjustment range to fit most body types.The pouch unfolds to be a rather good size, and through the ziplock type seal i was able to fit my wifes Galaxy S5 with a rather bulky wallet case on inside, and would still have had room for cash, credit cards and others. My concern however being that because of the air mattress like material, i would be very hesitant to place many keys inside. Perhaps a single key or possibly 2, depending on how you would be using the pouch.I also did a water test to check the waterproof claim. I just put it on one of my boys when they were in the pool to see how it did. Upon opening i found that the moisture reactive dot sticker, (like those used on many electronics,) Had not been tripped. So that is a good sign.So all in all i do like this pouch, its small and discreet, and would be nice out at the beach or the pool to keep your things sand and water free. Like some other reviewers have said, certainly test yours before usage, to ensure no flaw in manufacturing.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. Right off the bat you notice that this is well packaged for protection during shipping in what appears to be made of recycled packaging, that provides a nice touch.Upon removing the speaker, it feels great, metal frame and speaker grill. The back features your on/off switch, charging port as well as your aux in for connection via cable. Rubberized strip on top contains 4 buttons:Mode- if you have something synced via bluetooth as well as plugged into the back via aux cord. you would switch between sources.Track/volume down -quick press for track long press for volume control (these are also controllable from phone )Play/pause/ answer or hang up phone calltrack advance/volume up again short press for track long press for volumeInitially i was ready to give this only 4 stars due to having no real bass to speak of, then just out of curiosity i tried a different music player that i had not yet had time to load on my new phone, and the bass immediately screamed to life. Now it sounds like i had expected and hoped, with clear highs, nice mids and respectable low end bass.IT is worth noting too, there are many factors that go into sound quality, starting with the quality of your source music file, mp3s range from 120kb to 320kbs, not all phones have the internal ports to make good sound, though this has improved a great deal in the last few years, then you have the player app itself, as mentioned, i hadn't downloaded the one i use on my android phone yet (Rocket media player if you need a good one) and was just using google music app. and it made the world of difference. and last little tip, on my phone i always turn the bluetooth volume all the way up and then minus 1 notch, many times it will distort output if left turned all the way up.While i understand that they certainly need to brand the product i would have rather seen the name smaller on the top vs sprawled across the screen in large white letters, but this is more of an aesthetic preference.Long play time at normal volumes, in a speaker that has no problems filling a room or two with clear sounding music. Really is a winner.As others have mentioned, the talking when you turn it on and switch between modes, i did get a bit of a chuckle out of the accent, and i would maybe like to have seen this feature able to be turned off for the more confident users, however it does make it very clear to the state of your speaker.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. Great sounding headset.I have had the chance to check out a few bluetooth headsets here on amazon. And let me tell you these are right up there with the best of what i have sampled. And surely at this price point.I Have a deep appreciation for good sound quality and clarity, and while these certainly are not the best that money can buy, they are do deliver clear highs, nice mids and sufficient bass. So they are good quality headphones all by themselves, Now when you consider the price, they are an amazing value.I love that they include multiple sized ear buds. I had thought this to now be standard practice, however i received quite a few different manufacturers pairs that did not include these.I also like that the buds have little wings on them that fit into your ear and help hold them in place. If you use these wings and they still fall out you need a different sized bud try the next smallest one.While i am not a huge fan of the color, they are easy to find, and i had no issues with them staying put through my day working in construction. the buttons are easy to reach for volume control.I would and have recommended these to family and friends.Because again at this price its really tough to beat these.

My wife and 1 child have almost constant sinus issues, and the doctors kept telling us to get a humidifier, we had got one for my sons bedroom at night, and it did seem to help, ever so slightly. Then we got this from TaoTronics. I put this in our living room, where we spend most of our family time when its not outside, and they have greatly improved, they still have the issues, but not nearly as bad.Aside from being so much more aesthetically pleasing than those we found in the stores, it has a slim design, and a few cool features that either weren't available or just were out of the question as far as budget.the led screen makes it easy to see what the setting is a good distance from the unit vs, dials that you have to walk up to see.  3 mist modes instead of just 1 or two like the standard. I also like the nightlight feature that provide a cool blue glow.Included time to let you run it from 1 up to 24 hours before the unit shuts itself off.Automatic low water shut off. These units are expensive. I think it was around $50 -$60 bucks we paid for a really basic one in the store, and to my disgust, i have found it doesnt shut itself off when low or out of water. That is a big no no and can easily ruin the machine. This has built in protection, so if i forget about it because it's so quiet, and forget to fill the tank, i know that it will shut off and be ready to go when i refill the water.I also REALLY love the position able mist direction on the top. Allows me to put this where i want out of the way but still send the benefits in our direction.I Got the humidifiers for my wife and son, never thinking of any kind of benefit to myself, however, i have noticed. as odd as it may sound, we seem to get a lot less dust that settles on our piano black electronics, as well as i seem to breath a little better, and the house just feels cleaner. Very hard to explain.As others have mentioned i would like to have seen some sort of securing the tank to the base of move to built in handles on the side of that base or something, because your first thought when going to move this is "oh there;s a handle," if you grab that however and its full of water your next thought is " OH C'mon! wheres the mop" because it will just lift the tank, and leave you with a soaked floor. It is a nice way of making you mop more though.All in all though this humidifier is packed full of features, at a great price. These are never cheap, but you get a lot of feature for your money here, and TaoTronics have proven to have good quality products, time and again. I will probably pick up another one for our house and will continue to recommend to friends and family.  This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. I will admit i have not owned one of these headsets for a long long time 7+ years. The last one i owned, worked intermittently at best while still managing to be highly uncomfortable for any sustained use. And to top that all off the people could rarely hear me, which in truth is surely due in large part to the fact that i mumble.I mumble, my father mumbles, his father mumbled, so.... what better way to test a new headset than to call and mumble with my mumbling father.I was very pleasantly surprised. He had no problems hearing me and easily understanding what i was saying, despite being outside with an occasional breeze. And i could clearly hear and understand him. That is an A+ score in my world. no further testing required.I have used it quite a few times since then as it is very convenient to free up my hands while talking.The build quality seems nice. lightweight but still sturdy feeling. The design is very nice and almost sophisticated looking with a simple diamond style check pattern. I was glad that it didn't have the brand name slathered all over like some i have seen.Includes 2 different sized ear hooks for fitting different size people. These are interchangeable for either ear. Also, unlike the last headset i tried the speaker is is more of a flat spade that fits in your ear instead of a standard rubber booted circle that always seems to irritate my ears after awhile.Pairing was easy, hole the phone button until the small led light flashes blue. volume up and down included also.(keep in mind you will also have volume control from your phone once paired.I have not exhausted the battery yet. as i certainly can think of no combination of people that i would want to talk to for a total of 5 hours in a day.As for sound quality.For talking the quality is nice. AS for music however, this is something that is useful to provide a little background noise perhaps, definitively lacks bass and mids for any serious music listening. however, i could see myself using this out in the yard when i need to be able to hear the kids and dogs but want a little ambient music.So i would recommend this to anyone who is primarily going to use this for phone calls with perhaps the occasional ambient music listening. You simply cannot beat the price with a stick.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. As others have said, it is so hard to guess the size of a spoon by just a picture. I had expected a very very small infant spoon from reading other reviews, but i was glad to see that really is just a little smaller than a normal tea spoon.The slightly shorter handle is the only thing that i would say really makes this only ideal for kids, or i could see myself using it.The "Bowl" of the spoon holds a great amount that both my 4 year old and my 9 year old are able to use perfectly.These look and feel great. they are smooth and the wrapped black cording on the handle provides great contrast as far as looks as well as a little bit of grip for functional purposes.If there were a standard silverware set of these available, i would snatch them up in a heartbeat.

This is another great looking product from Tao tronics. It looks rather modern but still would fit well with many other types of decor, with its glossy piano black finish. I really like the large LED panel as it provides for wider light diffusion that has been a thorn in the side led light bulbs. Aslo because it is touch style buttons i love that they include a wipe cloth to wipe the fingerprints that show up on any glossy surface.I really like the multiple joints that allow for so many ways of articulation that i have been unable to come up with anything this wouldn't be good for. Desk, reading light, bedside light. Even the light head rotates 360 degrees.I also like the multitude of features available allowing you to really customize it to what i need and want at the time, weather that be a dim, warm yellowish  light like a nightlight or a bright bluish light (if you have ever bought a bulb labeled daylight that is what that would be) and everything in between. Really makes this light uber flexible.I also like that the base is nicely weighted that you don't have to hold it down while changing the articulation. at first mine was a little tight but it has since loosened just enough to not need to hold the base. I did play with the light a lot (roughly 1.5 hours while watching tv) to see if they would loosen too much and not be able to hold the set angles and had no issues. Still holds the exact angle i set it at.It is also nice to have a built in usb output for charging your devices.  the output is only 5v 1 amp output and so you are looking at a slower charge on your power hungry devices like tablets and some smartphones. I personally would have like to have seen at least 2.1a output as our electronic devices grow more power hungry however, it works to supplement power usage, and would still charge a device fully say overnight if using this as a  bedside lamp.5 buttons provide full control with one for higher, one for lower brightness, one for warmer temp (yellowish light) and one for cooler temp (blueish /daylight) , your power button of course and a sleep light that easily turns it onto a preconfigured setting to function well as a nightlight.I have come to have complete faith in Tao Tronics LED products. From their eco friendly packaging, to their typically well thought out design and function, to their good pricing. I would recommend this to a friend without hesitation.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. Looking at the other reviews for this item I wasn't quite sure what to expect. However I also understand that the whole tv box structure is relatively new and some people may not quite understand what is going on, or may not have managed expectations very well. I can also say that as with all electronics, sometimes you get a dud.That being said I took a chance on this box to test it out and see how it really was. I “cut the cord” or did away with pay tv (cable, satellite, all that) a little over 6 years now. And when I did that back then, you pretty much had to have a dedicated “media pc” to be able to take advantage of a lot of the tv options out there.Fast forward, now we have these dedicated tv boxes. They have taken the need for that big clunky computer that while it worked fine, slow to start up, and not so nice to look at and shrunk them down to a very small and indiscreet size that can go anywhere and not look too out of place, even sitting on say a dresser for a bedroom tv.Upon receiving this box, opening it up you will find the box with included internal wifi, remote,  power cable, an AV cable (not HDMI) and what I would consider a “quick start manual”Set up is straightforward and requires no instruction. I would recommend using an HDMI cable right to the tv however to get hd quality.Right off the bat, I will tell you that while the included remote will get you started, you will want to use it to go to the play store on the box, and download a program called anybox. Then on your smart phone in the play store (im not sure about iphone compatibility) you should download google tv remote.The included remote is an ir remote and the angle of operation Is almost 0, meaning you have to have the remote almost perfectly dead on for it to work. While this is manageable to use once set up it makes  setting up the unit VERY cumbersome. Although the savior for the remote was the included mouse button that let you control a pointer with the directional buttons.Also the 2 usb ports will not work with my rf keyboard as I had hoped.The description however says that it does support them, so it very well could be my specific mouse keyboard , And lastly This does not support bluetooth either, so the little keyboard/mouse pad combos I had been using for remotes, will not work with this.  So you will want to do the above to set up google tv remote, allowing you to input text right from your phone. This will also allow you to tuck the box away in a cabinet or stand no longer needing direct line of sight for the remote to work.Next I would tell you to delete the included XBMC install. It was clunky, and VERY slow, plus there is a better one out there already preconfigured that will not give issues. Once that is done, head out to the browser from the menu, and type in google TVMC. This is a custom install of xbmc with many of the best and most popular add ons already installed. Also for what its worth, I use YATSE xbmc remote app from the play store for controlling xbmc. Alot of nice features there and allows sending video from phone right to xbmc. As well as typing from your phone and of course standard controls. Though it should be noted, this only works from within Xbmc so it does not replace the need for the google tv remote set up mentioned previously, if you are going to do anything else with the box than xbmc.I mostly use the TVMC included add on called genesis for all my tv viewing and movie playing, but feel free to explore and see if you like one add on vs the other.With this box, I find that im not getting full 1080 p playback, roughly 720p, from xbmc which is ok as most of the sources are 720p. However from a thumb drive It did look very close to 1080p, so that could be an issue with the wifi distance and the source.Now, this box does have some issues as well as some GREAT high points.  Honestly they all do, just a matter of how minor they are vs the others.The issues thus far:- I really would like to have seen a better manual written. It is basically the equivalent of a quick start manual, which would be fine if it at least told you how to get a remote going on a smart phone. That is the big one and because of trying to use the included tv style remote, it was a huge hassle of trial and error to figure out which remote program would work. (I think all told I ended up downloading and trying about 10 before finding this one that worked.) Tell me how to get that remote going on my smart phone and the rest is gravy!- The no blue tooth support issue. I would really like to have seen bluetooth support, even if it raised the price by a few dollars, as there are now both remotes and game controllers, that are able to connect via blue tooth that would allow you to better control, and play some cool games from the play market.-the occasional freezing requiring a hard restart. (They pretty much all do this. The $180 box does it as well as my amazon stick and even my media pc would do it from time to time) When I say occasional, I mean maybe once a week, and that’s being left on 24/7-in XBMC I find that it has an issue with AAC audio codec support, so some sources with play audio but display just squiggly lines. This is just a case of you learn which sources do that and use different sources. (most shows have at least 10 sources with many having over 20) you learn which ones work for you and just use those.Also note that there is some playing in Xbmc settings disabling one of the Hardware accelerators that helps to minimize this.- the remote is loud clicks and as mentioned before requires you be almost straight on for it to work. As for range I had no issues sitting on my couch about 8 feet away. Much more than roughly 14 ft it does become hit or miss.The nice pros of this unit:-First and foremost price. Again its about managing expectations. No your $30,000 Chevy doesn't win a race against a $100,000 Ferrari. However this box delivers better than the comparably priced amazon fire stick (which I also have running TVMC) And Has Way more options with the Play store and such.-It comes already rooted from the factory. This is very nice as it gives you complete control over every aspect of the box and android. As well as lets you do some very cool customization. This also means there are several hundred more compatible apps.- Another VERY important one to me is the support of both flash and html 5. I watch all my football directly online, and currently all of those players use flash player to play it. Android itself no longer supports flash player trying to push people to the new html 5. That would be fine, except that Flash has been the primary standard for a long time meaning, it will take some time to get things changed over.This isn't just about football either, a lot of online video still is based off of flash player, so without it you really are limited.-You tube compatibility within xbmc. I don't often watch much you tube, however, there are some things I highly enjoy watching on there, as well as when you watch a preview for a show or movie it is sourced through you tube, and even my amazon stick modded to run XBMC had issues playing You tube videos from within xbmc. And while the amazon stick would run youtube from its main dash fine, Navigation was more than clunky and cumbersome. I do not have that issue with this box, it runs you tube from both the internal app as well as sending from my phone through the Yatse remote app mentioned above.So in wrapping this up. I Give this box 5 stars, simply based on price to feature and what the available alternatives at this price point are. Also as I use the amazon stick on my upstairs bedroom tv, I have experienced the same amount (albeit infrequent) of crashing requiring a forced restart. It  has some great aspects to it and though it has a few quirks here and there, many of them are not specific to this box, but shared by many types of boxes. We have to remember that again this is relatively new technology and also keep in mind that some of these can be fixed with updates.I wanted to knock it a star for the lack of bluetooth and lack of instruction to get a usable remote for my phone on  there, However no where in the description does it say it supports bluetooth, and while annoying, it seems any android device not from the big players, comes with a poor quick start manual. Luckily if you have ever worked any android, it is all very similar, and feels second nature.  Again assuming that my rf remote/touchpad is just my specific model that is not supported. I have been running this now for about a month, as my daily tv source, and it took me 2 weeks of tinkering off and on to get that remote set up. (though only 10 minutes to get TVMC going) but now that it is I can really appreciate the box.It is on par with the amazon fire stick and on par and I might even say better that some of the more expensive boxes. I would and have recommend to friends now, knowing its quirks and advantages.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. These Look Great. I am redoing a small desk space in my laundry room/pantry/office and needed some minor files storage without the bulky filing cabinets or the high price of descent looking solutions.These work great to throw files into, sit on a shelf and they look like typical decor. i Was able to fit an entire standard filing cabinet drawer into one basket (of course after going through the drawer and recycling things i will never need again.The wire file hanging racks are optional, so the other one i use to store the odds and ends with plastic stacking trays from office ax and staples and such. All my office supplies, (pens, rubber bands, paper clips, stamps, envelopes, Etc) all fitting in several trays stacked neatly on top of each other hidden in plain sight. And i have found since they are not in one big drawer, they actually stay neatly organized.Some mentioned there being no bottoms lol, These are collapsible, the bottom simply folds down to rest on its holders. I found these to be very strong and durable.They do not work with standard tabbed Folders however because of height. The folders linked below, are what i use and they work great, lid closes tight no issues.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001CDZ4U0/ref=oh_details_o03_s00_i00The little rope that keeps the lid from falling all the way open does, sometimes have to be guided inside the basket when closing, and i wonder if this couldn't have been remedied by simply moving the rope a little more inside toward the center or even to the center. It hasn't bothered me enough to even look at moving it myself.Great purchase, exactly what i needed. When i went to buy them the first time they were out of stock, i shopped and shopped the internet for probably over 2 hours collectively and i found nothing close to the look of these at a reasonable price. im talking $ 45 for something that didn't look half as good. Glad i waited!If i need to i would buy again in a hearbeat!

A very nice motion light, and something i have been wanting to put over the driveway for sometime just never got around to doing it.My first thought when i received this was, "who wants to fumble around with no doubt a complicated process of changing the batteries in an outdoor security light"However I found the battery design to be great, a simple twist of the front and the whole compartment comes out allowing you to easily hold it in your hands wherever you find it most easy to work. a simple squeeze of 2 clips releases the batteries, and your ready to replace the 4 D cell batteries.Light comes packaged nicely in a way that presents well, protects the light, but isn't wasteful and i do appreciate that.The package comes with easy to read and follow instructions, the light of course and 3 screws and 3 plugs. All you need for usually an easy install.The 2 led lights provide a nice amount of light that at roughly 8 feet high covers a width of roughly 15 feet.its rated at 12 hours or 2000 turn on's on a single set of batteries, Although keep in mind that there is a difference in the dollar store batteries vs a good set of batteries. Not saying there aren't good generic batteries, (Costco's kirkland brand as well as monoprice com batteries, are really affordable and work really really well) i'm only suggesting that if you don't have a brand of generic battery that you are familiar with, and know they are a good battery you put a name brand set in so you don't have to change them every month. While it will certainly depend on activation counts throughout a day, i expect mine to last roughly 1 year on a set of batteries, depending upon how much the bunnies mess with it this spring.Brightness, duration, and sensitivity is not adjustable, they are set from the factory with the light duration to be 20 secs after motion stops, i find this to be sufficient and have no complaints there.I agree with the other review that if possible 3 meters (around 9 ft) is a better height for both field of motion sensing, light spread, as well as just keeping some shady character from just knocking it down. Sure they could use a bat, or crowbar but loud noises like that have a tendency to wake my shot-gun up, (man is he grumpy when woken up ) so i would think (or at least hope) most would just move on and avoid that.I really like the 2 points of articulation on this light. Really allows you to mount it and point it pretty much wherever you need, and once tightening the finger screws, it has been secure in the pretty windy few days we have had. No issues thus far with the rain and snow either.I have no complaints about this light. The one that was provided to me was brown not black, so i am assuming they may have different colors to choose from. Be sure your ordering the color you want. I would definitely recommend to a friend.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is a nice 3 mode lantern. Runs off of 3 D batteries, with reported 30- 40 hours of operation. While i did not fully test this, i did leave the light on overnight on the 2 brightest setting, and upon checking in the morning not only was it still just as bright, but the unit was not remotely hot thanks to the 2 cree led bulbs.I don't know much about led bulbs, all the internet information i could find on Cree bulbs suggest that they are quality component and should provide long life and hassle free usage.I Like that this light is a little larger than the previous TaoTronics light i tested for when a little more light is required. Walking around with the lantern in the dark, this easily lights your feet and directly in front of your feet up, where some other lanterns bases seem to cast a shadow directly in front of your feet.Ip44 means that most wires and screws are protected as well as it is able to withstand splashes of water from any direction, so a light mist on a quick run through the rain should not effect the light.3 modes allow usefulness in a variety of situations. all controlled from the single button on the front. Low light, High light, and the s.o.s strobe Even on low this is plenty bright enough for most uses. Keep in mind that battery quality makes a HUGE difference in brightness and run time of the light. Dollar store batteries will not be as bright or last near as long as a good set of name brand batteries.In addition to the carrying handle, and the removable shade (for even brighter light) i like the little fold out hook on the bottom for quickly hanging this light in a tent or from something overhead to provide hands free lighting. While the rubber base, grip, and top keep it skid free when standing on its own, they of course also add some protection to the heavy duty abs plastic housing which is nice.MY only complaint of this light, is the battery compartment. When you unscrew the bottom, first there are no clear labels to identify the orientation of the batteries. You have to look for a small round ring where the plus side point would fit. And secondly reattaching the battery cover is very cumbersome. While i understand the need for a sure fit for water protection there has to be a better way. There are 2 little grooves that 2 slots from the light must line up with push down on before twisting. While Taotronics did a fine job of clearly marking them with 2 arrows on the lantern side and 2 arrows on the cap side, they are still quite tricky to actually get on just right easily. Once you do a few times, you kind of get the hang of it, but it is not something you want to be trying to do in low light for instance. I had my wife try it just to make sure i wasn't just having a case of stupid. Even with me explaining it to her, she bumbled with it for about 3 minutes like it was a mislabeled rubiks cube, before she was finally able to get it.That is my only complaint is that battery compartment, i had to knock it a star for that. That is something that gets picked up on and becomes easier after doing it a dew times however. Other than that, i really like the light, seems well made, brightness functionality are right on par with what i am learning to expect from Taotronics and there great led products. So even with the battery cover issue, i would still recommend to a friend, and beg that he let me watch the first couple time he tries to use the battery cover lol.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This thing really puts out the air.  I was really surprised. I mean sure it's its an air pump and it's suppose to blow out air but the pressure was so nice i was actually able to use it to blow out my computer.I really like that the 3 nozzles that come, not only should cover most anything this type of pump is meant to deal with. beach balls, air bed, rafts, pool toys, the list goes on I also like that they are all tethered together. They have enough to get out of the way for use, but they stay together, and helps not lose them, drop them.I also like the deflate feature, for quick deflation of large items like beds and rafts.It is worth noting, that the pump can run for 10 minutes, then it needs to cool down, so factor that in. I don't know what would need to run longer than that. I inflated our air mattress in less time than that. However, That is the instruction, clearly written on the side of the pump.This is made for home use or you will need a power inverter as it is an ac plug, so taking it to say the river to blow up a raft will need that inverter. I would like to have seen some type of dc converter to be able to run this from a vehicle for such instances,However for just over $10 bucks, Really can't complain.So yes i would still recommend this to a friend.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. This is one of the few types of products, your a little scared to turn use lol. Having raised 2 puppies in our home as well as dog sitting several other  dogs throughout the last few years, i was honestly a little TERRIFIED to see what my carpets may hold.I was surprised that all my shampooing and scrubbing did a pretty good job, there was a few remnants of spots here and there but pretty good. As i walked around the room with it it highlighted some other things besides urine. Also showed i need to shampoo the couches.But highlights dust, and the fingernail polish my wife had spilled and cleaned up way back when.The light came with the wrist lanyard attached, and batteries ready to go. But being they are led they don't get hot.All in all this light does what it needs and is suppose to do. As others have said, if you ever want to sleep on your next vacation, DO NOT TAKE THIS LIGHT. Just enjoy knowing that your room is cleaned and the sheets are washed often.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review. Installs pretty straight forward. In our recent bathroom remodel I put down travertine tile in the whole bathroom, wanted to make sure we always kept humidity under control.With the way my wife's morning routine would go with the kids, she was getting out of the shower just a few minutes before leaving the house. and having 2 dogs one of which still loves to occasionally shred rolls of toilet paper, leaving the door open when no one is home isn't an option, So to error on the side of caution, i would have her leave the fan on, which i would shut off when i got home from work. Problem is this puts a lot of extra unneeded wear on our expensive bathroom fan.Enter this. Yes it kicks on automatically if someone forgets, Although as others have mentioned, because of position, (at light switch height) it really does take quite a lot of humidity to kick on. i wish this were adjustable but it is not. So i have to ding it a star since its big thing is automatically switches on. However, i do thing that if the humidity levels arent high enough to trip this, they arent high enough to cause damage to the floor and wall tile. We just turn it on as we go in to take a shower.The 30 minute timer is what saves us, she can let it run when she leaves and it will shut off, saving electric and premature wear on our fan.The bottom switch is the fan, and obviously this isnt optional to switch as the sensor would then turn the light on and off. And having a 4 year old that cant quite reach the light only the fan, is a slight annoyance but he grows everyday so soon wont be a problem.All in all, it hits what i needed to, but i ding it a star for not having a humidity sensor adjustment.  Would still recommend, and buy again.I have had this installed now for like 4 or 5 months.

A nice cover here to protect most types of bikes. I was successfully able to fully cover both a mountain bike, as well as a standard style bmx bike.Seems to be respectable as far as thickness, while not thick like say a tarp, it conforms well to the bikes, and i feel confident in the strength of the material.Comes with a nice little storage bag, to keep it clean and rip free while not in use.The material itself did not let water through while testing under the sink faucet. It did however leave a few drops through the seams where the black meets the silver. I mean a few drops not a stream. This is always a common issue with every bike cover i have used even costing 3x as much. The nice thing is when put on most bikes, these seam locations, would allow any water that does get through to drop straight to the ground and not really touch the bike. So a real non issue.I like the included little buckle strap to keep the cover secured on your bike. Surprisingly, i've had a few covers that didn't have this, and it never fails my cover is in the neighbors yard if i happen to need the bike outside.I would still recommend the cover, as i stated the seam leakage is the same on just about all bike covers. So at this price it is still a great value.This was provided to me to sample and write an honest review.
