Actually very few software programs do these days. The slipcase included a card with a product code that allows the purchaser to download the software from the McAfee website. We now have McAfee protection for our laptops, my adult children's smartphones and my wife's tablet; all from one software setup.One of the first things I noticed about this new software is McAfee included is a new slogan (or tagline): "You live your digital life. We keep it secure." The second new thing is, in my opinion, the feature that will draw consumers to this product. The McAfee LiveSafe offers an unlimited device license for all of your PC, Mac, smartphones and tablets in your households. There are system requirements and a specific list of operating systems on the back of the slipcover which, of course, should be consulted prior to purchase.A third new thing is McAfee's offer to secure your identity and personal data. We are already using other systems for that so I didn't set that part up. According to McAfee, you can manage all of your on-line passwords from any of your devices and track and lock your PCs, tablets, and smartphones if they are lost or stolen. You can also store sensitive personal data in a secure on-line vault--accessed only with your face and voice. I seriously thought about setting this up just to see how it worked, but didn't.My product came with a McAfee LiveSafe 1-year free subscription. This was nice since McAfee subscription rates aren't cheap. I called McAfee's customer support to determine when the 1-year subscription began--at the time of purchase or upon activation? This seemed to me like a very basic question and should have been made clear on the packaging. Surprisingly, I was put on hold for some time while the customer rep consulted his superiors for an answer. The answer I received was "upon activation."

With the emergence of the soundbar speaker system as less complicated solution for today's poor flat-panel television sound has introduced flat-panel enthusiasts to a giant leap forward in improved sound and performance. This summer Audio Products International (API), owned by The Klipsch Group, has released the next advancement in the evolution of the soundbar. API calls it the "Energy Power Base" (EPB). The "Energy" brand has been around for some time and has consistently been at the forefront of providing interesting and popular options that have improved the sound quality for movies, TV shows and especially gaming.API describes its new Energy Power Base as "...a compact, high-performance, pedestal-style 2.1 system that provides a new alternative for placement and aesthetics." The EPB weighs in at almost 18 pounds with dimensions of 4 in. H x 25 in. W x 14.1 in. D. When compared to the average soundbar this unit is overall larger and certainly much heavier, too. But once you find out what this speaker power station was designed to do, its size and weight could very well not matter at all.The Energy Power Base system consists of one cabinet (Satin Black/Matte Black), is just 4 inches high and most flat-panel TVs with a stand can be set directly on top of the unit. Try doing that with your typical soundbar and DVD/Blu-Ray players. There is of course a limit to the size flat-panel TV this system can tolerate. The maximum size TV would be 80 pounds with a base no larger than 23 in. W x 12 in. D. When I first read that in the specs I had to wait for a few minutes and let it sink in...an 80 pound TV! This is what API means by a pedestal-style system; one designed to sit under the TV.The single digital optical cable (included) connects from the back of the EPB to the TV, eliminating the tangle of cables and power cords behind my TV. This system's built-in Dolby Digital decoder provides for a simpler no-hassle setup whether your TV outputs PCM (Pulse-Code Modulation ~ I had to look this one up) or Dolby Digital sound.Now let's get to the really good stuff. A soundbar should not be just louder than the TV. What it should do is provide a balanced, full-range sound so that the program dialogue and subtle details are not overpowered by a distorted or overblown bass. This EPB utilizes two separate .78-inch tweeters with aluminum dome drivers and two 3-inch mid-range IMG drivers for each channel enhanced by dual 3 x 5-inch subwoofers in a front firing composite cone/ported enclosure encased in a bass-reflex single-cabinet design. I suppose it is this new console form that sets the EPB apart from most soundbars and provides more cabinet volume and the potential for a high quality sound. The speakers peak at 160 watts. Even though the EPB is only a 2.1 system the switchable 3D surround sound feature simulates a 5.1 multiple speaker system pretty well. According to API this unit will provide "A well-balanced, detailed, full-range sound no matter where the EPB is placed." I can't disagree with that, though I can distinguish some differences between my old 5.1 home entertainment system and this Energy Power Base 2.1 system.As I implied earlier, you don't have to put the EPB under the flat-panel TV if you don't want to. If you have a TV cabinet or stand large enough to accommodate the EPB you can put it there if you like. I tried doing that and ended up leaving it inside the cabinet. If you do this remember to pull the EPB forward as far as is practical. This will ensure maximum benefit from the EPB sound system. Also, like any other piece of electronic equipment make sure to allow for maximum ventilation.The EPB is equipped with Bluetooth wireless technology so it can also be used for playback of your digitally stored music. Just turn on the Bluetooth wireless technology feature on your smartphone, tablet or other device, connect it to the EPB and sit back and enjoy your favorite music wirelessly streamed through the Energy Power Base. My tech savvy son even got Spotify and Pandora to play through the EPB! After disconnecting our 5.1 home entertainment system, with its multiple speakers and stands, speaker wiring, receiver and multiple cords I was able to install the Energy Power Base in about 15 to 20 minutes: Attached one cable from the unit to my flat-panel TV (one cable!), plugged in the power cord, completed a basic sound test and made a few adjustments; that was it! Since hooking the EPB up we have discovered a few additional things we can use the EPB with by reading through the excellent instructions that came in the box. I also noticed that after the EPB was installed it automatically muted the speakers in my flat-panel TV; this prevented the two sound systems from competing with each other. If your speakers don't turn off you can manually mute them through your flat-panel's Settings menu. As far as my family is concerned...this speaker power station rocks!Now what would a system like this be without . . . a remote? There are instructions included (and also a video on the Energy Power Base website) so you can program the EPB's volume up and down and mute functions into your own TV remote for easy operation. You also have the option of controlling the same functions with the remote control included with the EPB. I love options. I do need to address one point about the remote. The remote that comes with the unit about as basic as you can get, so it has to be pointed directly at the Energy Power Base front sensor for it to work. This was the weakest link in this system. Energy pours its Research & Development into the system, and then goes cheap on such an essential part . . . the remote. In my opinion, this needs to be corrected.What review would be complete without the mention of the accessories? I've already mentioned a couple of them, but they are worth repeating. The Energy Power Base comes with one 4.9-foot (1.5m)digital optical cable and one 4.9-foot (1.5m) 3.5mm to dual RCA cable. And as previously mentioned there is also one VERY BASIC, unsophisticated remote control included. Speaking of controls, if you are not into using a remote control most of the system controls for the EPB are conveniently located for manual use on one vertical bar locate right in the middle of the front face of the EPB (see photo). I left the bottom line until the end of this review. The Energy Power Base TV Sound System with Bluetooth Wireless Technology retails new at the time of this review for $399.99.

We have quite a few mature trees in our yard which provide an ideal place for bird feeders. Anyway that's what I thought when we moved here. I hung several of the birdhouse style feeders and in no time the squirrels and chipmunks figured out how to scare the birds away and skillfully scatter their meal on the ground. I watched some even work in tandem to steal the bird food.Perky-Pet® has recently released their latest in a line of anti-squirrel bird feeders. They call this one the Perky-Pet® Squirrel-Be-Gone: The Baffler (Model 397). If you have ever observed a rodent at work, they are clever and persistent in their desire to secure food and housing for themselves. As you can probable see by the photo this bird feeder has a long clear plastic seed tube that makes up the body of the feeder and providing a visible place to store the bird seed. The bird feeder dimensions are 25 in. H x 11.7 in. W x 11.7 in. D; the seed tube is about 4 inches in diameter and will hold a substantial amount of seed, up to 3 pounds! Here is a promotional blurb I found on this product from Perky-Pet®:"Best Used For: Attracting and feeding birds without allowing squirrels to get the seed. This unique squirrel-proof feeder will increase your bird traffic while minimizing seed lost to squirrels."This feeder has an attractive shiny metal saucer-shaped lid (or as Perky-Pet® calls it "a dome") that connects to the top of the plastic seed tube. There is a hole at the center of the saucer to connect the two parts and at the same time provides a place for a ring to be fastened on the top of the dome for hanging. The dome is part of this new squirrel-baffling bird feeder, along with a very cleverly designed metal base that comes already attached to the bottom of the seed tube. There are four holes (or ports) about the size of dime around the metal base right through the seed tube. These holes are the feeding ports. Small perches are also attached to the base in front of each feeding port and are made out of metal just like the base for durability. Considering the dimensions of the perches and the feeding ports this bird feeder is obviously made for small lightweight birds; No crows or pigeons allowed!Now let's get to the patented weight-activated base and other features of this squirrel-baffling bird feeder. The smooth metal dome is not secured tightly to the top of the seed tube which allows it to wobble around when any weight is applied from above or below; like from a squirrel or large bird. According to Perky-Pet®: "The dome tilts and wobbles as well to throw squirrels off balance who try and land on the feeder." This also applies to those pesky crows that dominate our backyard in the mornings, scaring away the smaller birds we are trying to feed. Likewise, if weight is applied to the base, such as by a leaping squirrel, chipmunk or a large bird, the base swivels like a bucket under their weight, automatically closing off access to the feeder ports and preventing the loss of seed.There is very little assembly required. Perky-Pet® has included an excellent sheet of instructions that are easy to follow and is written in English only. In fact, there are only two steps to complete assembly. All assembly applies to attaching the dome to the seed tube; everything else comes already assembled. During assembly one thing concerned me. The seed tube is plastic and there are two small holes on opposite sides to attach the dome to the seed tube by poking the ends of a metal bracket through the holes. This feeder is not light and once 3 pounds of birdseed is added it is quite heavy. In my opinion, this is the weakest link of the Perky-Pet® bird feeder. In order to prevent a future disaster I decided to drill-out the small holes so I could insert a 2-piece hard rubber grommet into each new hole. This allowed me to still insert the metal bracket as designed while also providing reinforcement for the plastic seed tube. Only time will tell whether my modification will prolong the life of the feeder, or not.Perky-Pet® has three short and informative videos on their website explaining (1) How the Squirrel-Be-Gone Baffler works, (2) Where to place your bird feeder and (3) Instructions for cleaning the feeder. You can Google the website by typing the following in your browser window: perky-pet squirrel-be-gone baffler model 397.I had originally intended to hang the bird feeder on one of my wrought iron shepherd staff hanging poles but decided not to when I realized the bottom of this 25-inch bird feeder would only be hanging about 3½ feet off the ground; much too low and inviting for the numerous non-flying animals that roam around my backyard. After I watched the videos mentioned above I decided to relocate my bird feeder to a higher point and nearer to our birdbath; I also added a hook to the end of the metal strap I am now using to hang the feeder from a protruding galvanized metal pole mounted horizontally on the bottom roof line of a large shed in the backyard. I have to use a stepladder to hang and remove the bird feeder, but that is no problem. This product was built in the USA with both U.S. and Chinese parts. The label information on the front of the box is written in English, French and Spanish.Overall I am pleased with this new bird feeder. The squirrels and crows have tried to access the feeder without success so far; the wobble and tilt action has definitely kept them off guard. However, they are crafty and persistent animals and since there has been a minor amount of seed loss, mostly during the recent wind storm, the seed that did fall to the ground has kept them motivated to devise new ways to thwart the security measures built into this new Perky-Pet® bird feeder.On the front of the box Perky-Pet® added the following statement:"Feeder base and dome tilt to baffle the squirrels and protect your bird seed! Birds feed undisturbed from 4 feeding ports."I think Perky-Pet® is overreaching reasonable expectations for this product by expecting small birds to feed undisturbed. There is always some animal around my neighborhood looking for a free meal; either in the form of birdseed or in the shape of a bird. Though it would be nice, so far undisturbed feeding is not the norm around here.Otherwise, The Baffler has worked as promised. Since there are moving parts it stands to reason that some attention will be necessary in the future to ensure the mechanisms continue to wiggle, tilt and wobble. There is no mention about maintenance on the Perky-Pet® website that I could find. Only time will tell how well this new feeder will work over the long haul. Since much of the Perky-Pet® Squirrel-Be-Gone: The Baffler is manufactured with metal parts I expect my Perky-Pet® bird feeder will outlast most if not all of the plastic and wooden bird feeders on the market. This bird feeder retails new for $73.99, which is a hefty price for what you are purchasing. I know you can shop around and buy this bird feeder for much less than that.

I've never purchased flowers on-line before. But after being inundated a couple of weeks before Mother's Day with marketing mailers, e-mails and on-line promotional deals from ProFlowers I figured, "Why not? The flowers in the photos look great and with an advertised Mother's Day special price of $19.99 (which includes a FREE glass vase) it seems like a great deal." I eventually found out this is not a special price after all...it's actually the ProFlowers everyday price. Regardless, I made a suggestion to my children that we buy their favorite selection from the bouquet specials. They chose the bright and beautiful One Dozen Rainbow Roses.So I went to the ProFlowers website and began the ordering process. The process isn't difficult, but with what seemed like an endless series of decisions, it wasn't a snap either. All the way through the ordering process I had flowers for $19.99 on my mind. Once I reached the final website page I discovered that with all the service fees, postage, extra fees and postage for the FREE glass vase the cost had reached an unexpected $38.00; for my children's sake I removed the vase from the order. We have plenty of those at home.Everyone knows Mother's Day is on Sunday; no surprises there. In order to have these flowers delivered on any Friday, Saturday or Sunday there are even more fees added, bringing the final price to around $45.00; and that's without the vase. Frankly, in my opinion the flower business should be like a grocery store; a 7-day-a-week industry. I'm sorry but it shouldn't cost the consumer more for for the same flowers and service just because of the day of the week. To keep the cost down I had to have the flowers delivered on the Thursday before Mother's Day. My wife is very understanding and appreciated the children's involvement.The flowers were delivered in a large decorated box sometime on Thursday before my wife came home. I have no idea who delivered them (the label didn't indicate) and the box was just left on the front porch, even though I was home; no doorbell ring or knock on the door. I moved the  boxed flowers downstairs and kept them in a cool spot eagerly awaiting my wife's arrival. When she opened the box it was very clear that a lot of thought and effort had been invested in designing a package suitable for shipping flowers. Even the card with our personal Mother's Day message was beautifully done.The flowers had a water tube attached, but it was immediately clear something was wrong. First, the flower selection was nothing like the photo. The bright-colored bouquet of small roses in the photo wasn't what was in the box. They were small roses alright, but there was a single dark red rose and the rest were white, lavender and pink; nothing bright (see the photo). And the flowers were obviously in distress; some, including the leaves and fern-like branches, were even beginning to curl.We live in Southeast Wisconsin, so I looked to see where the flowers came from expecting to find a local vendor, or at least a vendor in Wisconsin. To my surprise I discovered the flowers had been processed and shipped to us from a vendor in...San Diego, California! That's over 2,100 miles from here; no wonder they were in such distress. It will probably come as no surprise that the flowers lasted less than a week. It should also come as no surprise that I won't be purchasing flowers through ProFlowers again.

Sony has joined several other companies that have recently released their version of a portable wireless storage device, using WiFi to transfer and stream data. They recently released the Sony Portable Wireless Server which Sony claims is "your mobile storage solution." Considering quite a few companies are ready to or have already released their version of a wireless media storage device Sony may have more competition for this market than they realize.Sony's Portable Wireless Server (PWS) is a little larger than an iPod (approximately 4¼" x 2" x ¾") and is loaded with a number of features. Like most of the other similar devices this PWS uses a WiFi network to wirelessly transfer and stream data. This PWS does not have any embedded (internal) memory. Sony makes this clear right on the front of the box. In order to store and stream data a memory card or flash drive (or similar USB device) is necessary and is not typically included.The Sony PWS is compatible with both Android and iOS®-based smartphones and tablets and can view and transfer content wirelessly, though I has some difficulty sending data to my PC. Sony does include a USB cable that has a very cleverly designed cable holder which eliminates a dangling cable (you will have to see it yourself to understand that). Thus, as far as a PC is concerned it is little more than a card reader. Like most of the other devices, this PWS relies on an Android or iOS®-based App to configure and remotely manage the functions on the Sony PWS. The Sony App is available FREE from the usual sources for downloading to your mobile device(s) (Sony website, Apple App Store, Google Play Store). You can also password the system for security through the App during configuration.Because I'm not the most tech-savvy guy around I often either rely on my family or I most often check out the companies on-line tutorials to acquaint myself with what features a product has and how to best use them. Sony does have quite a number of these available on YouTube, anyway that's what they are supposed to be. What I actually found were high-tech, big production videos that focused more on visual effects, sensation-stirring, high-decibel, rhythmic music, and fancy graphics than it did as a useful tutorial. In short, they were sadly a waste of time. So having pulled an App and configured the manager at least once before, I gave it a try; it was pretty easy to do.The Sony PWS is capable of streaming content to up to 8 users at one time. It can stream, store and transfer photos, videos, music and data files. Another feature my wife really enjoyed was the ability to wirelessly back up digital photos from the memory card in her digital camera to free up space, even while she is on the go! Another plus is this PWS can be used as a battery backup to recharge portable devices like a smartphone. Now you're talking! The Sony PWS has a USB 2.0 high-speed port, a USB 2.0 micro high-speed port, a memory card slot. A USB memory stick and a memory card can be inserted into the Sony PWS and used at the same time.According to Sony the usage time on this PWS is approximately 10 hours before it needs recharging. It also comes with a 1-year limited warranty. As I mentioned earlier this PWS does not typically come with a memory card so that must be purchased separately. However, I did notice that Sony is currently offering a bundle deal on their website where they offer a 16GB memory card with the PWS (WG-C10/NWC1) for an extra $10. Right now this Sony Portable Wireless Server retails for $89.99 ($99.99 with the memory card). With a larger memory card like a 32GB or a 64GB card this PWS would provide plenty of storage space to backup your mobile devices.Side Note: I don't usually pay much attention to product jungles or slogans, but the slogan printed on the front of the box for this Sony PWS really caught my attention. After staring at is for awhile I'm still not not exactly sure what they meant to communicate, though I have a couple of possibilities in mind; must be the generation gap. Here it is: "SONY® make.believe."

When I think of external computer storage devices I always include SanDisk® on the list. Earlier this month SanDisk® introduced the next step in flash drives; their new "SanDisk® Connect Wireless Flash Drive." According to their promotional blurbs, this wireless flash drive can store, share and stream your digital files across tablets, smartphones and computers. And the real kicker is it "works anywhere, no internet required." Now I'm certainly no digital device "techie" but even I was interested in knowing more. According to SanDisk, this "Wireless Flash Drive is the next-generation of wireless storage technology."My family has a PC, a couple of Mac laptops and an iMac, as well as a couple of mobile devices. It would seem we are probably the target audience for this new flash drive. My spouse and I both have external storage devices hooked up to our computers and share data back and forth by way of the internet, standard flash drives and memory cards so I hadn't considered upgrading to something else. The device itself isn't much larger than one of the older SanDisk® flash drives from a decade ago and comes in 16GB and 32GB models. The one I am reviewing is the 32GB flash drive. It works just like a regular flash drive but has the added convenience of wireless mobile access to your movies, photos, music, and documents from anywhere in the house or while you are on-the-go, and all without the internet! According to SanDisk® it works with iPad, iPhone, iPod touch, Kindle Fire and Android devices, as well as a PC (Windows 8, 7, Vista, XP) and Mac (OS 10.6 or higher) computer. I've already heard that PC/Mac users are not very satisfied with this device.This device works wirelessly using Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n); no internet or router required. It can connect up to eight devices at the same time and stream video to as many as three devices, with accessibility up to 150 feet from the "SanDisk® Connect Wireless Flash Drive." Unlike a standard flash drive, this device must be charged up first and can then be used for up to four hours of continuous streaming on a single charge.  Charging is easy and can be done by either plugging the device directly into a USB port on a computer or by using a USB AC adapter. I plugged it into my PC to charge it up. There is a small light on the flash drive to let guys like me know when it is fully charged. This is the kind of detail I really like because, as I noted earlier, I can be technically challenged at times, especially with new innovations like this one. An additional feature my wife discovered is the 32GB memory card is removable which means once it is full either move some or all of the data to another location or just slip in another card and you're ready to go.After charging the unit you then need to download an App so you can control your "SanDisk® Connect Wireless Flash Drive." I found several places the App was available for download (Amazon, Google and the Apple App Store), but I decided to download it to my wife's iPad from the SanDisk® website; it's FREE! After that is done just press the on/off button on the "SanDisk® Connect Wireless Flash Drive" and it creates its own WiFi network. By the way, all of the information you need to get started and use this device is available in written and video format on the SanDisk® website. Based on what I've already written, I doubt you thought I was technically adept enough to set this up and use it without professional help. You were right. The videos on the SanDisk website are especially helpful. Kudos to SanDisk.I wasn't interested in using this device to transfer data between our home computers, we have other ways for doing that (like Drop Box), but my adult children did find sharing and streaming digital files to and from their laptops "really cool" and my wife really enjoyed wirelessly moving files back and forth between this wireless flash drive and her iPad. More importantly, for my children to have a device to stream movies and such between their smartphones was even "more cool." Watching my family enjoy this SanDisk® product may change my mind about joining them. As with most new devices there is always a learning curve to master before becoming proficient at using a new device. The "SanDisk® Connect Wireless Flash Drive" is no exception. The device comes with Quick Start instructions in the box and as I mentioned previously the website videos are excellent and easy to understand; a toll-free phone number is available for technical support on the SanDisk® website.This product is brand new on the market and frankly not that easy to find yet; it's not even available on Amazon.com at this point. Like any new product it's not inexpensive right now. I'm sure this comes as no surprise since it is the "next new thing." It retails for under $60. Oh, I almost forgot, the WiFi network on this device can be password protected for security. It also comes with a one-year limited warranty.It will probably take some time before I put this device into general use, using all the capabilities it has to offer. I stream movies through other devices hooked up to my TV and I don't own a tablet or smartphone. However, I am sure that my children will give it a full workout each time they come to visit; which is often. I was pleasantly surprised at the ease by which we were able to set up and use this relatively small device. I think my entire family was pleased with the "SanDisk® Connect Wireless Flash Drive."

I've used Chap Stick® lip care since it was reintroduced in 1963; especially since I moved to the Midwest (winters here can be brutal on exposed skin). On occasions I've experimented with the latest lip product on the market, like Blistex, Nivea and Carmex, but I always came back to Chap Stick®.Recently I tried one of the grooming products for men from Baxter of California, a lip balm called "HYDRO SALVE (Natural Lip Balm)." Baxter of California produces an entire line of men's grooming, skin care and shaving products advertised under the snappy little tagline "The evolution of men's grooming." A half fluid ounce tube of "HYDRO SALVE" comes packaged in a slender and rather dull in appearance 4" x 1" x 3/4" box. Considering this is a California company, I was surprised they would package one of their products in such an unappealing container. Doing so certainly wasn't what inspired the company's "evolution of men's grooming."Almost everything on the box and the tube is written in five different languages (English, French, German, Italian and Filipino). The decision to do that is probably the most California-like of anything about this product. The following brief instructions are printed on the back of the box and also on the tube:"USAGE: Apply to lips, as needed""WHAT IT DOES: Natural moisturizers and vitamins soothe dry skin and keep lips soft and hydrated"Besides a couple of cautionary statements (for external use only and don't stick it in your eyes--I paraphrased that second part) the rest of the information on the containers is an extensive list of ingredients (all in multiple languages). It wasn't until a few days after I received "HYDRO SALVE" that I discovered what I thought was simple silver graphic design work on the side of the cardboard container was actually the most interesting and informative characteristic of this product: A brief biography and purpose statement of the Baxter of California company! Except for the product name, which is printed in reasonably readable lettering, the rest of the printing on the box and the tube is so small I had to borrow my wife's large loupe (a magnifying cup used by jewelers, watchmakers, photographers and graphic designers) to read what was printed. Then throw in what looked like silver bands and white lettering printed on a cream-colored box, this could be considered a graphic design and promotional disaster.The applicator on the top of the tube is cut at a 45º angle for easy application. Underneath the product name on the box describes the balm as a "Mojito flavor/vitamin enriched formula." Just to show how out of touch I am, I had no idea what a Mojito flavor was. So what do you do then? Google it! I discovered the word Mojito traditionally refers to a citrus fruit-flavored cocktail or a Cuban highball. This product was getting more California-like by the minute.Equipped with the information in the paragraph above, it was time to apply HYDRO SALVE externally on my lips and not in my eyes. I quickly discovered that though the applicator was well designed it was still easier (and more frugal, considering there is only a half ounce of liquid in the tube) to apply a small amount of the gold-colored salve to my index finger and spread it over my lips. The citrus Mojito smell is very pleasant and the taste is just as enjoyable (and non-intoxicating, too). The salve went on very smoothly and I was able to cover my lips with a very small amount with ease.Some of the reviews I read indicated this balm didn't last very long on their lips. I found it was just the opposite. It went on easily and stayed on for quite some time. I even noticed that when I woke up this morning I could still feel and taste the HYDRO SALVE on my lips, thought not as much as the evening before. I was impressed with that. I'm not sure I can be that complementary about my old standard, Chap Stick®. A half fluid ounce of HYDRO SALVE sells for around $8. Doing the math, that's $16 an ounce for lip balm! Though I liked the product more than I thought I would, it's just too expensive when compared to what other lip balm products can do at a much more reasonable price. If you are planning a trip to California anytime soon, take along some HYDRO SALVE with you. When in California, do as the Californians do!Post Script: Please relax. Before anyone gets too heated up over my subtle, tongue-in-cheek treatment of California and its residence, I must let you know I was born in California and lived there for almost 45 years before moving to the Midwest. Any perceived barbs or jabs were all intended in the good spirit of literary humor.

I have used Fabreze products for years as an air refreshener so when I saw this Bissell "Pet Odor Eliminator" with an added ingredient from Fabreze I wanted to give it a try. We occasionally kitty-sit my son's cat when he is out of town. Having an extra strength pet odor eliminator on hand seemed like the sensible thing to do.The Bissell extra strength "Pet Odor Eliminator" comes in a generous 32 oz container and is primarily designed for carpets and rugs, though there are other uses Bissell endorses which I will mention later. In fact I not only used this product on our carpet throughout our home, I also used it on my daughter's removable rugs in her car. Care and common sense should be taken to remove and clean the car rugs first and then use this product as instructed on the container while the rugs are outside the car. This may come in conflict with what Bissell recommends, but I do not recommend this product be used for the carpet in a car, only the removable rugs; and then only when the rugs are kept outside for a period of time after application and vacuuming.This white deodorizing powder has a very STRONG scent! I can't say that firmly enough. This is why I don't recommend its use inside the small enclosed passenger compartment of a car. Once I got the container open (I'll comment on that later) the smell of the powder immediately made my eyes water. Though the scent is nowhere as pleasant as the Febreze air refresher products I have used over the years, it does have a fresh, clean scent. If you are looking for a perfumery scent, this may not be what you are looking for. This product is specifically a pet odor eliminator, and an extra strength one at that; it is not an air freshener.Bissell also recommends this product for use on "upholstery, automobile interiors, and drapes." Surprisingly, they provide no cautionary when using this product for these areas. Bissell put on the label exactly what this product should be expected to do:~ Eliminates tough pet odors~ Refreshes your home with a fresh, long lasting fragrance~ Releases pet hair & dirt~ Leaves behind softer, fresher carpetsBissell also included a list of things this product should NOT be used for, as well as a safety cautionary:~ Not intended for use on velvet, silk, vinyl or leather fabrics~ Keep out of the reach of Children and Pets.~ Avoid contact with eyes. In case of eye contact, flush thoroughly with water for 15 minutes. If irritation persists, seek medical attention.There are simple instructions provided on the container (English & Spanish) in written and pictorial mode. STEP 1: "Sprinkle evenly over area to be treated." (There is no indication as to how dense the coverage should be; evidently it can be according to personal preference). STEP 2: "Wait a few minutes and vacuum thoroughly." (The drawing provided indicates the "few minutes" is actually 20 minutes).Most products have a couple of noteworthy things that should be mentioned in a product review. This one is no exception. Though the Febreze trademark icon is the most prominent one on the container, the reader should be aware that this product is not manufactured by Febreze (Procter & Gamble makes Febreze); it's manufactured and distributed by Bissell Homecare Inc. However, the product is marketed (even by Amazon) under the following label: "Febreze Extra Strength Pet Odor Eliminator Deodorizing Powder." With that being said, the large endorsement on the front of the container seems rather misleading as well as in this case very self serving: "ENDORSED BY BISSELL."This point may seem a little silly to some readers. As I noted earlier opening the container is an important part of using this product. That shouldn't come as a surprise to anyone at this point. However, just how to safely open the container was not, for me anyway, apparent at first. Thus, it would seem reasonable to expect Bissell to provide some help in this regard. Not a single word of instruction!A secured plastic cap covers the entire top end of the cylindrical container. There is a circular insert in the cap that obviously is designed to turn freely around 360º. So far, so good. (I can hear the laughter starting already). There are two ways of dispensing the white powder: (1) two rows of holes for gently shaking the contents out and (2) a large smile-shaped opening for a more generous pouring application. In my mind anyway, there was no obvious way of opening the top of the container without cutting the lid open underneath the large pouring opening with a knife. In my opinion, anytime a cutting tool is necessary to open a household container...there must be explicate instructions included somewhere on the container! With some effort I was able to cut the plastic seal under the large pouring opening; this allowed the circular cap to twirl freely 360º, exposing openings for both the shake and pour applicators. Again, in my opinion this is one of the most poorly designed containers I've ever opened; with respect to safety anyway.When storing this product it would seem prudent to twirl the cap so both the shaker applicator and the large pouring applicator are covered. With this cap, there is only one setting that covered both openings; a 1/16 of an inch either way slightly exposed one or the other openings. The large pour spout needs to be smaller. I bumped the product over while reaching for my dictionary during the writing of this review; some of the white powder spilled out on my desk. I was able to find a plastic cap from a can of tennis balls that fit snugly over the top of the container, preventing this accident from happening again. It appears the old proverb is still true: "Necessity is the mother of invention." Maybe Bissell should try this quick, snap-on safety solution?Though Bissell's extra strength "Pet Odor Eliminator" does have a very strong scent the smell does dissipate over a short period of time after application. Also I didn't find the fragrance offensive like some of the other reviewers did, but thought is was rather pleasant after a several minutes. Furthermore, the scent doesn't stay around for a long time even though Bissell claims it has a "long lasting fragrance." What I did find was though the fragrance did dissipate, the product definitely neutralized the odors in our carpet. There are other products that can sanitize the air, such as Febreze Air Effects air refresher. I was more interested in getting rid of the pet odor in our carpet and making it softer. This product did just that.Before I finalize this review I have a curiosity question for Bissell: "If this product is supposed to be sprinkled on carpets and rugs, what is the purpose of the large pour spout?" Bissell does also provide a 1-800 telephone number for Questions and Comments. I see a phone call in my future.

After two years of drought, this spring and summer have been exceptionally wet. When that happens in the Midwest mosquitoes will be especially bothersome, along with a number of other pesky insects like ants, grubs, and lawn moths. Cutter makes a great deep woods mosquito repellant for campers and hikers so I decided to try their "Cutter Backyard Bug Control" this year.The insect spray concentrate comes in a ready-to-use 32 oz plastic jug with a garden hose attachable spray nozzle. The manufacturer claims this has a "fast-acting" formula that will kill and control nuisance pests for up to 8 weeks! Since I am using this product for the first time, I'll have to wait to determine the validity of that claim. There is a very detailed set of peel-open instructions (English & Spanish) attached to the back of the container. Listed under PRODUCT FACTS are three important pieces of information: (1) "What it Does": lists a large number of victims; some common (like grubs, ants and fleas) and some not so common pests (like European Crane Flies, Sod Webworms and Whiteflies), (2) "Where to Use": Lawns, Landscapes and Outdoor Surfaces, and (3) "Coverage (32 fluid oz)": Up to 5,000 square feet. A Questions & Comments 1-800 phone number and website address are also included. Based on some of the negative reviews for this product it would not be surprising that the manufacturer's phone may have been ringing off the hook in 2010-2012. However, a promising number of positive reviews have appeared in 2013.The instructions for application are very specific and should be followed to the letter. If you have applied other liquid outdoor products, like sprays for dandelions, this one isn't all that much different. However, spraying during the rainy season can be tricky and applications can be neutralized if it is followed by rain within days after it was used. Reapplication may be necessary. I used rubber garden gloves, old clothing, tall rubber boots, a hat and a painter mask on a calm day when I applied this spray to protect myself from spray mist and the residue on the lawn after application. A complete wash down afterward of the applier and clothing is recommended. The common-sense application guidelines are worthwhile reading before application; saves time, saves wasting the product as well as saves embarrassment if done without an effective application strategy.The guidelines for using this ready spray nozzle are very important, primarily since this Cutter product evidently has had a rash of poorly designed and manufactured nozzles in the past few years. I didn't have any problems with mine, which may indicate the manufacturer has responded to the wave of complaints about these nozzles. This bug control product has a very strong odor that stays around after spraying for some time. One thing I don't remember reading about is how long after application is it recommended before the lawn and other surfaces can be walked on (including domestic animals) and before the lawn can be mowed again. Hmmm, I see a 1-800 phone call in my near future.I was surprised to discover that this product can be safely used on ornamental trees, shrubs and flowers and is also recommended for patios and other cements surfaces. There is a short section in the instructions titled PRECAUTIONARY STATEMENTS; absolutely mandatory reading! In my opinion, this should have been at the very beginning of the instructions, but it was left to the very end.We haven't hit the height of our mosquito season yet so I will have to wait and see how effective this bug control really is and for how long.

I do a fair amount of shipping out of my home so having a shipping scale for weighing parcels saves time, money and trips back and forth to the post office. According to Amazon, the AccuPost (PP-110) scale is a postal scale from the USPS; it is very similar, but I checked with my local post office and this is not the one they sell. The AccuPost (PP-110) comes securely packaged, which is important to keep the scale undamaged and working accurately. The one I am reviewing is the small 10-pound desktop AccuPost (PP-110) postal scale manufactured by Measurement Ltd., Inc. It's compact (8"L x 6"W x 2"H) and weighs just over a pound.[NOTE: I was supposed to have received the USPS PS-10 scale but Amazon sent me this one instead. So I am reviewing what I received here where the PS-10 is supposed to be reviewed because the Amazon Vine program won't recognize my review if I don't. That's my story and I'm sticking to it.]This scale comes with a user manual (English only) and provides excellent instructions and pictures, the first of which are several WARNINGS to prevent damage to the scale. Some of the warnings are the common sense variety (Don't exceed the weight capacity, don't drop or bang the scale or use it other than in its intended use). There are no parts in this scale that can be serviced by the user and therefore the scale should not be opened. "Attempting to service the scale will void the warranty and my permanently damage the scale." The manufacturer "... warrants this product against defects in material or workmanship for a period of one (1) year from the date of purchase and agrees to replace it. This warranty does not cover damage resulting from misuse or abuse of the product. Should your product require service, you may send it back to Measurement Ltd., Inc. for repair of replacement."The scale comes with a Star IV power adapter for a 110 volt wall outlet and a USB cord and port for use with a computer. The scale can also be used with 3 AA batteries (not included). It also has an automatic power off feature. For a small scale the digital screen is large and easy to read (1.3" LCD display). It has three function keys: One to turn the scale on and off, another to switch from grams to pounds and ounces (LB/KB for international use), and a third to activate the Hold feature (retains weight reading on the display for a longer period). It also has a flip-up stand built into the scale surface to weight oversized envelopes.The digital reading may be set for any of four modes: (1) Grams (2) Ounces only (3) Pounds & Ounces in decimal mode and (4) Pounds & Ounces in fraction mode. I'm not sure when the fraction mode would be helpful, but there must be some need for it.Probably the most helpful feature of this scale is its use with a Windows PC (evidently the program won't work with a Mac). This allows the user to use the shipping data from the scale for use in their USPS, FedEx or UPS website account and to pay for postage and print shipping labels from your ink jet or laser printer. I have a USPS account and the downloadable program works well with USPS website. However, I do most of my shipping through eBay and PayPal; I gave up trying to get it to work. You can paste the data to a clipboard and then copy and paste it into the PayPal template. I might as well just type it into the template.Overall this compact postal scale does what Measurement Ltd., Inc. advertises it will do. I also have a larger WeighMax postal scale for bigger jobs (35 lbs maximum). If you need a scale to handle more weight, the WeighMax is a good desktop or countertop scale and can be purchased at a great price; less than this 10-pound postal scale that retails for around $38 to $40.

It is rare for me to include my regard for a book at the beginning of a book review. In this case, however, Timothy Witmer's latest book titled "The Shepherd Leader at Home (2012)" is such a needed book and well worth my highest recommendation. There are certainly other book about a husband and father's role at home, but none that I have read come close to Witmer's compact, simply presented and so very biblically based. In my opinion, this book should be required reading in every home, right next to the Bible.This could be considered a companion volume to Witmer's first book titled "The Shepherd Leader (2010)" which addresses the shepherding of a church family. In his Introduction, Witmer gives the reader an insight into the purpose for his latest book. Witmer writes:"The heart of this book, therefore, will be to walk together through the fundamental shepherding functions of knowing, leading, providing for, and protecting and their application to leadership in the family. These shepherding functions represent four of the most fundamental human needs the God meets through those who lead families. Each of the four parts will begin with an introduction showing its biblical rationale. This book is intentionally practical, personal and heart-to-heart. I write not as someone who has it all together, but as someone seeking to take seriously what God has called me to do and to be as a husband and father."Witmer divides his study into four parts, one for each of the shepherd's fundamental responsibilities: (1) Knowing, (2) Leading, (3) Protecting, and (4) Providing for his family. He adds discussion questions at the end of each chapter to enhance both an individual and a group study. It should come as no surprise that Witmer opens his book in chapter one with an essential introduction and overview of the biblical model for the family, beginning at the beginning in Genesis chapter one. Witmer writes: "Let's go back to the very beginning and take a look at how fundamental this concept of relationship is to marriage."Witmer captures the heart of the shepherd metaphor in this book by pointing first to Jesus, the Great Shepherd as a model for all husbands/fathers, who are His under-shepherds to their own family. Each relationship is a reflection of what the Old and New Testaments reveal a shepherd must do and must be; such as in Psalm 23 and John 10. Witmer rightly points out that: "If your relationship with your wife is the primary human in life, your relationship with your children comes next." Both come under the care and protection of the household shepherd.Beside discussion questions at the end of each chapter, Witmer also provides a list of valuable resources to use in family devotions. His recommendations include Bibles and Bible stories and even resources for singing, as well as material for memorization. I must admit I have never seen this kind of material added to other books for the family. Witmer's book is not loaded with notes, yet there is helpful material noted in the text and cited in the endnotes at the back of the book.As mentioned above, this book is biblically solid and very practical. Highly recommended.

5:06 MinsI gave these to my husband to review because I cannot put anything into my ears. They are very nice looking and seemed sturdy. I loved the way the ear pieces looked so comfortable - and he confirmed they did feel nice. There are smaller and larger ear cushion pieces so you can adjust them to fit your ear size.I really liked the red color because I felt it made them easier to see. They are wireless which is really nice. There is a function button and two separate up/down volume buttons that also double as a forward/backward button on the headset itself which makes using them easy!He had no trouble figuring out how to use them and stated that the music coming out of them sounded great. They have a voice confirmation of when they are on and when they are pairing to make them even easier to use. These would make a great gift item.Disclaimer: I received this item for free  in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

2:04 MinsIn this kit are two boxes that contain 15 LED Fiber Optic Light Up Flashing Hair Barrettes. That is enough for several people to fully light up their hair, so these are great for parties, holiday celebrations or just to have fun anytime. I love that the batteries are removable so I don't have to throw these away once the batteries die.The barrettes are very easy to open and close - best of all they actually stayed put in my hair which is amazing. Most barrette type products slide right out of my hair within an hour - give or take.The barrette is large enough it is going to be seen - but that was ok with me. I liked the colors but I did not wear mine late at night in total darkness where I am sure it would look more colorful. They can also be cut to match the length of your natural hair. I did not try this however as my hair was actually longer than the product.I did not find any problems with this product.Disclaimer: I received this item for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

I absolutely love this pillowcase! It is the first silk pillowcase that I have ever slept on and I can tell you that my hair is a lot less tangled come morning with this  pillowcase than what it is with a  standard pillowcase. I love that it zips up and keeps your pillow safely inside it. It is so soft to sleep on too. It is easy to care for, just wash it in cold water making sure to use a detergent that is ok for use on silk. The mulberry silk is a 400 thread count and the cotton on the underside is a 300 thread count. Truthfully without close inspection you wont know the cotton side from the silk side. It is that high of a quality.The silk is 19Momme mulberry silk. Mulberry silk is the highest quality among all types of silk.I am very pleased with this pillowcase and frankly very surprised that it does not wrinkle or need to be ironed to look good. This would make great gift item.Disclaimer: I received this item at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

This shower head is gorgeous! I love the chrome look - especially the way the front of the shower head is all chrome - just like a mirror. It looks so elegant and expensive! The square style is so modern looking and chic. It has a total of 81 rubber nozzles so they won't rust and they are easy to clean. Made with ABS material and satin nickel finish it will stand up to hot showers. The effect of the shower is like standing outside during the perfect rainfall - and that makes it great for watering plants too!This is a stationary shower head. It comes with a small roll of Teflon tape and the shower head itself. It mounts right where your old one was. It is easy to install and leak-free. The picture defiantly does not do this shower head justice. When I took it out of the box it literally took my breath away with its beauty! Seeing is believing!Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

This is a fantastic handheld shower head with 5 different functions! I am truly impressed! It is made of high quality Brass and ABS thermo material so it can handle high temperatures without any problem. The 67 nozzles are made of rubber, so they will not rust! I love the rainfall setting which is not only ideal for me, but also for my plants! In addition to the rainfall setting there are 4 others - a jet setting, a mist setting, a full body spray with massage and a full body spray.I like the larger head and the handle is just the right size for smaller hands - not too long and not too short - however a person with larger hands can certainly hold onto it with no issues.It comes with everything you need to install it - a small roll of Teflon tape, washers, the hose, the mounting bracket and the shower head. It is all a very shiny chrome color. The shower head is lightweight and easy to handle - even for a child.What I really love about handheld shower heads is they are ideal for bathing pets, young children, the elderly or disabled. They are great for rinsing your hair or giving your body a final rinse after a bath to make sure all the soap and bubbles are rinsed away. They also make cleaning things in your tub so much easier!Disclaimer: I received this product for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

This shower head is really large - much larger than it looks in the photos and talk about shiny! The back is just like a mirror. I had never seen  a shower head with buttons on it until I saw this one. The buttons allow you to switch between the two modes - waterfall and rainfall. Speaking of when you install this you want to make sure the straight line which is the waterfall nozzles are facing down closest to the tub. The waterfall mode is quite relaxing in my option and much like actually being under a waterfall.The shower head is very modern looking and is made of ABS thermo material so hot water is not a problem. The nozzles are rubber so they o't rust and it is easy to clean.Overall I like the design and love that it keeps my entire body warm when I shower.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

This is a reversible showerhead that has 10 mist nozzles on one side and 40 rainfall nozzles on the other side. The nozzles are all rubber so there is no need to worry about them rusting and ruining your shower head. To switch between the two settings, just turn the shower head so the side you want to use is facing downward and push the shower head down. Putting the shower head in the center turns the water off on both sides. Be careful however because it is easy to spray yourself in the face by accident with this shower head should you press it the wrong way.The shower head is easy to install and comes with everything you need - Teflon tape, washers, the hose and even a shower head holder. It is made of ABS thermo material so it handles hot water just fine.I like the unique circle shape of this shower head and think the empty center is quite unique. I like that it is a handheld shower head which is ideal for bathing children, elderly or disabled people. It also make washing or rinsing your hair easy.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

This dress is so pretty - and I am sure my grand daughter loves it! Even her mother was impressed with how pretty this dress was! It is very dressy looking - and I love the little embroidered flowers that add that "sweet" touch to a grown-up looking dress. Many little girls do not want something too frilly and this certainly is not. The material is easy to hand wash should any spots get on it and just hang it to dry.I love the crinoline underneath the skirt - and that vibrant pink bow around the waist just sets the dress off. All of the seams are well sewn and the dress is made of a high quality material that is sturdy enough for a child to wear without worrying about it tearing easily.It is sleeveless but a shawl or cardigan sweater would certainly look nice with it and keep your child warm during the winter. For the summer months your child is not going to sweat to death. I really like the seasonal versatility of this dress.I really wanted something for my granddaughter that she could wear and look nice during the holidays. This dress is perfect for that as far as I am concerned.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.
